As we were also hungry when we got to the coffee shop, we had some of their pastries and banh mi. Both were excellent! I should also mention the outstanding friendly service at the café as well. This literal hole in the wall café is located down a long alley hallway and up a flight of stairs, but it is well worth seeking out. I highly recommend this wonderful little coffee shop!

A true hidden gem in Saigon! We nearly walked past it as the entrance is just a doorway, but we’re glad we found it! We both had the Tonkin version of a Vietnamese coffee (mine was iced, my husband went for hot). We also had a custard-filled croissant each which were absolutely lovely! The atmosphere was calm and the staff lovely. Get yourself in!

name: Mrsimple Steakhouse
address: 62 Truong Quyen Ward Vo Thi Sau , District 3, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description:
To enjoy the ultimate French dining experience in Saigon, look no further than @mrsimple.steakhouse. Even though I have been to HCMC several times, but this is the 1st time we patronized a fine-dining. Located away from tourist areas and near popular pink façade Tân Định Catholic Church, it gives out a calm and relaxing vibe. 

With crystal chandeliers hanging over high ceiling and French paintings and décor, it make a posh fine dining restaurant, to celebrate special occasions. We go for their most expensive set for 2, which consists of starters, salad, soups, main course and desserts. 

Using quality ingredients and fine to attention details, every dishes was presented exquisitely, with nice blend of flavour and savoury, fresh and sweet in taste. Steak was cooked using sous vide technique, ensuring that it was tender and juicy, best to pair with a glass of red wine to elevate the flavour. 

Price was surprisingly reasonable, given the ambience and quality of food served. We were definitely be back when we visit Saigon again!!
example_reviews: To enjoy the ultimate French dining experience in Saigon, look no further than @mrsimple.steakhouse. Even though I have been to HCMC several times, but this is the 1st time we patronized a fine-dining. Located away from tourist areas and near popular pink façade Tân Định Catholic Church, it gives out a calm and relaxing vibe. With crystal chandeliers hanging over high ceiling and French paintings and décor, it make a posh fine dining restaurant, to celebrate special occasions. We go for their most expensive set for 2, which consists of starters, salad, soups, main course and desserts. Using quality ingredients and fine to attention details, every dishes was presented exquisitely, with nice blend of flavour and savoury, fresh and sweet in taste. Steak was cooked using sous vide technique, ensuring that it was tender and juicy, best to pair with a glass of red wine to elevate the flavour. Price was surprisingly reasonable, given the ambience and quality of food served. We were definitely be back when we visit Saigon again!!

Tucked away in a smaller alley in Ward 6, District 3 in Ho Chi Minh is this unique restaurant. I had seen online when home in Australia then when in Ho Chi Minh went a few days earlier to make arrangements re: specifics of what I wanted and paid deposit. On arrival all looked as expected. We were given menu immediately and needed to make selections for the night as 4 of the 5 courses had choices ! Easy enough . Had to ask for drinks menu and placed our orders and then courses started to arrive . The cake and happy birthday song came out after the first course. After having our final bite of our 3rd course the assistant waiter had our main course signalling the main waiter to take our current plate away to put main course plate down. We then had to ask as our cocktail was finished could he now get us our bottle of wine we had ordered as would obviously like to enjoy with the main course. Pace seemed very rushed . I had to use google translate to get this message across . This being said food was very nice . Ambience very was lovely . I would definitely recommend for a special occasion. It was also in mine opinion excellent value for money . The waiter was very attentive to all requests when asked and a great picture taker for all different couples , groups celebrating an event that evening Just please don’t rush the food.

Service was perfection as well as the food We were amazed with the foie gras and the angus beef was cooked at the or its best The fish with its crusted top was very good Desserts are ok but not the restaurant best I would not recommend espresso as it was a simple shot of black coffee and not a real espresso

name: Mayonaka Sushi
description:
A little gift, beautifully crafted.

From today, get a complimentary Salmon Rose sashimi when you book in advance and have a bill from 699,000 VND.

This elegant dish is our chef’s signature
example_reviews: Phenomenal. Probably the best sushi I have had to date. Fish was fresh and melted in your mouth, wasabi was strong and prices are really cheap. Staff were really accommodating and the whole experience felt authentic.

Thank you very much for giving me the chance to talk about my favourite restaurant. The name of my favourite restaurant is Mayonaka and it’s situated in the centre place of the city (175 De Tham street , Pham ngu lao ward, District 1. I like the spacious, serene environment, serves and tasty food. It is a two storeyed restaurant 2nd floor is reserved for different parties or special events. The room is large and The restaurant offers several dishes including exotic desserts, sashimi , sushi, ice-creams the food is more than great) The prices are reasonable and the foods are served quickly and discount for regular customers are two other reasons I like it more than other restaurants in Ho Chi Minh city

If you are looking for sushi at the very highest level in Ho Chi Minh City, you cannot avoid this address. The fish is simply extra class and even Wagyu fillet is served to Fine Dining Fans - and all at a price that is more than just reasonable, because in Europe a dinner in a Japanese restaurant of this class would be good and happy to cost three times as much and then probably not nearly as perfect! Just a big praise to the service and the kitchen! However, since the restaurant is not too big, it is definitely worth the Reservation in advance.

name: Cafe Hanoi Moment
address: 62 Nguyen Thai Hoc, Ba Dinh, Ha Noi, Viet Nam, Hanoi 000084 Vietnam
description: Nestled in a beautifully preserved French colonial villa, our café offers a unique blend of history, elegance, and charm. Surrounded by high ceilings, vintage tiled floors, and delicate wooden shutters. The ambiance is warm and inviting, perfect for those who appreciate a touch of nostalgia with their coffee.
example_reviews: I ordered an chocolate cheese foam with milk and a tiramisu. The coffee was rich and flavorful, not too sweet—just perfect for my taste. The tiramisu was soft, creamy, and delicious without being too heavy. The staff was friendly, attentive, and always ready to assist customers. Additionally, the café played soft, soothing music, making it an ideal spot for working or unwinding. The prices were reasonable for the quality offered.
Beautiful decor and great coffee, with very friendly service. We were a group of 16 which were easily accommodated in a lovely open space upstairs (with air con!)

name: Villa Des Fleurs
address: 95 Quán Thánh, Ba Dinh, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Villa des Fleurs is well located near popular sites in the centre of Hanoi, providing a handy respite from the bustle of the city.The attentiveness and friendly hospitality of the Villa des Fleurs staff are well-known. You receive individualised treatment and are treated like a cherished guest from the moment you arrive, making your stay genuinely unforgettable. Another highlight is the Villa des Fleurs dining experience. Meals are excellent and exquisitely presented as a result of the chef's commitment to using local, fresh ingredients.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Ba Dinh
Street Food Restaurants in Ba Dinh
Italian Restaurants for Lunch in Ba Dinh
Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Ba Dinh
example_reviews: Villa des Fleurs is well located near popular sites in the centre of Hanoi, providing a handy respite from the bustle of the city.The attentiveness and friendly hospitality of the Villa des Fleurs staff are well-known. You receive individualised treatment and are treated like a cherished guest from the moment you arrive, making your stay genuinely unforgettable. Another highlight is the Villa des Fleurs dining experience. Meals are excellent and exquisitely presented as a result of the chef's commitment to using local, fresh ingredients.

This is a beautifully decorated restaurant with fresh flowers throughout- attentive service and beautifully presented dishes. I had delicious smoked salmon, avocado toast - my friends teased me for choosing non- Vietnamese foood, but it was really delicious!!

"The coffee of this place is simply amazing! The taste is solid and aromatic, with a perfect balance between sweetness and acidity. The environment is cozy, ideal for a moment of relaxation or even to work. The service is friendly and quick, making the experience even better. In addition to coffee, there are delicious options of sweets and salts that perfectly combine with the drink. Prices are fair for the quality offered. If you love good coffee, this place is undoubtedly a great choice!"

name: Aira Sky Bar & Restaurant
address: 38A Tran Phu St AIRA Boutique Hanoi Hotel & Spa, Ba Dinh, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Whether you’re in the mood for a happy hour cocktail, a late-night nightcap, or a delightful dinner, indulge yourself at AIRA Sky Bar & Lounge, perched on the 10th and 11th floors. This stunning rooftop venue offers unrivaled panoramic views of the city skyline, including the iconic Hanoi Flag Tower and the beautifully illuminated National Assembly Building. Savor a carefully curated menu featuring charcuterie, cold cuts, fresh fruit platters, and a selection of fast-prepared delights alongside authentic Vietnamese cuisine. Let our talented mixologists impress you with exquisitely crafted cocktails or a handpicked collection of fine wines. Sink into plush sofas, cushioned seats, or high chairs as you take in the breathtaking sunset, soak up the city lights, and unwind to the rhythm of the music. This is your moment—relax and enjoy it.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Ba Dinh
Fast Food Restaurants in Ba Dinh
Asian Restaurants for Lunch in Ba Dinh
Cafes for Lunch in Ba Dinh
example_reviews: We actually stumbled across this bar because we needed to go toilet. Lol didn't realise it was a hidden gem with sky deck views of the city and fabulous cocktaiks and great music. The service was soo friendly and the staff were a joy. Gave us many tips what to do while we stay in Hanoi. The restaurant served amazing food which was open until 10pm so after our drinks on the sky bar we went to the restaurant to eat. Fabulous 👌 we will return ♥️

Bunbonambo is a good restaurant. It's a bit pricey, but the service is good and the view is good. The lemon lassi is delicious and everything is good, but you have to ask for water separately. I guess they charge extra for water. I asked for a lot of cilantro, and they gave me a generous amount. I was very satisfied with this.

I feel like the restaurant misses the spotlight due to the excellent bar on the roof.... I am a guest at Aira Hotel and usually I avoid hotel restaurants as they are more then usually pretty average. But tonight due to the unfortunate situation of being hit by a motorcycle crossing the road I decided to try the restaurant, rather than go out and risk being run over again... OMG this restaurant is amazing. The staff are so attentive and really care how you are doing, explaining the best way to enjoy each dish, and offer suggestions throughout the evening. But the food is incredible. I went for a set menu, which comes with three courses and a glass of wine. Each course was bursting with flavour and was a joy to eat. The meal was the perfect size leaving me very satisfied at the end. Perfect time to hit the sky Bar and Lounge and enjoy an Espresso Martini!

name: Co Vietnamese Restaurant & Vegan
address: 21 Hàng Cân, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: A distinctive, well-preserved and comfortable space, high-quality products, authentic cuisine, food and drinks are done flawlessly.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Cafes for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
review_summary:
Co Vietnamese Restaurant & Vegan is celebrated for offering authentic Vietnamese cuisine that reviewers find both flavorful and fresh. Guests have called out the establishment's reasonable pricing, considering the quality of the meals served.

The service at this restaurant earns rave reviews for its quick, attentive, and knowledgeable staff, contributing to a superior dining experience. Many travelers also find the atmosphere cozy and welcoming, providing a lively yet intimate setting that is perfect for a range of occasions.
example_reviews: Super friendly and cozy restaurant with locals and tourists. The staff is very nice. Zin Zin was the one who served me and he taught me how to eat the Vietnamese pancake. Also had shrimp with coconut and rice yogurt for dessert. All very delicious. There’s an 8% tax added to the prices and if you pay with card an extra 3%

Very friendly staff, and could speak decent English. Helped me to pick the right amount of food and showed me photos of what I was ordering. The menu was also in English. Delicious food, and fair prices.

We were impressed by the excellent dining experience at this restaurant. We tried the Vietnamese spring rolls, crispy on the outside, bitten down to make a slight crunch, and the filling was very fresh, full of vegetable aromas and meaty, layered taste. The service was also impeccable, the staff were very warm, friendly, always smiling, attentively answered all our questions and made us feel at home. In addition, the restaurant's environment is comfortable and welcoming, with chic and Vietnamese decor, perfect for parties, family dinners or a drink with friends. Enjoying food in such an environment is such an enjoyable experience that we look forward to coming back again!

name: Lighthouse Sky Bar & Restaurant
address: 27 Hang Be Rooftop, La Siesta Premium Hang Be Hotel, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: This ambitiously structured bar (unique to Hanoi and Vietnam for that matter) is styled on a boat which creatively plays to the meaning of Hang Be street. The bar is â€˜mooredâ€™ over three levels of terrace space (Rooftop floors); its bow with the bar area overlooks the street while at the back the stern faces the Red River.
cuisines: Late Night Asian Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: We came to the restaurant to celebrate our anniversary and were very happy with how we were treated. The food was a little expensive in my opinion but given how amazing the customer service was, we feel like itâ€™s justified. Definitely will be recommending our friends here

Our favorite rooftop bar for the combination of a group of professional bartenders, range of drinks and great waiters. Outside seating was very comfortable (not the high seating) and service was constant and efficient. I think we came here 3 times. The happy hour is good value. They even gave my partner a wrap when it got cold. That wrap was clean and did the job. The lighted signs make this place attractive. The prices on the regular menu are high but the non happy hour cocktail (Le vie en rose) was very tasty. We had the canapÃ© plate and we thought it was on the small side which is our only complaint. All in all a lovely spot to chill and yes meet some nice people.

This is a beautiful roof top bar with an amazing view and such an excellent service. Liam was kind enough to take some nice pictures of us and helped us select our drinks, the drinks are potent and delicious. The food was good and the vibe is amazing :) youâ€™re greeted with such warmth that you feel like staying here! Highly recommended. Itâ€™s cold so wear accordingly.

name: Hoang's Restaurant
address: 54 Hang Buom Street, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Hoang's Restaurant - Vietnamese Restaurant & Vegan Food located in heart of oldquater in walking street and night market. so it's easier for customers after eating luch or dinner to walk around walking street or visit night market . We are large restaurant with 3 floors where can accommodate up to 200 people at the same time. We serve 100% Vietnamese Cuisine & Vegetarian food. We are not stop there we will bring Vietnamse food around the world.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
American Restaurants for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: Hoang's Restaurant in Hanoi offers a delightful dining experience with a blend of traditional Vietnamese flavors and modern touches. The menu features an array of delicious local dishes, including flavorful pho and fresh spring rolls. The ambiance is cozy and welcoming, with attentive service that makes you feel right at home. It's a great spot for both casual meals and more intimate dinners, offering excellent value for the quality of food. Highly recommended for anyone wanting to explore authentic Vietnamese cuisine in a charming setting!

Food was great. Coconut coffee, egg cofee and the salted caramel coffee was tasty!Price is reasonable. Fast servcie! Staff are most helpful and very kind. Mai and the other staff were very attentive and made sure we were comfortable.

I had an amazing dining experience at Hoang Restaurant in Hanoi! The Vietnamese food was absolutely delicious – every dish was packed with authentic flavors and beautifully presented. The highlight of my visit, however, was the fantastic service. The waiter captain was not only attentive but also incredibly fun and full of humor, which made the atmosphere so much more enjoyable. I highly recommend this place if you're looking for great food and a lively, welcoming vibe. I'll definitely be coming back! Very good service staff

name: Cau Go Vietnamese Cuisine Restaurant
address: No 9 Dinh Tien Hoang Street, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Nestled in the heart of Hanoi, Cau Go Vietnamese Cuisine celebrates the rich heritage of Vietnamese food and culture. Recognized in the Michelin Guide for two consecutive years, we are dedicated to preserving authentic flavors with fresh, locally sourced ingredients. From the vibrant flavors of the North to the bold spices of the Central and Southern regions, each dish tells a story of Vietnam’s diverse culinary traditions. With a breathtaking view of Hoan Kiem Lake, Cau Go Vietnamese Cuisine offers an elegant yet warm setting where guests can savor true Vietnamese cuisine while embracing the beauty of Hanoi.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: The welcome from downstairs, the short lift ride and arriving in this swish designer space with amazing view unto the lake and red bridge was already a good sign. We chose various dishes, all absolutely delicious, but for me the grilled squid on charcoal and the tender chayote greens were a hit. We also had deep fried vietnamese springrolls and bbq pork ribs. But the impeccable, friendly service from Vy, made it a memorable evening. We will be back. Thank you.

This time, we received very polite service and were able to enjoy our meal. Thank you very much. The staff kindly recommended menu items, which allowed us to enjoy delicious food. The atmosphere of the restaurant was also very comfortable, allowing us to relax and enjoy our meal. We would definitely like to use your restaurant again in the future. Thank you very much!

It was nice to be able to have a meal in a nice atmosphere while looking at the night view of the lake in the evening. A staff member named Pam complimented the menu, everything was delicious and she was really friendly. I especially recommend the eel dish. It's eaten like Vietnamese spring rolls, but it's delicious. The grilled squid is okay, but the sauce is really unique, but it's delicious. It goes well together. Even my dad, who doesn't like the unique leafy flavor, enjoyed it.

name: Steakout
address: 24 Tran Hung Dao, Hanoi Vietnam
description: This is difficult for me to say having spent most of my 58 years in Texas and Arizona, prime beef states both, the Steak Out served me one of the best steaks I have had in 15 years.  I don’t know whether we are feeding our beef too many drugs or what, but this steak was like the steaks of my youth.  Delicious! Sides were tasty and had a decent Australian Red by the glass.  If you need a little western fare, I highly recommend.  My sister agrees 100%!
example_reviews: This is difficult for me to say having spent most of my 58 years in Texas and Arizona, prime beef states both, the Steak Out served me one of the best steaks I have had in 15 years. I don’t know whether we are feeding our beef too many drugs or what, but this steak was like the steaks of my youth. Delicious! Sides were tasty and had a decent Australian Red by the glass. If you need a little western fare, I highly recommend. My sister agrees 100%!

since 5 weeks in Asia, this place saved us. Finally we found someone who knows how to prepare a steak, has very professional service team embedded in a nicely designed restaurant. From greeting till leaving, everything was perfect. The Pizza of our son, the apetizers, the steak and the ribs, all high quality. Yes a bit privy, but really worth it!

After a week of the best pho you will ever eat, it's nice to have something a little closer to home. This place fits the bill nicely. Well decorated and the service is good, but not fast. The servings were appropriately sized, not huge American portions. The hot pate and compound butter served with the bread basket was a nice touch. We had the sea bass and seafood squid-ink pasta, both were very good. We will probably try it again before going home. It would have been nice to have at least one traditional Vietnamese dish for those in our party who were still enthusiastic about going local.

name: Quan Que Restaurant
address: 80 P. Mã Mây, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Located at the 80 Mã Mây St, one of the most oldest street in Hanoi's Old Quarter. The historic building is situated amid the quaint winding streets. A great place for Group or individual travelers, local people who wants to enjoy Authentic Vietnamese Cuisine and beverage. Restaurants offers private or common rooms within 300 seats at one time and great point to arrange for any special Events. Quan Que reminds you to think about the beautiful picturesque Vietnamese’s rural markets, which is really colorful of Cuisine & Culture.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: Great Food and very big portions… Amazing service and very good prices.😋😋😋 Very nice traditional location I‘ll vome back again

I had the pleasure of dining at Quan Que during my recent trip to Vietnam, and it was an experience I won't forget. Located in a charming part of town, this restaurant offers a perfect blend of traditional Vietnamese flavors and a cozy, inviting atmosphere. The staff were incredibly friendly and attentive, making sure our every need was met without being overbearing. The restaurant itself has a rustic, authentic feel, with wooden tables, lanterns, and beautiful decor that captures the essence of Vietnamese culture. As for the food, it was absolutely outstanding. We started with the Goi Cuon (fresh spring rolls) and Banh Xeo (Vietnamese pancakes), both of which were bursting with flavor and made with the freshest ingredients. The highlight of the meal was definitely the Pho – a warm, aromatic bowl of noodles with a rich broth that had been simmering for hours. The balance of herbs, meat, and broth was perfect!

Came here tonight with some friends I’m travelling with and was served by Henry who was so sweet and had amazing service! Spent 210.000VND on a drink and main meal (just over $8), which is amazing value for the deliciously large portion of pineapple fried rice I enjoyed. Thank you Henry for giving us great recommendations- my friends really enjoyed the beef pancake dish which was showed to us how to properly eat it. I was so jealous, it looked so good! Overall great place for all demographics :)

name: Hanoi Coffee Culture
address: 45 Nguyen Huu Huan, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Hanoi Coffee Culture & Brunch serve variety of high quality coffee and brunch including Egg Coffee, Coconut Coffee and Big breakfast. It built in very beautiful old French colonial building background design.
example_reviews: This place has a really nice atmosphere and a light, accessible menu for when you feel like a break the deep-fried delights of Hanoi. We had two salted coffees, an americano, an avocado smoothie, peanut butter sourdough toast and a fruit salad breakfast bowl for 10 GBP. Itâ€™s also right next to the home of the original Hanoi egg coffee.

A cute little spot with an upstairs air conditioned room if you need to escape the Hanoi heat, or a perfect people watching covered alley if you need to shelter from the rain. I visited twice during my visit to Hanoi, warmly welcomed and served by Chi on my second visit. The biggest draw for me was the Italian style coffee offerings (excellent latte) as a break from Vietnamese filter coffee. For those alternative milk hunters, oat milk is on offer. I also enjoyed the oat bowl (which again I think was made with a non-dairy milk). Whilst pricier than local-style coffee/breakfast offerings it was worth it.

Egg coffee is not what you may imagine. It was invented at the 5-star iconic Metropole Hotel in Hanoi when the French wanted a cappuccino and there was no milk. So, frothed egg whites, then frothed eggs, and finally frothed egg yolks were added to make a drink tasting like the best-ever tiramisu. This cafÃ© has been confirmed to be the #1 choice for the best egg coffee ever. I agree!

name: Ozone Sky Lounge & Restaurant
description: Ozone Sky Lounge & Restaurant – Hanoi’s Most Stunning Rooftop Escape! ✨ Perched on the 10th floor in the heart of the Old Quarter, Ozone is the only rooftop bar boasting an unbeatable view of the iconic St. Joseph Cathedral—a breathtaking backdrop for unforgettable moments. Savor delicious cuisine, from gourmet bites to authentic Vietnamese flavors, paired with creative cocktails, fine wines, or artisanal coffee. Dive into relaxation in our outdoor jacuzzi pool while soaking up Hanoi’s vibrant skyline. With live music weekly, the atmosphere is always electric—perfect for sunset cocktails, romantic dates, or lively gatherings. Whether you're here for afternoon tea, sunset drinks, or a night under the stars, Ozone offers a luxurious escape in the soul of Hanoi. Come for the view, stay for the vibe! #HanoiRooftop #SkyLounge #OzoneHanoi
example_reviews: We were looking for a place to chill out for about six hours until we caught a sleeper bus out of the city and we came across what turned out to be a little gem of a roof top pool bar which Included lockers and shower facilities . The bar is very smartly laid out with a cool design throughout and the seating is very comfortable. The food was absolutely gorgeous and the presentation was fit for the king of England himself ! Specifically, we had the duck, spring rolls, vegetable salad, pumpkin soup and crab fish cakes. The bar itself is great with a wide variety of drinks ! And finally, but certainly not least the bar staff themselves are very warm, welcoming and accommodating which made the whole experience what it was. which when I reflect on my experience at the bar it was simply outstanding and I hope to return or the very least I will recommend my friends and family that come to Hanoi to go and see how great it is for themselves. Big shout out to the bar staff particularly Sang, Vu, Dylan that made it so welcoming.

Staying in the hotel we had an afternoon at the Sky Lounge we enjoyed relaxing by the pool then day into evening had a few drinks and asked the lovely Chien could we eat from the dinner menu? Chien was so attentive and gave us a 5 star service with drinks and dinner. Nothing was too much trouble. A nice casual afternoon evening with amazing Mussels and wine, the largest I’ve ever had! Chien made our experience the best, such a friendly great English speaking member of staff!

Excellent night! We had an incredible time! We will listen to the DJ again and have shots with Fiu, our waiter who treated us very well. If you come to Vietnam, spend a few hours at night having a few drinks and listening to music, highly recommended!!!

name: Hong Hoai's Restaurant
address: 20 Bat Dan, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Welcome to Hong Hoai's Restaurant, a premier Vietnamese restaurant in the heart of Hanoi Old quarter . Celebrated for our authentic Vietnamese cuisine, we offer a diverse menu that highlights the rich flavors off Vietnam. At Hong Hoai's, we cater to all tastes with our extensive restaurant food selection, featuring hearty breakfast options, delicious lunch and dinner plates, and a variety of selectable vegetarian dishes. As a top choice among vegetarian restaurants, we delight both vegetarians and non-vegetarians alike. Experience the aromatic and intricate tastes of Vietnamese food at Hong Hoai's, where every dish is crafted to perfection. Join us for a memorable culinary journey that brings the essence of Vietnamese cuisine to your table.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Pizza for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: Excellent restaurant in Hanoi!! We took nems to share as well as bun cha that we had to assemble ourselves in rice leaves (the waiter very kindly showed us how to do it), they were delicious!! Note that this restaurant is a bit more expensive than most restaurants in Hanoi, we got 6€ per person but it was really worth the cost. I recommend!!

Friendly and fast service. Fantastic Vietnamese food- rice paper spring rolls two different kinds of vegetarian with respective tofu and fried fish in with vegetables and delicious fresh herbs, soy dressing etc- the waiter showed us how, we had to fold them and they tasted heavenly. Clean and neat inside and outside a small terrace with rice paper lamps with light in one could also enjoy the view to the inside- on 1. Sal. Can highly recommend and almost a must

This place has lots of delicious gluten-free options, I was a pleasure to eat their Rice fried and their mango salad. Nice waiters and very knowledgeable about gluten-free, speak very good English, which made it really easy to explain my needs. They made me feel safe! ;) Present so many vegetable dishes, which we really enjoyed. Beautiful discovery, BRAVI!!!! ❤️❤️❤️💛💛🪷🪷🪷🪷

name: La Capo Cafe
address: 48 P. Lương Ngọc Quyến, Hanoi Vietnam
description: A traditional vietnamese coffee shop with high service standard offering amazing drinks and experience in the Old Quarter, covering a huge range of drinks and brunch like egg coffee, coconut coffee, healthy smoothie bowl, sandwiches, fresh juice and so much more to discover. But which made us stood out from others is that we are happy to share with you informations and recipes in multiple languages. Please come and enjoy!
example_reviews: This cafe serves some delicious and affordable options for breakfast and brunch. This morning I tried their dragon fruit smoothie bowl, which was priced just at $3.50. The bowl was full of vibrant colors and flavors - the smooth dragonfruit puree was topped with crunchy granola, fresh fruit like mango and banana. It made for a healthy start to the day. This also has a relaxing, cozy ambiance and the service was friendly. Besides the smoothie bowl, they offer a range of coffee drinks, pastries, and other breakfast about $3 to $6. Overall, it's a nice spot to grab a quick but quality meal without breaking the bank. I'd recommend giving the smoothie bowl a try if you're in the area.

Cafe La Capo in Hanoi's charming Old Quarter is a little slice of heaven. The staff is incredibly friendly and welcoming, always going the extra mile to ensure customers feel right at home. The cozy, intimate atmosphere and beautifully presented Vietnamese specialties make this cafe a must-visit destination for anyone exploring the city.

This cafe exudes a welcoming atmosphere, adorned with rustic decor and soothing music. The baristas showcase expertise, delivering aromatic coffee creations and delectable pastries. Despite its popularity, seating can be limited, prompting potential wait times. The efficient and friendly staff, coupled with a diverse menu, make it a charming destination for coffee enthusiasts seeking a cozy experience.

name: The Moose & Roo Smokehouse
address: 21 19, Hai Ba Trung Street Inside the American Club, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description:
Moose & Roo Smokehouse is a regular go to for our elementary school birthday parties & play dates. They have a hard surface basketball court; sand pit for volleyball; a nice playground with swings & soft floor; a football/soccer pitch/field that used to be dirt but is now turfed for all-weather play.

We are very excited!

We went the other day to watch the World Cup & they put two different games on for us (US v. Portugal; Vietnam v. Netherlands). We had a blast.

They have a kids menu & will also make kids portions from the options on main menu. Enough vegetarian options for us.

Staff is always helpful & obliging.

The turfing of the field is a real positive game changer as our son loves to chase a ball around rain or shine.
cuisines: American Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
Asian Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
BBQ Restaurants with Buffet in Hanoi

They have a hard surface basketball court; sand pit for volleyball; a nice playground with swings & soft floor; a football/soccer pitch/field that used to be dirt but is now turfed for all-weather play. We are very excited! We went the other day to watch the World Cup & they put two different games on for us (US v. Portugal; Vietnam v. Netherlands). We had a blast. They have a kids menu & will also make kids portions from the options on main menu. Enough vegetarian options for us. Staff is always helpful & obliging. The turfing of the field is a real positive game changer as our son loves to chase a ball around rain or shine.

Everyone enjoyed their meal. We had a chicken burger (3 layers of chicken), a chicken avocado wrap (lots of avocado and chicken) and a club sandwich. Fries and smoothie great too. And huge TV screens to watch the Aus Open tennis!

Our friends took us here while we visited town and said that their chicken wings were really good. They definitely were right. We had their sausages as well and it was also very good, a little bit peppery for my taste but that’s just personal taste! Will 100% recommend to my friends back home!

name: French Grill​ By Jean-François Nulli
address: 8, Đường Đỗ Đức Dục JW Marriott Hanoi Hotel, Nam Từ Liêm, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Inspired classics... The restaurant offers 82 seats in a simplistic modern design and lively setting, a semi-private and 2 private dining rooms, walk-in wine cooler with a selection of the finest wines in the world, and one of the largest open kitchen in Hanoi to complete this must see eatery in town. True French classics combined with the best to offer from the grill, prepared with the very best of products available in Vietnam. Open daily for dinner: 18:00 - 22:30 and Sunday Lunch: 11:30 a.m. - 2:30 p.m.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Nam Từ Liêm
Street Food Restaurants in Nam Từ Liêm
Korean Restaurants in Nam Từ Liêm
Healthy Restaurants in Nam Từ Liêm
BBQ Restaurants for Lunch in Nam Từ Liêm
Cafes for Lunch in Nam Từ Liêm
example_reviews: Incredible experience. Staff is knowledgeable about food, wine and general hospitality and provides personalised service. 10/10 would recommend the indulgence menu, great quality for a reasonable price, and premium, tasty dishes.

We attended this outstanding establishment in September 2024. My partner and I had planned to elope in Sapa with our parents, however Typhoon Yagi had other plans for us and we instead got married in a forest outside of Hanoi. Scrambling for a place to celebrate our nuptials we emailed several restaurants including the French Grill. From our initial correspondence with the helpful Assistant Manager Ms Nga Nguyen onwards, our experience was nothing less than magical. Ms Nga Nguyen was completely sympathetic of our change in wedding plans and the entire team at the French Grill went out of their way to make our evening as seamless and special possible, including arranging a beautiful flower arrangement for our table even though the restaurant does not typically use flowers as part of their décor. We secured the Burgundy Room, a semi-private dining area that suited our needs perfectly. One of our party is vegetarian and had a delectable six course dining experience which was delivered and explained with as much care and thoughtfulness as the Indulgence Menu, chosen by the rest of us. We were served by the knowledgeable and charming Kian who was respectful of our need for privacy but equally seemed to be able to anticipate our every need and answer our every query with professionalism, grace and consideration, and even managed to delight and surprise us multiple times during the evening with his thoughtfulness. Kian, we wish you all the best with your career as a sommelier and have no doubt that you will be successful in all that you aspire to do. On to the food. Frankly, I was concerned that our parents would feel out of place and ill at ease with "fancy French food" that was completely unfamiliar to them. I need not have worried. My 79 year father has told us (and everyone he knows) repeatedly that the meal he had at the French Grill was the best he has had in his life and easily the highlight of his 2024 (even more so than presiding over our marriage ceremony in a the forest which was pretty spectacular). The Snow Crab was a real favourite on the table and each plate appeared more stunning and show-stopping than the dish before. There is a chocolatier on site and although we were all stuffed to the gills by the end of the night, the team brought us a selection of goodies as a parting gift and we all seemed to be able to make room for the deliciousness that followed - we cannot recommend trying the chocolate strongly enough. A huge thanks to the entire kitchen staff at the French Grill for a meal of a lifetime, unfortunately we did not have the foresight to ask for any names for our review (which we did not really intend to write as we never do, but thought the French Grill deserves all the public gratitude it can get). Overall, our night at the French Grill was so incredibly memorable and perfect. Budding photographer Nga Nguyen took some lovely photographs of our group and called us a taxi as we sadly said goodbye; she made us feel truly cared from from start to finish. We must thank mother nature for changing our destiny as we would not have had the pleasure at dining at this truly special establishment if our wedding had gone ahead as we had planned.

We enjoyed a family celebration at the French grill and absolutely loved it. The hostess, manager, waitresses and bartender were all amazing, bringing a small cake while singing happy birthday and making fun special mocktails for the table. The filets were ridiculous and the kids loved the lobster bisque and fresh bread with various butters! Thanks for a memorable night during our stay at the JW Marriott!

name: Cha Ca Thang Long
address: 21 Duong Thanh Street Old Quarter, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Be careful as google maps points you a different restaurant. The proper one is at 6B Duong Thanh Street. I have to give a mixed review because the food was good despite being ripped off. We ordered as a couple 2 off the cha ca dishes at 140,000 VND dong each plus 2 Hanoi beers at 30,000 VND but we were charged the set menu which includes spring rolls at 176,000 VND each. This was also the only restaurant in our entire Vietnam trip to charge an additional 8% VAT so we ended up paying 455,000 VND in total. Note also this restaurant only takes cash. I also felt that we were short served as we ordered two serves of cha ca which came out in a single pan but we would be lucky to have 5 small pieces of fish each (can barely see the fish under the veges). However, the meal itself was very tasty. So overall I feel that this place takes advantage of tourists especially if you can't speak Vietnamese.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Seafood Restaurants for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
Romantic Fusion Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
American Restaurants for Lunch in Hoan Kiem

I have to give a mixed review because the food was good despite being ripped off. We ordered as a couple 2 off the cha ca dishes at 140,000 VND dong each plus 2 Hanoi beers at 30,000 VND but we were charged the set menu which includes spring rolls at 176,000 VND each. This was also the only restaurant in our entire Vietnam trip to charge an additional 8% VAT so we ended up paying 455,000 VND in total. Note also this restaurant only takes cash. I also felt that we were short served as we ordered two serves of cha ca which came out in a single pan but we would be lucky to have 5 small pieces of fish each (can barely see the fish under the veges). However, the meal itself was very tasty. So overall I feel that this place takes advantage of tourists especially if you can't speak Vietnamese.

If you're in Hanoi and looking to indulge in one of the city's most iconic dishes, Chả Cá Thăng Long is a must-visit! This cozy, family-owned restaurant specializes in Chả Cá, a traditional Vietnamese dish featuring grilled fish served with fresh herbs, peanuts, and rice noodles. From the moment you walk in, you’re greeted by the sizzling aroma of fish being grilled right in front of you. The fish is tender, slightly crispy on the outside, and beautifully flavored with turmeric and dill, creating the perfect balance of taste. It’s served with a variety of fresh herbs, bean sprouts, and peanuts to add crunch and freshness to each bite. The portion size is generous, making it a great value for the price. The staff is friendly and quick, adding to the warm and welcoming atmosphere of the restaurant. If you’re in the mood for an authentic taste of Hanoi, Chả Cá Thăng Long won’t disappoint. It’s a quintessential Vietnamese experience that lives up to its reputation and then some!

Nice restaurant in the historic center of Hanoi, with tables outside and inside. As soon as we arrived it was very crowded but (even though we had a reservation) we were able to sit immediately on the first floor. The staff did not speak English very well, they presented us with the (basic) menu, asking us if we agreed to order 2 sets of menus. Without really understanding what they included, we took the plunge and asked for spring rolls too. The setting was immediately prepared for us, with different sauces, herbs and noodles to accompany the main course, which was served in a convivial pan placed in the center of the table, on a small stove used to complete the dish at the table. We were also shown how to compose the dish (lightly breaded fish fillets, with dill and other vegetables) using the ingredients previously brought to the table. All very pleasant and light, the spring rolls served separately were simply fabulous!! Extremely appropriate and low bill compared to European standards (€18 for two with drinks, water and Pepsi). Ideal for a taste of Vietnamese cuisine in an authentic, no-frills venue. For a quick meal! Advised!

name: Don Duck Old Quarter Restaurant
address: 29 Bát Đàn Hang Bo, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: The Don Duck old quarter restaurant providing Different Ducks& Duck dishes. We also serving special Vietnamese traditional meal and hot-pot and western food. With more than 20 years of experience in customer service we guarantee we bring Fresh, healthy product to served our customers. Visit us for an experience of duck dishes
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: We heard that Don Duck 2 in the old quarter was highly recommended and had their version of a Michelin star so we went there with high expectations, and we were not disappointed. Whilst the restaurant is small and on multiple levels it is best to book your table before arriving as even in the early evening the restaurant was packed. As the name suggests it specialises in duck based dishes but does still cater for those who wish to dine on something else. As a lover of duck dishes I tried their Duck spring rolls and was blown away at how good they were followed by Grilled duck on the table whilst N chose a chicken dish with rice which she thoroughly enjoyed. Finally whilst the food and service was exceptional the cost was significantly lower than one would expect from a Michelin star restaurant with main, (duck), courses starting from as little as 155,000dong.

Going off google reviews we found Don Duck… wasn’t disappointed.. good to see a restaurant specialising in one product and doing it 100%. Small aircon eating area downstairs, more seating upstairs. Staff were exceptional. Drinks cold and well priced - due to being busy they have us complimentary spring rolls while we waited. It was only a 10 min wait.

Our family had the pleasure of dining at Don Duck Old Quarter Restaurant in Vietnam, and it was an experience to remember! We ordered a variety of dishes including the Crispy Duck Spring, 1 1/4 Roasted Duck, Stir Fried Chicken, Vietnamese Beef Steak, and Seafood Fried Rice. Each dish was fantastic, bursting with authentic flavors and cooked to perfection.The Roasted Duck, in particular, was a standout—tender, juicy, and wonderfully seasoned. The Crispy Duck Spring was a delightful start to our meal, and the Vietnamese Beef Steak was a delicious twist on a classic. The Stir Fried Chicken and Seafood Fried Rice were also excellent, perfectly complementing the rich flavors of the duck dishes.Our meal was accompanied by refreshing drinks: Watermelon Juice, Lemon Juice, Coke, Orange Juice, and Lavie Water, which paired well with the food and added to the overall enjoyment of our lunch.The ambiance of the restaurant is warm and welcoming, making it a great spot for a family meal. The staff were attentive and provided excellent service throughout our visit.We highly recommend Don Duck Old Quarter Restaurant for anyone looking to enjoy authentic and delicious Vietnamese cuisine. It’s a must-visit if you’re in the area!

name: Ding Doong Restaurant
address: 18-20 P. Nhà Chung Grand Hotel du LAC, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Beautiful view of the St. Joseph Church. Great live Violin & Guitar perfomance. Looking for a private and intimate dining experience for your special occasions or business meetings? Ding Doong Restaurant has got you covered with our private dining room that can accommodate up to 20 guests. With a comfortable and stylish setting, it is ideal for small gatherings, parties and events. From birthday celebrations to corporate dinners, our private dining room is equipped with everything you need to make your occasion special. Book now for an unforgettable dining experience.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
review_summary:
Ding Doong Restaurant has earned rave reviews for its exceptional service, with many diners noting the staff's attentiveness and professionalism. The vibrant atmosphere, enriched by live music and cozy decor, complements the beautiful city vistas, particularly the view of St. Joseph's Cathedral.

Patrons love the fresh, perfectly prepared dishes, lauding the authentic Vietnamese flavors with a modern twist. Furthermore, the value for money at Ding Doong is often highlighted, with guests appreciating the combination of superb service, high-quality cuisine, and the inviting ambiance.
example_reviews: Beautiful atmosphere with a rooftop view of Hanoi. We arrived early, before 6:30 and witnessed a magnificent sunset. The service was very pampering and attentive. Every dish was well done and very appealing. We had the chef salad and for dishes- the grilled chicken and the salmon. The prices are much higher than typical Vietnamese restaurants, but for the food, service and location, it is worth it. Would recommend!

The staffs were very accommodating especially Eric and Emma. And I would like to thank all the other staffs who made the special notes for my mom ♥️ The food was delicious. The serving was big and the ambiance of the restaurant was very amusing as you can see the cathedral.

What an incredible dining experience! The restaurant has a lovely atmosphere that’s perfect for any occasion, whether it’s a casual dinner or a celebration. The staff were incredibly polite and went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed. The food was absolutely delicious—every dish was prepared to perfection, with the flavors perfectly balanced and ingredients that tasted incredibly fresh. I was especially impressed with the attention to detail in presentation. The portion sizes were just right, leaving us satisfied but not overstuffed. It’s clear that a lot of care and passion go into every aspect of this restaurant.

name: Lá Lốt Vietnamese Cuisine & Wine
address: 61 Lương Ngọc Quyến, Hoàn Kiếm Tầng 3, Hanoi 11000 Vietnam
description:
The first time I came here, I had a good impression from the name to the food. The restaurant space has a creative bar design with lighting through cups, the color space is soft, but the lighting is not right at each table position, the dishes are decorated. Beautiful decoration, beautiful ceramics, but the spotlight is evenly lit so it can't be turned on. Because the light is even, not focusing on the table, taking photos of people or dishes often ends up in shadows.
Regarding the service, you guys are gentle, enthusiastic, very nice, but the dishes don't seem to be in the right order, the main dish comes before the soup, so you should add them gradually in order so that the dishes don't get cold and the eating experience will be better. will be better.
Regarding drinks, the fizz leaf juice is delicious, and the apricot tea, I think, should be less of the tea flavor so the apricot flavor will be clearer.
Regarding the food, most of the dishes are very delicious, I really like them (mushroom soup, beef rolled in lolot leaves, lentil fish). The remaining rambutan salad with onions made it a bit too pungent for me, the beef taste of the bland dish made the pungent taste even more obvious. The pork banh mi dish has a strong bread taste, so the color of the lolot leaf flavor is not strong, and the flavor of the dish is not clear.
Today is my birthday so I should write a bit long. I am satisfied with my experience at the shop. I wish the shop to develop better!

This restaurant is located in Hanoi old quarter on 3rd floor of building. Last night, we visited the restaurant was busy but comfortable and dinning experience was incredible. Although the food was bit a low due to the crowd, the staff there were very attentive, they apologized and served us snacks while waiting

The restaurant serves mainly Vietnamese dishes at affordable prices. Enthusiastic and attentive service staff, worthy of 10 points for service quality. I think the food suits my taste, in addition, there are a few dipping sauces that I find quite impressive. Recommend for everyone to visit the restaurant to dine with family/relatives ^^

name: Vie L'essence De Cuisine
address: 99B Hang Gai St, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 11015 Vietnam
description: Vie L'essence De Cuisine là nhà hàng đầu tư chỉn chu về chất lượng và dịch vụ. Nó được trang trí bằng những đồ vật quen thuộc với cuộc sống đời thường của người việt như ngói, sen,… Mỗi góc phòng đều trang trí tỉ mỉ và mang lại không gian như nhà. Bạn có thể thưởng thức hơn các món ăn truyền thống Việt tại đây.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: L’essence de cuisine is a good spot to go for dinner, but I’m not sure it deserves to be ranked as one of the best in Hanoi. I don't specifically have anything bad to say - the food just didn’t blow me away. The service was very good, the ambience was nice and the presentation of each dish was carefully thought out. However, I don’t believe it should be ranked in the top 5 of the city. I did not feel that the food on the couples tasting menu was that memorable or flavourful enough to justify the price. It was definitely tasty, but not super unique. They are always looking to improve so I’m sure that this restaurant can work it’s way up to be a top location in Hanoi.

Had a wonderful dinner at L’essence de la Via Cuisine. The food was absolutely delicious — every dish full of flavour and beautifully presented. The cocktails were expertly made and really added to the experience. What stood out most was the exceptional service — the waiting staff were warm, attentive, and made us feel so welcome throughout the evening. Highly recommend this place for a special night out. Top marks all around!

On our last evening in Vietnam we went to eat at this place, hoping to end on a high note. Instead, despite the pleasant environment, we ate poorly, in fact we almost didn't eat, because after the first tastes we didn't like the food. Unfortunately, our evening was ruined, because we had no alternatives for that evening, we didn't trust ourselves to go, at a late hour, to another random restaurant in the center of Hanoi, and so we were left disappointed and fasting. My husband gave it a negative review. This fact and this unpleasant situation cannot be erased. However, after a few days, when we had already returned home to Italy, the owner, not present on the evening of dinner, refunded us the bill paid, after having been asked, through the email with which we had booked, for the data banking. Making mistakes in the kitchen, or in the dining room, can sometimes happen, and it has already happened even in the best restaurants. Fully refund the amount paid, days later and 13,000 km later. It had never happened to me before. Compliments. It seems right to me to also review this correct behavior.

name: The Rhythms Restaurant
address: 33 - 35 Hang Dau 7th Floor, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Our restaurant concept is formed in harmony with the rhythms of the King’s Symphony, showcasing an orchestra of Vietnamese authentic cuisine embellished with the grandeur of royal ambience. The blending of sophisticated Western architecture with local heritage has created a beautiful melody, expected to touch the emotion of guests and take them on a unique sensory journey.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Italian Restaurants for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
Pizza for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: The Rhythms did not disappoint with its warm and classy atmosphere, and the excellent dishes in the Vietnamese set and Signature set will surely satisfy the discerning diners’ taste buds. To top that off, our server Katie was most friendly, knowledgeable and very attentive, making our dining experience a most enjoyable event. Highly recommended.

We had a wonderful experience at The Rhythms (33–34 Hàng Dầu, Hanoi) celebrating our 1st wedding anniversary. The restaurant thoughtfully decorated our table and provided very attentive service, making our special day even more memorable. Prices were reasonable, and the atmosphere was cozy with a perfect amount of space between tables, ensuring privacy and comfort. Special thanks to Hằng (Katie), who was extremely dedicated and caring throughout the evening. She made sure everything was perfect for us. The food was delicious, beautifully presented, and full of flavor. We highly recommend The Rhythms to couples and families looking for a lovely place to dine and celebrate special moments!

It's like going for dinner on the last day of our trip to Hanoi. I ordered a Vietnamese course and steak here. The course meal was more delicious than expected and the portion was sufficient. The steak I ordered was served after the course meal and before dessert. Perhaps because I was full after the course meal, the steak was not as tasty as I expected. There was little Maillard on the surface of the meat. I especially ordered T-bone, but the tenderloin was so small that I thought it was l-bone. The steak was cooked the way I wanted it to be, but it was a little disappointing, but I enjoyed it. Dessert wasn't that great. I think it would be better not to eat it. The server in charge of us treated us kindly, which left us with a good memory. I would like to visit again next time if I have the chance.

name: The Hudson Rooms - Capella Hanoi
address: 11 Le Phung Hieu Rooftop Capella Hanoi, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Imbibe a taste of exploration and optimism at the top of Hanoi Savour the boldest period-inspired flavours on our rooftop, tinged with the golden-pink hues of sunlight. Inspired by a renaissance of travel in the 1920’s, we transpose a golden era into the contemporary for your indulgence. Each encounter is infused with a sense of provenance and charm, from the finest selection of oysters and caviar that transport you to the sea, to hand-wrapped cigars and the finely crafted glasses our whiskey and artisanal cocktails are presented in.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Italian Restaurants for Large Groups in Hoan Kiem
Pizza for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: We came to dine with friends in Saigon, I always appreciate Hudson's service. Today, serving the private room is Mai An, enthusiastic and always taking care of guests. The space is comfortable and spacious. Food is not controversial, always diverse and very beautiful. The price is suitable for the restaurant's location, food quality and decoration space. There is nothing to criticize. Highly recommend.

A very sophisticated and stylish set up from the furnishings, menu, staff uniforms and facilities. As soon as you walk in you know you’re in for a treat. During happy hour between 5.30pm and 7.30pm buy 1 for 1 free drink and oysters on flow. A feel great bar and many drinks to choose from

We stopped into The Hudson Rooms at the top of the Capella Hotel for drinks and a snack before dinner at Backstage. The top floor space is gorgeous as is the rest of the hotel. It is reminiscent of top floor lounges in Hong Kong. Service is sophisticated and high end. Our shrimp cocktail was five tiny shrimp for a healthy amount of money, but I expect to pay for such a swanky bar. Drinks were fine and equally as expensive. The Hudson Rooms is a special place in Hanoi. It is worth the cost for that extraordinary setting.

name: Au Lac Family Restaurant
address: 23 Ngo Huyen Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Well-located in the very heart of the Hanoi Old Quarter center, also near by Hoan Kiem lake, Hanoi Cathedral, Au Lac Family Restaurant is one of the best choices for Traditional Vietnamese Food
cuisines: BBQ Restaurants with Buffet in Hanoi
example_reviews: Great food. Staff was very friendly and hospotable service. Superb experience overall.Affordable cost and the chicken curry with cocounut milk was very filling and tasty and the spice level was optimal making me eat stomachful.

Fantastic restaurant where the food tastes heavenly. We ate two people each 1 starter and 1 main course and were full. A starter costs about 70,000 vnd and 110,000 vnd. Drank a cold beer for 30,000. The staff is super friendly and will be happy to change the menu if you have an allergy to something or you just don't want it. For example Cilantro. The restaurant is larger than it can be seen from the road, there are several tables in the room at the back. Definitely worth a visit.

Delicious and fun dinner with my friends. We arrived when the restaurant was very crowded, the atmosphere was bustling with many people coming from everywhere. He welcomed us very warmly even though he was very busy, the food was really fresh and delicious and quite filling ( banana salad, fish tomato, chicken cashew …) we promised him to recommend this place

name: Luk Lak Vietnamese Restaurant
address: 4A Le Thanh Tong Phan Chu Trinh, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: • MICHELIN Bib Gourmand 2024 • A premium Vietnamese restaurant with modern "Indochine" architecture located in the heart of Hanoi, just 3 minutes walking from The Hanoi Opera House - With the well-known Chef Madame Bình from the best 5 stars hotel in Hanoi.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Italian Restaurants for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
Pizza for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: We visited Luk Lak Restaurant in Hanoi after seeing it recommended in the Michelin Guide with a Bib Gourmand distinction. The location is convenient, right near the Opera House, and the restaurant itself is spread across three nicely decorated floors, creating a pleasant and welcoming ambiance. The menu offered an impressive range of dishes, with photos and detailed English descriptions to make ordering easy. The staff were lovely—very friendly and attentive, adding to the positive atmosphere. For our meal, we chose the following: • Cua Lột Sốt Me Cuốn Bánh Tráng: Deep-fried soft-shell crab wrapped in rice paper with fresh herbs and seasonal vegetables, served with tamarind sauce. • Gà Nướng Tú Lệ: Grilled chicken with lime leaves, accompanied by sticky rice from Tu Le and special house-made sauces. • Vịt Cháy Tỏi: Pan-seared boneless duck with garlic from Ly Son, Thai basil, and pickled bamboo shoots. The portions were generous, and the presentation was good. However, the flavours didn’t quite meet our expectations. The lime leaves in the grilled chicken were almost imperceptible, and while the duck dish was better, it wasn’t particularly memorable. Overall, we were a bit underwhelmed given the restaurant’s reputation. It’s worth a visit for the ambiance and service, but the food might not leave a lasting impression. (Also posted to my food blog on Instagram @AbbeyKing16)

Luk Lak is a clear step above the average local restaurant without being significantly more expense. We enjoyed it so much the first time we dined there that we came back a couple of nights later. The room is well presented with a reasonable amount of space between the tables and we found the food delicious.

The restaurant spans three colonial-style floors, each exuding a nostalgic Indochine charm. The first floor houses a cozy café, while the upper levels provide spacious dining areas adorned with custom paintings celebrating Vietnamese heritage. Guided by Chef Madame Binh, who brings over 25 years of experience from Sofitel Legend Metropole Hanoi, the menu is a testament to Vietnam's rich culinary diversity. Dishes are crafted using regionally sourced ingredients, ensuring both authenticity and freshness. As Asians we enjoyed the restaurant so much that we returned the next day. Highly recommend the Stuffed Pigeon with Sticky Rice, where tender pigeon meat is combined with sticky rice, wrapped in lotus leaves, and grilled with five-spice seasoning, resulting in a flavorful and aromatic dish. The Nem Lụi Huế was also good. The Nem Ốc Hà Nội must have been unqiue but we took the soft-shelled crab spring rolls instead. I believe they have the dồi huyế, blood sausage but we were already too stuffed. The Restaurant offers an impressive wine list that rivals those of many top-tier establishments, yet at more accessible prices. Their selection encompasses a variety of sparkling, white, rosé, and red wines. I found some not so big names ones like Damilano Barbera d'Asti DOCG which i definitely recommend with the meats.

name: Top of Hanoi
address: 67 floor, 54 Lieu Giai Street, Ba Dinh District Lotte Hotel Hanoi, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Through many reviews from friends, we decided to come and experience at Top of Hanoi. With outdoor and overhead space, the shimmering city appeared, making us extremely excited. The band performed wonderfully with songs of many different styles. Notably, the drink menu is quite rich and diverse, suitable for young people. In addition, Mr. Bao (Top of Hanoi Manager) is very attentive, from menu advice to seating suggestions to help us have a better experience. Next time, we will come back for more delicious food and drinks.
example_reviews: Through many reviews from friends, we decided to come and experience at Top of Hanoi. With outdoor and overhead space, the shimmering city appeared, making us extremely excited. The band performed wonderfully with songs of many different styles. Notably, the drink menu is quite rich and diverse, suitable for young people. In addition, Mr. Bao (Top of Hanoi Manager) is very attentive, from menu advice to seating suggestions to help us have a better experience. Next time, we will come back for more delicious food and drinks.

A must visit place for the view after sunset. The place is on the 67th floor with an open roof. You can go to the 67th floor after touring the sky observatory deck. However once you’ve gone to the top of Hanoi you aren’t allowed to come back down to the sky observatory. Really loved the Vietnamese techno being played there. The live music band is also good and playing a lot of jazz versions.

Very special place with a beautiful view of the city of Hanoi. You can have dinner at the Poano restaurant downstairs and then you can go to the terrace to have a drink and see Hanoi from above. Expensive restaurant but the food is good. Drinks on the terrace at prices from 6 to 10 euros. Recommended

name: Hanoi Fusion Pub & Restaurant
address: 54 Nguyen Truong To, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Welcome to Hanoi Fusion Pub & Restaurant, a charming and cozy restaurant nestled in a narrow tube house at the edge of the old quarter of Hanoi. This unique eatery aims to cater primarily to tourists, providing you with an unforgettable culinary experience that combines the best of local traditional flavors and well-selected Western delights. At Hanoi Fusion Pub & Restaurant, we take pride in showcasing the rich tapestry of Vietnamese cuisine, offering tourists the chance to savor authentic local & fusion dishes that embody the essence of Hanoi's culinary heritage. From steaming bowls of pho, vibrant fresh spring rolls, and flavorful banh mi sandwiches to delectable Vietnamese desserts, our menu takes guests on a culinary journey through the heart of Vietnam's food culture. While we celebrate traditional Vietnamese food, we also understand the cravings of travelers who miss the taste of home after spending a long time away. To cater to their nostalgia, we have thoughtfully curated a selection of Western favorites like wood-fired pizzas, mouthwatering spaghetti, and a delightful assortment of Western wines and craft beers. Our fusion dishes, such as expertly grilled fish and tender beef creations, are the perfect harmony of local and international flavors, crafted by our skillful chefs. Hanoi Fusion Pub & Restaurant is more than just a restaurant; it's a celebration of cultural exchange through food. The narrow tube house setting adds to the restaurant's charm, immersing guests in a cozy and intimate atmosphere where they can relax, share stories, and make memories. Whether you're a tourist eager to explore Vietnamese cuisine or a traveler longing for a taste of home, our restaurant promises to be a gastronomic haven that delights the senses and nourishes the soul. Our passionate team is dedicated to providing warm hospitality, making each visitor feel welcome and cherished. Come and indulge in the flavors of Vietnam and beyond, as we invite you to slurp on comforting broths and savor every delectable bite, creating an unforgettable dining experiences.
cuisines: Late Night Asian Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: What a fantastic experience at Hanoi Fusion. The food was absolutely beautiful and the service from Zo was exceptional. The restaurant itself is so inviting and perfectly laid out even with dining on a mezzanine floor. The prices were very good with a family of 4 having a huge feast and two rounds of drinks at a very low price. I cannot forget to mention the Hanoi special smoothie oh so good! We will definitely come back when we return to Hanoi in a few days. We are so pleased our Tour Guide Quan mentioned this restaurant to us.

We had a lovely meal at Hanoi Fusion! We tried the seafood pasta and the tenderloin steak—both were absolutely delicious and beautifully presented. The seafood was fresh and the steak was cooked to perfection. While the space itself is a bit small, the restaurant is spread across three floors. If you're willing to climb a few stairs, the top floor is definitely worth it. It offers a charming open-air dining experience with a great view of the street below, adding to the overall vibe. Highly recommend for a cozy yet flavorful dining experience in Hanoi! Would you like it written in a more casual or humorous tone?

We came here through a friend's recommendation, the food and drinks here are very delicious and the prices are reasonable. The cozy space is very suitable for those who like quiet, the staff is friendly, enthusiastic and cheerful. We will definitely come back.

name: Tiệm Mỳ Tiên Sơn - Noodles And Dimsum
address: 2 Ngo Huyen , Hang Trong, Hanoi Vietnam
description: The noodles here are hand-pulled flat noodles, beef and duck stewed with herbs for 6 hours. You can feel the toughness of the non-fried fresh noodles, the frugal taste of herbal medicines, beef, and duck that are soft but not broken, marinated with the fruity spices after 4 hour stewing. Beside of that, we also have several choices of Dimsum and buns to pair with for your full dinner. Dimsum is fresh made everyday not like the ones in supermarket. The restaurant is located in a hustle and bustle area called Ngo Huyen, which intersects with Ly Quoc Su Street. Coming to Ngo Huyen, you will easily find the restaurant with our eye-catching red lanterns and red LED signage.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: My husband and I passed by this unassuming restaurant in a small back street and decided to stop in for dinner. I can not emphasize enough how incredible our meal was. We ordered duck leg noodle soup and fried rice with duck leg and an egg. The noodles were firm and chewy as home made noodles should be. The broth was complex with a depth of flavour that can only be achieved from hours of simmering. And the duck was tender and delicious. The sauce on the duck leg combined with the fried rice and the jammy egg made each bite perfection. We will definitely be back again. This is one restaurant not to be missed.

Best food I’ve had in Hà Nội! Tucked down a cosy alley near the cathedral, this place is a real find. The food looked gorgeous and was delicious, with all the condiments you’d expect on the table if, like me, you want to ramp up the chilli as you eat… Friendly staff, easy ordering, great prices, and the music was brilliant, too. Perfect lunch!

Great food with affordable price. We tried the noodles and dimsum as well, both are fresh, rightly flavored. The service was 10/10 i believe, the servers were gentle, responsive. The location is easy to reach, right in the heart of the Old Quaters, definitely recommend this place for both local people and tourists

name: Xofa Café & Bistro
address: 14 Tống Duy Tân Hàng Bông, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Xofa Cafe was hatched from such simple wishes and is connecting souls with a desire to deliver it’s customers' heartwarming experiences. Like a soft and gentle sofa, we want to bring friends together and closer . Your smiles and joys are our rewards. If there is anything that makes you feel uncomfortable, please leave us a message and we'll try to make your next visit even more comfortable. Love,
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: What a charming spot in hustling Hanoi!! The place is inviting and the food is simply outstanding! Everything we tried was of superior quality, fresh and flavorful. We had pasta and some cakes for dinner. Lovely coconut coffee and great service!!

The cafe appears to be very popular and was almost full when I was there. It serves regular cafe food and the decor, reminiscent of a cabin in the woods, provides a relaxing atmosphere. I ordered an almond milk, which came unsweetened and grainy. I guess the latter indicates it's made fresh? Staff were very polite and helpful. Not a bad place to rest your feet.

An oasis of calm in the otherwise frenetic Hanoi old quarter, we loved the spinach pancakes and fries. We sat on the balcony overlooking a shaded courtyard and took advantage of the excellent WiFi. Service was swift and friendly.

name: Mizumi Westlake - Sushi, Teppanyaki & Sky Lounge
address: 51 Xuan Dieu street Floors 13 - 15. Tower B - Fraser Suites Hanoi, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Mizumi is the only modern Japanese restaurant in Hanoi that offers all 3 dining styles: Omakase, Teppanyaki and A la carte, each style offering completely different experiences. In addition, diners coming to Mizumi can enjoy the "view" embracing West Lake on Sky Lounge, located on the rooftop of the restaurant, adorning the journey of enjoying modern Japanese cuisine, which would definitely elevate the culinary scenes in Hanoi. Mizumi pioneered modern Japanese cuisine, different from traditional cuisine. Modern Japanese cuisine at Mizumi is expressed through the skillful combination of traditional & premium ingredients of the country of rising sun, with ingredients and rich culinary flavors of the Western cultures. Mizumi hope that we could deliver both diversity and uniqueness in terms of cuisine, experience space and quality of service to Hanoian customers.
cuisines: South American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: For me, the best Japanese restaurant in Hanoi. The view over Westlake is breathtaking. The restaurant is really high end and luxury but the price is very good value for money. They have Omakase, Teppanyaki, A la carte as well. Our bill was $100 for 2 people (we order a la carte) including drink and we were super happy with such a beautiful experience. Service here they follow Forbes Standards and this is the only standalone restaurant in Vietnam is doing so (What the manager shared with us). I have a look at Lunch menu and prices are even more attractive, $11 for a lunch set as I remember, definitely need to come and try next time.

I get to know this place from a sharing from you tube . Since I plan to visit Hanoi I decison to visit this place. Is Amusing I was luck to serve by waiter Mark .He's very observant always attend to my need and chef Tuan is amusing he not only cook well for me he also provide some Entertainment Show out the Serve process .He also make my lunch experience with Good Memories. This meal is not cheap for the local but for Foreigner is Worth whlie to try . High recommend any one should come over Hanoi visit Mizumi to Experience the Fine dinner. I recommend come Lunch time is better U can enjoy the Full experience Chef Tuan can give u. See u soon .....

Amazing, authentic Japanese experience. The reception from the staff was incredibly friendly and every dish came with a description of what it consisted of and how it was made. The food was absolutely delicious, and there was plenty of it. We assumed that we would choose one selection from each category, as is normally the case, but the meal is actually everything on the chosen menu. A highly recommended experience.

name: The Hung Snake Restaurant
address: 161/64 Hoa Lam, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description:
Please come to our restaurant, you will see, play with snakes, you can eat snake dishes.
Our slogan is: Happiness first, money second so we promise and commit with you that if you are not happy and satisfied , you don’t have to pay.
P/S: If you come to the restaurant, please make a reservation in advance to make sure we have space as well as the right snake for you. Call me directly: +84 989331012 (Imessage and Whatapp)
Thank you!
Mr Dragon, the owner
cuisines: French Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: It was a great experience! The price was 50 USD for two people, including one bamboo snake and drinks (including alcohol). The owner, Dragon, was friendly and very charming. We were able to talk a lot about the restaurant and the food. Because it was a weekday, we were able to talk a lot with Dragon, so I recommend visiting on a weekday when it is not crowded with other customers!! First, you are asked to choose between a bamboo snake or a cobra (which is a little more expensive). Next, if you want, you can see the moment the snake is killed. You can also choose whether to drink the heart and blood. After that, you order a drink, and the dishes made with the snake you just killed are brought out one after another. … The taste is excellent. Depending on the cooking method, it tasted like chicken, fish, or eel white meat, so it was fun. By the way, Dragon likes dirty jokes. The serve is humorous and the atmosphere is somewhat mysterious. There is no other restaurant as wonderful as this! Eccentric!

An incredible experience. It is a little far from the center but it is worth experiencing. Mr. Dragon's treatment is unbeatable. He is always joking so that you have a good time but at the same time you can talk seriously with him. They have a Bamboo Snake or a King Cobra (the first one is cheaper than the second one). We opted for the first option and for the price we agreed upon, they served us the snake in 7 different ways (all of them delicious) and all the drinks we wanted. 100% recommended if you are in Hanoi, we loved it.

family reastaurant. kind workers. the owner (dragon) was very kind to show me the snakes served in the restaurant. if you come alone give a call to the owner to check if there is a dead snake already, otherwise, you need to pay for a whole one. great place to come with friends and great snake dishes!

name: Banh My Mama
address: 54 Ly Quoc Su Hang Trong, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Since 2013 Traditional Viet Nam bread with pork, fried chicken, pate, sausage, egg, cheese,... and special sauce.
example_reviews: Reccommended this stand by a local. Every time we went for lunch the que was at least 45 mins long. Finally we decided to go early for breakfast. Even then thr que was 20 mins but well worth the wait.

This Banh Mi is so good. Long line to order as the food is so yummy. Worth the wait! Been here numerous times. The bread roll is so fresh and crispy and the fillings are delicious. Our two favourites are Chicken and Pork. Mama is so sweet too, service with a smile. Must try!
Fast food, 30,000 VND. Basically a delicious Vietnamese subway roll for $2. Despite being ridic cheap "street food" we did not get stung by the funny runny dunny tummy, so that's a win.

name: Rasm Indian Cuisine
address: 126, Pho Tu Hoa Quang An Ward, Tay Ho, Hanoi, Hanoi 11200 Vietnam
