description: We serve memories, not just food “Rasm” a magnum-opus of The Czar of Indian Cuisine & Tastemaker to the Nation – aims at showcasing the epicurean lineage of Ancient India, representing culinary excellence from across the geographical landscape of the country. The Rasm experience is showcased through its unique spread represented by dishes from the key provinces of the country.
cuisines: French Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Best chicken kebabs after a very long time. O my a few mins walk from Intercontinental Westlake. We were served Papadum with green chutney - the chutney was delicious Chicken kebabs best we had after a very long time Butter garlic chicken and Padina paratha was absolutely delicious. Would definitely recommend and come back if we visit Hanoi again

One of the best Indian Restaurant in Hanoi . We tried Chicken tikka kabab, a culinary delight, Marinated in spices, a taste that excites, Grilled to perfection, a sizzling sight, Served with mint chutney, a true gastronomic height. Love this 😍

This restaurant is 200 metres away from Intercontinental Hanoi Westlake. The Sambar was quite spicy, however, all other items were amazing - Dal Khichdi, Masala Dosa with aloo bhaji & chicken thaali. It's a matter of choosing the right dishes. Thanks to Mr. Harry for some wonderful conversations :)

name: Bếp Chay Huệ Nhiên
address: 39 Phố Hàng Quạt, Quận Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Hanoi 11000 Vietnam
description: A small humble vegan & vegetarian restaurant in Hanoi with a reasonable price for everyone. We do everything with love and dedication!
cuisines: Late Night Middle Eastern Restaurants in Hanoi
Pizza for Large Groups in Hanoi
Late Night Seafood Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: A restaurant that serves both vegetarian and vegan options, the menu is labeled with ingredients so you can choose to have eggs or no eggs. The space is simple but cozy with many paintings by young Vietnamese artists. Affordable prices, enthusiastic staff. Highly recommend!

Amazing experience in the middle of Hanoi! When you enter, the chaos of the city stops immediately. You can experience super good food... All the choices are vegetarian or vegan. Everything was really good tasting, there are lots of options. Highly recommend!!!

In surroundings it is very nice and the food very tasty. I agreed with some local people who noticed that I would be in the puasa of the food at the same restaurant and the truth is that it is a super nice place to eat and be at ease. Super recommended and completely different from all the ones I found on the Hanoi tour. Superb!

name: WOOMASTER - Korean Aging Steak House
address: 2B Ngô Thì Nhậm Hàng Bài, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: WOOMASTER - The First Korean Aging Steakhouse in Vietnam provides high-quality American Wagyu & USDA PRIME Beefs combined with unique Water Aging technique.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Late Night Cafes in Hoan Kiem
Indian Restaurants for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: Very nice ambience, cozy lighting. Charcoal barbecue at the table is awesome. We had the Wagyu set (USA) for two people (3*130 gr) and additionally ordered an Angus Ribeye (130 gr). Meat quality excellent, we found the best Wagyu pieces with higher fat content. Due to the ripening, the meat has a special taste - extremely delicious. Just add some salt and pepper and you're done. As a side dish we had a green salad, grilled vegetables and potato wedges and as starter fried dumplings. The quality of the side dishes was also top. We paid 90 € (including beer, water, cocktail), which is of course expensive for Vietnam but quite inexpensive for this enjoyment. Also the service was top. Our waiter Trinh has a very pleasant attentive nature and helped us with the barbecue (the meat is pre-grilled medium-rare and then finished grilling at the table grill according to taste). Conclusion: If you like to eat meat and want to treat yourself, this is the place for you.

Excellent place to eat grilled beef and pork. A great combination of cuts that serve with very delicious Korean tapas. The salads are very delicious too. The price is a little higher than the average of other restaurants; but it is well worth it for the quality of the meat, the combinations of sauces and different types of salts.

Dining at this Hanoi steakhouse is a world-class experience, unique in its charm. The quality of meat is exceptional, rivaling the best steakhouses globally. Their cocktails are a delightful journey in flavors, adding to the exquisite dining atmosphere. The staff strikes a perfect balance between attentiveness and discretion; they're not only highly professional and fluent in English but also intuitively responsive, ensuring comfort without intruding on your privacy. It's a place where culinary excellence meets impeccable service.

name: Rk Spice Indian Restaurant
address: 42 P. Hàng Hòm, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: one of the famous indian halal food restaurant in old quarter (district) of hanoi vietnam. situated on hang manh street hoan kiem . our main guests are mainly western and Asian tourists. we take pride in providing them fresh indian food in affordable price
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Romantic Vietnamese Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Italian Restaurants for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: I had the pleasure of dining at RK Spice Indian Restaurant during my visit to Hanoi, and it was an experience worth every bite! Nestled in the vibrant Old Quarter, this restaurant serves some of the most authentic Indian food I’ve had outside of India. The menu is extensive, offering a range of North Indian, South Indian, and Mughlai dishes. The flavors are rich and bold, with each dish prepared to perfection. I particularly enjoyed the golab jamun—an absolute treat! The butter chicken was creamy and delicious, and the naan was freshly baked, soft, and warm. One of the things that stood out to me was the simplicity of the restaurant. RK Spice isn’t about fancy interiors; it’s about delivering incredible food at reasonable prices. This approach has clearly resonated with diners, as the place was buzzing with both locals and tourists alike. The service was top-notch. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable, making sure our dining experience was enjoyable from start to finish. Whether you’re a fan of Indian food or someone looking to try something new, RK Spice should be at the top of your list when in Hanoi. If you’re in the Old Quarter and craving a taste of India, don’t miss out on this gem! This should provide a different perspective while highlighting the key features of your restaurant.

We came across this place when looking for an alternative to all the Vietnamese restaurants. The food was excellent, especially the many mutton dishes and the service was prompt and friendly. The owner, a cricket aficionado, was very attentive and keen to know what we thought of the food. We would certainly recommend this as a spicy and tasty alternative while in Hanoi.

I visited this restaurant last week and had an excellent experience. The food was delicious, full of authentic flavors, and made with fresh ingredients. The staff was friendly and welcoming, providing great service. Prices were very reasonable, making it a great value for money. If you're looking for tasty halal food in Hanoi, this place is a must-visit!

name: Hang Qua Asian Fusion Restaurant
address: 13 Hang Bong, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: We serve traditional and non-traditional Vietnamese dishes (Bun Cha, Nem, Pho, Curry etc.) and diverse beverages (tea, egg coffee, smoothies, juices, etc.), all fresh and daily prepared. Just 5 minutes walk from Hoan Kiem Lake, HangQua brings you cosy and peaceful vibe amidst the outside chaos. Families and big groups are welcome.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: I was walking to eat at around 9pm on a weeknight, and I passed once, but went back and entered. The reason I decided to enter the restaurant was that it was clean from the outside. I travel alone a lot, so I have a lot to worry about when I eat, but the friendly staff here said, "There's a table in the back of the shop, which one would you rather have?" It was very impressive that he confirmed his intention. Even though I was a single guest, I was very grateful to be shown to a quiet back seat. He understands that I'm hot and adjusts the fan, and is very considerate. Order Xôi Hàng Quà for dinner. I ordered it without any prior knowledge, so I was curious about what kind of meal would be served, but it was a bowl of so-called sticky rice topped with meat, sausages and vegetables. Many restaurants around town have stiffer meats, but that hasn't changed here. The flavor is just right. The amount is also satisfactory to most people if it is an adult male. It may be a bit more for women. After the meal, order an additional Vietnamese coffee with salted cream. It tastes good in other cafes, but I was able to enjoy it well here. There's plenty of ice in there and there's no sense of cutting corners at all, which you see sometimes in Vietnam.

Hi, I'm Teresa from Singapore. Their salted coffee and sticky rice were delicious! The staff was approachable & friendly and I had a very nice chat with him (I forgot to ask for his name). They have a very adorable Corgi mixed Siberian Husky dog (Dom). Thank you for the very pleasant dining experience for my last night in Hanoi. Highly recommend this place! :)

Food and coffee was just amazing. The cafe is really cozy and friendly staff ;). The Bahn mi sandwich was simple but memorable. The rice combo dishes and chicken noodle soup are perfect light lunches.

name: BIG PIG Bar - BBQ - Beer
address: 84 Ngo Duc Ke Ben Nghe, Quan 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Drop into Big Pig for delicious American style BBQ Ribs, Awesome Burgers, Steak & Pizza, along with yummy Vietnamese favorites like grilled seafood, rice & noodles, Big Pig also has a big selection of ice cold beers, cool cocktails, wine list and excellent western and Vietnamese coffee. Open for breakfast, fantastic lunch specials (from 99k+), hearty meals and late night drinks & snacks, the team at BIG PIG District 1 is ready to welcome you. Daily Happy Hour from 3-7pm! Our team speaks English well, and look forward to seeing you soon!
example_reviews: We had an amazing meal with entrees and main, the meals were very large serving and so tasty, the staff were amazing the drinks were cold the aircon was on and it was just a great experience. Highly recomend the pork belly bites, the ribs the steak and the garlic bread all the foods we had. Yum

We’re in Saigon on a school trip from the UK, two teachers with ten teenagers. The students asked for a mix of western and Vietnamese foods for dinner and we stumbled across The Big Pig which beat our expectations. Being such a big group we managed to reserve a table a couple of hours earlier. We had a warm welcome on arrival and we’re quickly offered food and drink menus. There was a great choice of food to keep everyone happy. The students told us the Smoothies were the best yet (and they’ve had several from across the city!). The food was tasty with generous portions all came out fresh and hot from the kitchen. We had burgers, pizzas with a lot of side dishes and left with many clean plates - a huge sign of happy teenagers! Fab place for tasty food to please all tastes, and really well located right by the Siagon Skydeck, making our evening even easier. The staff were excellent always on hand to help and serve us quickly. Brilliant work.

Really professional friendly service, welcoming and polite showing my wife and I the full food menu and drinks menu before we were seated by Lewis who was brilliant 🤩 Our waiter this evening was Le Nhu Y who was exceptional in his service. A friendly smile and a very warming personality who makes guests feel so welcoming. The restaurant is very spacious with a few levels. The beer was ice cold and the cheeseburger & fries was really nice reminding me of a good burger from back home,many thanks for your service 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

name: Hải Sản Hoàng Gia
address: 954 Đ. Nguyễn Văn Linh P. Tân Phong, Quận 7, Ho Chi Minh City Vietnam
description: I had been keen to try out the food at Hai San Hoang Gia and finally managed to try it together with my family during their visit. The seafood is very fresh and the customer service is excellent! Would highly recommend this restaurant to all!
example_reviews: I had been keen to try out the food at Hai San Hoang Gia and finally managed to try it together with my family during their visit. The seafood is very fresh and the customer service is excellent! Would highly recommend this restaurant to all!

Great seefood in Ho Chi Minh district 1. Huge selection of everything from see. Very nice waiters, service is fast and good. Prices are little bit higher for Vietnam, but very cheap for Europe. Huge reccomendation!
A seafood lover would truly enjoy dining here. We tried the fish cooked in a hotpot and it tasted great and I couldn't get enough of it. Generous servings of veggies too!

name: Viet Rice Essence
address: 93 Phung Hung Street, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Viet Rice Essence Restaurant serves authentic Vietnamese cuisine and also caters to vegetarians. Here, you can enjoy top-notch traditional dishes in a beautiful ambiance. Additionally, we organize a special cooking class every day to introduce international travelers to secret ingredients and unique flavors of Vietnamese cuisine.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Pizza for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
Seafood Restaurants for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: We were served by Chris, super helpful and cute, we took as an appetizer the rolls with crab and that with mixed super good fish and combined each with a sauce in my opinion much better those with crab. Then bamboo cane skewers with chicken and sweet bread balls also paired with a semi-sweet sauce with salt and lime to accompany. To conclude shrimp skewers with super spicy mixed spices accompanied with clouds and squid in super good tamarind sauce in total we spent in 3 the modest amount of 59 €. The place super clean and very cozy.
Food was lovely and well presented. Restaurant although a little quiet was also lovely. The staff, especially Nam, couldn’t do enough for us.

Chris Vu looked after us so well. The food, drinks and service were amazing. Make sure you try the Seafood Netted Spring Rolls and if you’re there between 7.30 to 9.00pm buy 2 drinks and get 1 free. Good value, good service, great food

name: Chops Old Quarter
address: 22 P. Ma May, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Top 25 best-of-the-best burger restaurant by Travelers' Choice on TripAdvisor. Also voted 1st place at the Hanoi burger festival. Since 2015, CHOPS crafts every burger with fresh, premium ingredients and bold flavors. Savor the taste that's captured hearts globally. Chops serves food from 8am until late. With our burger menu that runs all day serving up the best burgers Vietnam has to offer, or if you're feeling a bit healthier, try one of our amazing salads. We bake all our buns from scratch, grind fresh Australian Wagyu Beef to make our burger patties, and make all our own sauces on a daily basis. Top that off with a really nice selection of craft beers, making Chops your one-stop shop for lunch or dinner.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
American Restaurants for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: We went to chops for our last dinner in Hanoi, the food was delicious and fairly priced with really fast service. Tammy was fab and super friendly. Will definitely return if in Hanoi again. Also the option to pay by card!

The service was super friendly and efficient! When all the food came out it was all hot which is amazing for 6 burgers. Quan was super funny and friendly. Speaks English quite well so it made for good conversations and great service. Even gave us some recommendations to see in Hà Nội. Even though we came quite late and close to closing time they didn’t rush us or degraded the food quality or service so we all really enjoyed it. The burgers were juicy and delicious and the the truffle chips are a MUST. Would recommend if you wanna change up from Vietnamese cuisine to some American styled burgers.

If you are traveling in the city and feel like burgers, you can eat here with pleasant and not too loud music. Personnel: I was served mainly by the very nice Mike, but can also say that the others were also very friendly and always had a smile on their lips. To the kitchen: I had a burger (fresh ingredients that you can also taste) with fries and dessert. In terms of taste and appearance, a recommendation from me. For the price: Although a bit more expensive (about 13€ incl. dessert and drink).

name: Hải Sản Hoàng Gia Cn 46 Phạm Văn Nghị
address: Đ. Phạm Văn Nghị, 46-48 Khu Phố Hưng Gia 4, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description:
Good location
Fresh seafood
Booking table in advance is better.
Price is medium range compared to others seafood restaurant.
example_reviews: Good location Fresh seafood Booking table in advance is better. Price is medium range compared to others seafood restaurant.

name: PHỞ VIỆT NAM - Bùi Bằng Đoàn
address: S36-1 Bùi Bằng Đoàn, Tân Phong Ward, District 7 Khu Hưng Vượng 2, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description:
This restaurant is near my hotel
I just walk around and find something to eat
sooooo amazing experience, I will comeback again
example_reviews: This restaurant is near my hotel I just walk around and find something to eat sooooo amazing experience, I will comeback again
Great spot for a tasty pho. Made with in house noodles... My wife really liked it so it appears we'll be back next time we're in the area.
The Pho is VERY good. The staff is super friendly, and the atmosphere is very welcoming. I highly recommended this restaurant !!! 👍👍👍

name: Eddie's D1 New York Diner & Deli
address: 73 Pasteur Street, Ho Chi Minh City Vietnam
description: With 3 convenient, tasty & fun locations in D1, D2 & D7 Eddie’s Deli & Diner is Saigon's Favorite Authentically American Dining Experience since 2018. We pride ourselves on our Good Food, Warm & Friendly Service, Awesome Shakes, 1950’s Diner Vibe & Huge American Menu with something for everyone! All of our cuisine is made in house using the finest ingredients for that Real- American taste. So what’s on the Menu? All-day breakfast, mouthwatering burgers, hotdogs, and deli sandwiches including our famous Reuben, juicy steaks & chicken, salads, soup, apps, full vegetarian menu & even an American Chinese Menu. We bake our own cinnamon buns and pies too. Kid’s love Eddie’s and we have a full menu for the little ones. Our Satisfaction Guarantee makes Eddie's the perfect place to enjoy a little taste of home. Please Visit us at 73 Pasteur in D1 71 Thao Dien in D2 408 Pham Thai Buong in D7. Eddie hopes to see you soon!
example_reviews: I stayed at this restaurant with friends because we felt like a nice hamburger after days of local cuisine. The place is faithfully reminiscent of the American ones, the staff is welcoming and friendly. We tasted the classic burgers (very good) with chips and coke (you can refill the drink for free once you finish). We spent about 10/15 € each, including two desserts that surprised us particularly, given the loyalty with those eaten in America.

We looked up restaurants close by and Eddie's came on the scope. So we popped in for dinner and tried some burgers, what sensational burgers absolutely top class and the staff were attentive to our needs and happy to engage in friendly chat. We will definitely be back for more. Also the apple pie was the best. Our main man Tai who served us was the best.

Eddie’s is the real deal! Started by an American ex-patriot from Minnesota, it serves up fresh, authentic diner food in a casual atmosphere. Where else can you get a tuna melt in Saigon? Eddie’s serves breakfast all day, along with burgers, cheese steaks, fries, onion rings and even chicken parm! Yes, they make their own ice cream, too. Servers are fluent in English, so there’s no menu-pointing required to order your favorites. When you’re half a world away from Katz’s and craving a corned beef Reuben, Eddie’s is the place.

name: Soul Classic Pub
address: 06 Đoàn Văn Bơ, Phường 9, Quận 4, Ho Chi Minh City Vietnam
description: When you see these lines, you may be on a trip to Vietnam. I hope you have a meaningful and joyful journey while you are here. Looking forward to meeting you. We are Soul, a bar with a comfortable atmosphere and friendliness, always welcoming everyone.
example_reviews: awesome place to habe a good drink and an incredible view to Saigon City Center. Cocktails looks and taste very nice! recommend to visit after sundown
Various cocktails, good price, and supper windy on this high rooftop, that will blows away your stress and frozen your brian.

Beautiful day to visit soul, open space, nice view on the terrace, reasonably priced wine and beer to enjoy, very friendly staff, chill and vibrant music, where love and friendship can sit together, my leisure time will be here...

name: Crystal Jade Palace Le Loi
address: 123 Le Loi, Ben Thanh Ward, District 01, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: It is a very delicious meal, and although the price is not cheap, the overall quality is absolutely right for that price. From the selection of ingredients to the carefulness of padding, you can feel the professionalism and sincerity of the store. Each dish is not only rich in flavour levels, but also a surprising creative combination, so that people can not stop one by one. The staff was also very kind and courteous, and the overall meal experience was very pleasant. If you are looking for a textual, memorable meal, this restaurant is definitely a good choice.
example_reviews: It is a very delicious meal, and although the price is not cheap, the overall quality is absolutely right for that price. From the selection of ingredients to the carefulness of padding, you can feel the professionalism and sincerity of the store. Each dish is not only rich in flavour levels, but also a surprising creative combination, so that people can not stop one by one. The staff was also very kind and courteous, and the overall meal experience was very pleasant. If you are looking for a textual, memorable meal, this restaurant is definitely a good choice.
Locate at District 1. Good service. Nice ambience. This is an awesome Cantonese restaurant. Definitely will come back again.
Great place with tasty dishes. Good services. Suitable for both lunch and dinner. Should reserve for best experience.

name: Phở Phát Tài
address: 34-36 Đ. Trần Hưng Đạo, Phường Phạm Ngũ Lão, Quận 1, Ho Chi Minh City Vietnam
description:
Craving something bold and local at night?
From 6:00 PM to midnight, get 15% OFF our newest dishes:
Stir-Fried Pho and Crispy Fried Pho Noodles!
Cooked fresh right on the sidewalk for an authentic street food experience.
Don’t miss this foodie deal!
example_reviews: Fantastic experience! Phong was such an attentive host, we had 12 people in a group and he helped us choose what to have on the menu, and how to add the condiments! We had teens that are fussy eaters and he was patient and they ate majority of their food which was a win for us. Thanks Phong you are a legend!

Super Phở, delicious beef noodles soup with authentic favors. Great and inviting design, English speaking staff and helpful. We think this restaurant is new but best soup in town. A must-try soup shop.

The Phở Tái Lăn was simply exquisite, with fragrant herbs and perfectly cooked noodles. The atmosphere felt nostalgic, reminiscent of traditional Vietnamese eateries. The staff made us feel at home, offering recommendations and sharing stories about the dishes. Plus, the complimentary parking was a nice bonus. We left with full stomachs and happy hearts, eager to come back for more!

name: Nossa - Italian Steakhouse
address: 36 Pham Hong Thai Ben Thanh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Established in 2014, Nossa located in the heart of Saigon (opposite to five star New World Saigon hotel), NOSSA is a cozy & romantic restaurant featuring Western steak house and Italian cuisine. We offer a wide selection of chilled premium Australian Black Angus & Wagyu beef like striploin, tenderloin, ribeye, TBone and many choice of pasta, riíotto & pizzas. To complement with the aforesaid statements, the restaurant comes with an bar counter at first floor, indoor and outdoor terrace at second floor with flower and candle. The restaurant is good for couple with romance ambience and businesses or family dinner with a private room.
example_reviews: After almost a fortnight in the Far East we were keen to eat something without rice! Found this atmospheric Italian restaurant about 100yards from the New World Hotel and were seated on the first floor balcony. Food was delicious with a couple of us having Lasagna and others fish served by delightful staff.

After two weeks on the road in Vietnam, we wanted something a bit different for dinner. We found this place online and decided to try it out. It was a great decision ! . Walking distance from our hotel, we went upstairs and sat outside to watch the happenings on the street. It's not too noisy and the weather was warm. The very nice waitress was with us in minutes and we ordered a glass of red and white house wine, a salad, and some pasta with prawns and a pizza. The salad was fantastic, the wine very good and the pasta and pizza as good as you'd get in Italy !! . The dinner was that good that we actually went BACK the following night for dinner and it was brilliant yet again ! Same waitress, very nice - and friendly service. . Around $80 Australian dollars for 2 and that included bottle of wine. . Highly recommend.

The restaurant was close to our hotel and after a long trip walking around the area looking for dinner. We both ordered pasta dishes finished off with the passion fruit panna cotta. The pasta was ok, the dessert very good. What warranted the rating was the attentiveness of the staff which makes all the difference.

name: Fabrik Restaurant
address: 16 Tran Vu, Ba Dinh, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: I found the combination of dishes to be quite exquisite. I ordered the Filet Mignon aux Cepes here, and the tender beef fillet paired with fragrant mushroom sauce and creamy potatoes was a delightful experience. I would definitely come back.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Ba Dinh
Street Food Restaurants in Ba Dinh
Italian Restaurants for Lunch in Ba Dinh
Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Ba Dinh
example_reviews: I found the combination of dishes to be quite exquisite. I ordered the Filet Mignon aux Cepes here, and the tender beef fillet paired with fragrant mushroom sauce and creamy potatoes was a delightful experience. I would definitely come back.

This restaurant is within walking distance of the Pan Pacific across the bridge that has the John McCann Memorial. A little challenging to cross the streets closest to the Pan Pacific. It is on Tran Vu, the first street after the bridge to the left. Not a big place, probably very busy at night with the bar. We ate upstairs, very quaint. Food is excellent. The French onion soup & creme brûlée were outstanding. I had a special which was similar to a shepherd's pie but made with duck & it was delicious. My husband tried the lasagna - it was good but not what he would consider lasagna. We ate here a second time and had the hamburgers, really done well. It's not easy to find Western food in Hanoi.

The French Onion Soup and Duck Confit were very nice! The brownie was special. And, the olives were devine. My friends’ Seafood Bisque was the best he has ever had and he is from New York City and Boston where the chefs take pride in their Seafood Bisque.

name: Carpaccio - Italian Restaurant
address: 79 Hai Ba Trung Street, District 1 Dong Khoi Area, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Carpaccio - Authentic Italian Restaurant Since 2000s with 25 years brand history in Vietnam We are proud being the ambassador of Italian culinary culture, where you can immerse yourself in a refined experience from the charming yet romantic Venice. From the traditional pizza, the handmade pasta, to the classic Italian cocktails are greatly combined to create a cozy and intimate dining experience. Buon Appetito!
example_reviews: A very good indication is always if an Italian restaurant outside of Italy, has many Italian or native speaking Italian guests. Long story short: service, food, drinks – summarized – very good. You can spend a nice evening there in a relaxing atmosphere with good music in the background. Price - value is in a very good ratio

A trip to Italy even in these times is possible, no visa nor CoVid test required. This restaurant serves the very best of Italy: atmosphere, great flavours and dolce vita. The refreshing Aperol Spritz creates the first WoW, awesome al dente pasta, homemade minestrone, antipasti della casa follow before the main course. We love the pizze e calzone, also the grilled fresh tuna steak with olives, capers, oregano and tomato sauce. Prosecco sweetens our lunch before delicious Tiramisu and Panna Cotta with berries. Not to forget the sound of the typical Italian coffee machine producing worldclass espresso. Adriano Celentano & Monica Bellucci join us for the grappa and Amalfi coast limoncello... Viva l’ Italia

Maybe the best Italian in town with homemade fresh pasta like linguine alla Sarda with fresh prawns, mussels in a slightly spicy tomato or white wine sauce. We love the original Napoli style pizze and the house special ravioli and truffle risotto. Feels like a trip to Italy 🇮🇹 despite travel restrictions! Cheers, btw their Aperol Spritz is fabulous, followed by delicious Panna Cotta or Tiramisu and iced Amalfi style Limoncello... buon appetito

name: Au Lac Do Brazil Nguyen Hue
address: 131 Nguyen Hue St, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description:
Best place for meat lover and gymer 🔥
Many types of Churrasco hot grilled meat flavored Brazil ingredients, free flow soft drinks
I had premium buffet with 1,250,000++ per person. More than 10 types of Churrasco, baked lobster with cheese, picanha, cupim, etc.
They also have samba performance at weekend, so perfect for group of friends and family. ALDB feasted so much fun 🥳
example_reviews: Best place for meat lover and gymer 🔥 Many types of Churrasco hot grilled meat flavored Brazil ingredients, free flow soft drinks I had premium buffet with 1,250,000++ per person. More than 10 types of Churrasco, baked lobster with cheese, picanha, cupim, etc. They also have samba performance at weekend, so perfect for group of friends and family. ALDB feasted so much fun 🥳

Good food but confused and maybe new (?) tableware. All tables had to ask for napkins and we did not get all the food we ordered, for example. If you want to eat a lot of good meat, you can go here, but no place that is memorable.
Go with my colleague on Friday, Set lunch is really tasty, decoration suitable for Brazilian style and nice music vibe.

name: Phở Việt Nam
address: 66 Trần Quốc Toản, Phường 8, Quận 3 163 Tran Nao Ward Binh An, Dist. 2, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description:
Affordable price, i came and ask the staff if they accept card for payment but the staff cant speak english, so i need to wait until 1 staff come and talk to me, i think only one staff who can speak english. Order the one with hot stone, so we need to put by ourselves the noodles, meat and other vegetable into the hot stone fill with the soup. Because i not put all of them in one time, the soup not boil enough and my meat not cooked well, lol, so i ask the staff who can speak english to boil again my soup, and voila..they also adding my soup.

The taste really yummy, the meat so tender, the noodles also fresh and they give so many vegetables, the soup is super tasty, love it. The restaurant really crowd, but more guest come with family. The condiment available in the table and the drink (looks like tea) also avail in the table, free charge, free refill. I got trouble with my payment, but thanks for the cashier want to wait until the issued solved. The restroom also clean and provide westafel.
example_reviews: Affordable price, i came and ask the staff if they accept card for payment but the staff cant speak english, so i need to wait until 1 staff come and talk to me, i think only one staff who can speak english. Order the one with hot stone, so we need to put by ourselves the noodles, meat and other vegetable into the hot stone fill with the soup. Because i not put all of them in one time, the soup not boil enough and my meat not cooked well, lol, so i ask the staff who can speak english to boil again my soup, and voila..they also adding my soup. The taste really yummy, the meat so tender, the noodles also fresh and they give so many vegetables, the soup is super tasty, love it. The restaurant really crowd, but more guest come with family. The condiment available in the table and the drink (looks like tea) also avail in the table, free charge, free refill. I got trouble with my payment, but thanks for the cashier want to wait until the issued solved. The restroom also clean and provide westafel.

We found this place by accident, as it’s not centrally located and has such an unimaginative name. It was such a pleasant surprise, as this is undoubtedly among the best phở in Vietnam! Go for the house special; the delicious pho broth and cooked meat (which includes brisket and oxtail) is served in stone bowls, so remains piping hot for almost the whole meal. You can order extra sides, like tendon, blood, an egg, etc, but sadly no tripes. The raw meat and noodles come separately, and you throw them into the bowl. Unique among phở restaurants anywhere in the world, they make their noodles fresh from scratch here, and you can observe the whole process through the glass window. Boy, it makes a difference, freshly-made noodles are much, much better than the packaged dry ones served elsewhere. Crispy yu-tiao (extra price) is left on the table; I highly recommend you dip it in the broth for additional delish texture. Service is excellent, they’re super quick at bringing you requests for extra stuff, like fresh lime, etc. Our go-to

Crowded restaurant, mainly frequented by Vietnamese. Just pho with fresh pasta and beef (your choice of fillet meatballs, tail ribs, etc.). Served either in bowls (small, medium, large) or cast iron casseroles filled with boiling broth into which you throw the raw meat, your fresh pasta, your Thai basil and your bean sprouts. From 70,000 to 110,000 VND. It's exotic, it's noisy, it's fast. Everything we love about Vietnam.

name: Cocotte Sila
address: 21 Ngô Thời Nhiệm, Ho Chi Minh City Vietnam
description: Located on the ground floor of SILA Urban Living, Cocotte SILA is a fantastic space between two terraces from pool side to the main street decorated with designer furnitures and a large wine cellar filled with amazing and rare bottles. Near War Remnants Museum, in the heart of Ho Chi Minh City, Discover Traditional Authentic French Cuisine for everyone, with great value, warm and friendly professional service. There are 3 inside area's including a mezzanine that can be privatized for events. Our Cocotte French Bistro menu is available, it is complemented by a SILA only menu offering items only available here (Foie gras, Scallops, Veal, Lamb, Tarte tatin , etc..). The wine and cocktail selection as well as our A La Carte & special SILA menu are available all day long from 10am to 10pm. You can enjoy our Stylish French Bistro at anytime of the day, and every day of the week. Come visit, it is truly a beautiful setting with an amazing food and beverage selection at great value for money.
example_reviews: Firstly I’d like to say thank you to Xavier and his staff for a lovely experience in Ho Chi Minh City for their friendly approach making you feel very welcome in Cocotte, a truly beautiful restaurant. We were both blown away with the quality of food and drinks at a very reasonable price. Signature dish is the French Onion soup covered in Emmental cheese which tasted like a traditional dish. We also had the Tuna with Wasabi beurreblanc and the beef ravioli, both were excellent and washed down with a very nice bottle of Cremant which was excellent. Many thanks for a great evening.

I discovered Cocotte through a friend's recommendation. Located in Sila Urban Hotel, I tried the food here last week and found myself smitten with the pan-fried duck breast served with a fragrant black pepper sauce. The dish stands out more when paired with a glass of red wine, stimulating the dish's richer taste. In addition, the space is also very chill, and the service is extremely friendly. I will definitely come back.

This is a French restaurant that really impressed us. The food was delicious and the price is really reasonable. Another nice surprise was that we found the exact taste we had in France (some of my us are french). A place you should try! And enjoy some of the best dishes that are also signature dishes of this restaurant: duck magret, duck confit, rosbif

name: De Tham Restaurant - Vietnamese Cuisine & Vegetarian Food
address: 258 De Tham Street Pham Ngu Lao Ward, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Welcome to De Tham Restaurant - We are proud to be a famous Vietnamese restaurant located in District 1 - considered the center of Ho Chi Minh City. Famous for its authentic Vietnamese cuisine, the restaurant offers a diverse menu with classic dishes such as Traditional fried pork, Traditional fried fish and Vietnamese Pancake. Whether you are a meat eater or a vegetarian, De Tham has a dish to please every palate. With a commitment to using fresh, locally sourced ingredients and traditional cooking techniques, De Tham is considered one of the best Pho restaurants in District 1 and is a must-visit for anyone looking for a truly memorable dining experience.
example_reviews: Wonderful food! Would definitely recommend if you are vegetarian too - my friend is and she really enjoyed her meal. Our waiter Kien was very helpful and he showed my friend how to eat her “traditional Hanoi pork” with rice paper. He also had a lot of patience with us when we were sorting the bill.

The food at this restaurant was some of the best my wife and I have eaten in Vietnam. Went back twice in 4 days and both times the food was excellent, portions generous and service quick and friendly all at a very reasonable price. The make your own Vietnamese pancake was especially delicious. The restaurant was clean and welcoming but not fancy decor wise but that doesn’t matter as the food is the main event. We booked a table through their Instagram. They do walk ins but each time we went there was a queue for that which seemed to have around a 15 minute wait time. Would highly recommend for great food and service

My husband was looking for somewhere for our last dinner in HCMC and found De Tham. We were warmly greeted and fortunately for us, a comfortable table had just opened up so we were quickly seated. The menu is good with plenty of regional options plus a fairly extensive vegetarian/vegan selection. Our waiter, Jack, was very attentive, knowledgeable and friendly so any questions we had were answered and we felt very well taken care of. My husband ordered us the fried eggplant as a starter and had the grilled beef served in bamboo as his entree while I enjoyed the caramelized pork and quail eggs. I had a glass of red wine from Dalat Vietnam and a lime soda (lime juice, a can of soda water and a small jug of simple syrup so you can mix it to your palate!) and my husband tried a couple of the Vietnamese beers they offered. The eggplant was crispy and tasty and we enjoyed the chili sauce for dipping so much that Jack brought us more. The beef was delicious, tasted chargrilled and looked appealing served up in bamboo. My bowl of pork and quail eggs was so comforting, the broth tasted like it had been simmered with love for hours at Grandmas house. We shouldn’t have ordered the banana split to share but we did and had no regrets, it too, was well executed. Prices are reasonable for District 1 and portions quite generous. Thank you Jack for taking such good care of us!

name: The Monkey Gallery Dining
address: 3F 91 Mạc Thị Bưởi, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description: Host by Chef Hậu and our Monkey. The Monkey Gallery DINING is one of the first fine dining restaurants in Ho Chi Minh City, opening in 2019 with a passion for bringing a new gastronomic destination with a Vietnamese soul to local and international diners. The dining room features an ultra-high ceiling with a central open kitchen that acts as the heart of the gallery, where our artists work on their imaginative creations. The 200m² area has 12 seats, 7 chef's table seats, and a Private Gallery, all designed for the best comfort to enjoy the chef’s creativity. The Monkey Gallery DINING has received Michelin-selected awards for 2023 and 2024, the Best 50 Discovery award, and Tripadvisor’s Traveller Choice 2023.
example_reviews: Culinary experience of the highest level, where flavors of Asian cuisine steeped in spices and aromas give life to an alchemy that demonstrates the personality of the chef, less experienced in molecular techniques, expressed in many courses between spherification and gelation not perfectly successful. The rest very well worked out. Michelin is rigid in its 360-degree evaluations... here it has blindfolded in the service, albeit sympathetic waiters. Minimal tone in the mise en place. Too bad they replaced the wine glass with a beautiful water glass in fine Hungarian crystal .. Modest location , jap style but advanced technologies that maybe make you feel in an interstellar space and that, fortunately, you forget as soon as you are out to find yourself in the magical Saigon.... long live Vietnamese Cuisine!!

We comeback to this wow place after a short period of time since our last visit to enjoy their new festive menu. Staffs are kind and well trained and food is super delicious. We love our experience here and definitely will comeback many more times!!

This was an excellent meal! If you're looking for a fine dining experience in Saigon that is beyond worth the price point, please do check it out! I tried the 'Stylish' menu, and although it was 4 courses, there were loads of complimentary nibbles in between. Rita was our server, and she was so helpful that it made the entire experience seamless. Highly recommended!

name: Ngon Restaurant
address: 160 Pasteur, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description: Exquisite and heavenly dishes in an elegant, spacious and sophisticated interior. Tastefully decorated with elaborated wooden frames, slide doors and comfortable armchairs with cushions. Soft died cloth drapes its sealing and red lanterns illuminates its interior at night. Its beautiful outdoor seating has a traditional theatre where water puppet shows and Vietnamese cultural music are held weekly. The chef’s ability to marry ingredients & flavours results in multi-dimensional dishes that are a pleasure to eat. We also offer a fine wine section that caters for those wanting to indulge.
example_reviews: The setting is superb. Fast and efficient service despite the size of our group. The dishes are very generous (too much) but not as fragrant as in the other restaurants where we stopped during our tour. The spring rolls for example were huge but only tasted like meat. Spring rolls not as good as elsewhere. Completely incomprehensible: we asked for towels to replace the wet towel intended to cool our hands. There are no paper towels and wet ones are charged extra...

This restaurant downtown was suggested by our guide. The façade of the restaurant is very lit and richly decorated with plastic plants and flowers. The interior consists of various rooms and other tables are in a large courtyard in front, all lavishly decorated. The tables are pretty close. The menu was very varied and enriched with photos to illustrate the individual dishes. Food is normal and portions plentiful. The service was efficient considering the considerable number of tables but completely impersonal. There are no architectural barriers to get to the front tables.

In the central area of Ho Chi Minh City, this restaurant offers a well-kept environment both inside and outside. The service does not shine for friendliness but you eat well and with a wide choice. I definitely recommend it also in light of the now 2 weeks of local cuisine. I count around 30 euros for 4 dishes and 4 beers.

name: Xliii Coffee
address: 178A Pasteur Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description:
Came here for specialty coffee (i.e. pour over) after touring at the independence palace. The entrance and ambiance of the shop is minimalist style, pretty special for a coffee shop. Apparently they have another store in Danang and the shop looks even more amazing (from pics shown to us).

The staff was very friendly and spent time to explain the steps for us to order coffee. He also explained how they sourced the beans and how the beans taste. He also recommended us the beans and types of coffee to try based on our preference.

The price is not cheap consider it is in HCM, some could be even pricier than in HK. So, not really for budget drinkers or if you just want to have a dose of caffeine, it is more for experience.
example_reviews: Came here for specialty coffee (i.e. pour over) after touring at the independence palace. The entrance and ambiance of the shop is minimalist style, pretty special for a coffee shop. Apparently they have another store in Danang and the shop looks even more amazing (from pics shown to us). The staff was very friendly and spent time to explain the steps for us to order coffee. He also explained how they sourced the beans and how the beans taste. He also recommended us the beans and types of coffee to try based on our preference. The price is not cheap consider it is in HCM, some could be even pricier than in HK. So, not really for budget drinkers or if you just want to have a dose of caffeine, it is more for experience.

Delicious the hand poured coffee tasted like tea. No bitterness and the quality of the beans were superb. The staff were extremely knowledgeable of the business ethos and how they value not just quality coffee but genuine relationships with their coffee suppliers and methods of growing coffee that are sustainable.

Staff is friendly and study coffee well. They can recommend suitable coffee based on your demand. They serve tasty cascara tea for free after you enjoy the coffee. Only a pity is that some pastry are already sold out even I came early in the morning. Not easy to find this kind of cafe for special coffee beans. Price is quite expensive compared to the typical Vietnamese coffee shops, however it worth trying !

name: The Lounge - Sheraton Saigon Grand Opera Hotel
address: 80 Dong Du Street, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: The place to meet, work and relax. The Lounge offers all-day dining menu themed with &More by Sheraton concept encompassing a gathering place at the hotel lobby, serving everything from coffee, tea, fresh juice to craft beer, wine, and afternoon tea.
example_reviews: The Lounge, located adjacent to the lobby, has first class food, drinks, and service. I happened to arrive during happy hour (daily from 5-8pm) and drinks were 50% off, which made my Mai Tai extra tasty. I also tried "Banh Xeo" for the first time, which is a traditional Vietnam dish made with Pork and Shrimp, and served with mint, basil, lettuce leaves, and a wonderful dipping sauce. Absolutely delicious and would highly recommend.
Coffee & Tea & cookies are perfect,,, Service team are good as well. Space is warm & quiet We feel relaxing and will be back 😍😍

We stayed at this hotel recently for a couple of nights and had a bite to eat at The Lounge on the ground floor of the hotel at lunchtime on our first day. We were very happy indeed with the food and service so decided to do the same the next day, too. The bar/restaurant offers a good choice of plates, both local and international, plus drinks. It is a very spacious, modern area with tables, more relaxed seating and chairs at the bar as well. The mostly young staff are well trained and have great communication skills. Our waitress on both occasions, Huyen, was extremely attentive and eager to please. She recognised us the second day and greeted us warmly which was lovely. We were very impressed!

name: Lagom Café - Belgian Beer & Coffee Lounge
address: 87 Vo Thi Sau Ward 6, District 3, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Based on the idea of combining 3 interconnected F&B services: Cafe, beer lounge and mini retail shop specializing in selling Belgian beers directly to the end-users. Lagom Cafe has become known not only as one of most relaxing place for savouring Belgian craft beers but also as the only location in the country selling the most diversified collection of Belgian beers at the most reasonable prices
example_reviews: This is a super cute little Belgian beer bar, cafe and restaurant just a couple of minutes walk from The Pink Church and directly opposite Quan Pho Huong Binh for those of you on the Michelin credited pho restaurant trail, as we were. We noticed it across the street and stumbled in out of curiosity. Lovely, rustic wooden decor over several floors in a typically narrow HCMC-style dwelling squeezed, almost impossibly, into the shaft of space between buildings. A huge selection of bottled Belgian beer and several good quality staples on draft as well (I had a draft Vedette, she had a bottle of Grimbergen blonde). Really lovely staff - the young lady who served us was particularly helpful in recommending the best pho places to visit if you want to eat like a local. Hint: they are not on the Michelin credited list. But if you want to find out more about that, I suggest you pop in and ask yourself…

The first time I came here, I was impressed by the cozy feeling and the unique decoration style with beer bottles, creating a very suitable space to enjoy beer. The shop has many varieties from Belgium and has many choices from light to heavy, serving many customer groups. The service staff are very enthusiastic and attentive. I will definitely come back again!! ✨✨

I had the opportunity to visit Lagom and was really impressed with the way the shop represents the culture of Belgian beer. First, the restaurant's space is very comfortable and cozy. I feel like I'm in a little corner of Belgium. There are many unique decorative details, including paintings of famous Belgian beers. Soothing European-sounding background music creates a relaxing atmosphere ideal for enjoying beer. The shop's biggest strength is its diverse Belgian beer list. I tried many different beers and each one was interesting in story and rich in flavor. The bar's staff is very knowledgeable about Belgian beer and helped me choose the one that suits my taste. In addition, the shop also has a variety of snacks to pair with beer. I tried a few dishes such as a delicious cold charcuterie cup and a plate of beef with fragrant red pepper sauce. Although the prices are somewhat higher than some other shops, for all that the shop offers, it is a worthy experience investment. If you are a Belgian beer lover and want to experience the country's authentic beer culture, this is a great destination. I will definitely return to this restaurant in the future.

name: Latest Recipe
address: 3C Ton Duc Thang Street Le Méridien Saigon, Mezzanine Floor, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description: Overlooking the vibrant Saigon River, Latest Recipe is one of Ho Chi Minh City's most sought-after dining destinations. Featuring a stunning open showcase kitchen, guests can enjoy live seafood, fresh noodle selections, wood-fired pizza, and made-to-order dishes crafted by our talented culinary team. Indulge in an extensive international buffet available for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and Sunday brunch, or explore our à la carte menu for a personalized dining experience. Whether you're looking for a delicious meal, a lively gathering, or an intimate dining experience, our diverse menu caters to every palate.
example_reviews: Residing at Le Meridien Saigon where this restaurant is located, I tried it for both breakfast and dinner. The breakfast buffet is of a good standard, not a lot of choice and variety but what is there remains of quality. The fruit and/or vegetable juice freshly centrifuged to order is very appreciable. For dinner, however, I ordered a la carte, again not a lot of choice but well-prepared dishes in a mix of international and local cuisine. The price is very high for Vietnam but considering that this restaurant could be in any other metropolis in the world, you choose when you want to be safe

Tonight I dined at Le Meridien restaurant on Ton Duc Thang Street, District 1. Although the restaurant is buffet, I tried à la carte to experience the food here. I must say that the dishes I ordered to try were Mekong salad, cod fish eaten with rice... especially the fries served with shaking beef were delicious, very delicious. And the attentive, cheerful, enthusiastic waiters made the atmosphere as well as the meal more delicious. Thank you Yen, Van, Ngoc, My Dung, and Thu, for your very dedicated service.

Came here for breakfast and was impressed by the service. The waitstaff are responsive and kind, and speak English well for those who do not speak Vietnamese. Maru Nguyen served us and was polite and friendly. She speaks English well and was able to answer our questions with ease. The food was good, with choices of American breakfast, Chinese food, pastries, and Vietnamese food. Nguyet or Luna, the head chef who makes Pho, is very personable and greets you when you come to her station. She is very helpful and makes great food recommendations. The pho that she and her staff makes is delicious! My family and I had a great experience.

name: L'entrecote - Social Meating
address: Level 2, 63 Đông Du, Phường Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Ho Chi Minh City Vietnam
description: L’Entrecôte, the iconic Parisian eatery since 1959, now graces cities worldwide. Savor our famed single-course meal; fresh organic walnut salad, Prime Sirloin with its famous secret sauce, and unlimited daily prepared crispy french fries.Enjoy this Legendary Dining Experience in Vietnam!
review_summary:
L'entrecote - Social Meating wraps guests in an atmosphere that exudes both elegance and comfort, complete with a French charm that's perfect for both romantic dinners and business meetings. The service at this establishment has received high marks for its professionalism and warmth, enhancing the authentic French culinary experience.

Diners often feel they receive excellent value, with the quality of ingredients and exceptional cooking justifying the cost. The prime sirloin, praised for its perfect preparation and irresistible secret sauce, along with an array of delightful sides and desserts, consistently earns rave reviews.
example_reviews: Once again, L'Entrecôte Social Meating did not disappoint us! The formula is simple but effective, with excellent Value for Award. We took advantage of the "60,000 VND" offer to taste sautéed vegetables and pepper sauce, a delight! The service was impeccable and the atmosphere very pleasant.

The restaurant's understated and elegant décor is a perfect interpretation of French sophistication. The specialty steak is served with a secret butter sauce, and the meat is tender and juicy. The wine list is impressive, with a selection of wines from Burgundy to Bordeaux. The service team is professional and welcoming, giving us a true sense of French hospitality. The most amazing thing is that they follow the traditional French recipe strictly and each dish is full of craftsmanship. It's expensive, but it's definitely worth a special occasion. This is a rare romantic dating spot in Saigon!

The signature entrecôte steak was cooked to perfection, swimming in their secret sauce. Generous portions had us swooning, while the authentic French atmosphere transported us straight to Montmartre. Absolutely smitten with their crème brûlée!

name: Oriental Pearl Restaurant
address: 720A Dien Bien Phu 66th Floor, Vinpearl Landmark 81, Autograph Collection, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: The Oriental Pearl, the city’s finest and highest all-day restaurant, serves elevated local dishes such as pho prepared with Wagyu beef set against a stunning view of the city so diners can sip on the clouds. A focus on local fare that blends tradition and creative re-imagination embodies Vinpearl Landmark 81 - Autograph Collection’s emphasis on immersing guests in modern Vietnam.
example_reviews: Honestly, one of the best restaurants I’ve been too. The location and the view is beautiful, and they have live music with a good variety on music type on saturdays that made the vibe even better. Now, the first impression, except from the view was the staff. All the staff were smiling and seemed happy which for me is very important that you can see and sense that they do wanna be there and work, and that you’re not bothering them or that they just wanted the evening to be over. Our waitress of the evening was Mocha and the service she gave was first class in my opinion as a former waitress. She went out of the way to explain the dishes to us, recommending dishes and ordered small portions for us to try. One thing I was impressed by was that she noticed that I ate the oysters raw, and therefore she recommended other dishes that contained raw fish like ceviche. She made sure that we had everything needed and didn’t mind to do everything so the evening would turn out the best for us as customers. The food was so fresh and seasoned so well. The range of seafood wasn’t very big but here it’s definitely quality over quantity and honestly, you don’t need much more than what they have. The only thing I can point out was the pasta dish that they prepare upon order. If you start with it, it might turn out great. But we had it for last and after all the fresh seafood it tasted a bit too salty for us. But definitely nothing wrong with the seasoning or so. In conclusion, I would not even hesitate to eat here again.

Great service and great quality of food! Our server Mocha was the best, she was very attentive and gave us great hospitality, truly a 5 star rating. The A4 Wagyu and fresh seafood was Devine and worth the price, definitely would recommend!

My wife and I went on her birthday and we thoroughly enjoyed the late lunch, we had the 990,000 dong Pho (which was a whole different experience - the meat quality of the Pho is better here but the flavor of the Reverie pho is better in my opinion. Com ga Hoi A was a pleasant partner to the Signature Pho. The service from Mocha was exceptional. We also appreciated the birthday cake (gratis) and Mocha taking endless pictures of us and the surrounding breathtaking views. Landmark is also known for its great seafood buffet.

name: Sol Kitchen & Bar
address: 110 - 112 Ly Tu Trong Ben Thanh Ward, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Sol kitchen bar, a new dining destination right at the heart of District 1, Ho Chi Minh City. Our cuisine is inspired by the flavours of latin America. We draw most of our influence from Mexico & Argentina. We look forward to welcoming you to Sol kitchen & bar.
example_reviews: This place has a nice vibe, staff are attentive and efficient and the food and cocktails were excellent - the pork and lamb option are melt in the mouth delicious! Couple of dissatisfaction points: mains a little lacking for vegetarians - we asked for vegetarian fajitas instead of chicken but restaurant was not willing to improvise to accommodate; If you are wine drinkers make sure you check they have enough bottles in stock for your group (12 people), ours ran out after 2 bottles - restaurant had no equivalent price alternative, the next option was almost twice the price. Could improve with accommodating customers better.

We had anniversary dinner here and were absolutely blown away with the food we received. It was beautiful and some of the best food we have ever eaten. Wasn't cheap by Vietnamese standards but to have the same quality meal at home we would've paid double the price we paid here. Would recommend this restaurant for any couple that want to treat themselves whilst on holiday 10/10

This is a great, vibrant restaurant with excellent food, cocktails/drinks and service! The atmosphere was lively as it was busy with lots of young people enjoying HCMC at night. There was a couple of birthday celebrations that staff supported with a cake and singing. My partner chose the chilli con carne and duck and I chose the warm cheese & chorizo and seafood with orzo. All of the food was delicious, hot and plentiful. We were given a cheesecake dessert free as there was a very slight delay in the main courses not arriving together. Staff were helpful, efficient, smiley and created a lovely atmosphere for a great dining experience! I would highly recommend this restaurant 😊

name: A Taste Of Saigon - Kitchen
address: 272 Đề Thám Quận 1 Hồ Chí Minh, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: At “A Taste of Saigon,” we are committed to providing a memorable dining experience that celebrates the essence of Saigon’s culinary culture. Join us for a journey of flavors, where every dish tells a story and every moment is a celebration. Discover the heart and soul of Saigon through the exquisite offerings at “A Taste of Saigon.”
example_reviews: The staff were so friendly and helpful in this restaurant and their service seemed genuine. We were served by Blink, who had a lovely smile, and nothing was too much trouble for her. The food was really good and we didn't have to wait long for our meals. If you want to sample authentic Vietnamese food in a restaurant that provides good value for money, then this is a good choice for you

Amazing food and excellent service! The papaya salad, spring rolls, and tofu balls were all delicious—fresh, flavorful, and perfectly prepared. The servers were attentive and made our experience even better. Highly recommend this spot!

A fantastic meal. June our waitress was very attentive, taking time to explain the menu options to us. She was extremely friendly and her use of the English language was excellent. The food and drink were delicious and good value. We shall be recommending this establishment to our tour guide.

name: Hanoi Train Track Cafe
address: 47 Le Duan Street 224 Lane, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: CAFE & DRINK Come in and get a taste of our great cafe & drink. Excellent place to visit, to chill and get amazing photos of the train.
cuisines: Late Night Mediterranean Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: In the heart of Hanoi, tucked away along the train tracks, lies a quaint café that exudes a unique charm. The ambiance is captivating, offering a serene escape from the bustling city. The coffee served here is delightful, complemented by a selection of tasty snacks that perfectly accompany your drink of choice. The staff are friendly and attentive, ensuring a pleasant visit every time. It's a place where you can unwind, soak in the local atmosphere, and enjoy a moment of tranquility. Highly recommended for anyone looking to experience a hidden gem in this vibrant city. 🇵🇹🇻🇳🇵🇸🌍🙏🏼🤍✨🖤🌙

We ordered the coconut coffee and egg coffee from Cafe Ga Dong Duang and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The cafes along the railway were beautiful and had a great atmosphere. Great place to relax and watch tourists come by. A guard is at the only entrance. A cafe owner will come and bring you in. It’s their way to manage the crowd given the authorities’ concerns with safety issues given the trains. You can choose which cafe to go to.

Check train times before you go so you can see the train. The train goes past about 9 times a day, some are spaced a hour or so apart and some in the evening. There are about 10 spots to stop and have a drink on the small section of track. Of course you have to purchase a drink to sit down at a shop but it’s the standard price. 20k - 50k for a beer with lots of juices and snacks to be had. We stayed for 45min and had 2 beers a ice tea and a smoothie for 115k dong. If you don’t want to spend money you can walk up and down the track and just take pictures for no charge

name: Fu Rong Hua Cantonese Restaurant
address: 9 Dinh Tien Hoang Street, Hang Trong Ward, Hoan Kiem District 09 Dinh Tien Hoang, Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Fu Rong Hua is a Cantonese-style restaurant. Located in the heart of Hanoi capital, overlooking the Hoan Kiem Lake, Fu Rong Hua is the ideal place for couples, families and diners to love Chinese food such as dim sum, roast duck
cuisines: Middle Eastern Restaurants with Buffet in Hanoi
example_reviews: Decent meal but not on par with the Cantonese food served in Europe. Eg pancakes for duck are incredibly thick and doughy, the dishes are highly salty (maybe don’t check your blood pressure reading on the same evening of dining). Pricey for Vi standards but a nice treat if you fancy something different. The dim sum (crab and prawn) cannot be faulted and the service is speedy. Solid 3.5/5.

We ate there early, so we had the benefit of a quiet restaurant. I can honestly say I don't remember the last time I ate dimsum so good! Fresh ingredients.... every prawn dimsum was meaty and you could see and taste the prawns... it was really outstanding. Also the Hong Kong style pork was great.... Our server Ván Anh was extremely friendly and helpful! Huge compliments to her. Overall really no complaints, and I would definitely eat here again.

Very average food with a Pekin Duck ( the house specialty, it seems..), served with only one kind of sauce (no Chinese mustard, no pickled chilli) chewy and tasteless. The Dim Sum were standard, with little difference in taste from one to another. Dining rooms are pleasantly lit, the service efficient. Last visit.

name: Maison Marou
address: 91A Tho Nhuom Tran Hung Dao Ward Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Exellent chocolate cocktail! I ordered chocolate cookie cocktail. Although it was a bit expensive (120 000 VND) it was worth the price. I liked that with a dessert you get a free refill of drinking water, which helps on hot days. Great place for a date.
cuisines: Eastern European Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Exellent chocolate cocktail! I ordered chocolate cookie cocktail. Although it was a bit expensive (120 000 VND) it was worth the price. I liked that with a dessert you get a free refill of drinking water, which helps on hot days. Great place for a date.

It looked like a classic Vietnamese souvenir shop, and I walked to the hotel in front of Hanoi station where I stayed. It took me about 10 minutes to get there, but I found myself facing a road just down the street, so I had to rely on navigation if I didn't know. There was a showcase of cakes as soon as I entered the store, and when I ordered recommended products and drinks, they served me to the eat-in space at the back. Further into the eat-in space was a handmade workshop where visitors could watch demonstrations. There was a dedicated corner by the entrance for tea and souvenirs, which could be purchased here, but because it was hot outside, you had to be careful about the take-home time.

I came to the cafe for the sweets. It's fun just looking at the sweets in the cafe's showcase. The beer mug-style chocolate sweets I was looking for were not sold out yet. There are so many types of chocolate in the shop corner that it can be confusing, but you can sample them. You can have fun selecting items. I chose a standard set as a souvenir for home. The price is high, but you can buy it cheaper than buying it in Tokyo.

name: Spices Villa - Vietnamese Cuisine
address: 73 Ly Nam De Cua Dong Ward, Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Nestled in the vibrant heart of Hanoi's Old Quarter, yet serenely removed from the bustling streets, lies Spices Villa a Vietnamese Restaurant. More than just a place to eat, it's an experience, a journey into the soul of Vietnamese cuisine. Housed within a beautifully preserved French colonial villa, the restaurant exudes an air of timeless elegance and tranquil charm. Step through its doors and be transported to a bygone era, where the aromas of fragrant herbs and spices mingle with the hushed ambiance of a peaceful sanctuary, promising an authentic taste of Vietnam in an unforgettable setting.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: . Ate here on our first & last nights in Vietnam, initially recommended by our hotel reception . The ambience was tranquil, with an airy semi open area at front and plenty more space under cover Tables were spaced well apart and the food delicious, My duck breast was perfectly cooked & my husband’s stir fried beef fillet soft and succulent. Desserts were also fabulous. The staff were lovely, just the right level of attentiveness. A special mention for Chilie, our lovely waitress on both occasions- she recognised us straight away on our 2nd visit even gave us a sketch of our meal, drawn while we were eating, to give us as a memento. This is the perfect spot for a celebration or just a good slap up meal.

Gorgeous restaurant with event outdoor and indoor seating. Set menu was the perfect amount of traditional yet elevated Vietnamese food. The spices, flavourings, and textures were really a cut above other places we have eaten (and loved) in Vietnam. On top of this the young, vibrant staff (who all speak fluent English) were impeccable. Both polite and friendly it made us feel really at home. Special shout out to Ms Chi Le who also gave us a great bar recommendation for later!

We dined in this beautiful place. The restaurant , in a beautiful house elegantly restored , is quiet and offers a lovely room and two charming courtyards. We tasted refined dishes full of flavor and finesse. The kitchen is really upscale! The welcome of the whole team is exceptional , Miss Chile is adorable, professional and speaks very good English. Thank you , it was a last dinner that ended our trip to Vietnam and we will keep a wonderful memory. Do not hesitate to discover this place in Hanoi!

name: La Badiane Restaurant
address: 10 Nam Ngu, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Founded in December 2008, La Badiane -French for Star Anise spice- is heralding its claim to be one of the best restaurants in Vietnam, dedicated to fusion of flavors and international gastronomy. As reference, La Badiane is rated top 500 Restaurants in Asia by The Miele Guide, has been recommended by The New York Times, and has received 5 consecutive Certificates of Excellence by Trip Advisor -since 2011. Indeed, with more than 300 upvotes as “EXCELLENT”, La Badiane knows a high rating deserved to top-end restaurants. Yet, if most is about tastes, fusion of flavors and international gastronomy, great attention is also constantly paid to the quality of the service provided as well as to the overall atmosphere, so guests have a unique culinary experience by enjoying every aspect of their meal. When coming in, one’s attention is instantly caught by the multitude of perfumes & aromas flowing out from the open front kitchen. The entrance corridor planted with harmonious luxuriant vegetation leads you towards the heart of the restaurant, and its glass covered patio. Surrounded by carefully chosen leaf plants, walls predominantly white, and large B&W photo portraits, the place provides for a true feeling of calm and elegance. The combination of tablecloths, two-color curtains, and the green vegetation gathers all conditions to let guests’ visual and gustative senses fully express themselves. The attentive and discreet lightening in the evening makes it very romantic, and live classic music concerts every Wednesday evening levels-up La Badiane restaurant to turn it into a complete place. On the upper floor, two rooms available provide for perfect intimate spaces, appropriate for guests either looking for privacy, or mid-size groups wishing to enjoy a private lunch or dinner on a special occasion. As opposed to the ground floor and its B&W photos, the first floor presents large-size color portraits. A must-see.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Late Night Indian Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: Tonight, my wife and I ate at La Badiene, and the experience was simply wonderful. I booked the restaurant from Australia via email - the communication was very easy, clear, and timely. From the moment we arrived, the staff were fantastic - chilled, but super attentive. We had the degustation menu and at their suggestion we had the Signature menu and Fusion menu and shared each dish, this doubled the number of dishes we had, but also doubled the amount of work for the kitchen and staff. Throughout the meal, the waiters offered additional bread, making sure that we had enough for the pate, etc. The meals were beautifully crafted, full of flavour, and complemented the other courses. On completion of our meal, our waiter helped us book a Grab (Uber), and another of the staff waited with us until it arrived. We often eat at restaurants, but La Badiene is exceptional - Great food and wonderful staff. If you're in Hanoi and looking for a special night out, this is it. 11 out of 10

This is a beautiful place. We ordered a four-course lunch, and the quality started incredibly high and gradually declined over the courses. I think the starters were best because they were relatively simple, so the excellent preparation and great flavours really shone through. But the mains and desserts felt over-complicated, with too many ingredients, not all of which seemed to belong together. They'd look great on Instagram, but weren't so satisfying to eat. Overall, though, a very good meal. The staff tried hard to provide what they clearly think of as good service, but to me it was very annoying. They were constantly fussing over us and making a big production of doing simple and/or completely unnecessary things like unfolding napkins, clearing crumbs from the table and putting down empty plates between each course and then taking them away again. But when we actually wanted something, they were nowhere to be found, and the bill took so long to arrive that my wife had to get up and fetch it herself. To me, good service is unobtrusively efficient, but this was inefficiently obtrusive. Probably wouldn't come back.

As you walk through the entrance with the glass panelled kitchen, you immediately feel special in this place of warm welcome sophistication.. from the beautiful black and white portrait prints that adorn the walls, to the head chef Benjamin coming and introducing himself to customers. But wow.. it’s the the tastes & the fusion of flavours, combined with the quality of service that you must come and experience. There is so much creativity in the combination of flavours & spices that pair so well together. Do yourself a favour when looking for a special meal. Come to this place. They have well priced degustation lunches that change weekly or simply try their individual meals… whichever you choose you won’t be disappointed.

name: TUNG Dining
address: 2C Quang Trung, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: T.U.N.G Dining is Vietnam’s first pioneering tasting menu restaurant, where innovation knows no bounds. Our vision is to offer diners an extraordinary experience—one that transcends limits and redefines expectations. Chef TUNG’s approach to food is inspired by culinary influences from around the world, thoughtfully combined with the finest local ingredients and flavors. Join us on this journey of discovery!
cuisines: South American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: One of the most expensive Western restaurants I've ever been to and enjoyed. The Nordic food menu is extremely diverse, including ordering by portion or individual dishes. We got to try a lot of strange dishes that we have never tried before. When the wait staff brought it out, they fully introduced the name of the dish and even the main ingredients of the dish. Each dish is served in a fairly small quantity, we came here to determine this in advance and the price is also very luxurious. Professional and polite service staff, luxurious space.

I have been to this restaurant since attracted by reviews. I must say that what I tasted was partly amazing, partly normal. There are some things that, perhaps out of Italian habit and not only, did not convince me so much, like the fact that wine and water are not left at the table, but the waiter, every time he sees the empty glass comes with the bottle and pours what you need. Too bad that the white wine we chose arrived at the right temperature only at the end from dinner! That said: - pros: environment and dishes, some dishes with exclusive taste, attentive service, but not too much; - cons: drinks not left available to diners, some dishes with a bit 'flat flavor, price in my opinion not justified compared to the offer and prices of the place (although I understand it is a high-end restaurant), the waiter who once outside the room (right on the street), asks which dishes were liked more and which ones you liked less ... even today I do not understand why these questions are asked outside the restaurant. Otherwise, would I come back? Safe not. Would I recommend it? Yes, if you have an additional budget to spend differently... as I said above, some dishes are really crazy!

Giving T.U.N.G. Dining anything less than five stars is a travesty and does a disservice to creative cooking. Listen, I’m 74, was part owner of three restaurants, and have dined at the culinary temples of the world including many three star Michelin restaurants. T.U.N.G Dining is on par with most of them. Our 17 dishes tickled our senses of smell, taste, and sight. The culinary journey was a trip to Wonderland and Oz. The photos tell part of the story, but everything also tasted delicious. Service was charming and helpful, and everyone displayed pride in what they were serving. Pricing is extremely high for Vietnam, coming to around $280 for two including tax and tip. T.U.N.G. Dining is worth every penny.

name: Maison Vie
address: 28 Tang Bat Ho Street, Pham Dinh Ho ward, Hai Ba Trung district Hai Ba Trung district, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Based on 28 Tang Bat Ho Street, Maison Vie Restaurant is an indispensable destination for French cuisine lovers in Hanoi. With 20 years of in-depth experience in French restaurant business, Maison Vie promises awesome dishes and services delivered by skilful chefs and dedicated staff. Inspired by "Brasserie" - imperial and crowded French restaurants with Neoclassical architecture, characterized by meticulous and subtle sculptures, Maison Vie Restaurant owns ancient but luxurious beauty, partly forming an elegant trait among a busy street.
