Mansion perspective with light white color and gently patterned arches not only forms graceful and moderate architectural portrait but also creates open space of fresh air and natural light. Enjoying characteristic and superior French dishes in a classical and opulent space will be splendid memories for any choosy clients. On the second floor, outdoor dining area under green liana truss will be ideal composure for nature lovers. Simultaneously, 4 VIP rooms with cosy brown interior will well fit intimate and private appointments. Maison Vie means "house of life", which derived from the desire to establish a familiar address for family get-together, friend reunions, colleague gatherings in a subtle, deluxe French-originated dining space. Nothing is more marvelous than the period of relishing meals together with our dear ones, temporarily forgetting daily anxieties and appreciating sweet relaxation. Maison Vie logo with the simulation of a Gaulois cock, French national historic emblem, features goodwill, closeness, generosity, hospitality. Slogan "Let's taste better now" not only signifies determination to set up a superior nutritious French food spot, but also accumulates dedication to innovate combination of fresh high-class ingredients with native spices, which brings clients ultimate appetite. Maison Vie is the perfect dining site of gourmets, the must-try paradise of French cuisines once in a lifetime, the "third place" cementing family sentiment and nourishing intimate camaraderie. Maison Vie Restaurant - "Taste better now"
cuisines: Middle Eastern Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
Pizza with Private Dining in Hanoi
Seafood Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
example_reviews: Wonderful classy French restaurant. My wife and I went on a recommendation from a tour guide and were not disappointed. Beautiful setting and excellent food and service. We had the four course option with wine and everything was great. I’m not a real big dessert person, but with the 4 courses I selected the strawberry/orange cheesecake and it was flavorful, smooth and light as air. Amazing. And for those who come from another big city (we come from NYC) the cost is very reasonable. Highly recommended.

We had a price fix dinner that include a voice of appetizers and a selection of entrees. Included were dessert and wine. Food was excellent. I had the Basa Fish Bouilabaisse style entree which was quite different that other Bouilabaisse dishes I have had in the past. This did not have a broth, yet it was terrific.

We were very impressed with the quality of the food, the ambience in the restaurant, and the attention the staff paid to us. We could not fault anything. A well-informed local recommended to us the restaurant for fine French dining. We ordered two sets comprising Starter, Soup, Maim and Dessert. The choices for the sets, which we consulted with the staff, as well as for wine, turned out to be perfect. The beef cheeks, particularly, were juicy and delicious. A meal like this for one person would easily set us back by more than A$100 in Australia, but we paid under US$60 for two. Thank you for giving my wife and I such a beautiful dining experience. You are an important addition to Hanoi's fine culinary scene.

name: Bun Cha Huong Lien
address: 24 Le Van Huu, Hanoi Vietnam
description: This spot well-known on webs and we found it packed with visitors. Bun Cha and grilled pork skewers were excellent, we all too loved the broth soup that we asked for a second. And it was served quite fast. This dining spot seemed private, however, it' quite cramped so it' unconvenient anyway.
example_reviews: This spot well-known on webs and we found it packed with visitors. Bun Cha and grilled pork skewers were excellent, we all too loved the broth soup that we asked for a second. And it was served quite fast. This dining spot seemed private, however, it' quite cramped so it' unconvenient anyway.

We just enjoyed a tasteful lunch at this small but famous restaurant. Food was very fresh and service was good although the restaurant was crowded and it all went very quick. Would certainly recommend to visit this restaurant if you stay in Hanoi. It definitely is worth visiting

I was told to by the glove driver, but I had made a mistake. But I had never eaten Buncha before, so I tried it. I eat a sweet dipping sauce with vegetables and noodles. By the time I finished eating, I was bored with the sweetness and greasyness. Fried spring rolls are delicious.

name: Hill Top Curry Indian Restaurant
address: 6 P. Hàng Lược, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: At Hill Top Curry Restaurant, we serve you fresh, and healthy food. All dishes are cooked by Experienced Chefs as our desire is to create a place where you can enjoy the beauty of food. Enjoy your meal! With more than 100 dishes and drinks on the menu.
example_reviews: Very conveniently close to the Masjid an Noor. V good quality Indian/Pakistani cuisine , very reasonably priced. Friendly and efficient service. No long wait for good food. Be cautious when ordering especially on a hungry tummy...The portions are very generous and the meals on the menu are often substantial enough for 2 adults to share. If you've over ordered management will gladly oblige if you have leftover food to be packed for taking home.

One of the best Indian Restaurant in Hanoi city and is very close to maximum hotels. Food is so Delicious and Tasty in reasonable best price. The team is very polite and humble. I recommend people to prefer this Restaurant without any doubt.

Vietnamese people may not like Indian food, and the price is higher than the average of local restaurants, but I love it! Authentic spice cuisine, you can eat delicious vegetarian or meat, masala, thali, biryani... It is worth exploring here. In Hanoi, a city full of imagination, eating delicious South Asian food is totally worth the money!

name: 5ku Station
address: 29 Thai Van Lung Ben Nghe Ward, Dist. 1, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description:
We had dinner at 5ku Station today. After reading the map, we decided on shrimp, octopus and fish stomachs. Since we didn't know exactly what to expect with the last dish, we were curious. Then came the charcoal table grill for the ordered food, the fish stomach looked quite nice on the plate and we thought this was his normal fish. Far from it, it was actually fish stomachs that resumed their original shape on the grill. We tried a piece and then it was clear that this is not for us.
The waitress noticed that we don't really like the ordered fish stomach and took it back with us and didn't calculate it, just great, because we had ordered this.
All in all a nice experience with the barbecue at the table, the ambience is Vietnamese, but the service just super nice, for this 5 points with star.
example_reviews: We had dinner at 5ku Station today. After reading the map, we decided on shrimp, octopus and fish stomachs. Since we didn't know exactly what to expect with the last dish, we were curious. Then came the charcoal table grill for the ordered food, the fish stomach looked quite nice on the plate and we thought this was his normal fish. Far from it, it was actually fish stomachs that resumed their original shape on the grill. We tried a piece and then it was clear that this is not for us. The waitress noticed that we don't really like the ordered fish stomach and took it back with us and didn't calculate it, just great, because we had ordered this. All in all a nice experience with the barbecue at the table, the ambience is Vietnamese, but the service just super nice, for this 5 points with star.

First of all, the restaurant is more than rustic, the chairs and tables are hand-made, the floor is bare concrete; the air is quite smoky due to the various table grills. The restaurant is always busy, however, as it is comparatively cheap. The barbecue itself is an experience, you grill yourself at your table on small charcoal grills, we tried beef and pork, both very nicely marinated and nicely flavorful! In conclusion, it's not for a quiet dinner for two, but if you like grilled food and a good beer, you're in good hands here.

Great place for cook your own bbq - great atmosphere and service. Ordered the eggplant which was amazing along with the morning glory with garlic. For the bbq the pork and beef were both delicious but the octopus was very tough. The accompanying sauces were all delicious too. Beers were ice cold.

name: ST25 by KOTO
address: Lê Duẩn/17 Ward Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: ST25 by KOTO pays tribute to the renowned Vietnamese rice variety, ST25, which earned the prestigious title of "World's Best Rice" in 2019, representing the essence of Vietnamese culture. It's a place where every meal can be a force for good, where the quintessence of Vietnamese cuisine and the mission of contributing to community development go hand in hand.
review_summary:
ST25 by KOTO garners high praise from patrons for providing exceptional value, with its high-quality, flavor-rich dishes and commendable social mission. Guests have called out the staff's attentiveness and warmth, enhancing the dining experience.

The restaurant's atmosphere is often described as stylish and luxurious, perfect for both intimate dinners and group gatherings. Moreover, the fusion of traditional Vietnamese flavors with contemporary twists in the food presentation consistently earns rave reviews from travelers.
example_reviews: We were looking for a romantic setting with Vietnamese cuisine, knowing how much my girlfriend loves Vietnamese dishes. As Vietnamese ourselves, we’ve tasted countless dishes across the country, but KotoSt25 redefined our palate of how Vietnamese cuisine can be presented in such an elegant and exuberant setting. We opted for a set menu at Koto, which was authentically Vietnamese, rich in flavors that brought us back home, yet delivered with a Western twist that elevated our dining experience. Every bite was a rediscovery, from the spring rolls with well-braised Vietnamese-style Wagyu beef to the perfectly steamed ST25 rice. My girlfriend indulged in three cocktails, each beautifully mixed and served, with the standout being the “Canh Chua”— which amazes us enough as its taste uniquely captured quiet much resemblance to the Vietnamese tomato soup but still fit itself nicely to indulge as a cocktail. Staffs were incredibly attentive, friendly, and took lots of their effort to explain the ingredients and stories behind each dish (though we barely remembered all the details 😂). Their warmth made us feel truly appreciated and cherished. We were even greeted by the hotel’s GM and the restaurant manager, who made their rounds to ensure every guest was enjoying their meal—a truly memorable touch. It was a night that brought us even closer as a couple, and we would highly recommend KotoSt25 to anyone looking to share a lovely evening with their loved one.

Lovely dinner with braised Australian wagyu beef cheek spring rolls and the Halong Bay oysters for entrees. Springs rolls were hot, flavourful, and a nice start, as were the oysters, which were huge. Our mains were the slow roasted half bbq chicken and the crispy pork belly porchetta with seasonal asian greens and the fried rice with mushrooms and baby corn. The bbq chicken was well worth the wait and was tender, moist, and full of flavour while the porchetta was very tasty but huge and more than enough for two people. Finally, our desserts were rice pudding and the pandan waffle with strawberries, cream, and soursop ice cream. The coconut and mango rice pudding was the best we ever tasted with a beautiful texture and was simply genius. The waffle for me was the perfect finish to a lovely meal. Our server, Thuy / Mille was friendly, patient and very attentive with a very strong interpersonal skills. Very approachsble and professional at the same time. 10/10

Large open kitchen restaurant with lovely attentive staff, explained the dishes when presented etc etc topped up water when the glasses got low. Food was fantastic, we had the half chicken (knowing it would take 45min) and some Asian greens and of course a bowl of ST25 rice. Spring rolls for entree were great, full of beef and a great way to start. Was offered to have greens and rice whilst we wait for the main but chosen to have it together. Fantastic flavours and topped it off with dessert. We would def come back here again. Looking forward to it already. At the time of our visit they were open for lunch but only on weekends. Last dinner orders taken I think was 1030pm so a great option for late dinner. Accor Plus discount applied, I think the max discount was 30% food and the usual 20% for drinks)

name: Secret Garden - Vietnamese Restaurant
address: 158 Pasteur, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description: Secret Garden 158 Pasteur is the original restaurant established since 2012 offering patrons signature home-cooked Vietnamese dishes and drinks, located on the rooftop of old building in town as a perfect view of the whole city life in day and night time.
example_reviews: We recently tried the Vietnamese rice pancake with mushroom, and it exceeded our expectations. The pancake was perfectly crispy on the outside, while the mushrooms added a burst of earthy flavors. It was a delightful combination that left us craving for more! What sets Secret Garden Restaurant apart is not only the delectable food, but also the affordable prices. You can enjoy a fulfilling meal without breaking the bank, which is a rare find in such a bustling city. The ambiance of the restaurant is charming, with a cozy garden setting that creates a tranquil atmosphere amidst the hustle and bustle of the city. The attentive staff were friendly and knowledgeable, eager to provide suggestions and ensure our dining experience was enjoyable.

It would be very easy to think the directions / location were wrong for this restaurant as you walk down a semi dark lane and then you find yourself climbing up a stairs past many busy apartments occupied by local Ho Chin Minn families. However, on arriving at the semi open roof top restaurant you are greeted by welcoming staff of this atmospheric culinary experience. Food was superb set out a very comprehensive menu. Can highly recommend but again, trust the directions 👍

Looking for a delectable dining experience that won't break the bank? Look no further than Secret Garden Restaurant. The affordable prices and generous portions ensure you get a satisfying meal for a reasonable price. The attentive and helpful staff are knowledgeable about the menu, making sure you get exactly what you desire. The authentic Vietnamese cuisine, made with fresh ingredients, will leave you craving for more.

name: Octo Tapas Restobar
address: 75 Ho Tung Mau 2nd Floor, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Here to kick off a country with spanish food frenzy!! Highest quality ingredients married with modern techniques and exquisite style!! In the heart of Saigon, the first premier Spanish open kitchen experience! Most extensive Spanish winelist in Vietnam with over 65 vineyards to choose from!
example_reviews: Went here on the complete off chance. My wife found it looking on the internet as she fancied some tapas and it did not disappoint. Food and service was excellent. The waitress was very helpful and would not let us over order and the food arrived in the perfect amount of time. Not too quick but slow enough to know it was all being prepared freshly. Open kitchen so you can see the action. Very clean and a very nice ambiance. Would highly recommend the sucking pig.

Excellent food , tasty small plates to share. You won’t get tired of the same flavors ( like in a large portion) try lots of different and interesting dishes. The waiters are very friendly and attentive, and good suggestions if you’re not sure what to try. Open kitchen was fun to watch the dishes being prepared! We went there twice and was not disappointed!

Our group of 6 selected the We Pick, You Eat 6 course tapas menu for 900k/per person and it did not disappoint. Everything was delicious and the service excellent. Our only complaint and it's a small one, was that the wait time between dishes was quite long.

name: Dogalbi Saigon
address: 31e Lý Tự Trọng, Phường Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Tp. Hồ Chí Minh, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description:
Probably the best meal we have ate in our two weeks in Vietnam. We have been to Korean grills before in the uk but they do not compare to this.

The service was fantastic from start to finish. A waiter cooks the food on the grill for you are the table which ensures it is cooked to perfection.

The quality of the meat was fantastic and it all came in big steaks (rather than the little slivers we are used to in uk grills). There was so much food that we could not eat it all and we have big appetites!! They keep bringing the little plates and sauces out as soon as they see an empty pot

Would highly recommend this place. The prices are brilliant too and there was more food than we could eat.

10/10 from us!🥰🥰🥰
example_reviews: Probably the best meal we have ate in our two weeks in Vietnam. We have been to Korean grills before in the uk but they do not compare to this. The service was fantastic from start to finish. A waiter cooks the food on the grill for you are the table which ensures it is cooked to perfection. The quality of the meat was fantastic and it all came in big steaks (rather than the little slivers we are used to in uk grills). There was so much food that we could not eat it all and we have big appetites!! They keep bringing the little plates and sauces out as soon as they see an empty pot Would highly recommend this place. The prices are brilliant too and there was more food than we could eat. 10/10 from us!🥰🥰🥰

We were taken to this place by a local employee... the place looked nice but the food was way too expensive. She ordered japanes wagyu beef, black pork mini burgers... I was surprised because it was delicious, the meat was fresh, soft and sweet... We've been to other Korean places downtown and we found them to be even better here than the original. Wow Korean restaurants in Vietnam are better than Korea, very surprising!

Really good option if you're looking for something a little bit different to the local food but don't want to go for the stock options of Pizza, Burger, Pasta. We ordered a Combo meal - so a selection of different meats BBQ'd on the hot coals in front of us and it came with a wide selection of Korean style sides. Very filling and overall and excellent option. Unlike Korean BBQ I have been to in the UK/Ireland, the food is cooked for you and in front of you.👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼

name: Viet Kitchen
address: 8-15 Ton Duc Thang Street Renaissance Riverside Hotel Saigon, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Viet Kitchen is a trendy lifestyle-driven dining and networking spot in Ho Chi Minh City, where modern design and ambiance meet traditional and global flavors. International dishes combined with local Vietnamese flavors offer a unique, innovative take on classic cuisines near and far. Fresh produce, exotic herbs, and international favorites come together in our crowd favorites. Coupled with warm and friendly service, the venue’s funky design and communal tables make space a social hub for those wanting a high-paced, tasty lunch or an indulgent dinner with friends and loved ones.
example_reviews: The chef's food is very delicious and diverse, the service is very attentive, and the staff are very cute Thank you Manager for being very enthusiastic and applying the 2-for-1 program for our group Will definitely recommend friends and colleagues to experience it, the price is very reasonable for a lunch at a 5-star hotel.

We were warmly greeted by the host and watched the food being prepared and cooked in an open kitchen. Our host chose for us and the food was first class, ample in size and very well priced. Family atmosphere , not pretentious and well worth a visit

This restaurant has great food and if you are staying at the hotel you get 20% off. Specifically, we felt our server named Phat was outstanding. Truly above and beyond, one of the kindest most genuine people I’ve experienced in the service industry. Thank you to him and to the amazing staff for making us feel so welcome.

name: The Olive Steakhouse
address: 151 Dong Khoi, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1 2nd Floor, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: The Olive is where everything is made from quality ingredients. Right in the heart of downtown Saigon and with only 7 tables in our restaurant, we are able to focus on providing excellent service in a cozy environment.
example_reviews: Looking at older reviews I had become a little worried, but after being served two beautiful medium rare pieces of meat by a lovely waitress, I'm happy to say this is a lovely little spot found in the art arcade in saigon. With wonderful service from the staff and pleasant Aussie cuts of beef which are about A3 rating. As someone who normally enjoys a good rib eye fillet or sirloin cut at home along with tomahawk, I know when I'm eating a well cut and cooked piece of meat. I highly reccomend the second serving platter consisting of a 350g rib eye and 350g sirloin which is cheaper than buying them separately. These also come with 2 complimentary side dishes, I don't reccomend the potato wedges and it would be a sin to eat such good quality meat with the mac and cheese, highly reccomend the sauted mushrooms. Don't be afraid to try a red with these lovely cuts as it develops overtime. To us, this was a wonderful experience with calming atmosphere.

Really great food. -I went back a second time. (And I heard the table near mine raving about how good their meals were as well) Excellent service. When you rock up with an allergy list nearly as long as your arm and they accommodate that. You know the waiting staff are attentive, when you order a drink and they bring it to you, without ice, because that is how you ordered it the other time. You know they paid attention when it comes to ordering the side and they say 'you didn't eat the mushrooms last time would you like to try the salad or something else this time?' Cute location too.

Absolutely delicious meal, my husband had the wagyu steak which was cooked to perfection and I had the beef steak with rose cream pasta which came with a whole steak! Absolutely delicious, wonderful ambience and lovely host. I would highly reccomend coming here over the commercial restaurants on the square. Thank you very much!

name: Anan Saigon
address: 89 Ton That Dam Street, Ho Chi Minh City 710000 Vietnam
description: About Anan Saigon: The name of the restaurant is ănăn, which also means ‘eat eat’. It is located in Chợ Cũ Tôn Thất Đạm, a wet market right in the center of bustling Saigon. We specialize in street food-inspired dishes created by the award-winning chef Peter Cuong Franklin. Chef Peter’s creative Vietnamese cuisine reflects his vision of a Vietnam that is deeply respectful of its history and traditions yet progressive and international in its outlook. He takes inspiration from the country’s vibrant food culture and uses fresh ingredients often sourced from local markets while incorporating French culinary techniques. The result is a focused menu of deeply flavorsome dishes that are all intended to pair perfectly with our bar’s diverse selection of local craft beers, carefully curated wines, and tropical inspired cocktails.
example_reviews: Genuinely excellent food, a class above most fine dining restaurants and it was absolutely delicious throughout. I’d strongly encourage a trip even at the high costs, but… Two things stick out to me: 1. I’m still hungry. Every dish of the tasting menu was very small, and despite being very tasty I’d have gladly had a decent amount more food even if it meant sacrificing a dish or two to balance the costs. 2. A little bit of a bitter taste left in my mouth by the staff at the end. We’d made a point to ask for the bill early and to pay quickly because we had somewhere to be, yet they genuinely seemed to be making no effort to facilitate this (and indeed collecting payment from other tables ahead of us even though they were clearly not finished with their food/drinks and in one case had just had fresh drinks delivered). Overall though despite these (meaningfully frustrating) complaints I can’t bring myself to go less than five stars because the food really was exceptional.

This was an excellent Michelin star experience. Know that it’s not like say an Alinia in Chicago, it’s a casual but food centric pleasure in a Vietnamese food market sort of way. Think like say Direkte Boqueria in Barcelona,(but at a typically lower Viet price point). The premises are very tall and very narrow but they manage to space everyone out in an appropriate way. They even quickly upgraded us to the air conditioned first floor from the breezy rooftop We opted for an à la cart experience although there were several rave reviews about the more expensive mixed fixed menus. The Foi Gras egg roll, while small, was loaded with taste. The duck mango salad was perfectly seasoned and very ample. My wife and I then shared the main course, choosing the pork chop specialty. Very tasty and tender. A nice surprise dessert cake for our anniversary, along with the fish sauce caramel vanilla ice cream topped off our meal and sent us off very happy and very satiated As I said, simply adjust your lense from an elegant high end Michelin to a casual but very flavourful Michelin experience. It’s all part of the fun. By the way, the staffing was very ample, all knowledgeable, warm and efficient.

Service and food are very good at this Sài Gòn Michelin star eatery. The layout is on five floors, all small spaces. We ate in the roof- dry pleasant. Creative cocktails, tho’ my berry mocktail was too sweet for my taste. The fried rolls of shrimp & crab were terrific, and the deep fried fish was delicious, with the meat served in chunks on the crisp body of the whole fish. Plating of all the dishes was creative. We felt the vanilla ice cream dessert with fish sauce was a bit much-excessive showmanship that bordered on tacky. That sauce was served in a little cologne spray bottle. Fish sauce by Dior😂? The food here is expensive, which it always has been. 6 of us ate for more than $200, and we did not order wine, just drinks. I’ll still return here for a special occasion & memorable meal.

name: Hum Lounge
address: 34 Võ Văn Tần, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description: Hum Lounge offers a cozy, tranquil atmosphere amidst the hustle of District 3. We are proud to pioneer a plant-based cuisine with fresh vegetables, flowers, beans, nuts, and fruits sourced from local regions and prepared new on-site daily. There is no artificial flavoring; we only add creativity and attentiveness to our dishes. Check out the drinks, too - they complement the food in intriguing ways that will please both your eyes and palette. Last but never least, our team maintains the highest hospitality standard every minute of the hour. Whether for a large gathering or a personal meeting, your time with Hum will delight the senses.
example_reviews: I went to this vegetarian restaurant with friends, relaxing and welcoming atmosphere, attentive to detail. We tasted dishes at the beginning of the dinner, which we shared (fried tuber, potato type ..) and each we chose a dish (fried rice with mushrooms, rice with pineapple and raisins ..). All very good, accompanied by fruit drinks (orange, lime and pineapple). Recommended dinner to enjoy a different evening, from the usual bars that are in the city. Cost for the city above average, we spent about 25 € each. Recommended!!

The photos people have shared are excellent, but there’s so much more to experiencing all that is this building and what goes on within. The food is on another level when it comes to creativity and deliciousness. The design of the interior design compliments the beauty of the plates being served. The staff are outstanding. The photos are outstanding, but the smells and flavors are something you must experience yourself.

After a stressful day, Hum truly felt like an oasis of peace. The atmosphere was calming, and the food was amongst the best we've ever tasted, with plenty of delicious vegan options to choose from. The staff were wonderful, going out of their way to help us select the perfect dishes. Special thanks to Phoung Vu for his exceptional hospitality—he looked after us so well, making sure we were 100% happy and satisfied throughout our meal. It was a dining experience we won't forget, and we highly recommend Hum to anyone seeking incredible food and warm service.

name: Ngon 138 Restaurant (Quán Ngon 138)
address: 138 Nam Ky Khoi Nghia Ward Ben Nghe, District 3, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Ngon 138 Restaurant is located in the heart of Saigon, in an ancient house of Hue, and offers a rich and delicious banquet menu since 2001. It is ideal for organizing event parties for friends, partners, and company year-ends, as it brings together all the typical dishes of the country under one roof. It has been a reliable destination for many locals and foreigners who love Vietnamese food.
example_reviews: Central location, atmosphere of a rich man’s home in the countryside, and most comprehensive menu of typical dishes from all regions of Vietnam. Only missing are fertilised egg embryos (trứng vịt lộn or balut in the Philippines). None of the dishes is the best in its category, but they’re all pretty good. Excellent service from friendly staff. Prices are very reasonable; ignore comments from cheapskates who would be better home eating at the market or just staying home!

We ate here twice during our stay. First time we ordered nine dishes as we didn’t have a clue about Vietnamese food. Next time we went we had a better idea on what and how much to order. The prawns were excellent and the waitress put on gloves and peeled them for us. Very informal dining but a lovely way to spend an evening. I would class it as outside dining and maybe the floor could be cleaner but that’s down to untidy diners. First evening was £40 nine dishes, bottle of wine and two beers. Second time £32 less dishes same amount of drink.

No air conditioning, but plenty of fans to keep cool. Right across the street from the Independence Palace. Good place for lunch, but also okay for dinner. This place is rather informal in a good way. Menu has lots of pictures and English translations of each dish. Perfect restaurant to experience local cuisine in a setting that isn’t too fancy (not like those white tablecloth french colonial restaurants). The menu is quite extensive—like the Cheesecake Factory in the USA, so you can try a variety of Vietnamese exotic dishes if you’re feeling adventurous. Bathrooms reasonably clean.

name: Reflections Restaurant
address: 19-23 Công trường Lam Sơn 3rd Floor, Caravelle Hotel, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description: A fine-dining restaurant with a cosmopolitan outlook, Reflections’ award-winning team is dedicated to serving creative dishes from around the world to diners in the heart of Saigon. Claiming a discreet perspective above one of the city’s most prominent intersections, this third-floor restaurant is a fitting space to reflect on the changing faces of Vietnam. Photographs on the walls pay tribute to Saigon’s heritage, and patrons have a front row view of the lights of Lam Son Square and the Saigon Opera House. Enhanced by the warm, intuitive service the Caravelle is known for, Reflections aims to create a magical, memorable dining experience every time.
example_reviews: The quality of the food was very good and the service attentive and prompt. We enjoyed the setting and the fact that there was no loud or inappropriate music. Less agreeable was the fact that all courses of a three course lunch were served on a tray simultaneously. This inevitably meant that the main course was cold by the time we had consumed the entrées. Perhaps the management interpreted a Business Lunch as placing the emphasis on speed and efficiency. In our judgement this should be reviewed in favour of a "course by course" serving approach rather than "all at once". (The day we ate there were only a handful of other diners so there was no time pressure on the staff.) This would considerably have enhanced our enjoyment.

First class service in a building of a long and vital heritage. The menu was well combined und delicious prepared while everything was of a high quality standard fitting to the higher prices here. Especially if you search for a location which is quiet and has a great view this restaurant is a good pick.

I feel quite satisfied I suggest that the lamb dish in the set needs more fat in the sauce. Because sheep don't eat dry food. Dessert and appetizers are okay for me The waiters here are very cute, Tran is very enthusiastic and gives thoughtful advice

name: Mặn Mòi - Tao Đàn
address: 34 Vo Van Tan Vo Thi Sau Ward, District 3, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description: Mặn Mòi serves authentic Vietnamese cuisine, which we relish. Having set foot in foreign lands, we've come to appreciate local, homely dishes even more. This is our reason for opening this bistro to share our love for Vietnamese delicacies with friends worldwide. Let us share a few notes here and there about the origins of our dishes so that your meal takes on this air of leisure. We draw inspiration from the hearty meals our Grandmothers and Mothers prepared and select the freshest local produce to turn into homely dishes, be it a salad, a stew, a soup, or a dessert. We do everything with care because we want to convey the elegance of Vietnamese cuisine and the warm hospitality of Vietnamese people. Please note that we also have a takeaway option. If you can't dine in, ask our staff to wrap savory Saigon delicacies to enjoy at home. May you have a festive meal.
example_reviews: Second visit to this restaurant and really worth the trip: DELICIOUS, fine, tasty. Bcp people but it was Friday night, better book. After a small papaya salad with beef jerky grilled absolutely divine and to finish in style of banana grilled with coconut juice and here even the decoration and service were at the rendezvous.

Excellent service and amazing food. We ordered several dishes to taste and all of them 10/10. We were told we were ordering too much food for 2 people so they advised us which dishes to remove, which proves they care about customer satisfaction over financial gain. Loyal to the service and the food. The building itself is unique and deserves a mention. Highly recommend if you find yourself in Saigon!

This restaurant is fabulous from the stunning external design, the interior decoration, the interesting menu and the helpful and attentive staff. We had been recommended to this restaurant by some travellers we met in Hoi An. When we got to HCMC we tried to book online but there was no availability. We took a gamble and turned up shortly after opening time and helpfully they managed to fit us in. Ms Nhu Lam patiently helped us through the interesting local menu and we had a chicken with sticky rice under a dome, a beef dish, some greens and from memory we had a rice dish with duck. They really get the attention to detail right without being over fussy. Mr Phuong Vu and his team do a great job!

name: Towa - Japanese Cuisine & Lounge
address: 92-94 Nam Ky Khoi Nghia Saigon Centre, Level 28, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Towa offers an interpretation of the art of Japanese cuisine through originality and flavor. Our guests are encouraged to discover or rediscover the authentic Japanese cuisine alongside classic Ginza Style Japanese Cocktails known for their minimalism and sublime attention to details in an intimate ambiance. Towa's uniqueness makes it an unforgettable visit where a wealth of sensory experiences
example_reviews: The food is great. We had a set menu and it was delivered without to much waiting times and tasted great. Service was very punctual and able to explain all the varieties of food. It is on the 28th floor so the view is great and the restaurant is decorated nicely. I do think they could choose different type of music with more ambiance, but it is not loud, so this didn’t bother me too much.

Beautiful location with a great view of the city. Right in the center next to the shopping mall so it was convenient. We came for the omakase experience and it was around $100 per person which was reasonably priced and the food was delicious. I thought it was little at first but by the time we finish the whole tasting, I was so full. Hung, our server, was very attentive and took good care of us. My husband loved it and we would come back next time we are in the city.

A very upmarket dining experience in a private Japanese dining room just for the two of us (yes, shoes had to come off before entering, tatami mats everywhere). We could order from two menus one Japanese “Towa”, the other Cantonese “Lai”. We started off with an incredible sashimi spread prepared by Towa’s chef before moving onto a selection of Cantonese dishes from Lai and finished up with a huge bowl of fruit. There is also a great selection of teas available by the pot in the Towa drinks menu if like me, that is your preference over alcohol. Tonight a perfect pot of black Oolong tea was a great match to the cuisine. Faultless service, Delicious food, Great atmosphere. What else could you ask for?

name: Banh Mi Huynh Hoa
address: 26 Le Thi Rieng P. Ben Thanh, Q.1 26 - 30 - 32 Lê Thị Riêng, P. Bến Thành, Q. 1, Tp. Hcm, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description:
I think this is one of the most well-known banh mi in HCMC. I went there late at night, roughly 9 pm., there was a queue (10 people)  so we joined. The queue processed fast, as there was only one thing to order, one banh mi costed 68,000 VND and the queue for walk-in order was separated from food delivery. Then we were moved to another queue after payment, where we would get bahn mi with separated vegetables, pickles and cucumber.

You can also ask the staff to cut bahn mi in half so it’s easier for you to share. Eating whole banh mi is too much for me, so I think half for a meal is about right.

It was meaty, there were at least 4-5 types of meat and sausages inside. My recommendation is to open the sandwich and put all the pickles and vegetables in it, since the vegetables like coriander, spring onion and pickles added such a nice touch. The green chilli (came mixed with the vegetable) might be too spicy for some westerners, but it spiked the flavour. If you don’t like spicy, please try to pick it off the vegetable before you add the vegetable to the filling.

Overall, it’s a big hit for me. I’d definitely come back or else, I would order Grab to my hotel next time in HCMC.
example_reviews: I think this is one of the most well-known banh mi in HCMC. I went there late at night, roughly 9 pm., there was a queue (10 people) so we joined. The queue processed fast, as there was only one thing to order, one banh mi costed 68,000 VND and the queue for walk-in order was separated from food delivery. Then we were moved to another queue after payment, where we would get bahn mi with separated vegetables, pickles and cucumber. You can also ask the staff to cut bahn mi in half so it’s easier for you to share. Eating whole banh mi is too much for me, so I think half for a meal is about right. It was meaty, there were at least 4-5 types of meat and sausages inside. My recommendation is to open the sandwich and put all the pickles and vegetables in it, since the vegetables like coriander, spring onion and pickles added such a nice touch. The green chilli (came mixed with the vegetable) might be too spicy for some westerners, but it spiked the flavour. If you don’t like spicy, please try to pick it off the vegetable before you add the vegetable to the filling. Overall, it’s a big hit for me. I’d definitely come back or else, I would order Grab to my hotel next time in HCMC.

A friend recommended this place to us and said "it's the best Banh Mi you'll ever have" and he was not wrong! As we turned onto the street we saw two large queues - one was JUST for delivery drivers to pick up for take out/delivery, and one was for people on foot to takeaway. We knew from the queues it must be good! They don't have a menu as it's just one option - again - sign of someone who knows what they're doing vs a jack of all trades and master of none. Queue was big but wait wasn't long bas they have such a good system and production line going on in there! Can't remember exactly the cost but think around $3USD or something equally as cheap for what really could've been split between two not just for one person! They give you the bread with various cuts of meat with the pate and mayo wrapped up, and then little bags of the salad bits to add inside (1 x cucumber, 1 x pickled radishes, 1 x spring onions and herbs). I honestly can't describe how tasty the whole combo was! Gotta try it!

The French bread, crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside, is crispier, fluffier, and softer than the real French bread, which seems to be due to the fact that Vietnamese bread is made from rice flour. I liked this better than the real French bread, which is filled with at least five different kinds of ham, pate, pork char siu, chicken ham, meat floss, onion chips, etc., and vegetables such as fresh cucumber, radish and carrot namasu, pak choi, green onion, fresh chilies, etc., are served separately and can be topped according to your preference. Vegetables such as fresh cucumber, radish, carrot, pak choi, green onion and fresh chili are served separately and can be topped as desired. The price is reasonable and the food is too good to be true.

name: Vietnam House Restaurant
address: 93-95-97 Dong Khoi, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: A Vietnamese cuisine with a Modern Twist restaurant lies in the heart of Saigon that amaze your appetite The restored colonial building on the corner of Dong Khoi and Mac Thi Buoi in the heart of the city once housed the famed Café L’Imperial in the early 1900s, and was a popular destination for the city’s affluent business class. The new Vietnam House Restaurant is set to bring back the nostalgia and charm of this storied street corner, and introduce a new generation to the sublime qualities of of Vietnamese food at its finest.
example_reviews: Very delicious local food and great service. Super attentive and helpful. In particular Nu, an exceptional waitress. Everything is very clean and, in addition, a very very beautiful decoration of the land. Air conditioning is appreciated. Super attentive and different dishes: transparent lobster rolls, purple rice with shrimp and chicken with lemon sauce, highly recommended. This is the only reason I would go. And a delicious coffee. It is not the cheapest but the price is worth it. I recommend it.

We decided almost at the end of our holiday. In Vietnam to treat ourselves to a dinner in one of the best and elegant restaurants in Saigon. The restaurant is located in the center, a stone's throw from the best hotels and tourist attractions of the city. The location, although a little dated, is very elegant with crystal booths with colored inlays. The menu includes typical local dishes with dishes not so dissimilar from others tasted in other restaurants, I ordered a classic as a starter, Fresh Rolls with prawns and pork followed by a duck breast cooked in two ways with tomato and pepper sauce with bok choi and smashed potatoes, both very elegant dishes and truly excellent on the palate. The service is absolutely professional, you are accompanied and followed right from the moment you enter the room. Naturally the prices are much higher than the Vietnamese average, absolutely normal for us Italians

Having the opportunity to enjoy the anniversary special course dinner was truly wonderful. On previous visits to Vietnam, my schedule never aligned, so I was thrilled to finally seize the chance to dine there this time. Each course was a masterpiece, meticulously crafted and beautifully presented. While it wasn’t inexpensive compared to typical prices in Vietnam, I believe it was a unique and memorable experience worth every penny. The servers were highly professional and impeccably trained, contributing to what was, in every way, a perfect dining experience.

name: 33 De Tham Restaurant
address: 33 De Tham Street Co Giang Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Our restaurant was founded in 1997, and offers an extensive menu of freshly cooked authentic Vietnamese food, at a reasonable price. We pride ourselves on great food, warm friendly service and a memorable dining experience. No matter if you are a solo traveler or large group, we can accommodate you with a wide variety of meat, seafood and vegetable dishes. You will never be disappointed when eating in our restaurant. Welcome!
example_reviews: Perfect quiet restaurant amidst the hustle and bustle with extremely nice staff and very delicious food. I didn't know I ordered a dish to be rolled with rice paper, but my waiter Jack taught me that well. A clear recommendation !

What a delightful surprise find this restaurant is! Fresh and delicious ingredients - the seafood! - at a ridiculously cheap price. Serving sizes are also very generous. The food more than compensates for basic surroundings. Limited English skills from the very hospitable staff counteracted by pointing at menu (in English and on website) and Google translator. Part of the adventure being the only non-locals there! After our first visit, we brought decent wine glasses and wine. No corkage, they provide an ice bucket. Perfection!

This was our revisit after our last visit in 2019 (before Covid19) and that left us great impression and so decided to revisit again. The restaurant is located in De Tham street, where many family restaurants are located. If you are a first time visitor, you maybe spoiled for choice which restaurant to visit as all look "good"! For us, without hesitation, we went to this restaurant. And surprisingly it was quite empty although it was 7.30pm in the evening. Only 2 tables were occupied (on 2nd storey, including ours). Think Covid19 has hit hard on the small and medium businesses here. We ordered the pork ribs with fried rice, BBQ clams, stir fried cauliflowers and water spinach and deep fried chicken. We didn't order the BBQ oysters and beef dishes as we just had them the night before and wanted something "light". Portions were huge, And the food were yummy, well marinated and cooked to perfection, consistently good no doubt in that! And prices were reasonable too, despite of inflation, the price did not rise or rise slightly like 5000 dong only. Our dinner at around 220,000 dong. We didn't order any drink as we had plan to visit a cafe for iced beverages as the weather was warm. And it took us 10mins via Grab to get back to Saigon Center for our drinks then!

name: Li Bai Authentic Cantonese Restaurant
address: 88 Dong Khoi Street Ben Nghe Ward, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Experience authentic Cantonese cuisine reimagined for the modern palate curated by seasoned chefs.
example_reviews: Libai Dim Sum Brunch – A Place That Feels Like Home For 17 years, my family and I have been coming to Libai Dim Sum Brunch, and it never fails to bring us warmth and joy. Every visit feels special, like stepping into a familiar place filled with delicious food and heartfelt hospitality. The dim sum here is simply perfect—char siu bao is soft and flavorful, the pastries are crisp and golden, and every bite is crafted with authentic flavors. The service is truly five-star, with staff who are always welcoming and attentive, making us feel valued and at home. Whether for a celebration or a casual brunch, Libai never disappoints. It’s more than just a restaurant; it’s a cherished tradition where love, family, and great food come together. For the best dim sum in HCM, this is the place to be!

The service of "Man" is good and today we had a nice night with family. Duck is delicious and the atmosphere is good. About $50 per person. Mega Members also enjoy a 10% discount. If you stay here, it is recommended to eat.

A wonderful dim sum buffet. Lot of choice and amazing quality. Maybe the best one in HCMC. And quite affordable during the week. And if you are lost regarding the extended menu, the team can advise you on the dim sum relevant to your taste. And by the way, the main dishes, apart from the dim sum, are quite tasty too.

name: The Deck Saigon
address: 38 Nguyen U Di Thao Dien, Ho Chi Minh City 10000 Vietnam
description:
Fusion menu,you can have full vietnamese or full western or everything in between, pages of cocktails service is velvet perfect.costs less than a cafe in Aust. We had chefs degustation ,5 star just go!  It is incredible value and a wonderful outing.
10-20 minutes from district 1 by taxi
example_reviews: Fusion menu,you can have full vietnamese or full western or everything in between, pages of cocktails service is velvet perfect.costs less than a cafe in Aust. We had chefs degustation ,5 star just go! It is incredible value and a wonderful outing. 10-20 minutes from district 1 by taxi

We dined at The Deck Saigon in Thao Dien recently and while the food was satisfying, we found the pricing and service to be disappointing. Despite being forewarned by some locals, my wife and I decided to give it a shot. The riverside seating offered a pleasant ambience, but the service left much to be desired. The main drawback here is the prices, considering that similar quality can be found with service to match. It wasn’t bad service, just inattentive and seemed to not know the menu. We are willing to give it another shot in the future to see if the experience improves. Everybody has off days.

Well worth the short trip through the suburbs, The Deck offers a stunning example of intelligent "fusion" cuisine with a perfectly orchestrated mix of local (pancakes or spring rolls ) and Western classics ( carpaccios or ceviches). The impeccable service is in tune with the flawless freshness of all the products. Everything, including the bread and amuse-gueules, was delicious. The team in the kitchen got an unanimous approval from our group of six seasoned travellers who all chose different dishes. Surrounded by magnificent orchids, we enjoyed the peaceful view of Saigon River at our feet, as the meal progressed so smoothly that we forgot for a moment that Saïgon was re-baptized nearly 50 years ago. The Paris of the East is still well alive in many places across the city and this is definitely one of them . Heartfelt congratulations.

name: Ros Yacht Club
address: 10B Ton Duc Thang Bach Dang Harbor, Ben Nghe, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Inspired by the restaurant “La Pointe Des Blagueurs”, then the café “Jokers’ Point”, built in the same place at Bach Dang harbor - a popular destination of Saigon during the country’s tumultuous 1950s, after nearly 7 decades, ROS was established and revivified in 2019. Building on the history of the area while sewing ourselves into the fabric of future gives us the opportunity to become a gatekeeper to the city – a key player in Saigon’s food and drink scene. ROS is a day-to-night, Pan-Asian restaurant with nautical vibes and a hint of Cote d’Azur style. More than just an exquisite meal with a panoramic riverfront view, dining experience at ROS meant to engage all of the senses by offering a chance to savor an innovative Pan-Asian cuisine, sip on a range of exotic cocktails, and immerse yourself in the serenity of Saigon river.
example_reviews: Have a chance to have lunch here with your family. The space is decorated modernly and luxuriously. My family ordered the set menu - Vietnamese food including 1 salad, 1 stir-fried vegetable, 3 salty dishes, 1 soup. The food is seasoned very well, the family really likes the braised fish dish - suitable for entertaining after the Tet season with braised eggs and meat. Seating space is available indoors and outside at noon, from evening outside, very suitable for romantic dates. The reception and service staff are very enthusiastic. My family and I went to the room that they helped us arrange to sit in the VIP room, and Duyen served our family wholeheartedly throughout the afternoon today.

Last Saturday morning, my girlfriend and I went to have breakfast at ROS restaurant. We accidentally found out about the restaurant because we took the Water bus in District 1. The two of us ordered shrimp noodle soup and beef pho. The noodle soup is delicious, the broth is light, rich in shrimp flavor but a bit off for me. Beef pho is served in a stone bowl so the broth stays hot, has a strong flavor of cinnamon and anise, and is quite delicious. In particular, I find the milk coffee here delicious because I like to drink strong, sweet, bitter coffee. However, because the morning is quite sunny, I think sitting indoors will be cooler and less glare. If I have a chance, I will come back again.

I came one afternoon waiting for my friends to start dinner. Since you haven't arrived yet, I decided to sit at the bar to enjoy a cocktail. Right at happy hour, it's only 89k per drink. The drinks recommended by the bartenders are very suitable to my taste, they are very enthusiastic and fun. After that, I moved to the river bank to have dinner. The food is delicious and unique, there is a slight minus point: I came on the weekend so I had to wait a bit but it's okay, the experience is still very good, the service people are very enthusiastic. Will come back in the near future.

name: Cafe de L’Opera
address: 19-23 Lam Son Square Caravelle Hotel, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description: Cafe de l’Opera is quite possibly in the best location in our city, that’s if you enjoy your views with a dash of history and a slice of modernity all rolled into one. The cafe is located on the ground floor of the hotel on the corner of historic Dong Khoi Street and Lam Son Square, just metres across from Saigon’s iconic municipal theatre, better known as the Opera House. During the day, as temperatures soar and the heavens threaten to open, Cafe de l’Opera becomes a refuge for travellers and the like, just as it always has been since the hotel doors opened in the 50s. Over high-tea, things slow down, friends catch-up, business associates meet and lovers hold hands. By night, things become lively again with tapas, cocktails and wine to the sounds of jazz and the excited chatter of guests enjoying an extended Happy Hour as the city comes alive again.
example_reviews: Opera Café, nestled within the opulent surroundings of a five-star hotel, is an ideal destination for those who appreciate a refined atmosphere and top-notch service. From the moment you step inside, you'll be captivated by the modern interior design, which seamlessly blends with classic elements to create a space that is both cozy and elegant. Hoai and Tram very cute.

During my short visit to Caravelle Saigon, I found myself captivated by the enchanting atmosphere of the Opera Caffe. The elegant décor and soothing music created a classy and sophisticated ambiance. The staff were incredibly attentive and always ready to engage in delightful discussions. Whether it was sharing travel stories or exploring cultural nuances, their genuine warmth and knowledge made the experience truly memorable. I highly recommend visiting this gem in Saigon for a tranquil and inclusive environment that fosters connections.

The cafe is located in a very prime location, it covers a central area with impressive views. Coming here to drink morning coffee, eat a bowl of pho, read a newspaper and look at the street is something worth experiencing. They also have attentive friendly service. What a perfect way to start my day!

name: Hoa Túc
address: 74/7 Hai Ba Trung, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Hoa Tuc - "Poppy" - came from the owners’ desire to explore new avenues in Vietnamese cooking. Food in Vietnam has been stuck in a stiff “mold” with every chef in the country churning out the same food over and over, year after year.
example_reviews: Very tasty and well presented dishes served very competently by Oanh. Four diners shared veggie and other dishes and all were more than satisfied. Wine was reasonably priced and we enjoyed eating outdoors in this very busy restaurant. Hard to find but worth looking for.

Been to this restaurant twice on a business trip. It's a little hard to find without special knowledge ) but eventually figured out the location. In the evening you usually need a reservation, but we were lucky and waited no more than 5 minutes . Good service, waiters give good advice on choosing and eating some special dishes. Pleasant atmosphere and interior. And of course, Asian food is delicious.

We had the pleasure of dining at Hoa Túc during our recent trip to Ho Chi Minh City, and it was a fantastic experience. We believe we first visited this restaurant 25 years ago, and it’s just as impressive today! Set in a beautifully restored colonial building that once served as an opium refinery, Hoa Túc offers a charming atmosphere and a unique culinary experience. Their concept of “Vietnamese Cuisine with a Contemporary Twist” is both creative and authentic. The Food: • Starters: • Cá thác lác chiên giòn (Crispy featherback fish cakes): Perfectly cooked and full of flavor. • Bò lá lốt (Grilled minced beef wrapped in betel leaf): A standout dish, tender and packed with aromatic spices. • Mains: • Sườn non mật ong nướng (Grilled honey pork ribs): Sweet, savory, and perfectly tender, complemented by pickled shallots and lemongrass. • Cà tím xào sốt sa tế / Cà tím nướng (Eggplant with saté sauce / Grilled eggplant): Both variations were delicious, but the saté sauce added a delightful kick. The Service: The staff were friendly, attentive, and genuinely welcoming, which enhanced our overall dining experience. Hoa Túc is a must-visit for anyone looking to explore the vibrant flavors of Vietnamese cuisine in a unique and historic setting. We can’t wait to return!

name: Mad Cow Saigon Wine & Grill
address: 148 Đ. Trần Hưng Đạo Level 30, Pullman Saigon Centre, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Mad Cow Wine & Grill, the signature restaurant of Pullman Saigon Centre, redefines the dining scene with its innovative steakhouse concept. Located on the 30th floor, this venue offers stunning rooftop views of Saigon. Our menu features the legendary Tomahawk steak and a selection of locally sourced tapas. Whether for a special occasion or an intimate dinner, Mad Cow Wine & Grill delivers unforgettable dining experiences in a vibrant, cosmopolitan setting. Discover why it’s one of Saigon’s finest dining destinations.
example_reviews: We had a great experience thanks to Nhi, who was incredibly friendly and helpful. She gave us great recommendations on what to order and clearly explained the ingredients when we had questions — very thoughtful, especially for those with dietary needs. Nhi also shared some great local tips on places to eat and visit nearby, which really added to our trip. Thank you, Nhi, for making our visit extra special!

The private dining room with a phenomenal view was the perfect spot for a big family birthday. The staff were so helpful in setting up balloons and decorations - Tien was just delightful! The food was spectacular - my fillet steak with bernaise sauce was just glorious. My only reservation was with the wine: any kind of deep full bodied red would really rattle the purse.

We were all very impressed with the breakfast, lunch and dinner, especially the seafood dinner on the 6th of April. The hotel staff, especially those in the 3rd floor dining room, maintain an excellent standard and are a credit to the hotel. Thank you all for a very enjoyable stay. Ken Butler and Carol Humble. Room 1706 [4th until the 7th of April 2025].

name: Pasteur Street Craft Beer - Cua Bac Taproom
address: 30 Cua Bac, Truc Bach, Ba Dinh,, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: A charming, cozy but lively taproom in the historic Ba Dinh district. The taproom has two floors, each with a unique atmosphere and view. The ground floor is warm and inviting with artwork posters, while the balcony is cool and relaxing, with a stunning view of the bustling streets from a nice balcony.
example_reviews: We found Pasteur Street Craft Beer – Cưa Bắc Taproom & Restaurant on our first night in Hanoi, and ended up coming back multiple times! The beer is fantastic, and the food is just as impressive. They have 16 beers on tap—10 of their signature brews and 6 rotating seasonal options—so there’s always something new to try. On our first visit, I ordered a tasting flight of six beers and loved every single one. My favorites were the Pomelo IPA and the Passion Fruit Wheat Ale, and I could easily sip the Bia Chanh Muối (a low-alcohol salted lime beer) all day long. My husband, an IPA fan, really enjoyed the Session IPA, and we both loved the Double Jasmine IPA. David was incredibly friendly and helpful, encouraging us to explore the different styles and offering great suggestions along the way. The food was awesome, too! The menu is extensive, ranging from burgers and wings (both excellent!) to creative salads and dishes featuring Vietnamese ingredients. Even better—they sell their beer in affordable 1-liter growlers, so you can bring your favorites home. If you love craft beer and great food in a relaxed setting, this spot is a must-visit! If I could give Pasteur Street Craft Beer more than 5 stars, I would!
So much life passing by, great beer...the Blonde was fab but sadly ran out. It would have been 5 stars but the nuts were crap. Sweet otatoe fries were battered but still tasty. Lovely staff.

The atmosphere of this place is great, quite bustling and modern. Some of the beer flavors I tried were delicious. We also had some spicy chicken, which was great. The staff are also very friendly. Overall, this place is bang for our buck

name: La Table du Chef Restaurant Hanoi
address: 59A Ly Thai To 3rd Floor, Press Club Building, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Set in its original colonial décor from the 1920's, La Table du Chef is a subtle journey into fine crafts, paintings, culinary and winemaking arts sourced from Vietnam and France. In the same way that Hermès workshop was once defined as a song of gestures, lovers of haute cuisine are invited to hunt for traces left by the hand's gestures embedded into many aspects of the decoration of the restaurant. This story appealed to two Michelin-star chef Alain Dutournier who had selected La Table du Chef to bring his art of haute cuisine for the first time outside of France. He adheres so intimately to the concept that Alain now personifies the soul of La Table du Chef and his hands are the expression of the highest culinary art. Together with his talented Vietnamese Resident Chef, Dao Van Son, he brings to La Table du Chef the highest standard of excellence in French cuisine, with a touch of Vietnamese taste. In this artistic atmosphere, gastronomes will have a chance to discover an exceptional menu, highlighting the best local and imported products delivered daily, such as Foie Gras from Landes, Truffle from Perigord, Fleur de sel from Guerande, Duct from South Western France, Sapa's honey, Phu Quoc's pepper... These exquisite dishes are carefully paired with the most refined selection of wines to create a memorable culinary experience in the heart of Hanoi's French quarter. The very explanatory wine menu proposes 450 labels from most famous producers of the world, a majority of French wines, as well as wonderful discoveries from Alain Dutournier, all stored in the open cellar on site.
cuisines: BBQ Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
example_reviews: Ordered the set dinner so the dishes were pre-set. The starter, soup and main were good. Not quite like the dessert because we were not a sweet person. Overall, happy with it.
I visit this place a few times and have a quite mixed opinion. Sometimes it's amazing and other times can be just average.

As soon as arrived in Hanoi bt plane my family wanted to eat western food so I reserved lunch in La Table du Chef. As I expected the presentation was excellent and the food was delicious! There was a 3 course special lunch meal for 600,000 and it was more than you can expect for this price. The staff was friendly and offered an excellent desert dish for our son athough he did not order as he was tired and dizzy from his flight. I definitely recommend this to restaurant for a treat during your stay in Hanoi. (Note that it seemed around me there were mostly formal business luncheons and I regret i didn’t wear a more formal atire)

name: Gent Steak+
address: 95 Bùi Thị Xuân, Hanoi 84 Vietnam
description: Just happened to pass by this restaurant and decided to come in for a try. My first impression was that the staffs here take care of their customers really well, they even prepared birthday dishes as gifts for the reserved tables. The food here is quite wonderful and diverse, from classics to fusion dishes while still made it easy for customers to consume, definitely recommend the Beef Rossini and the Wayu Salmon . Beverages are not as diverse but didn't make it less delicious, we ordered some cocktails for the evening and I feel like the Golden Hour and Whisdream are must try. Overall my experience here is wonderful, worth the price, if you're travelling and want to try something different traditional Vietnamese food, I highly recommend you give this place a try.
example_reviews: Just happened to pass by this restaurant and decided to come in for a try. My first impression was that the staffs here take care of their customers really well, they even prepared birthday dishes as gifts for the reserved tables. The food here is quite wonderful and diverse, from classics to fusion dishes while still made it easy for customers to consume, definitely recommend the Beef Rossini and the Wayu Salmon . Beverages are not as diverse but didn't make it less delicious, we ordered some cocktails for the evening and I feel like the Golden Hour and Whisdream are must try. Overall my experience here is wonderful, worth the price, if you're travelling and want to try something different traditional Vietnamese food, I highly recommend you give this place a try.

I visited a restaurant to book a table to celebrate my wife's birthday, and received free, quite romantic decorations. The food was delicious, my husband and I both ate all the dishes, especially my wife loved the soft Fuji Steak. The staff were welcoming, even singing happy birthday and giving away cakes, my wife was very happy. Thank you Gent.

On the evening of March 15, my family and I went to experience the facility at 95 Bui Thi Xuan. My whole family was very satisfied with the food as well as the enthusiastic and attentive service. I will definitely come back one day in the near future

name: Cafe Goethe
address: 56 Nguyen Thai Hoc Ba Dình, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: I've eaten at this restaurant twice and found the food to be quite salty. The first time I found it salty and told the waiter, the second time I ate here I still found it quite salty. Maybe it's because the chef is used to cooking with a lot of salt?
cuisines: Late Night Mexican Restaurants in Hanoi
Late Night Middle Eastern Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: I've eaten at this restaurant twice and found the food to be quite salty. The first time I found it salty and told the waiter, the second time I ate here I still found it quite salty. Maybe it's because the chef is used to cooking with a lot of salt?

Situated in the premises of the German Cultural Institute this restaurant with a warm interior design and and outside area offers a lot of traditional German dishes as well as Vietnamese food. You get locally brewed German draft beer. I was there several times the Food is ok , like in a German brewhouse. The staff is nice , it is often packed for lunchtime and sometimes very noisy as people there like to talk a lot.

Wonderful place to sit and talk. Food i had chosen was average, mashed potatoes tasted strange, also the almost green colour was strange and a red Sauerkraut i never ate in my life😂 - because it was Blaukraut. But who will know this in detail outside Germany. Espresso could be improved as wel, no crema and too much water.

name: Pho Bo, Ga
address: 32 Bat Dan Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: I have a fondness for Vietnamese specialties especially pho, this restaurant is located at 32 Bat Dan Hoan Kiem, Hanoi. There are many types of pho here for you to choose from such as chicken pho, beef noodle soup, the broth of the pho is not the best but I think it's acceptable for the price. The tables and chairs used here are all plastic and everything is not cleaned, so it is quite inconvenient for us to eat here, My friend is a clean person so he does not like the restaurant here very much. . The Restaurant should change and clean things up
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi

The Restaurant should change and clean things up

Pho Bo restaurant has delicious and appetizing food, beef is added to the food quite a lot and it is delicious, the seasoning is seasoned to my taste. The broth is quite good and the side dishes are vegetables. They have ready-made spices for everyone to choose and add themselves. However, in my opinion, this restaurant is really not very comfortable, they should change other furniture and equipment and should clean it more. Really hard to choose it to come next time.

We stopped here for lunch and enjoyed the chicken Pho which was excellent. At nearly 6 feet tall it was a struggle for me to sit on the tiny stalls - but sure was worth the effort! It was great to experience traditional food in a traditional no thrills setting. It's a must if you are in the Old Quarter and want some authentic fare. Thank you.

name: Nao Bistro
address: 26 Trần Bình Trọng, Phường Nguyễn Du, Quận Hai Bà Trưng, Hà Nội, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: NAO Bistro is a rustic hideaway, a quiet corner for anyone seeking a moment of calm. Surrounded by greenery and gentle lighting, this cozy spot invites you to slow down, sip organic coffee, enjoy Vietnamese specialty teas, and savor wholesome vegan dishes. Come, sit with us at NAO Bistro, and simply enjoy the peacefulness.
cuisines: American Restaurants for Breakfast in Hanoi

name: Nao Bistro
address: 26 Trần Bình Trọng, Phường Nguyễn Du, Quận Hai Bà Trưng, Hà Nội, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam

name: Lecker
address: Số 55 Phố Vệ Hồ, Hanoi 11206 Vietnam
description:
We selected the mixed platter so we could try a little of everything the kitchen had to offer and nothing disappointed.

The home baked bread was excellent as were the rosemary potatoes. The best sausages we have had in Hanoi.

Located on a quiet stretch of the road around west lake, there is plenty of space for motorcycles.

Well priced for the quality of the food.

We do not drink but we understand the draft German beer is excellent

name: Zaynab Restaurant
address: 12 Hang Luoc Next to Masjid Al Noor, Hang Ma, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: It is a small restaurant just beside the mosque. Easy to find because it is within the walking distance from city center. nice food and coffee. Price wise was quite on the expensive side for local cuisine but since it was hard to find halal food, the price was justified.
cuisines: French Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi

There is a small halal restaurant just beside the mosque. Its entrance is not facing the main street. Find where they park motorbikes, and you will find the Zynab restaurant entrance. There are about 4 tables. It opens at 11 am. Come early, eat and quickly make space for others. The food is good. A wide selection of Western, Arabic and local Vietnamese-style foods. The price range is between 100-250k dong.

love the foods! I was told that this restaurant close at 4 pm but when we came, the waiter said it close at 6 pm! they have a limited choice of food. the curry was delicious. the grilled chicken was nice and big portion.

name: Edo Japanese Restaurant
address: 360 Kim Ma Street 1st Floor, Hanoi Daewoo Hotel, Ba Dinh District, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: With fresh imported seafood, Teppanyaki and a selection of beautifully presented sushi and sashimi, Edo offers an authentic Japanese dining experience in a refined environment. Pair your meal with one of premium sakes. 04 VIP dining rooms are available for private event, business lunch, family or friends reunion.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: I would highly recommend visiting this restaurant if you want to experience high-quality Japanese cuisine in Hanoi. With its beautiful ambiance, professional service, and diverse menu, I would have a fantastic meal and a memorable experience here. Although the prices may be higher than some other restaurants, the quality and great service at here justify every penny I spent.

Happened to stumble upon this restaurant and I'm glad I did. The experience was incredible and the service was beyond outstanding. We had "Chef Hai," who was entertaining throughout the experience and was extremely friendly. Definitely check out this spot when you have the time, I will definitely be going back.
teppanyaki was great and entertaining! Service staffs were attentive and cool! Would love to dine back !

name: Ab Sushi
address: 01 Thuỷ Nguyên, Ecopark Tầng 2 cafe Điện Báo, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: In Japan, getting that sushi rice right is seen as the highest art. Also at AB Sushi, Sushi rice is not only meticulously processed from the talented hands of a professional chef who has a lot of experience with Japanese cuisine, but also has freshly fish freshly fish are carefully prepared and cleaned evryday . Definitely will satisfy all the most demanding diners.
cuisines: American Restaurants with Buffet in Hanoi
example_reviews: My family's favorite restaurant. Staff were all professional and made you feel like valued customers. Food was all good: fresh sashimi, grilled saba fish, sushi (many different types of sushi).. Try the cordyceps mushroom hot pot and noodles that come with beef. Even the dessert greek yogurt (with pearl) was delicious. The menu is regularly refreshed with many dishes. Definitely worth a visit. Good value for $20 dinner set per person considering the food quality, service and restaurant setting.

My partner and I were walking in the area and decided to stop at this lovely looking place for food. We were immediately charmed by the great ambiance, fresh sashimis, delicious tuna rolls, incredible service. A total gem!

OMG I had such an amazing experience that I thought this place was a godsend. After visiting our relatives in Eco Park, my family needed something to eat for dinner. Then we stumbled upon this quaint little restaurant and were pleasantly surprised. The place itself was rather small but tidy with lovely atmosphere. The service was excellent with very accommodating staff. As a sushi snob, I give this place my approval. The food was fresh, super authentic and delicious. The salmon avocado salad is to die for. The bathroom was clean too, so I undoubtedly rate this place a 10/10. So so good, thank you!

name: Restaurant - Cafe CCCP
address: 103 Lane 84 Ngoc Khanh Giang Vo, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: This is a good restaurant. I came here my boyfriend before he left to China. I went back again before I leave Vietnam. I realize I like the food we ordered so I ordered them again. I feel I knew more of him as we went to this place together. I realize what I want when I came back alone. I really love their food and how simple ingredients can create great flavors.
cuisines: Late Night Mediterranean Restaurants in Hanoi
Middle Eastern Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: This is a good restaurant. I came here my boyfriend before he left to China. I went back again before I leave Vietnam. I realize I like the food we ordered so I ordered them again. I feel I knew more of him as we went to this place together. I realize what I want when I came back alone. I really love their food and how simple ingredients can create great flavors.
Food was ok, well seasoned with big portion. For those who love Russian cuisine, this one should be the place in the list. Service, however, was a bit unfriendly and slow.

I have read many good reviews about this place. I love “black bread” and here in Hanoi, it is hard to get good ones. I went there according to “less busy hour” on one of the web-sites (as I have read it is a busy place; the service may need to improve, etc), which was at 3 pm. As on their face book page, the working hour was from 11am to 10 pm, also having name” Cafe”, I could not believe a man who was their (seems the part of owner family) told me “in Vietnam, every restaurant must have lunch break” and told me to go back. The cafes in my neighborhood are open from the early morning to night, by the way.... “Weill then, please change, as your are open from 11 am to 2pm and 5 pm to 10 pm” as a kindness. At that moment, the lady of the restaurant said “since you have come here, we offer what we have”. Thanks to her, I was able to eat very good black bread and borscht. I have asked only to have black bread as I don’t eat white wheat and I did not them to waste any. But lady insisted. Funny thing is that a person who were in the kitchen quietly told me, “please do not worry, here, nothing would get wasted. This bread will be used as bread crumbs later.” Well... those who eat any fried cutlet, please keep that in mind... For the kindness of the lady, I give 4 stars.

name: Viet Traditional Cuisine
address: 2RMX+G93, P. HÃ ng Bá»“, HÃ ng Gai, HoÃ n Kiáº¿m,, Hanoi 111100 Vietnam
description: This place is a definite must try and great for families, including young kids.  The staff are super lovely and attentive.  We ordered sweet and Sour tofu, beef rice paper rolls, prawn skewers, sweet and Sour pork, lemon grass chicken. It was seriously all very delicious.  Very home like feel and very accommodating with young children. Definitely try here and prices are good. Would get a grab or taxi depending on where you are staying in old quarter if you have young kids.
cuisines: Late Night Sushi Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: This place is a definite must try and great for families, including young kids. The staff are super lovely and attentive.
