Would get a grab or taxi depending on where you are staying in old quarter if you have young kids.
Fantastic food and service. Waitress spent time explaining menu and suggesting some traditional dishes. Great place for a lunchtime stop or evening meal. Would strongly recommend this restaurant.

First night in Hanoi and we came here as it has great reviews and is close to our hotel (Dolce Vita). The service was exceptional, the food was absolutely lovely, shrimp and rice and stir fry chicken with lemongrass and chilli and some vegetable spring rolls. We would definitely recommend this place to anyone wanting lovely food in a lovely place. Thank you ðŸ˜Š

name: Koh Yam - Thai Kitchen & Dessert
address: 34A Quang Trung Street, Hoan Kiem District Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Good food but not great. Presentation was fantastic but the customer service left a lot to be desired. Pretty much a group of young men dragging their feet (literally) around the store. Served desert over the dirty dishes.
cuisines: South American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Good food but not great. Presentation was fantastic but the customer service left a lot to be desired. Pretty much a group of young men dragging their feet (literally) around the store. Served desert over the dirty dishes.

A good place for a quick bite. There is a modern atmosphere with good service and food. The menu offers a variety of options. The food (while good and presented pretty) was not inspiring. It lacked some flavor.
The choices were good. There were plenty to choose from the menu but they hardly tasted. And for the records, I even make better Thai hotpot at home. Staff were good and polite.

name: Mon Ngon Sai Thanh Restaurant
address: 59A Huynh Thuc Khang Street, Dong Da District, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Our first night in Hanoi and we had no idea where to go for dinner, so we asked at our hotel reception what they would recommend. The ladies suggested the Mon Ngon Sai Thanh, at Da Tuong, just along the road from our hotel. We enjoyed a very tasty meal of pork and shrimps with a caramelised sauce and beef and bell peppers. Most of the staff spoke a little English, and were very happy to oblige when we had trouble understanding the menu. Our meal was delicious and we would certainly return to try more of the great food served here. Highly recommend this restaurant.
example_reviews: Our first night in Hanoi and we had no idea where to go for dinner, so we asked at our hotel reception what they would recommend. The ladies suggested the Mon Ngon Sai Thanh, at Da Tuong, just along the road from our hotel. We enjoyed a very tasty meal of pork and shrimps with a caramelised sauce and beef and bell peppers. Most of the staff spoke a little English, and were very happy to oblige when we had trouble understanding the menu. Our meal was delicious and we would certainly return to try more of the great food served here. Highly recommend this restaurant.

Food is served pretty fast. Their soup is one of the best I have tasted, it's tasty and not bland like most. The prawns are big and juicy. Noodle soup has plenty of ingredients and soup is yummy. Definitely should visit here for food, but its slightly pricier than regular restaurants.

We walked in and up 3 flights to find a table in this great restaurant that is very popular with local people...always a good sign. We had stir fried pork and chicken, some seafood fried rice with some soft drinks. Food choice and quality was great and there was a great buzz with lots of local parties enjoying their Friday lunchtime. Would happily come back here and would recommend it.

name: Pho Lam Nam Ngu
address: So 7 Nam Ngu, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: This was amazing chicken pho. We couldn’t find a seat as the place was packed so they sat us over the road. The coffee maker next door was very friendly and eager to test out his English skills and help us with some new Vietnamese words. His coffee was delicious. The pho ga had so much flavor and is very popular with the locals. I would recommend arriving early so you don’t miss out.
cuisines: Late Night Mexican Restaurants in Hanoi
Late Night Middle Eastern Restaurants in Hanoi

The coffee maker next door was very friendly and eager to test out his English skills and help us with some new Vietnamese words. His coffee was delicious. The pho ga had so much flavor and is very popular with the locals. I would recommend arriving early so you don’t miss out.

Interesting Pho Ga inside the back lane. The chicken soup (juice?!) is brilliant. The number of chickens they are using for the soup is amazing. I don't see any foreigners during my few visits. Mainly visited by locals.
While it's not hard to find pho ga in the morning, this place is open all day through dinner time. You know it's good when you see it packed with locals. And the owner is very friendly.

name: Hey Pelo - Original French Tacos
address: 45B Dao Duy Tu Ba Đình, Hanoi 111505 Vietnam
description:
I was looking for a good fast food when this restaurant appeared. I didn’t know about French Taco (even though I am French), and it’s actually something very common in France, with a french name of course.

I must say this is simply one of the best I have ever tasted, identical to what we have back home <3
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: I was looking for a good fast food when this restaurant appeared. I didn’t know about French Taco (even though I am French), and it’s actually something very common in France, with a french name of course. I must say this is simply one of the best I have ever tasted, identical to what we have back home <3

This is the second location for Hey Pelo! but the quality stays the same, excellent! You can expect delicious foods and warm and friendly staff. Price is reasonable for such good quality ingredients. Ill definitely be coming back here many times ;)

I passed by the restaurant the other day and have to come back to check it out because its smell so good from outside. I was right if I wasn’t go back then i would be regret. I must say that French Tacos is best food I had on my trip in Viet Nam so far! So yummy and fresh, nice staffs and cool restaurant!

name: Chibo
address: Number 5, 535 Kim Ma, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Chibo brand was created in Osaka in 1973. In 1992, 7-storey Okonomiyaki building in downtown Dotonbori was completed, including luxury brands Purejidento Chibo specializing in Teppanyaki, meanwhile, has created buzz Culinary large community in particular and in general all over Japan. Osaka is a land famous for culinary Kuidaore neighborhood, among them, typically cakes Okonomiyaki and grilled octopus Takoyaki . Currently, Okonomiyaki are specialties, won the love of not only the parts of the country throughout Japan but also foreign tourists. However, it is still considered unique culture, born from the soil of Osaka. Okonomiyaki plump cake, smear mayonnaise, sprinkle seaweed, fish tissue have great taste when enjoyed by Teko. For diners can enjoy delicious cuisine and attractive at Chibo, we always pay attention to the following factors: Mae aji, Naka AIJ, Ato aji, including: Mae aji impression about food and restaurants ; Naka aj: Taste cakes Okonomiyaki, Ato aji: Comment of the customer after eating and left the restaurant. We absolutely do not take any light of it at all! Okonomiyaki pancake dish was strange, not traditional Japanese cuisine, dishes nor Chinese, European dishes. It's great when everyone gathered around the grill, enjoy a hot Okonomiyaki cake, talking incessantly, creating a closed loop inside of the excitement, enthusiasm. We call it an Okonomiyaki conversation (Okonomiyaki communication) and really appreciate it.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: I can say Chibo is one of the best Japanese restaurants in Hanoi. Living in Hanoi for a few years, I visited many of the Japanese restarts that are highly recommened in many other webs and apps. Chibo has lots of different options you can choose from, noodles Okonomiyaki, and sushi. I actually order more than 5 menus to satisfy myself haha. I wanna give 5 stars or more if possible
Favorite okonomiyaki in town. Great variety of option in the menu and all tasted amazing so far. Great place for family and children.

Me and my partner been to Chibo in Osaka and had a very bad experience with their service. Now in Hanoi, we decided to give it another shot and were pleased with the experience. The staff is very polite and attentive, okonomiyaki is has a very authentic taste. We were seated in a private cabin so it was quite and cozy. A bit upset that they didn’t cook the food on our grill table, but rather brought a ready made okonomiyaki from the kitchen. But overall, we are happy. Will come back!

name: Studios - Art-Inspired Dining
address: No. 1 Nguyen Gia Thieu, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Step into the New with Modernist Dining, Innovative Mixology & Arts | Coming soon
cuisines: Late Night American Restaurants in Hanoi
Asian Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
example_reviews: My wife chose this place as a surprise to celebrate my birthday, and honestly I'm very glad she did. They have a good selection of the 2 mil vnd set menu, and the atmosphere was very cozy, although the pairing wine would have been a bit better. The best thing was after the meal, the restaurant manager found out that our bill was wrong (we didn't notice we were over charged cuz we were enjoying our time there), and she called my wife to offer a refund. That's what I called a very attentive and wholesome service. Well done guys! I'll be back for sure.

My family of 4 recently had dinner at Studios and the experience was unforgettable. Every dishes has it own color but for me, I particularly enjoyed Pie Tee and Beef Tartare. The flavors were perfectly balanced, and the ingredients were fresh and of high quality. The portion size was also perfect, leaving us comfortably full without feeling stuffed. The restaurant itself had a warm atmosphere. The music was at a pleasant volume, allowing us to easily converse. Will coming back and am really excited to see the new menu to try out

The restaurant serves an artistic style combining cuisine and handmade drinks. This is the first time I have experienced this style. The quality of the food is nothing to criticize, and the pairing drinks are also excellent. Compared to such quality, the price is very reasonable. I will definitely come back often.

name: Bún Chả Sinh Từ
address: Số 48 Trần Thái Tông, Cau Giay, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Sinh Tu Bun Cha has a clean, airy space and can accommodate up to 100 people per store with attentive and enthusiastic staff so you can enjoy joy and happiness with your family. , friends, and colleagues when coming here. In addition, the facilities in our system are always ready to welcome tour groups, groups, and groups, and especially we can provide on-site service for large and small scale events.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Cau Giay
Fusion Restaurants for Lunch in Cau Giay
Asian Restaurants for Lunch in Cau Giay
Vietnamese Restaurants for Lunch in Cau Giay
example_reviews: Delicious food that suits our taste. We will definitely bring friends to enjoy. Thank you restaurant for the delicious meal.
Spacious, airy space, delicious food, attentive and enthusiastic service staff, convenient parking
The restaurant space is clean and airy. Enthusiastic staff, delicious food is worth experiencing ……..

name: Hanoi Taco Bar - West Lake
address: 166 Tu Hoa Cong Chua Ho Tay, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: We serve Californian-style Mexican food, unique cocktails and craft beer at our quiet lakeside location.
example_reviews: Little restaurant tucked away (sort of) and on the water at West Lake - away from the centre so quieter and cheaper…. Great, simple menu (ie not overfacing with too much complex choice, but hits all the right notes) Great drinks menu (had the first pisco sour I’ve seen out here - and it was excellent!!). Staff were attentive and knowledgable and could t have been the right side of friendly and without being intrusive. Food arrived quickly and was absolutely wonderful - large portions of fresh tasty fare. Would highly recommend

What a find! Neat little place, with air on upstairs if needed. Tortilla chips while not made onsite come out warm, guac is really tasty though a touch more also and cilantro would be awesome. Tacos are excellent!

I strongly recommend their shrimp taco. The tempura fish taco was really good also. A bit strange that they ran out all wine bottles in their list (all 20 kinda types of wines) so we had to buy a bottle at the warehouse nearby. They were nice not to charge us extra fee on outside drinks as usual so we ordered tequila also and it was good. Services was great. Nice ambient to sit outside by the lake. A bit disappointed that the ceviche was not as good as few years ago when they first opened on Tu Hoa.

name: Hanoi Sandwich House
address: 8 Tay Ho Street, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: I buy sandwiches from HSH regularly. The sandwiches are consistently delicious, but unfriendly service is also quite consistent. I always feel like I'm bothering the staff when I place an order. If the servers were more friendly, I would enjoy going to HSH more.
example_reviews: I buy sandwiches from HSH regularly. The sandwiches are consistently delicious, but unfriendly service is also quite consistent. I always feel like I'm bothering the staff when I place an order. If the servers were more friendly, I would enjoy going to HSH more.

Good coffee. Very friendly service. Spotlessly clean. Salads are outstanding, I tried 3 different ones over the course of my visit. Soup delicious. Western style coffee too. Very fair pricing for a “foreigner” place. I was able to ask for a mango smoothie made with fresh unsweetened milk instead of the usual sweetened condensed milk. Thanks.

- The Food: Super duper awesome and worth the price. The sandwich is carried out in a proper manner with house chips. The menu is balanced and showcases a considerable depth in sandwich's lore. - The Drinks: Cool and do a good job paralleling the food. - Interior Design: It was cool. - Service's Attitude: It was cool. - Location: Somewhat sequestered to the corner, but has a wide space in compensation

name: Meat King
address: 4 Tran Kim Xuyen Yen Hoa, Cau Giay, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Bring smiles and happiness through perfect meal
example_reviews: 가족들과 간 하노이 한국 고기집 생각했던 것 이상 좋았습니다 위생적이고 음식은 맛있고 직원들도 훌륭했습니다 아주 즐거운 시간을 보냈습니다 Very very impressive concept from every interior design corner to the fantastic food and the best services. All is designed by a supreme talented Food Korean Artist.

Its is the first time I have ever had that experience when having dinner with my friend in Vietnam. There's no word to describe that feelings. Just go there to see beautiful interior and meet friendly actresses!!! Will come back again

name: Bottom's Up Cafe
address: 54 Luong Van Can Street, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam

name: My Van Than - Nhà hàng Thành Trung
address: 22 Hang Phen St Old Quarter, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description:
If you love dumplings and soup, this is your place.
I was looking for a Vietnamese Dumpling Soup and so glad I came across this little gem. Quick service, great prices and yummy food! Loved the big variety of dumplings and the broth was ace.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: If you love dumplings and soup, this is your place. I was looking for a Vietnamese Dumpling Soup and so glad I came across this little gem. Quick service, great prices and yummy food! Loved the big variety of dumplings and the broth was ace.

We popped in here for a quick lunch. First of all, it is super cheap and great value. Only 5 dishes on the menu - super quick service, fresh food, tasty and also seems popular with the locals. Suited us perfect for a quick lunch.

After walking for a long time in the Old Quarter, my friend and I were hungry by 9pm. We had lots of Pho Bo and Bun Cha in the last few days, and we wanted some alternatives. This stall offers very good egg noodles (Wonton noodles) and also the Dry Phnom Peng Noodles were fantastic! We will certainly return to this stall again!

name: SunKat's
address: 172 Yen Phu street, Tay Ho district 150m down along Yen Phu street from Thang Loi hotel inter section., Hanoi Vietnam
description:
We had an amazing lunch at SunKat's!  
We loved the various options available to build our own burger.  
The fries were fantastic, both garlic and rosemary, as well as the animal fries.
We loved the paper burger holders that are provided on the tables allowing you to eat your burger as tidily as can be possible.
example_reviews: We had an amazing lunch at SunKat's! We loved the various options available to build our own burger. The fries were fantastic, both garlic and rosemary, as well as the animal fries. We loved the paper burger holders that are provided on the tables allowing you to eat your burger as tidily as can be possible.

My partner and I came here for dinner for an escape from noodles every day and we LOVED it. It's like a Vietnamese version of Five Guys or ShakeShack and building our own burgers was great and also cheap. Theres loads of options of what to put inside your burger/sauces/patty/bun as well. Great service and cute little location too. Also, if you visit here, get the rosemary and garlic fries!!! Would recommend for sure!

Service was good. Food was delicious. Burgers can be customized, or picked from a list of Signature selections. Vegetarians and vegans will have options. A meal for two with a shared desert (we couldnâ€™t fit more into our tummies) and 2 non-alcoholic beverages set us back around VND 450K. Go check it out if you like your burgers and fries.

name: Baek Jeong Korean BBQ Restaurant
address: N05, Lot TT3, My Dinh Residence, Nam Từ Liêm, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: We were able to have a special family dinner in a room that could fit 12 people on the second floor in a cozy and comfortable atmosphere. It was even better that the lively and friendly servers provided attentive service. Satisfied with the taste, atmosphere, and service!
cuisines: Healthy Restaurants in Nam Từ Liêm
Fast Food Restaurants in Nam Từ Liêm
Street Food Restaurants in Nam Từ Liêm
Korean Restaurants in Nam Từ Liêm
BBQ Restaurants for Lunch in Nam Từ Liêm
example_reviews: We were able to have a special family dinner in a room that could fit 12 people on the second floor in a cozy and comfortable atmosphere. It was even better that the lively and friendly servers provided attentive service. Satisfied with the taste, atmosphere, and service!
I really loved this restaurant! Not many English speakers or menu but we got by as the staff were so friendly !
The food and service here is exceptional. Highly recommend this restaurant. The price is moderate but the quality of meat here is wonderful.

name: El Loco Tapasbar
address: 65/52 To Ngoc Van Front of the lake, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Tapasbar, spanish food.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: The bar is well placed in a quiet neighborhood. Still suffering the aftermath of the pandemic, need some refurbishment to offer such an Spaniard atmosphere, as the name suggests. Not much customers when we dropped by, Saturday noon. Dishes are small but tasty and well seasoned, bread is outstanding and his owner Rodrigo is a nice guy and used to be around and keeping an eye on everything.

This made a nice change from local cuisine and was a treat. We ordered way too much food but is was all delicious, if ordering a meat platter this comes with bread already so best not to order more bread on the side as you end up with like a loaf, same with the alioli dip, pretty much everything came with this so ordering a side was unnecessary. The Spanish omelette was tasty, cheeae empnadias and mushroom croqueetes were good too. All of the food came out together and well presented, we just know to order less next time! The staff were super friendly and welcoming here also

Great value for money and tasty food. Generous portions. Potatoes a bit too oily. Service staff look depressed, no smile and walking around very sad...owners must be in kitchen but service team need to cheer up.

name: 21gam of Hanoi
address: 26 Trương Hán Siêu, Hoàn Kiếm, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Located on Truong Han Sieu street, which is neither long nor short, noisy during the day and quiet at night, the old house with red paint of 21GAM is like a different world as soon as you step in. Just behind a door, there is a space filled with music, the sound of a lively crowd, and the clinking of glasses from the bartenders who are busy mixing drinks behind the bar… All these will captivate you, occupy all your senses, and make you forget about life outside. That explains why 21GAM is one of the most popular nightlife spots for Hanoians, and tourists seem to also agree with that. Hey, if you have 8 hours of work in the office, a busy day with meetings and unfinished deadlines, a little hectic life, then let 21GAM soothe your soul
example_reviews: I like the old fashioned. My wife got too many of the signature cocktails and she ran away with another man. I am currently trying to sway her back by brooding at the bar. No amount of cologne has helped.

Classy atmosphere but with great energy. Went with my friends and we had such a fun night. If you are looking for an elegant and unique space (favorite design choice: the giant amber egg hanging overhead) and like grooving along to music from the DJ, it’s a must-try. The space feels cozy and lively. Enjoyable for many age groups.

I went there with my best friends and had a great time. I love the ambience, decoration was impressive. The staffs were very nice and supportive. They managed to give us 2 seat without prior reservation. Overall a very nice experience!

name: The Taj - Indian Restaurant & Bar
address: 71 Hang Buom, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Welcome to "The Taj" a culinary oasis in the heart of Hanoi, where the essence of India meets the energy of the Vietnamese capital. Named after the iconic Taj Mahal, our restaurant offers a modern twist on traditional Indian cuisine. At The Taj, experience a harmonious blend of authentic flavors and contemporary flair.Our menu showcases culinary masterpieces that transport you through the diverse landscapes of India. Whether you are a connoisseur or a newcomer to Indian cuisine, The Taj promises a delightful journey for your taste buds. Join us at The Taj for an unforgettable dining experience, where the spirit of India converges with the heart of Vietnam. Welcome to a place where every dish is a celebration of flavor and tradition.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Pizza for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
Seafood Restaurants for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: Great little find when we were out walking last night. The food was fresh and tasty for a great price. Service was excellent. We ordered a rice each and nan to share which was a mistake as one portion of rice was big enough for two of us and the nans were individual sized. We would recommend the chicken tikka masala. Will definitely go back before we go home.

Wow, our meal here was absolutely delicious!! We ate the best butter chicken and garlic naan we have ever had!!! Rich and creamy sauce, tender fresh chicken and authentic spices and flavour!!! The rice was perfect and fluffy and the garlic naan was out of this world - cooked perfectly with the freshest garlic embedded in the bread and the dipping sauces took it all to the next level! The restaurant is just around the corner from Hanoi Beer St in the old quarter so a fantastic, vibrant area to wander through. The atmosphere inside and out was great! You can choose to sit outside or inside, ground floor or upstairs where the aircon was perfectly cool! A very high quality yet affordable meal (and drinks) with great service from lovely Indian and Vietnamese staff! If you feel like a change from Vietnamese food on your trip, this is a must try!!!

YOU can’t Go Wrong with The Taj Indian and Vegetarian Restaurant. We started with the samosas which were flaky and not greasy. Nans were like pastry with a good selection of fillings. The vegetable masala was spicy deliciousness, and the spinach was smooth and flavorful. Mahdab, the owner was delightfully friendly and attentive. Priced and portioned for families. I highly recommend a visit at least once during your stay in the Old Quarter, Hanoi. It’s also on a street that is bustling with all sorts of candies, nuts and bottled booze! ENJOY ☺️

name: Cinebar Cocktail & Wine
address: 41 Hang Bai, Hoan Kiem 2nd Floor, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Every corner in has a way to speak to all movie and music lovers out there. The most special thing in Cinerbar is the bar which imitates ticket-selling counters in movie theatres, and a screen showing teasers. When you look around, the bar surrounds you with a vintage atmosphere with its warm dark colours, classic movie posters, and vinyl records. One couldn’t help but feel a little nostalgic. You can pick a seat at the “ticket-selling” bar, or at the rows of red sofas to enjoy your drinks of choice in this cinema-inspired space.
cuisines: American Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
Asian Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
example_reviews: Cinebar is one of the top cooktails in Hanoi, located near by Hoan Kiem lake. Excellent live music every friday. Good spot fora date or chilling with friends
Great cocktail bar. The bartenders take great care making the drinks and also checked to make sure we were happy with them after we’d had a few minutes to taste them. Planning to go back again soon!

Really nice bar tucked away up a stairs. You could so easily walk by it and not even know it’s there! The bartenders were very attentive and we had a lovely chat, giving us great recommendations for our travels. I tried the 500 days of summer cocktail, I would really recommend it.

name: Khang Japanese Restaurant
address: 322 Ba Trieu Street, Le Dai Hanh Ward, Hai Ba Trung Dist, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Would not recommend. Two of us spent 1.7 mill but you could have spent 1/2 or 2/3 the money somewhere else with much more satisfaction. Sashimi wasnâ€™t fresh. Portion was small and expensive.
cuisines: Seafood Restaurants for Breakfast in Hanoi
South American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Would not recommend. Two of us spent 1.7 mill but you could have spent 1/2 or 2/3 the money somewhere else with much more satisfaction. Sashimi wasnâ€™t fresh. Portion was small and expensive.
This restaurant looks small outside but amazing inside. the food is really delicious and safe. I love eating Khang restaurant.

khang is one of my favourite Japanese restaurant in town. could'nt remember when was my first time there back in early 90s of the last centuryðŸ˜€. You would find the Japanese family style restaurant. menu is extensive and I guess there are not few chinese or vietnamese mixed disks. the modest lunch sets for single customers are very popular. the foods are generally good. sashimis are quite fresh, mostly from local fish. the prices are on the above average side. the shop looks small outside but quite big inside and very busy at lunch time. better book your table in advance. note that all shoes off entering the shop. Services are average.

name: Hoa Sua Training Restaurant
address: No 2A, Hang Chuoi Alley Pham Dinh Ho, Hai Ba Trung, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Hoa Sua is an organization that is designed to give disadvantaged youth life and vocational training skills. Hoa Sua's Training Resturaunt gives it's students a place to learn and deliver an excellent customer dining experience. Our students serve great Vietnamese and French cuisine in an elegant setting.
cuisines: Eastern European Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: We loved the Idea of this Cafe. It is for people with mental health problems.. The all learn English and work to serve people like us that stop and visit. The sevice was good and the cocktails and food were really good.

What a cool place! This place trains young Vietnamese kids and prepares them for a career in the restaurant industry. The kids were really engaged and excited. The food was really tasty and well-presented. I really enjoyed my lemongrass chicken and banana flower salad.

Wonderful cooking class at Hao Sua, a vocational school designed to teach teens from poor villages a trade (sewing, embroidery, French cooking, Vietnamese cooking, baking, table service) then places them in local restaurants and hotels post-graduation. Started the day at the local market. Fresh vegetables, spices and meat. Seeing chickens in a cage was bothersome for my 13 year old son and my husband made sure he didn’t see chickens being killed. In retrospect, we should have asked our guide to avoid the meat section of the market although can’t get a more authentic experience. The ingredients for our food had already been bought but we picked up some mangosteen and vegetables. After a quick tour of the school, we made our way to the kitchen. Spent the morning making a delicious papaya salad, fresh spring rolls (rolling them perfectly is definitely an art) and grilled chicken. The chef guided us through the prep and cooking process. After we finished, we sat down at a beautifully set table to our feast. One of the best meals we had on our trip thanks to a great chef. Highly recommend this class as family fun and a great way to learn about Vietnamese food.

name: Paolo and chi Italian restaurant
address: 284 Nghi Tam Street Yen Phu Ward, Tay Ho district, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Paolo and Chi is located at 284 Nghi tam, a main street of Yen Phu, Tay Ho. We are a family owned operated business and offer a dine in, take out and delivery all day long to late night. We have always given the people excellent "home cooked" food as well as fast delivery and friendly customer service, all at a palatable price. Our pizza, pasta, salad and meat are prepared fresh daily in our kitchen and that is our guarantee
cuisines: Late Night Mexican Restaurants in Hanoi
Late Night Middle Eastern Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: We ordered from this place a number of times while we were in lock-down for COVID. The food was so good that I really wanted to visit and eat in the restaurant itself. The ambiance isn't much. The dining room is quite small and because it's all concrete, the loud party next to us was quite annoying. And, we saw some of the kitchen staff smoking in the kitchen. Perhaps that's OK in Vietnam but for a westerner, it's a bit of a turn-off. Either way, the food was good. Yes, most of my friends prefer Pizza Belga but I find Belga to be overpriced and "under-cheesed" if that's a word. We actually really enjoyed everything we got from Paolo and I hope to return soon.
We had a late dinner cause we couldn't find anything else but we were surprised by the prices,food and staff, everything was good,the restaurant is clean,wasn't too crowded when we got there
This place is quite expensive, so because of that we probably wouldn't order with them again. But the food was ok, nothing special, just average.

name: Ramen Iroha
address: 25 Duong Thanh Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description:
Was really craving a good ramen and wanted to try a new spot in Hanoi and after googling best Ramen in Hanoi this spot popped up.

Trust me you won't be disappointed. The ramen was AMAZING, and the BEST part was the pork was roasted instead of boiled.

More importantly, the service was INCREDIBLE. Our waitress was extremely polite, friendly and attentive, one of the best waitresses I've ever seen.

Definitely try out this spot when you have the chance.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Was really craving a good ramen and wanted to try a new spot in Hanoi and after googling best Ramen in Hanoi this spot popped up. Trust me you won't be disappointed. The ramen was AMAZING, and the BEST part was the pork was roasted instead of boiled. More importantly, the service was INCREDIBLE. Our waitress was extremely polite, friendly and attentive, one of the best waitresses I've ever seen. Definitely try out this spot when you have the chance.

we eventually got to try Iroha ramen after they opened again after being closed over the recent Tet new year celebrations and it was definitely worth the wait. One of my favourite restaurant dishes is Ramen and having tasted ramen in 5 of the 7 continents I certainly rate Iroha up there with some of the best outside of Japan. The broth was both flavoursome and not too salty, with a nice selection of ingredients. This is a highly recommended ramen restaurant.

Was looking for a quality ramen 🍜 place in Hanoi and stumbled upon Iroha after looking it up. Arrived right after they re-opened for the dinner service, so had the place entirely to myself. The staff were second to none and they were extremely attentive and courteous. Food-wise, I went for the Miso Ramen, which was as good a bowl I could have hoped for. Noodles were spot-on, broth was great, the pork slices were tender and flavorful, and the egg yolk was just as it should be with a gorgeous consistency. Price was a bit high by local standards, but well-worth it if you’re craving the good stuff like it is back in Japan. As someone who lives in this city, I’ll definitely come back for more.

name: Nam Phuong
address: 19 Pho Phan Chu Trinh French Quarter, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Recommended by hotel concierge upon checking in. 10 mins walk form Meliá Hanoi and find this traditional Vietnamese food. Is is definitely an upper class Vietnamese food for sure but the quality is guaranteed! Love the pomelo salad as I always look forward it. The fried squid looks like chrysanthemum flower rather bland inside but with the special prepared dipping sauce , pretty good. The grilled chicken thigh with fried rice cake! Rather bland for the chicken meat for sure and need more marination ! The rice cake is great and brought me back to my nostalgia time that my grandma prepared for us ! The decor is very traditional Vietnamese setting and service is great..!
cuisines: Late Night Thai Restaurants in Hanoi
Late Night American Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: Recommended by hotel concierge upon checking in. 10 mins walk form Meliá Hanoi and find this traditional Vietnamese food. Is is definitely an upper class Vietnamese food for sure but the quality is guaranteed! Love the pomelo salad as I always look forward it. The fried squid looks like chrysanthemum flower rather bland inside but with the special prepared dipping sauce , pretty good. The grilled chicken thigh with fried rice cake! Rather bland for the chicken meat for sure and need more marination ! The rice cake is great and brought me back to my nostalgia time that my grandma prepared for us ! The decor is very traditional Vietnamese setting and service is great..!

Although this place was recommended by our tour guide and has a lot of accreditation- I personally was very disappointed with the food. It was not tasty and also ratio of value for money did not exist. They have portraits of many dignitaries who are in this place but perhaps it was a good restaurant in the past. The only highlight for me was life music performance
very clean and warm welcomed french and local vietnamese marriage food not too spicy also not too much strong herbs everybody can enjoy at this restaurant for food and atmosphere

name: AHA Cafe
address: Hanoi Vietnam
description: VIetnamese Street Style Coffee Shop
cuisines: Mexican Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
Middle Eastern Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
Pizza with Private Dining in Hanoi
example_reviews: We happened to walk by this place and thought we saw a sign for Che Thai (Thai fruit dessert) so we came in. Turned out they didn’t have it. But we’re glad we sat down because the coffee is sooo good! Dark and strong and sweet, what real Viet coffee should taste like. I think this is more of a local spot, but if you want strong Viet coffee this is one of the spots to check out (they don’t have egg coffee though, but quite a selection of drinks and dessert drinks. And it’s at a busy intersection so you can sit and enjoy the traffic and people watching.
Got to the nearest AHA cafe to get am fix and was not disappointed. The straight black without any sweetening energised me immediately!

Mango smoothie was delicious, but the service forces rather bored. Wie sat in the 1. floor and have watched the bustle on the road junction. Unfortunately, the waiter was told that he was quite unmotivated. But our mango smoothie was very delicious

name: Ashima Giang Van Minh
address: 60 Giang Van Minh Ba Dinh, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: The service was great and the staff were super friendly. Tons of mushrooms to try! Just a heads-up: the beef wasn’t super fresh and the hotpot felt a bit oily and salty.
example_reviews: The service was great and the staff were super friendly. Tons of mushrooms to try! Just a heads-up: the beef wasn’t super fresh and the hotpot felt a bit oily and salty.

My father and I had dinner at Ashima tonight (16th Jan 2019) and I can honestly say this was a breath taking experience. We are foodies and know are food. The quality of the fresh ingredients (morilles and cepes mushrooms, Japanese wagyu beef etc) was just outstanding. We were brought a whole plate of fresh morilles which are extremely expensive. We were amazed by the profusion of high quality ingredients specially in such quantities for each customer. The resulting hotpot was... Well... The best I have ever had. It was not cheap but certainly worth more than we were charged. Highly recommended
The dishes that this restaurant have were very tasty and I really enjoyed eating the mushroom and the noodles.

name: Banh Mi Ba Dan
address: 32 Lo Su, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: What a great find! Cute and clean little white and blue bahn I’m restaurant serving perfect bahn mi and other delicious goodies - their tofu and avocado salad topped with freshly fried shallots with a tangy dressing was sublime! Owner was very accommodating and also served our kuds plain bahn mi with cheese (which wasn’t on the menu and lots of other placed refuse to do for some reason). We loved this place and went back 4 times in 3 days!!
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: What a great find! Cute and clean little white and blue bahn I’m restaurant serving perfect bahn mi and other delicious goodies - their tofu and avocado salad topped with freshly fried shallots with a tangy dressing was sublime! Owner was very accommodating and also served our kuds plain bahn mi with cheese (which wasn’t on the menu and lots of other placed refuse to do for some reason). We loved this place and went back 4 times in 3 days!!
Absolutely fantastic food. The restaurant is beautiful. Highly recommend. Really good, fresh bread, delicious hotpots and Banhmi
Delish. They warm it up and it goes all crispy. Better than other places I’ve had Banh Mi. You would never think to go in here as no tourists. But it’s great! A steady stream of locals come here.

name: Tony Vu's Brewing 2 - Local Craft Beer
address: 79 P. Đường Thành, Hàng Bông, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Vietnam, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Great street beer experience- not sure that this isn’t the definition of high tempo atmosphere in Hanoi. Lohe looked after us royally with a great recommendation on street beer and a chilled bar. Come on down!
cuisines: European Restaurants with Buffet in Hanoi
French Restaurants for Breakfast in Hanoi
German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Great street beer experience- not sure that this isn’t the definition of high tempo atmosphere in Hanoi. Lohe looked after us royally with a great recommendation on street beer and a chilled bar. Come on down!

Craft beer in Vietnam… absolutely wild how far the industry has come. This is an excellent little spot, bringing a handful of beer varieties - from hazy hops to stouts - on par with what you’d expect in the UK or US. You’d be mistaken that the Hop Bullet IPA is, in fact, not Sierra Nevada’s Torpedo. Solid stuff - highly recommend if you enjoy your beer!
Best service, beer is nice and cold, beautiful view, friendly service, in the old town of Hanoi- capital of Vietnam, see u again tomorrow

name: Tatsuya Japanese Restaurant
address: Tầng 1, Tòa L1 Le Grand Jardin, Kđt Sài Đồng, Phường Phúc Đồng, Long Biên, Hanoi 11800 Vietnam

name: Loving Hut Hoa Dang
address: 33A Ba Trieu. Ward Hang Bai, Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Delicious food and good vibes
cuisines: Late Night Asian Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: It's the people that count, and here I was blessed to be provided wonderful food by the warmest and most hospitable people you could have. Thank you a thousand times over
loving hut is simple service but the foodis great, the veg seemed to be really fresh to us and we enjoyed the small spice
what a great dining experience! More like fine dining - staff were so polite and lovely. We found this through the happy cow app and so pleased we did. Wonderful food :) great place to eat.

name: Nhà Hàng Sen Vàng - Bắc Từ Liêm
address: BT90, TT4 Khu Đô Thị Thành Phố Giao Lưu Đường Số 11, Hanoi 11917 Vietnam
description:
Nơi hội tụ của mọi hương vị. Từ món ăn cao cấp đến mâm cơm gia đình giá ưu đãi, Sen Vàng đáp ứng mọi nhu cầu của bạn. Phòng riêng sang trọng, nơi tổ chức sự kiện chuyên nghiệp, không gian rộng rãi phục vụ được nhiều quý khách hàng.
HOTLINE: 0994.89.89.89
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi

name: Tomato Seafood
address: 33 Nguyen Thi Dinh Street Trung Hoa, Cau Giay District, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Fresh seafood everyday, in a clean and modern restaurant with reasonable price and friendly staffs. This seafood restaurant brand has 2 locations in town: 82 Le Van Huu, Hoan Kiem & 33 Nguyen Thi Dinh, Cau Giay.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Delicious food (grilled oysters with cheese, garlic butter snails, jellyfish salad, gourd crab hotpot), enthusiastic service. Yummy. This is the 5th time eating at this restaurant.
The seafood at this place is really nice, especially the fried seafood noodle and egged squid. It's a shame I was the only one enjoying it. I definitely plan to come back with a group next time.

My husband and I had a fabulous seafood dinner at this restaurant during our visit to Hanoi last week. The staff did not speak much English but they were friendly and helpful. We had 2 seafood dishes, the crab in sour sauce and mantis shrimp with garlic and butter and both dishes were excellent. Sauteed morning glory and seafood with glass noodle were both also very tasty. The best part was that they had a promotion for week night dining which made the meal very reasonable (even our tour guide thought so). This restaurant is located a bit away from the main tourist area in the old quarter but definitely worth the trip to get there.

name: Tannin Wine Bar
address: 46 Hang Vai, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: A few things to know about Tannin Wine Bar - A cozy, international, specialized wine bar in the heart of Hanoi - Over 500 wines listed and in stock - Old World & New World fully represented to suit all budgets - Curated list of 10 wines by the glass, from entry level to premium - try something new! Changes every 2 weeks - A nice range of premium spirits, digestifs & aperitifs - Relaxed, cozy atmosphere with good music and professional but friendly service - Delicious dishes, charcuterie, cheese boards and our great breads to go with your wines - Main bar, also with back room for groups, and our mezzanine wine cellar overlooking the bar - Tannin was opened by a team of wine professionals and long-term Hanoi residents from France, Vietnam, and the UK - a place built as somewhere we wanted to spend time in and we hope that you enjoy as well! - Convenient central location on a quiet, classic Hanoi street on the edge of the Old Quarter with plenty of parking.
cuisines: Pizza with Private Dining in Hanoi
Seafood Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
example_reviews: Lovely little place in Hanoi - a place with a sophisticated European feel in the hustle & bustle of Hanoi Old Town. We visited a couple of times, once on a Wednesday which is Jazz night - beautiful soft jazz, not too loud, gave the place a lovely atmosphere. Would recommend if in Hanoi Old town - good wines, & though not extensive, the menu has a good selection - can certainly recommend the cheese board. Hope it continues to thrive!

Nice wine bar with a very good selection of wines, delicious cheese and very fresh, crispy baguettes. The music is tailored to European tastes and fits perfectly in this bar. Everything is very pleasant and atmospheric. The bubbling sound with which mucus is drawn up from the nose into the throat is certainly not one of the more pleasant acoustic experiences. Unfortunately, the young bartender doesn't know this and is constantly busy with his slime, which is especially disgusting when you are eating. Unfortunately, the staff is not very friendly to the guests. We were here practically every evening during our stay in Hanoi and the behavior hasn't changed. It's a shame, we would expect that at this price level and in a bar that is obviously aimed at European customers.

This is a proper wine bar in Hanoi. A range of red and white wines by the glass and an extensive wine by the bottle list. Happy hour 4pm to 7 pm with 30% reduction was sadly missed by us but fir top quality wines this is still a great venue The cheese plate was substantial and will be easily sufficient for two Don’t miss Ajax Wednesday. Soft mellow jazz beautifully song and played by two local musicians. Overall this is a place to plan into any trip to Hanoi

name: Bep lang Duong Lam
address: So 8, xom Dinh, lang Mong Phu, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Bep lang Duong Lam - The restaurant serves fresh food with traditional dishes of the old village in Vietnam
cuisines: Thai Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
Vietnamese Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
American Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi

name: Som Tum Thai
address: 37 Trần Hưng Đạo, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description:
This is a great spot for some pretty amazing Thai food.  It's nicely presented, and there's a few stories to there's a bit of room (although it seems to be popular with office lunches so it can be a bit raucous).  

The food was amazing.  We over ordered with grilled chicken and fishcakes, followed by half a baked fish and some very good Thai red curry.  It was all cooked perfectly.

Service is great, Tiger beer was cold and the flavours authentic.  Well worth a look if you're in the area.
cuisines: American Restaurants with Buffet in Hanoi
example_reviews: This is a great spot for some pretty amazing Thai food. It's nicely presented, and there's a few stories to there's a bit of room (although it seems to be popular with office lunches so it can be a bit raucous). The food was amazing. We over ordered with grilled chicken and fishcakes, followed by half a baked fish and some very good Thai red curry. It was all cooked perfectly. Service is great, Tiger beer was cold and the flavours authentic. Well worth a look if you're in the area.
Lovely place to enjog with family and frineds to try some Thai food, Will bring my friends here the next time, lovely food in the winter
Everything is good. We had wonderful meals here and will go again. We had nice lunch with the couple in an aesthetic restuarant

name: Nhà hàng Cafe Thủy Tạ
address: 1 Lê Thái Tổ, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Excellent location, overlooking Hiam Kiem Lakr and the Ngoc So Temple. I loved it so much i went twice. The service is prompt as the place is really busy.  First visit I had the fresh spring rolls then the banana prawns and stir fried pork salad with peanuts noodles bamboo shoots on my second visit.
cuisines: Thai Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
Vietnamese Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Excellent location, overlooking Hiam Kiem Lakr and the Ngoc So Temple. I loved it so much i went twice. The service is prompt as the place is really busy. First visit I had the fresh spring rolls then the banana prawns and stir fried pork salad with peanuts noodles bamboo shoots on my second visit.

My recent visit to Thuy Ta Cafe on the banks of Hoan Kiem Lake in Hanoi was a mixed experience. The picturesque lakeside setting and view of Hoan Kiem Lake were certainly major draws for this property. The quality of drinks and food was acceptable, but not exceptional. However, the main negative was the price. I found that the prices were a little too high compared to the quality of the products offered. It's important to note that prices shown on the card do not include taxes and service fees, which may result in a final bill that is higher than expected. The service at Thuy Ta cafe was OK, but not particularly attentive. I would have appreciated an additional touch of friendliness to make the experience more pleasant. Despite these drawbacks, the lakeside location was lovely, and the place was conducive to relaxation. It's a nice place to have a coffee or a snack while enjoying the beautiful view of the lake.
Beside good service and tasty vietnamese food, this restaurant is “must visit” place in Hanoi due to its location! I love the view toward Hoan Kiem Lake! Amazing

name: Westlake Station
address: 24 To Ngoc Van Street, Hanoi Vietnam
description: WLS is a new Bar & Bistrot located in To Ngoc Van. WLS offers you a bistronomy's experience with daily specials, lunch and night's Bistrot menu. WLS is your new place to enjoy craft beers, craft food & great selection of wines around the pool table or simply in our garden. Enjoy our fresh pizza cooking in real wood oven pizza... If you like the typical Bistrot you will appreciate the new talent and the delicate touch of our French Chef Morgane and the typical design of the different Bistrot and Estaminet from France. Find also a great selections for the veggie fans on menu or in daily specials... Come to visit us shortly, and enjoy WestLake Station day and night.
cuisines: Asian Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
BBQ Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
example_reviews: This is a decent spot for food and drinks. They have seating in the patio and also Air-Conditioned seating upstairs if you want to escape the Hanoi summer. The The food was good, my suggestion is to stick to the salads, appetizers and pizza. The service is very good, staff there were very friendly. Check it out.
Interesting and fun place.. A pool table for added fun. There’s plenty of space to sit outside surrounded with greenery. We had pizza & fries which were tasty.

This place was a great find whilst here in Hanoi with my work for 6 weeks. Thursday nights they do mussels in a fantastic tomato and garlic baste - very tasty. They do wood fired pizzas and various other foods, which are delicious. Not local Viet food, but not over priced either. Very friendly team there and always happy to help. We went on Thursday night 19/12 for mussels. Last night for pizza and beers. We will be back tonight again.

name: OAK Wine Boutique
address: 6 Trang Thi, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: This little wine bar is a must do in old Hanoi. Nestled above the street, walking distance from Hoan Kiem lake, they have an extensive, yet reasonably priced selection of wines and some simple, but fabulous dishes. We sat out on the balcony and watched the city drift past! The staff were incredibly friendly, and you would be hard pressed to have better warm fresh bread and butter in all on Vietnam (or France for that matter)! Definitely recommend giving this place a try!
cuisines: Late Night Thai Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: This little wine bar is a must do in old Hanoi. Nestled above the street, walking distance from Hoan Kiem lake, they have an extensive, yet reasonably priced selection of wines and some simple, but fabulous dishes. We sat out on the balcony and watched the city drift past! The staff were incredibly friendly, and you would be hard pressed to have better warm fresh bread and butter in all on Vietnam (or France for that matter)! Definitely recommend giving this place a try!

We came here (almost) by accident as the tour bus stopped outside and it looked so nice we said we must come back - and did. Even though we interrupted Thao and Minh’s break they made us so welcome - and served us a number of delicious wines in a stunning environment. Recommended.

We went to the Oak Wine Boutique yesterday. Love that the entrance is down an alley and up some stairs. We sat on the balcony above the fray and enjoyed a glass of white wine while the city bustled below. Some friends joined us for dinner- lamb chops, steak and noodles shared between us - and of course more wine. The service was great, very friendly and just close enough. Also the music was so nice, all of us remarked on it - jazz, but did not compete with the conversation. ☺️

name: L'Mo Dinning
address: 34 Nguyen Thi Dinh, Trung Hoa, Cau Giay, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: L'Mo impresses by its own charming architecture design, outstanding quality menu which every single dish is cooked to perfection, creative cocktails from experienced mixologists.... L'Mo delivers to you a sense of intimacy which makes you feel like you are set in your "second living room". The right place to welcome your guests, friends or family in the cozy European environment.
example_reviews: Recommand this new restaurant in new Hanoi area with excellent manager director Ms Uyen and top chef M.Thu!! Nice 5 floors restaurant with lift and private room. Nice Tournedos Rossini , will come back next Hanoi trip!! Bravo !

name: Family Restaurant
address: 39 Hang Hanh Street, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: FAMILY RESTAURANT - Welcome to Family Restaurant in Hanoi. We are a family restaurant with an experience team and friendly family service. Family Restaurant is also offered a beautiful look and nice view from the terrace with 3 floors & spacious balcony facing to Hang Hanh Street, that made our customers more happy to enjoy the view and our delicious food. We are expert in Vietnamese Food with a best chefs for Vietnamese Cuisine, so we ensure that our restaurant will bring you a relax and happy time to enjoy delicious dishes with local price. Family Restaurant promise to bring guests a best experience of local food and local price. As well as, we also offer a good taste of European, Asian, Australian... to make sure that tourists can taste their delicious food during your travel in Vietnam.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: This restaurant was very close to our hotel and was a perfect location for a light evening meal prior to a massage. All plates were well presented and were great examples of popular local dishes. Beers and wines are also available and all at very reasonable prices.

and definitely the best in Hanoi. Charming local family owned restaurant, master chef selects best local ingredients and you can taste it. has an upstairs patio where you can enjoy a Hanoi beer and watch the disarray of scooters and shoppers below
Very good place, ideal for solo travellers looking for good meal, local flavor, while on the way. No frills, just good food nice and peaceful place,

name: SentÃ© - The Flavour Of Lotus - The Metro
address: 12 Liá»…u Giai, Hanoi 11106 Vietnam
description: Went here with colleagues. The food was great, absolutely no complaints. The reason for the 4 stars instead of 5, is mainly due to cost of the dishes which is quite pricey for the portions you get. The service is great and the staff that work there are very polite.
cuisines: Asian Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
BBQ Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
example_reviews: Went here with colleagues. The food was great, absolutely no complaints. The reason for the 4 stars instead of 5, is mainly due to cost of the dishes which is quite pricey for the portions you get. The service is great and the staff that work there are very polite.

This is my first time going to Hanoi, I know SentÃ© for a long time and have had the opportunity to experience it. It's really worth the waitii This time I ate at Lieu Giai, the food is super strange and delicious, I like it the most and the staff are very polite. polite and enthusiastic. Having returned to SG, I miss SentÃ© food so much ðŸ¥º

Came here for a birthday celebration over dinner, texted the staff beforehand and they helped to arrange the birthday cake. Really grateful for the extra service! Food is really interesting, very different from all that we've tried in Vietnam. A quiet location away from the hustle and bustle, great service too!

name: Rajbhog Hanoi Indian Restaurant
address: Lan Ong Street 47, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: We are serving Delicious Indian food with varios menu options. our restaurant have a capacity of 100+ guest at same time for lunch and dinner with an authentic taste for Indian food.
cuisines: South American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: This place is very near to Hanoi Night Market , Food Choices are limited but taste is good. Service can be a little faster. But Overall the food tasted good and has mix of Veg and Non-Veg choices.
Rajbhog is the best option for Indian tourist looking for authentic Indian food. The service is very fast and food is toasty too.
The service was slow but that was worthy as the food was very tasty not too much oil. It was just like home food. I give 9/10. I highly recommend.

name: Paolo & Chi Pizzeria Old Quarter
address: 48 Hàng Buồm, Hoàn Kiếm, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Welcome to Paolo & Chi Old Quarter! Proud of 12 years of serving Italian cuisine in Hanoi, we welcome a new member located on Hang Buom street. The special combination of Pizza - Bar - Music in a spacious and modern space is waiting for you to discover. Come and enjoy great flavors with us!
cuisines: South American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: One evening we were hungry for pizza. Since Paolo was near our hotel, we just went there with no expectations. We just wanted to eat pizza and sat down outside on the small terrace. We were very pleasantly surprised by how friendly the service was and how tasty our pizzas were! It was a hit! We can recommend the "Paolo & Chi Pizzeria" without hesitation.

EXCELLENT thank you Hieu and the team! This is a must, the food was very tasty. Pizza and pasta, great ingredients fresh. Great service great atmosphere and staff! If you fancy a change this is a must!! We need to up the reviews here!
Great pizza! We had the 4 cheese & the capriciosa. The 4 cheese was a little sickly due to being a purely white base but overall very yummy

name: Little Tipsy Pub, Hanoi
address: 33B Nguyen Huu Huan str. Ly Thai To ward, Hoan Kiem DIST., Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: The small pub offers you a wide range of Belgian, Dutch and local beers, various kinds of cocktails in a friendly atmosphere.
cuisines: European Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
French Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: There are hundreds of bars selling cheap beer in Hanoi. However, if you are after higher quality beers and drinks, still well priced, you really should make your way to this excellent small place in central Hanoi. Friendly owner and staff help make this new bar a really pleasant place to chill.

We came in for an afternoon beer but little did we know that we would enjoy a genuine chat and amazing experience. Stephen (owner) shared his captivating story with us along side the best beer in Vietnam! Highly recommend for everyone!

Great cosy bar. Really welcoming owner and staff with fantastic knowledge of the wide range of beers and wine on offer. Told us the story behind the beers we had. Just sad we only found it on our last night!

name: Lamai Garden
address: 36B Đê Quai, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description:
The couple wants to be quiet, enjoy delicious food, share happy and sad stories about their children or work... Or find a simple place to sit and meditate, listen to Le Cat Trong Ly's music, enjoy Vietnamese food but Cooked and presented in a minimalist style but not boring.
The arrangement of the dishes and the order are all intentional by the chef.
I'm the type that can eat anything, but with the message the chef conveys through every detail and flavor, the feeling of last night's dinner is like a gentle, deep song but filled and filled with happiness, laughter and joy. understanding.

This is suitable for dating for parents, after many days of hard work taking care of grandparents and children, they deserve to sit there, make funny flirtatious jokes and enjoy delicious food, fragrant wine and reminders. about our difficult but exciting journey together.
example_reviews: The couple wants to be quiet, enjoy delicious food, share happy and sad stories about their children or work... Or find a simple place to sit and meditate, listen to Le Cat Trong Ly's music, enjoy Vietnamese food but Cooked and presented in a minimalist style but not boring. The arrangement of the dishes and the order are all intentional by the chef. I'm the type that can eat anything, but with the message the chef conveys through every detail and flavor, the feeling of last night's dinner is like a gentle, deep song but filled and filled with happiness, laughter and joy. understanding. This is suitable for dating for parents, after many days of hard work taking care of grandparents and children, they deserve to sit there, make funny flirtatious jokes and enjoy delicious food, fragrant wine and reminders. about our difficult but exciting journey together.

This is an amazing experience in a special place that looks more like a living room than a commercial restaurant. 10 minutes taxi ride from the old city, this is a residential area and the restaurant is hided behing a wall that conceals a beautiful garden and villa. We sat at the bar which allows for full view of what happens in the open kitchen. The tasting menu is balanced, very special and based on local produce and Vietnamese ingredients. Everything was so beautifully presented and the taste was always subtle and yet exciting. The price is also friendly for what you get so it is a highly recommended experience when in Hanoi. DONT MISS IT !

Lamai Garden Restaurant in Hanoi is a delightful place for dinner. They specialize in authentic Vietnamese cuisine, and the dishes are full of flavor and freshness. The cozy atmosphere and attentive service make it a top choice for an authentic dining experience in the city.

name: Coffee 24
address: 24 Bat Dan Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 110802 Vietnam
description: This is a local coffee shop in the Old Quarter in Ha Noi with very cheap price. There are some kind of local coffee such as : coffee with milk, black coffee etc... Beside that, local fast food is one of the most delicious food in my restaurant like : Bread with pate,with egg,grill meat... It costs only from 1$ to 5$/ person. Come to us to enjoy a part of local lifestyle of Vietnamese.
example_reviews: Visited this centrally located café in Hanoi and the prices are very cheap, between 30,000 and 40,000 ish for a banh mi. We also ordered a very nice coffee (25,000) and a mango smoothie (40,000) and both were delicious. Staff are very friendly and the food is so good - highly recommend.
Beef pho was delicious and so cheap 50k dong!! We also asked for vegetable egg fried rice which they did and was big portion 50k done also. Nice cheap eat place, not to much on the menu though!

This is a wonderful place. You feel welcome. The lady is taking care very well of all her clients . It's such a pleasure to have drinks, tea, coffee, coconut water on this little terrace in the fans breeze. I love to stop here every day. 😁

name: Pepperonis
address: 98 Hang Trong Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description:
After a morning of sight-seeing, we were looking for an "easy" lunch, and Pepperonis (right next to the Oriental Jade Hotel where we were staying) was both convenient and offered a familiar western-style menu.  I ordered the lunch special offered that day (salad bar, pizza, pasta, 145,000 VND) but misunderstood that apparently both a small pizza and a small portion of pasta was included; as I declined the pizza I received a double portion of pasta.  Had I ordered both the pizza and pasta, it would have been far too much food.  The salad bar was incompletely stocked at 1:30 PM but what I found was good.  The "spaghetti bolognaise" didn't taste a bit like what you'd find in Italy and had a tomato-based sauce that resembled what would come from a bottle of Ragu.  My partner had a BBQ beef pizza that was "okay."  The total bill with two bottled waters was 387,720 VND (about $16).

Despite only an average experience at lunch, the easy option appealed to us again several days later for dinner.  We split a large Hawaiian pizza that was good but not great.  With three local beers, the charge was 337,000 VND (about $14).  Service for both meals was good but not polished.  We sensed tension between the wait staff and their manager.

The menu is extensive and extends far beyond pasta and pizza.  The other diners were mostly local, and at dinner included families enjoying huge platters of ribs and other western items.  I found the experience at Pepperonis to be like going to Denny's in the USA.  Never great, but it gets the job done.

I ordered the lunch special offered that day (salad bar, pizza, pasta, 145,000 VND) but misunderstood that apparently both a small pizza and a small portion of pasta was included; as I declined the pizza I received a double portion of pasta. Had I ordered both the pizza and pasta, it would have been far too much food. The salad bar was incompletely stocked at 1:30 PM but what I found was good. The "spaghetti bolognaise" didn't taste a bit like what you'd find in Italy and had a tomato-based sauce that resembled what would come from a bottle of Ragu. My partner had a BBQ beef pizza that was "okay." The total bill with two bottled waters was 387,720 VND (about $16). Despite only an average experience at lunch, the easy option appealed to us again several days later for dinner. We split a large Hawaiian pizza that was good but not great. With three local beers, the charge was 337,000 VND (about $14). Service for both meals was good but not polished. We sensed tension between the wait staff and their manager. The menu is extensive and extends far beyond pasta and pizza. The other diners were mostly local, and at dinner included families enjoying huge platters of ribs and other western items. I found the experience at Pepperonis to be like going to Denny's in the USA. Never great, but it gets the job done.

Located between the Hanoi Cathedral and our Minerva Premium Hotel, we saw that the menu out front had lots of salads and pizzas and then noticed all the Asian customers. On our 1st visit, we enjoyed Avocado salad with shrimp, Lime drink and Brownie with ice cream. The 2nd visit, we ordered the large split(Hawaiian/Marinara) thin crust pizza, Lime Drink, Zero Heiniken, then caramel dessert and apple crisp with ice cream. Excellent food and service with both bills under $19. Noise level is high especially with families on the weekends.

Decent place for a quick pizza dinner. We had the family combo with a large pepperoni pizza, six ribs, garlic bread and an Australian sausage. About what we expected for a pizza in this area of Hanoi.

name: Madam Tu Hong
address: 5 Hoi Vu Alley, Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description:
We had the best Cha Ca at Madame Tu Hongs restaurant. We stumbled on it down a back alley behind our hotel, the Beryl Charm Hotel and did we ever luck out. 

We ordered fresh spring rolls and they were delicious. We then ordered the Cha Ca and they brought out a plate of vermicelli and a tray with peanuts, chili 🌶️ peppers as a topping. A young man cooked the vegetables and fish at our table. We put the vermicelli in a bowl followed by the vegetables and fish and topped it with a fresh shrimp paste.  It had to be one of the most delicious meals we have had in Vietnam. The vegetables and fish were so fresh and the mixture of the shrimp paste with the fish was sublime. 

If only we could go again we certainly would. The price point was very affordable for any budget.
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
Thai Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
Vietnamese Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi

We ordered fresh spring rolls and they were delicious. We then ordered the Cha Ca and they brought out a plate of vermicelli and a tray with peanuts, chili 🌶️ peppers as a topping. A young man cooked the vegetables and fish at our table. We put the vermicelli in a bowl followed by the vegetables and fish and topped it with a fresh shrimp paste. It had to be one of the most delicious meals we have had in Vietnam. The vegetables and fish were so fresh and the mixture of the shrimp paste with the fish was sublime. If only we could go again we certainly would. The price point was very affordable for any budget.

The cha ca was amazing. I am normally not a big fan of shrimp paste, but this restaurant knows how to make it easy for first-timers like me to give it a try. I changed to fish sauce after but overall it was great.

This place is one of the best and nicest restaurants I have been to in Hanoi. Super friendly staff, super delicious food, super great ambiance and the price is perfect. Complete value for money. 10/10. No complaints. 100% recommend.

name: Thang Tran Quan
address: 14 Hang Ca Street 14 Hang Ca Street - 14 Cha Ca Street, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: The iconic dishes of Hanoian & Vietnamese cuisine for you to enjoy in a cozy setting right in the heart of Hanoi. Walk-ins and takeaways are all welcomed.
cuisines: Japanese Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
Late Night Mediterranean Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: Really great place. We came here by a group of 4 hugry people after 8h of walking around city and we recived even to much food to eat all of it. Prices are really fair, from my point of view, and personel is really friendly. Only one thing to notice - noodles = soup, but it was great, so who cares XD

We went twice it was that good, owner is so so so lovely gave us free bananas as dessert. Food was great, we had the steamed chicken both times it was that delicious. Good prices too compared to similar places around the old quarter and very generous portions. Cafe is small and cozy sealed off from the busy road so less noise, good air con, very clean. In summary just eat all your meals in Hanoi here

We had walked around trying to find a small cafe restaurant that wasn’t eating on the side of the road. They were friendly, good the best we had whilst on our stay in Hanoi and with wifi and a good fan, it was perfect. We ate bbq pork and seafood dishes with noodles

name: Anbien Eatery
address: 111 Trieu Viet Vuong Bui Thi Xuan Ward, Hai Ba Trung District, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: An Bien is the first restaurant which severs Haiphong's street food as daily dishes in an warm and creative space in Hanoi.
example_reviews: Coming with few friends to Anbien, feeling Hai Phong's breeze. Such a cozy and simple nice decor restaurant.
Nice small but very clean restaurant's the food was very tasty and cheap compared with other restaurants in the area. Very local cuisine and they have some English speaking waiters

I really like to enjoy meal here. All foods are famous-street-foods of HaiPhong. Taste is delicious with nice decoration. Variety selections are from low to high prices and suitable for slight to main meal, for single to family with kids. Restaurant is quite clean with feeling cozy. Highly recommended for family with kids because restaurant has Air Con and of course, that is the best thing we wish in summer of Vietnam :)

name: Vine Restaurant & Wine Bar
address: 1A Xuan Dieu Tay Ho, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Vine Quality Hospitality Group began in 2003, and was the first to be certified as an ISO 9001 for Quality Management System and as an ISO 22000 Food Safety Management System in Vietnam.Wine Spectator award-winning fine dining experience.
cuisines: Thai Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
example_reviews: Great food with amazing service. They make westerners feel at home. Our servers were great and the quality and value were outstanding.
Romantic, cozy & beautiful! Perfect for groups or date nights- wine quality is excellent-they do offer a happy hour as well from 4-8pm Staff is friendly and attentive, prices reasonable too!

5 minute walk from both the Sheraton and Intercontinental hotels. The food quality, selection, and presentation are excellent. The prices are extremely reasonable. We started with duck pate matched with a variety of breads. We were served an amuse bûche of beef relish. Hummus was provided to go with the bread baskets. I ordered a set menu of spring rolls, duck confit, and crème brûlée. My partner ordered the fish and panna cotta. We loved everything. They have an extensive wine cellar, VERY reasonably priced. The meal was excellent and the staff were very attentive and engaging with a good command of English. The decor is beautiful - brick walls with a selection of modern paintings. We had a table by a very large window so we could watch Hanoi nightlife while we ate. I recommend the Vine to anybody staying in the area.

name: Botanica Restaurant
address: 116/D4 Giang Vo, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description:
I went to Botanica Restaurant at Kim Ma Thuong street. The food in here was delicious, the space was clecm, poetic and I was enjod it. Som agents was so professionals enthusiastic.
This place will be the best choice I want to go back again.
cuisines: South American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: I went to Botanica Restaurant at Kim Ma Thuong street. The food in here was delicious, the space was clecm, poetic and I was enjod it. Som agents was so professionals enthusiastic. This place will be the best choice I want to go back again.

Walked to the restaurant at night and dark soi... almost missed the restaurant. Walking in and asking for a table, those available only half had reserved signage and others (small two seated French coffee table) set as two table for four guest and only having seated two guests each). The waiter did not try to make any effort and the-arranging anything and told me all reserved (!!!!!!!) and showed me out. Most unprofessional and unfriendly.....

name: Pacifica
address: 1 Thanh Nien Road, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: An all-day dining venue with Asian and international buffet as well as a delectable a-la-carte selection, this restaurant provides the perfect backdrop for socializing luncheons as well as relaxing family dinners or romantic dates. The weekend seafood buffet offers a wide array of prawns, oysters, and other fresh seafood.
cuisines: Middle Eastern Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: I chose from the a la carte menu: 1 soup, 1 salad and 1 wagu beef steak. The steak is really impressive, soft and delicious, and the degree of doneness is just right. Polite and enthusiastic service, price is about 100 USD/person including mineral water and beer. Highly recommend 👍

We stayed at the Pan Pacific Hanoi from the 23rd Dec 2019 to the 30th Dec 2019. We had breakfast at the place for about 3 times and the rest we upgraded to the club house. The spread of the food is large and they have nice healthy freshly blended fruits and vegetable juices too.

I have never encountered a better buffet! Vietnamese, Korean, Japanese, American and other cuisines too numerous to mention. The choices are overwhelming and uniformly delicious! Located off the lobby of the Pan Pacific hotel, the Pacifica can’t be beat!

name: Jinro BBQ
address: Opposite 63 Huynh Thuc Khang, Thanh Cong, Dong Da, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: I had a great lunch with friends here. As a person who loves Korean food, I chose a Korean restaurant with my friends. So great for the taste of Korean when eaten at hanoi, it reminds me of my previous trip to Korea. The space is too small, you should book a table before coming. The staff is agile. Will definitely come back to enjoy the food here😋
example_reviews: I had a great lunch with friends here. As a person who loves Korean food, I chose a Korean restaurant with my friends. So great for the taste of Korean when eaten at hanoi, it reminds me of my previous trip to Korea. The space is too small, you should book a table before coming. The staff is agile. Will definitely come back to enjoy the food here😋

name: Panorama Restaurant & Bar
address: 13 Ly Thai To Street Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Perched at the rooftop of the Authentic Hanoi Hotel on the 11th floor, Panorama restaurant offers a spectacular Heart of Hanoi panoramic view of the skyline with a modern mixed Western - Asian style cuisine and drinks.
example_reviews: The view is very nice and the servers Kelvin and Cantus served us for two consecutive nights and they provided us with excellent and heartwarming service that we needed in this trip. They are very accommodating and they play a big role on why I am giving a 5 star review. If ever you happen to pick this place for dinner, I hope you enjoy the view and have a wonderful conversation with Kelvin and Cantus.

We had thr pleasure to be sreved by Kelvin and Cantus for our dinner. They're attentive, knowledgeable, and very kind. The food is also delicious, great value for money. The place is nice and clean, with a great view of the lake. Highly recommend!
Good hospitality, good food. We spent here for 10 days and were happy with the restaurant. Hospitality, service and friendliness of Thong FBM, Hung, Thanh and Duc Anh, Keep up your good work.

name: Quan Bia Nguoi Yeu Cu
address: 55A Hang Chuoi Hai Ba Trung, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Where you can find beers as cold as your ex, and qualified foods.
example_reviews: Very good Vietnamese and fusion food. My first visit with my old friends - all people are happy. The mânger, Duy is very friendly and helpful Thanks!
Welcome to Quán Bia Người Yêu Cũ, where you can find beers as cold as your ex and Vietnamese fusion food with very reasonable price

name: Kinger Cuisine & Lounge
address: 2 P. Lương Ngọc Quyến, Hàng Buồm, Hoàn Kiếm, Hanoi 111515 Vietnam
description: Asian & European Food Cuisine
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
Thai Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: We ordered a beef noodle souple and it was really exquisite, value for money with a good portion size. The interior is amazing, very relaxed modern place to sit and enjoy your meal. Customer service is great as well, very attentive.

This is a great new restaurant with amazing service. The food was very good, and the cocktails were delicious. The air conditioner was a great bonus, as many other restaurants close by are not air conditioned. All of the staff were extremely professional and friendly.
