This was a great place to stop off after our visit to the cathedral. Fantastic range of craft beers definitely recommend Nitro Irish stout. The food was also delicious and we had great service from Ngoc. Thank you

After we arrived in Saigon we wandered looking for a cold beer! We landed in the perfect spot!! Great variety of beers, awesome appetizers and even better hospitality! Well worth the visit if you want a great fresh beer!!

name: Redcrab Danang
address: 138 Phạm Văn Đồng, Bắc Từ Liêm, Hanoi 550000 Vietnam
description: i like red crab crab is so fresh and so teaste next time i will go one more time(한번 가보세요)jessica god
cuisines: Korean Restaurants in Bắc Từ Liêm
Healthy Restaurants in Bắc Từ Liêm
Asian Restaurants for Lunch in Bắc Từ Liêm
Vietnamese Restaurants for Lunch in Bắc Từ Liêm
example_reviews: i like red crab crab is so fresh and so teaste next time i will go one more time(한번 가보세요)jessica god

name: 7 Bridges Brewing Company Hanoi Taproom
address: 104 Xuan Dieu Quang An, Tay Ho, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: 7 Bridges is all about great craft beer. Our taps feature our award winning beers AND ALSO other great craft beers of breweries with awesome products. Our NY style pizza, made with our spent grain, is back alongside a new menu.
cuisines: Late Night Mexican Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: GREAT PIZZA AND BEER!!!! This place is legit; granted we’re going back to Cali tomorrow after 4 weeks-in SE Asia are missing the home cookin but this place was sooo good. Solid diversity of beers, Fire Starter is awesome, and the pizza is excellent. We got the 50 cm pie and the crust was nice and thin; perfect for folding! Staff is super friendly, the only challenge was crossing the street😜.

I went there with my friends to relax and have a good talk. The restaurant has a very relaxing ambiance and the beer taste really good. You should not forget to try their pizza. Their staffs are really friendly and very accommodating. The staff who order from our table is a really nice staff and he makes sure that you feel comfortable and that they gave everything we asked for. Here are some pictures of me and my friends with the staff, his name is Denver from what I remember.

I've gone here and ordered home a bunch of times. The food is GREAT. The drink selection is awesome. More importantly, the service is absolutely spot on. The waitresses and waiters that work there are extremely pleasant, polite and attentive. Definitely check out this spot if you're looking for good food and drinks. It's a great place to meet up with friends. I'll definitely be going back.

name: Me Me Bistro
address: 47A Nguyen Huu Huan Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: We are a modern Thai bistro with cocktails around-the-clock and Bangkok living vibe for anyone who's looking for some good food and good fun!
cuisines: Thai Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
example_reviews: If you've had your fill of pho, bahn mi, bun cha and other Vietnamese delights then this place offers a welcome break. The Tom Yum was creamy and not so spicy while the serving size was just right. The beef curry had some tough pieces but was quite okay. Closer to a saucy rendang than to a hot Thai curry in flavor. The Pad Thai was the best dish. Service was prompt and English was passable. Will certainly be back if I am in Hanoi.

Perhaps the best place for Thai food in Hanoi. Really like how the food taste here, flavourful, rich but not overly spicy. There are many must-try dishes, namely, grilled iberico pork, soft shell crab, padthai, durian creme brulee. Offering good value for money that definitely worth a visit.
The foods are so delicious and staffs are very nice. Love this place whenever we visit all the corners of hanoi old quarters.

name: Gecko Cheap and Cheerful Restaurant
address: 7A Dinh Liet Street Old Quarter, Hanoi Vietnam
description:
Lots of options for Asian and European food. Our food tasted great! 

Prices are nice and low, so we recommend!
cuisines: Asian Restaurants with Buffet in Hanoi
example_reviews: Lots of options for Asian and European food. Our food tasted great! Prices are nice and low, so we recommend!

The restaurant is cheap with a huge menu. We just had some light food - panini, garlic bread and spring rolls. Fast service and food tasted ok. We sat on the balcony on first floor. This restaurant is no longer at this address and we found it on Google Maps. It’s now called Geckos Cafe and is on Pho Hang Bông, about 10mins walk from this street (Dinh Liet).
I always came here for lunch during my 3 days in Hanoi and I have to say that I always enjoyed the food, although I don’t like asian cuisine!

name: Épices D'indochine Restaurant
address: 38 Phố Thi Sách Q. Hai Bà Trưng, Hanoi Vietnam
description:
This restaurant was all right. We enjoyed several courses. Service was adequate. Ambience was not great. There really isn’t any atmosphere. 
Neighborhood was so, so. We would not return.
example_reviews: This restaurant was all right. We enjoyed several courses. Service was adequate. Ambience was not great. There really isn’t any atmosphere. Neighborhood was so, so. We would not return.

The restaurant is located in a small house at the bottom of a courtyard, quiet, the setting is pretty. The dishes are good, fragrant and varied. Only downside, the end of the service was a little long.

name: Munchen Beer Club
address: So 4A Le Thanh Tong, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: this is the best bar on this side of the lake. you find a whole range of european beers. it is well chilled and the ambiance is tastefully done. good place to have cold beers on a hot afternoon. a bit pricey the beers.
cuisines: BBQ Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
example_reviews: this is the best bar on this side of the lake. you find a whole range of european beers. it is well chilled and the ambiance is tastefully done. good place to have cold beers on a hot afternoon. a bit pricey the beers.

we popped in for one drink in the day. Thought it was a popular venue but we were the only ones in there. The staff appeared uninterested in us being there. Why Munchen beer - they only had 4 x beers on draft - and I think only one was german We didnt feel the need to re-visit this bar.

We were looking for a place to have a few beers late on a Sunday and this was open. Clean with a friendly staff, it felt more English than German but the beer tasted the same... good and cold. Not sure why I always eventually end up in a pub when I travel but... this was one and I drank beer there. The only thing I could do without was the guy next to us with a "stanky" cigar.

name: Banyan Steak & Beer
address: 6C Đường Thành, Cửa Đông, Hoàn Kiếm, Hanoi Vietnam
description:
We came here for dinner last night, and it was really lovely food and the man that served us was lovely too. 

In Hanoi we have struggled for vegetarian options for food, and we pleased to see they had plenty of vegetarian spaghetti options! 

Really delicious pasta! 

Thank you
cuisines: Late Night Asian Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: We came here for dinner last night, and it was really lovely food and the man that served us was lovely too. In Hanoi we have struggled for vegetarian options for food, and we pleased to see they had plenty of vegetarian spaghetti options! Really delicious pasta! Thank you
Last day kami di Hanoi. Pasta nya semua enak, steak nya juicy. Ice Americano nya juga okay. Tempatnya lumayan cozy. Ownernya ramah Nice to met you guys Thank you

Great location and really pleasant owner who will chat with you if you want too. Reasonable prices. Although I did not eat here some others at my hotel said the food was good. After a couple of weeks of oriental food nice to finish off with a steak

name: Mapa Bistro
address: 34 Nhà Chung 34 Nhà Chung, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: We happened on this by accident. Must have just opened up as there were zero recommendations for it. But really really really you have to try it. Italian food beautifully prepared and so cheap that part of me thinks that they have gotten their pricing wrong. Hopefully they will succeed. They certainly deserve to.
cuisines: Middle Eastern Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: We happened on this by accident. Must have just opened up as there were zero recommendations for it. But really really really you have to try it. Italian food beautifully prepared and so cheap that part of me thinks that they have gotten their pricing wrong. Hopefully they will succeed. They certainly deserve to.

Amazing little bistro that you would probably walk past. We had the triangle steak which was an amazing steak that arrived at the table in a triangle wooden box. Succulent and melted in the mouth. Red wine was beautiful and dinner very price friendly. Staff were excellent. Toilet very clean.

I came across this restaurant because it's located next to the hotel where I was staying, and I found it on Tripadvisor, although it didn’t have many reviews. It turned out to be a real surprise! The food was absolutely delicious and offered a great variety. We ordered a set for two people, which included a mix of different dishes. We came back again on our last day in Hanoi, and this time I tried their white sangria, which was really good. We also ordered a few more dishes, and they were all fantastic. I highly recommend this place!

name: Banh Cuon Gia Truyen Thanh Van
address: 81 Le Van Huu Hai Ba Trung, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Very good stop for the Hanoi/Vietnamese Bánh Cuốn (basically, rice crepes filled with pork and mushroom); they are made fresh to order.
example_reviews: Very good stop for the Hanoi/Vietnamese Bánh Cuốn (basically, rice crepes filled with pork and mushroom); they are made fresh to order.

45k for pork rolls and a side dish. I saw a good number of locals eating here and a couple of walking food tours so my guess is that standards are decent? My only gripe is that the cashier tried to charge me for a Pepsi I did not order, so I suggest to track and you’ve ordered and the prices to ensure you pay the right amount!
Very simple address (and quite clean), and cheap. A specialty: Banh Cuon. Who are good! And some chicken Pho.

name: Pho Xao Phu My
address: 45B Bat Dan Hoan Kiem, Hanoi Vietnam
description: No frills here, but amazing Pho Xao! We were told about this Pho joint by a local. All I can say is, the food was excellent! The Pho was super unique and stood out compared to other versions we tried while in Hanoi. Rich, flavorful, and tasty. The place was packed with locals - usually a great sign! I would highly recommend this Pho spot!
example_reviews: No frills here, but amazing Pho Xao! We were told about this Pho joint by a local. All I can say is, the food was excellent! The Pho was super unique and stood out compared to other versions we tried while in Hanoi. Rich, flavorful, and tasty. The place was packed with locals - usually a great sign! I would highly recommend this Pho spot!
A quite strange way to cook and have Pho. All i ever though was that Pho is just a kind of soup, but i've discovered this place which sell fry Pho which is stir-fry noodle
We ordered the fried pho (65,000VND) and the owner allowed us to share 1 portion between 2ppl. Portion was huge and for Singaporeans out there, this tasted like beef horfun. Still good though!

name: 88 Bistronomy
address: 88 Xuan Dieu Tay Ho, Hanoi 1000 Vietnam
description: 88 Bistronomy is a unique architected bar - restaurant - lounge at 88 Xuan Dieu (Ha Noi), offering a unique dining experience in our ambient lounge where you will find an array of wines from around the world, tasty food and great music.
example_reviews: One of the hidden chic place in Hanoi. Location is convenient with a view of West Lake. Different floors fit different occasions such as young people on the top, business & friend dinning on 2nd, social gathering with cocktails in 1st floor. The food is very French style and the dishes were delicious. I had been there a few times this year and service was good.
Drinks and food are always fantastic. Service is good and I always enjoy the relaxing lounge environment. A place to enjoy a quiet drink or to celebrate a special occasion.
Very creative dishes with Vietnamese flavors Very nice view on West lake Very unique atmosphere Highly recommended

name: Cafe Lautrec
address: 29 Trang Tien Street Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: A stylish and contemporary Mediterranean style brasserie located in the heart of the French Quarter offering guests a splendidly unique and intimate dining environment.
cuisines: Mexican Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
example_reviews: Good quality food. The beef was done perfectly and the spring rolls had a generous helping of fresh ingredients. It could be a meal in itself. Staff were professional and attentive.
Family Breakfast - great atmosphere, very good service and lovely selection of food. The eggs benadict was first class as was their coffee's.

Located in the Hotel with both Asian and Western menus available. The service is attentive, the food good, aand the staff go out of their way to ensure the experience is memorable special mention to sen, Duy and Thu for their wonderful customer service for bith the breakfast ( good range and choices) and the dinners we enjoyed at the hotel

name: Yukichi Ramen
address: 20 P. Nguyễn Hữu Huân Lý Thái Tổ, Hoàn Kiếm, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Yukichi is an international Ramen brand established in 2019 with 9 locations, including 2 locations abroad and 7 locations in Vietnam. Coming to Yukichi Ramen, customers not only have the opportunity to enjoy the rich, flavorful original noodles but also feel the cultural and historical beauty in a standard Japanese space.
cuisines: Thai Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
example_reviews: Searching for a good Ramen dish in Hanoi well this is the place for you. Staff were all really friendly and willing to help with the menu. We got a few dishes so we could try, which this did not disappoint. Would highly recommend the curry ramen, delicious and very tasty. The portion sizes are massive too

Incredible food. We ordered Gyoza’S and they were deliciously fresh and tasty. We then tried the Ramen - two different styles and they were amazing. You sit mainly at the bar which is perfectly fine as you can watch the chefs make your delights. There were two sit down tables but they were busy. Just go!

We all decided to have ramen for dinner and after reviewing ramen restaurants in Yelp in Old Quarter of Ha Nôi, we selected Yukichi Ramen. Well, we got LUCKY!!!!!! Yukichi offers 3 type of ramen noodles: thin, medium, large size. I love thin noodles because you get to taste the softness and flavorful noodles and the richness of the soup stock. The quail eggs inside the bowl of ramen added a sweet richness to complement the noodles but not taking away from the flavorful richness of the pork soup stock. The potstickers were good but don't forget to add a little of red vinager, sesame oil & palm sugar to their dipping sauce because it was too salty for me. Beside that, this is an amazing spot for ramen. Thank you for not over-charged your ramen noodles like the other ramen restaurants!!!!!

name: Sushi Hokkaido Sachi - Lotte Mall HN
address: 272 Võ Chí Công, Quận Tây Hồ, Hanoi Vietnam
description:
We did not have a reservation but managed to get in. Absolutely loveeee this place food!!! Many many choices!!!! Miso crab 🦀 was great!!!

They offered free appetizer of roasted ginko nuts!!!

Must try the Melon 🍈 juice!!!! Super yummy!! The assorted tempura 🍤 was also great! Plating was an eye pleaser which makes the food really delicious.

Also the Japanese 🍈 fruit is also good.

Price was also affordable.
cuisines: American Restaurants with Buffet in Hanoi
example_reviews: We did not have a reservation but managed to get in. Absolutely loveeee this place food!!! Many many choices!!!! Miso crab 🦀 was great!!! They offered free appetizer of roasted ginko nuts!!! Must try the Melon 🍈 juice!!!! Super yummy!! The assorted tempura 🍤 was also great! Plating was an eye pleaser which makes the food really delicious. Also the Japanese 🍈 fruit is also good. Price was also affordable.

Affordable prices, diverse dishes, good quality. Standard Japanese taste. The sashimi is very fresh. But you need to order more perilla and seaweed if you want to eat it with it. Eel rice has rich flavor and delicious rice grains. Need to book a table because the restaurant is very crowded, and there are discounts.
I had good experience at this res. Their seasonal menu is very special, delisious and fresh. Many service staff so nice. Reccomend if you want eat sashimi ưhen you come Ha Noi. ❤️

name: Sushi Dokoro Yutaka
address: 95 Xuan Dieu, Tay ho, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Good food and nice Staff overall. Price is resonable compare with other Japanese restaurants nearby I have tried with similar quality. The design is normal...Anyway would recommend this place.
cuisines: Mexican Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
Middle Eastern Restaurants with Buffet in Hanoi
example_reviews: Good food and nice Staff overall. Price is resonable compare with other Japanese restaurants nearby I have tried with similar quality. The design is normal...Anyway would recommend this place.
Have been to this places several times and I really enjoy the food and service here. Price is reasonable compare to the quality. Overall is good experience.
Very nice place, well located, with a good variety of Japanese dishes. Lunch is a great deal. Good service.

name: Kampong Chicken House - 107 Lò Đúc
address: 107 Lo Duc Street, Hai Ba Trung District, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: The brand name was established in April 2015 as Kampong Chicken House, this is a concept of a fast serving Asian restaurant for the modern society. Since its establishment up to now, Kampong Chicken House is always mentioned by customers as the first restaurant concept specializing in serving Hainanese Chicken Rice of Singapore standard flavors. Above all, the biggest difference and also the biggest advantage of Kampong Chicken House is to always use fresh chicken of good quality combined with a variety of fresh sauces prepared for daily use. In addition, the green and clean space, professional services and various menus of foods made from chicken according to modern Asian flavors are also impressive points for the customers who have visited Kampong Chicken House.
example_reviews: Chicken rice is one of the signature dish of Singapore, and the restaurant managed to make it real. The 3 sauces are mostly identical with what you would have on a chicken-rice dish: Ginger sauce, Chilly sauce, Dark-Soy sauce. however i would prefer to have my chicken >>> boneless.
The fried chicken rice here is very good. Fresh chicken with sticky rice, so my parents love it 💙💙💙💙
The restaurant is Nice and warm with chill music. My daughter enjoys with salad and coconut juice. See you soon

name: Banh Cuon Gia Truyen Thanh Van
address: 128 Pho Tran Nhat Duat, Hanoi Vietnam
description: We're the third establishment of Hanoi's favorite steamed rice pancake restaurant - Thanh Van's Traditional Steamed Rice Pancake - a 50-year-old family-owned business in Hanoi's Old Quarter. Having been featured on various tourist guidebooks and TV shows, we're a household name for both locals and foodie travelers. The 3rd restaurant is opened and managed by Mrs. Van's daughter, who has been working alongside her mother since her youth. We're a 2-minute walk from Ta Hien beer street and the pedestrian streets, making it extremely convenient for you to join us for a taste of Hanoi's traditional delicacy.
cuisines: Late Night Vietnamese Restaurants in Hanoi
Asian Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Me and my girlfriend was here and ate their Banh cuon, a rice flour pancake. And I tried their pork version and it was amazing. My girlfriend is vegetarian and even if they didn’t offered a veggie option they made a pancake without the meat so we could share the experience! Maybe not the best place for vegetarians but highly recommend it for meat eaters! :)

Exceptionally fresh and tasty steamed rolled rice pancakes. So light and fresh. Very clean and modern and lovely ladies in the restaurant. We discovered it on a street food tour and made a return visit. Highly recommend.
Very good Banh Cuon for very cheap price. One of the best foods I've had in Vietnam so far. Service was fine and fast! Recommended.

name: Le Garden
address: 143 Trieu Viet Vuong Hai Ba Trung District, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description:
I heard that the owner is a Chinese from Hong Kong who came to Hanoi to open a small restaurant.

Located in the downtown area of Hanoi, the interior decoration is novel, gorgeous, fashionable and clean!

The dishes are quite delicious, and the chef’s cooking skills are of a five-star hotel standard!

The price is quite affordable (for foreign tourists)

Definitely a must-recommend Chinese restaurant in Hanoi!
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: I heard that the owner is a Chinese from Hong Kong who came to Hanoi to open a small restaurant. Located in the downtown area of Hanoi, the interior decoration is novel, gorgeous, fashionable and clean! The dishes are quite delicious, and the chef’s cooking skills are of a five-star hotel standard! The price is quite affordable (for foreign tourists) Definitely a must-recommend Chinese restaurant in Hanoi!

This was an excellent place for business dinner or family dinners. The food prepared are so unique and delicious. They have pork ribs, chicken , vegetables that are fresh and deserts to finish it off. The service is professional and fast.

We came to Le Garden(黎苑), a beautiful restaurant for lunch. The restaurant has an elegant setting and beautiful decoration. Their service was quick cordial and very professional. We, a group of tourists, visited here when we were in Hanoi. The Chinese Foods they served were all delicious, excellent in taste and gorgeous in presentation. We all enjoyed the lunch well.

name: Bun Cha Burger
address: 43B Truc Bach Ba Dinh, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Our Bun Cha Burger is a fusion of east and west, with a burger patty wedged between layers of Vietnamese tastes and textures bound by two buns and then dressed with Hanoi’s famous bun cha sauce. The result is just the right amount of crunch, just the right amount of sweetness, just the right amount of Vietnam, and just tthe right amount of sweetness, just the right amount of America.
cuisines: South American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: I live in Hanoi and have been here many times. CRAFT BEER here! The cuisine is innovative and thoughtful, with lots of food knowledge woven into the menu. There are plenty of vegan options but the beef burger is outstanding in flavor and complexity. My instinct was to use ketchup but the bun cha sauce brings it to perfection (they don’t offer ketchup anyway. There’s a commanding view of Truc Bach Lake from the top floor and the bar there has a nice vibe. The location is easy to miss; the doorway is tucked in a narrow opening. Come join the chess games on Sunday or the vegan buffet on Saturday. The owner is a genuine foodie and it shows!

Been here thrice. The cuisine is innovative and thoughtful, with lots of food knowledge woven into the simple menu. There’s plenty of vegan choices but the beef burger is outstanding in flavor and complexity. The instinct was to use ketchup but bun cha sauce brings it to perfection. The tacos are as unique and flavorful as the burgers. There’s a commanding view from the top floor and the bar there has a nice vibe. Each of four floors is unique, with great simple decor. The location is easy to miss; the doorway is tucked in a narrow opening. Local craft beer here and cocktails.
A very good surprise ! Pleasant welcome and fine food.... even titled “burger”, this place actually includes local food to make their burgers. I will come back and tell my friends to go !

name: Nisa Restaurant
address: 32 Hang Tre Street Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Established in 2001, NISA Restaurant is the first Halal Malaysian restaurant in Hanoi. Our restaurant is conveniently located at the centre of Hanoi city, the so-called peaceful city of South East Asia. With highly skillful staffs, modern facilities and excellent services, our restaurant is the right place for you and your family to enjoy the warm settings for a truly Halal meal.Come to NISA and we commit to give you the most delicious and traditional Malaysian, Indonesian and Indian cuisines.Nisa Restaurant's founder is Mr. Ben Taat Alias. With his love for Halal food, his real hope is to offer Halal food to people, especially Muslim people living and traveling in Vietnam. He first established Nisa Restaurant in a place where is now known as Tien Thuy Hotel. At first, Nisa was quite small with only 4 tables. After that, in 2002, recognizing the increased demand of tourists from Muslim countries, Ben decided to move Nisa to present place at 32 Hang Tre Street, with larger space and more tables for better services.
cuisines: Late Night Sushi Restaurants in Hanoi
Late Night Vietnamese Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: Went to his restaurant after a tiresome day to have some delicious food. but we did not enjoy the food so much. The service was great but personally didn't like the food preparation.

This restaurant is quite clean and comfortable, the staff are friendly but food is bit quite expensive. Beside this there are some more halal restaurants in Hanoi, one nearby in Hàng Bè street, No.92 Le Duan street n some more... Those who want to buy Baju kurung, jubah, telekung and other stuff for muslim may contact murahborongvietnam.com. There design is quite nice and cheap. They have a shop in Ho Chi Minh and just opened one branch in Ha Noi. Luckily the guide took me to there shop on the 1st day the shop was opened so I got some discount.

Now called Little India, this restaurant had a diverse menu (written in English), including a large vegetarian section. 4 of us were very pleased with our meal. The service was good, and the place was clearly overseen by a short Indian man who swung by our table, made sure our meal was good, and asked us where we were all from. The atmosphere was okay. (A little music would have been nice, and distracted from the city and kitchen sounds). Highly recommended.

name: Valentino Cocktail Bar
address: 12 Ng. Báo Khánh Hàng Trống, Hoàn Kiếm, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: It is said that the shortest path to the heart of a man is through his stomach but you can also touch the heart of a woman at Valentino Cocktail Bar. Inspired by love and romance, the name of Valentino was chosen. At Valentino, we use simple, fresh ingredients, and through the process of infusion and fermentation, preserve nature's essence to create classic to brand new flavors. We believe in giving our guests amazing drinks, romantic experiences, and great stories.
example_reviews: Valentino Cocktail Bar is a hidden gem in the heart of the city, offering an intimate and cozy underground atmosphere that is perfect for a night out with friends or a romantic evening with a loved one. The dim lighting, comfortable seating, and unique decor all work together to create a warm and inviting atmosphere that instantly puts you at ease. What sets Valentino Cocktail Bar apart from other bars is the exceptional staff. The bartenders are true mixologists, with expert knowledge of their craft and a passion for creating the perfect drink. They go out of their way to make you feel welcome and are always happy to offer recommendations on which cocktails to try. Their attention to detail and creativity really shine through in the exceptional array of drinks on the menu. The cocktails themselves are truly outstanding. Each one is crafted with high-quality ingredients and expert techniques, resulting in flavors that are complex and nuanced. Whether you're in the mood for something classic or want to try something a little more adventurous, there's a drink on the menu to suit every taste. Overall, Valentino Cocktail Bar is a must-visit for anyone looking for a cozy underground bar with friendly staff and an excellent array of expertly crafted cocktails. The attention to detail and creativity put into each drink, combined with the warm and inviting atmosphere, make for an unforgettable experience.

This Cocktail Bar if it was in Singapore, Melbourne or Bangkok in another metropolitan city would be packed. The bar staff know how to make great cocktails and the drinks are excellent here. The staff are amazing, friendly, and willing to go off menu for your selected choice of cocktails. This is great service here and they know how to make cocktails very well. Overall a great experience here and again cocktails are made well!
Nice place, cozy bar. Quite easy to find . I order something not strong and fruity and they made exactly what I want. Will comeback

name: Com & Pho 12
address: 12 Ly Quoc Su, Hang Trong, Hoan Kiem Ha Noi, Hanoi 12 Lý Quốc Sư, Hàng Trống, Hoàn Kiếm Hà Nội Vietnam
description: Delicious Asian food. We love this restaurant . In our 5 days in Hanoi we came 3 times and tried various food in this restaurant . Price is reasonable and place is kept reasonably clean. We like the fried rice , rice with onion and shrimp , pho and spring roll
example_reviews: Delicious Asian food. We love this restaurant . In our 5 days in Hanoi we came 3 times and tried various food in this restaurant . Price is reasonable and place is kept reasonably clean. We like the fried rice , rice with onion and shrimp , pho and spring roll

We visited at midday. The pho place next door was rammed so we tried here on pure chance. No regrets. My favourite meal to date in Vietnam. Husband and wife served us. I had fried rice with chicken and veg. You must too! If you want a humble and authentic quick meal, get in here. Extra star for husband humming to himself in background as we ate. Felt like the extended family.

We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner. The stir-fried noodles with vegetables was delicious. My husband ordered Bun Cha, and it was also good, but he wished the meat was a little crispier which is why we gave “4” instead of “5”.

name: Dong Son Drum Restaurant
address: 1 Tran Dang Ninh Street, Cau GIay District, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Nha hang Trong Dong Son - tu hao boi su hien dien cua cac vi chinh khach, cac nguyen thu quoc gia noi tieng trong nuoc cung nhu tren the gioi da an dinh nhung buoi tiec chieu dai tai nha hang. Voi mot khong gian sang trong nhung van khong mat di net van hoa rieng cua Viet Nam. Nha hang Trong Dong Son cam on rat nhieu vi su uu ai cua cac doanh nhan trong va ngoai nuoc da lua chon chung toi lam noi hoi hop, trao doi cong viec. Day cung la dia diem to chuc tiec tung yeu thich cua gioi van nghe si hang dau trong nuoc va hai ngoai. Chinh su quan tam va uu ai cua cac thuc khach da thuc day them tiem tang suu tam co vat Dong Son ngay cang tang gia tri von khong the danh doi duoc. Bo suu tap do dang duoc trung bay tai nha hang Trong Dong Son cung cac buoi trien lam vinh danh van nghe si. Voi su khac biet da dang ve san pham va dich vu quy khach co rat nhieu lua chon phu hop cho nhung buoi tiec chieu dai lon hoac nho: - Phong tiec VIP hang sieu sang. - Phong tiec chieu dai doanh nhan. - Khu vuc dac biet danh cho gia dinh. - Sanh tiec lon & nho to chuc cac su kien. - Khu vuc giai tri Club Bar & Lounge. - Tiec ngoai troi theo yeu cau tai vuon. - Thuc don tiec da dang phu hop moi nhu cau. - Thuc don chon san danh cho khach du lich. Hay cung Trong Dong Son dua huong vi am thuc Viet Nam chuan muc va sang trong ra the gioi!
cuisines: Late Night Vietnamese Restaurants in Hanoi
Asian Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Recent private dining experience at this unique establishment that promotes local history Ancient drums adorn the main restaurant We were entertained my masters in ancient instruments it was truly wonderful Food was amazing. Local Vietnamese cuisine we dined on an endless sea of plates Very unique experience and a must go

I came here as a guest and we had a private (air conditioned) room in the garden area. The ambiance is very good and the staff treat you like a king. We had traditional Vietnamese food, which wasn't entirely to my taste but I could taste it was fresh and cooked to perfection. Really top class.

From the look the restaurant is a fancy one. It serve traditional vietnamese dishes and capable to serve more than 200 guesses at once. The food is okay.. The restaurant serve more seafoods then any other food type. Maybe becouse seafood is a hits in hanoi as a seaside country. During the meal it also provide live music performing traditional instruments played by girls. Very nice place.. Good food. Suitable for big groups dining.

name: Paris Baguette
address: B010 The Manor , Me Trì, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Style over Substance. A great looking place with visually stunning cakes which somehow seem to fail to deliver on the wow taste factor (with the clear exception of the tiramisu chocolate tart, which was as good as ANY european pastry I have EVER eaten). It would be divine if the immaculately presented open working kitchen delivers on better taste rather than just the brilliant visuals. Perhaps I am being harsh here, I feel bad about writing this. But that’s the lot of the critic.
example_reviews: Style over Substance. A great looking place with visually stunning cakes which somehow seem to fail to deliver on the wow taste factor (with the clear exception of the tiramisu chocolate tart, which was as good as ANY european pastry I have EVER eaten). It would be divine if the immaculately presented open working kitchen delivers on better taste rather than just the brilliant visuals. Perhaps I am being harsh here, I feel bad about writing this. But that’s the lot of the critic.
Great location by the lake but the pastries choice is very poor. Nothing attractive and definitely no french recipe. Very local. The place could be much better with the unique surroundings !

Came here twice...a little pricey but well presented. We ordered two different types of teas but they came out the same!! They were not interested in changing anything insisting they were different teas. Clearly they were the same! Also charged 15000 dong for about 20 ml of milk which curdled in the ‘black’ tea because it was actually a lemon tea!!! Customer service needs a little work! Lovely clean space to hang out.

name: Doner Kebab Anh Nguyen
address: 2 Hang Bac Street, Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: The kebab served at this location is authentic and quite good. Excellent for a mid afternoon "snack" or lunch. Great location in the heart of the old quarter and easy to find. I return each time that I am in Hanoi.
example_reviews: The kebab served at this location is authentic and quite good. Excellent for a mid afternoon "snack" or lunch. Great location in the heart of the old quarter and easy to find. I return each time that I am in Hanoi.
took a punt and ordered a pork kebab - very tasty and so impressed with the bread roll well done thank you!
When you have too much of pho or noodles in Hanoi,try this kebab and you will definitely ask for more !! The bread is crispy outside and soft inside, the pork is amazingly delicious.

name: Me & An Vegetarian
address: Số 61, Phố Hàm Long, Phường Hàng Bài, Quận Hoàn Kiếm, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description:
Best vegetarian restaurant ever.
We felt like god in France. Very delicious courses. Culinary art at its best.
We will be back!
example_reviews: Best vegetarian restaurant ever. We felt like god in France. Very delicious courses. Culinary art at its best. We will be back!
Absolutely amazing food n it's all vegan. The service is exceptional and the food is so good. I was so happy to have lunch with my close friends in this place.

name: Hatoyama
address: Số 8 Vạn Phúc Ba Đình, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: One of the best Sushi restaurants I visited and eat in. The ambience is great, service and the quality outstanding. We returned here after first time. Meals are served within a private room plus you get a great brown rice roasted green tea (genmaicha). The chef has two Michelin stars.
example_reviews: One of the best Sushi restaurants I visited and eat in. The ambience is great, service and the quality outstanding. We returned here after first time. Meals are served within a private room plus you get a great brown rice roasted green tea (genmaicha). The chef has two Michelin stars.
Absolutely excellent. I'm working in Japan, but ti's restaurant represents a top quality restaurant in Japan. I had no idea about finding this level outside Japan!
It was a perfect experience.. ambience, service, food! The menu had plenty to choose from..we tried a range of dishes & each was really tasty!

name: Vi Quang Restaurant
address: 35 Tran Hung Dao, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Vi Quang – Quang Nam, Da Nang traditional taste in Hanoi Located in the center of Hanoi, Vi Quang Restaurant serves traditional dishes of Quang Nam and Da Nang in the center region of Vietnam such as Mi Quang (famous Quang style noodle), Banh canh (Vietnamese udon), Hue Spring-roll, Banh xeo, Nem lui… A cozy space with truly characterics of the central region and with friendly, dedicated services will makes you feel very pleased to dine there. The restaurant serves daily from 10.30am - 2pm and 5pm-10pm.
example_reviews: Clean, attentive staff & good food. This place is around the corner from our hotel Hilton Garden Inn. Super easy to walk to with English menu. The food is something we have eaten at the home of my Vietnamese friend back in the states. It was a wonderful experience to have in Hanoi. A nice variety from the soup noodles and rice dishes. The staff was attentive especially the woman there (sorry lost the sheet of paper with her name that we wrote down) who helped us select the dishes and gave us an extra lettuce basket. Also watched her really cleaned up the tables/ chairs & set up the tables. Just wish there was AC but most places in Hanoi do not have AC.

One of the better places to break away from also tasty street food in the neighbourhood. It was recommended by our local friends. Friendly staff. Prices are reasonable for the food quantity, quality, presentation and taste. So order something extra you won't get elsewhere.

Really pleased I got a recommendation from a local for this restaurant. Excellent food !! Tipical regional dishes on the menu. Happy we got some explanation how to make te combination with the dishes being served. Very kind and pleasant people. Happy to be a bit away from the touristic track and find these authentic dishes. Definitely recommended. Our best restaurant we found in hanoi.

name: Mam restaurant
address: 13 11, Hang Mam, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Food was typical. Portions small. Not enough alternatives for those who don't eat seafood. Service too slow.
cuisines: South American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Food was typical. Portions small. Not enough alternatives for those who don't eat seafood. Service too slow.
Good food. A little disorganized for getting drinks out. Small and personal. Enjoyed our group lunch with Road Scholar.

While I suspect this is a popular place for tourist guides to take their guests, we had a delicious meal there. We had the set menu which can actually work well with a group with varying tastes (we have two children in our group) as all the food is brought to the table at once and there is enough for everyone to have something. However as with these types of meals there always seems to be too much food.

name: Latino Texmex Grill & Tacos
address: 121 C8, lane 12Nui Truc, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Tonight, we were very happy to find this beautiful restaurant at walking distance from our hotel. the Mexican dishes are quite authentic and there is additional choices for meat lovers...we definitely recommend.
example_reviews: Tonight, we were very happy to find this beautiful restaurant at walking distance from our hotel. the Mexican dishes are quite authentic and there is additional choices for meat lovers...we definitely recommend.
- Tasty mexico dishes. Highly recommend for a lovely dinner. Romantic and attractive. Love Mexico and Latino

Just to clear that up as I see many comments here about Mexican food. The food is Latin, and as such is very good. I had the ham and Chorizo as a starter. Not cheap but that was expected as the cold cuts are imported. The ham regrettably was straight out of the freezer and still had pieces of ice stuck to it. The main course, chicken with black rice was pretty good though it could have used a little more seasoning. Whilst I am no big fan of getting my menu on an IPdad, service was outstanding.

name: Hot Rock Cafe
address: Building Hacinco B3.7, Le Van Luong - Hoang Dao Thuy, Thanh Xuan, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description:
They fed me cold beer and sat me directly in front of their industrial air conditioner, which satisfied my primal needs at the time. 

The pizza was ... weird ... odd crust and cheese consistencies ... but maybe that’s how pizzas are throughout Vietnam. 

Menu is in English and service is friendly!
cuisines: Thai Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
Vietnamese Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: They fed me cold beer and sat me directly in front of their industrial air conditioner, which satisfied my primal needs at the time. The pizza was ... weird ... odd crust and cheese consistencies ... but maybe that’s how pizzas are throughout Vietnam. Menu is in English and service is friendly!

Well my first impression is the atmosphere which is very cozy and make feel comfortable. Although there a good view with lots of window, the Cooker Hood system seem to be quite useless. There was a table which order the steak and i can't stand the smoke. The food is affordable. It costs about 15$ a 3 courses meal. Soup and salad is served as the starter. The cream soup with mushroom I think is the best starter in the menu. The soup is very tasty. The creamy flavour blended with some salty and the chewing of the mushroom made the special of this soup. There are lots of savoury dishes such as pizza, spagetti, beefsteak, lamb, chicken and seafood but i suggest the Napoli pizza. The dough is very crispy and tons of cheese is cover the tomato and mozzarella made a great texture of the pizza.

We have been to the new Hot Rock Cafe in Trung Hoa Nhan Chinh area. We like the location but we faced a bit difficulty interm of parking. Food was good but service was still no improvement found here. And the ventilation was really a headache. After dinner, we were all very oily smelled.

name: Cha Ca Tan Tan
address: 15 Trang Thi Street, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi Vietnam
description: We were brought here by a local and the majority of people there were local. The food was very tasty and inexpensive. We did not get the Cha Ca but I let my friends order. Everything that came out tasted like a home cooked meal.
cuisines: Thai Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
example_reviews: We were brought here by a local and the majority of people there were local. The food was very tasty and inexpensive. We did not get the Cha Ca but I let my friends order. Everything that came out tasted like a home cooked meal.

name: GOC by TÁCH
address: 20 Hai Bà Trưng, Hoàn Kiếm, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: I recently had lunch at GOC, and confidently say that it's a hidden gem for office people working around Hoan Kiem lake area to be discover. What truly impressed me was the perfect combination of exceptional food at affordable prices (~120K with full option) and service with a genuine smile. Highly recommend!!!
cuisines: Japanese Restaurants with Buffet in Hanoi
example_reviews: I recently had lunch at GOC, and confidently say that it's a hidden gem for office people working around Hoan Kiem lake area to be discover. What truly impressed me was the perfect combination of exceptional food at affordable prices (~120K with full option) and service with a genuine smile. Highly recommend!!!

In my opinion, the menu of the restaurant is quite unique, giving me many choices. The food here is Asian grilled style, so it is very tasty. Besides, the waiters are very enthusiastic and attentive and have a certain understanding of the restaurant's dishes.

I visited the restaurant with my friend last week and it's truly impressive experience. I used to visit the Tách space to drink coffee, but it was only last week that I discovered there's a restaurant inside. Food: The establishment seems to specialize in grilled dishes, which are quite suitable for casual dining and drinking. Since we went during lunchtime, my friend and I ordered a Beef Udon and a Seafood Rice. I was quite impressed with the sauce of the seafood rice I had; the flavor was rich and the sweet and sour taste was my cup of tea. The set meal was quite comprehensive, including a soup and dessert. Ambiance: The restaurant's style left a strong impression on me, with a vintage touch that truly embodies Hanoi's essence. The spacious layout ensures that clothes don't retain any lingering odors after dining. Service: The day I visited, the restaurant was fairly crowded, but the staff was quick in their service. They provided enthusiastic recommendations for suitable beverages to complement each dish. Definitely will come back for dinner and drink!!!!

name: Lotus Blanc Cafe Restaurant
address: 08 Ly Quoc Su Hang Trong, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description:
Stumbled across this restaurant whilst hunting for somewhere for supper, having just arrived in town.

It was getting late, a Saturday, but we managed to get a balcony table with great views of the street activities below.

Good service, lovely good and decent local wine at a fair price.
example_reviews: Stumbled across this restaurant whilst hunting for somewhere for supper, having just arrived in town. It was getting late, a Saturday, but we managed to get a balcony table with great views of the street activities below. Good service, lovely good and decent local wine at a fair price.
I was on a search for Pho Ga... theirs was really good, fast service and variety of drinks. Thumbs up 👍
Nice terrace overlooking a busy street. Quick service, good choice of drinks and snacks. Attentive and friendly service.

name: Kisu Sushi
address: 65C Tran Quoc Toan Street, Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi Vietnam
description:
My first visit to this restaurant. Had been to a few Japanese restaurants in the region and I can say this one rates very high on the list.

The Salmon sashimi was excellent.

Portions are on the small side but taste and presentation wise, top marks.

Price wise, a dinner for two with non alcoholic beverage and shared dessert (which was excellent), set us back USD50.

Then again, the food and service was really good.
cuisines: French Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: My first visit to this restaurant. Had been to a few Japanese restaurants in the region and I can say this one rates very high on the list. The Salmon sashimi was excellent. Portions are on the small side but taste and presentation wise, top marks. Price wise, a dinner for two with non alcoholic beverage and shared dessert (which was excellent), set us back USD50. Then again, the food and service was really good.
We are usually spent time in there about 2 times a month...the ingredients are very fresh especially for sashimi..

Having lived several years in Ho Chi Minh City, I've tried many sushi places. This easy to find restaurant in Hanoi surpasses them all in terms of food quality and decor. The price is a bit high, and the service is Hanoi-lacksadaisical (part of our order was forgotten). Overall, a great experience and delicious meal.

name: Hanoi Gourmet
address: 6T Ham Long Street, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Hanoi Gourmet was first established in 1997 and in June 2012 was re-located to 6T Ham Long Street. Designed to reflect a Tuscan/Provence style, Hanoi Gourmet has a large selection of the finest imported wine, cheese and deli products as well as chocolates, biscuits, jams, cereal, fresh fruits, etc. The second floor has bistro and wine cellar style dining. We specialize in light lunches and evening meals based upon fresh salads, ham, sausage, many cheese varieties and delicious French bread - Foods that complement our large international wine selection. At Tet we specialize in the production of Tet gift baskets that are innovative and attractive.
cuisines: Late Night Mediterranean Restaurants in Hanoi
Middle Eastern Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Absolutely adorable. Everything is made with gf love. Waffles were beautiful. Well presented. Very quiet down a small ally. A gf diets dream. Must try everything!!! Pastries are to die for!

We found Hanoi Gourmet just around the corner from our hotel. It's a lovely spot for a quick lunch of a ham and cheese sandwich on a baguette with salad and a latte. We had a great chat with the son of the owner, who had designed the remodeled space. Worth ducking into.
Delightful deli with tapas-type plates accompanied by good wine (sold at retail prices. No restaurant mark up). Very popular with Vietnamese.

name: Lalina Kids Cafe & Restaurant
address: 9 Đường Tây Hồ, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description:
We discovered Lalina right after arriving to Hanoi, it was the first place I visited with my kid, and we loved it. We had never experienced that, a place where you can relax and eat tasty food, while your kid is having fun. You can watch your kids because it has the right size to look around, it is nice and secure, so you can talk with a friend or work knowing your kid is going to be ok ✨ 

The owners are the kindest people, and they take care of everything with so much love. We just celebrated our kid's birthday there, and it has been much more than we expected. Everything looked so great, the decoration, the light, and the bubbles while kids were arriving, made it extra special. Kids had the best time, and we could be relaxed, because they were taking care of everything. We were in their hands, and we appreciate it. We highly recommend this place, I think it is the best for kids and parents. We were impressed since the first time we visited, and we still are, always in our hearts ❤️
example_reviews: We discovered Lalina right after arriving to Hanoi, it was the first place I visited with my kid, and we loved it. We had never experienced that, a place where you can relax and eat tasty food, while your kid is having fun. You can watch your kids because it has the right size to look around, it is nice and secure, so you can talk with a friend or work knowing your kid is going to be ok ✨ The owners are the kindest people, and they take care of everything with so much love. We just celebrated our kid's birthday there, and it has been much more than we expected. Everything looked so great, the decoration, the light, and the bubbles while kids were arriving, made it extra special. Kids had the best time, and we could be relaxed, because they were taking care of everything. We were in their hands, and we appreciate it. We highly recommend this place, I think it is the best for kids and parents. We were impressed since the first time we visited, and we still are, always in our hearts ❤️

This is a great place to visit if you have small children under 10. There different play areas, each themed plus a ball pit with screen. For little girls there is an abundance of princess dresses to wear. Whilst your little ones are playing parents can relax with a wide variety of drinks. I recommend the Coconut Coffee, the best we had on our visit to Hanoi. If the family gets hungry, there is a wide variety of dishes. Cleanliness is a very high priority .

Two things that stand out about the place: nice and friendly staff and clean and child-friendly playhouse. I am so happy we picked Lalina for our boy's birthday party venue. The owner himself was hands-on, his staff were all very friendly and accommodating. They did all they could to cater to our request, especially the environment-friendly decorations. They were very helpful and made sure everyone was catered to. Food was great! It is also a clean and bright place for kids to play at. I highly recommend this place for families!

name: Tokyo Red Grill
address: 23 Phan Chu Trinh Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Delicious Japanese dishes in French Quater of Hanoi. It usually crowds in lunchtime caused by many offices out there. But for dinner, it is a very good place which quite and peaceful. Prices are reasonable.
example_reviews: Delicious Japanese dishes in French Quater of Hanoi. It usually crowds in lunchtime caused by many offices out there. But for dinner, it is a very good place which quite and peaceful. Prices are reasonable.

this joint is the best sushi I've had in Ha Noi hands down. Its in the middle of n office building which makes for strange ambiance but if you can tuck in with your partner, they have cute private booths where you can enjoy the food and each other <#
Among lots of Japanese restaurants in Hanoi, Tokyo Red Grill can provide a variety of Japanese dishes of best quality in a reasonable price. Sushi is also nice.

name: Ngân Đình Hanoi Restaurant
address: 360 Kim Mã 2nd Floor - Hanoi Daewoo Hotel, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Located on the 2nd floor of the iconic Hanoi Daewoo Hotel, Ngan Dinh Hanoi Restaurant celebrates authentic Cantonese cuisine through finest ingredients. From the creative dim sum menu, to a selection of exquisite Chinese delights cooked with style and flair, Executive Chef Li from Hong Kong and the talented culinary team will impress even Hanoi’s most glamorous diners. 08 VIP dining rooms available for private event, business lunch or special occasion.
cuisines: BBQ Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
example_reviews: Yum Cha buffet lunch…in a fairly new 5 star hotel ! Impressive classy hotel foyer… restaurant has white table clothed tables.. Impressive comfy chairs..and expected classy fit out! It was a “ table buffet”..where U order a Yum Cha dish ,and it is brought to the table..next dish ordered, and the process continues. Order n eat!! Then, I turned over the menu, to discover Cantonese Roast Duck, and a couple of “ side dishes”. We were almost finished when discovering the back page .. so ordered a Roast Duck dish…!!! At first sight, it would have to be the best looking 1/4 Roast Duck, that I have seen to date.( and Cantonese Roast Duck, is my favourite dish !!! Looked absolutely “ perfect colour wise”..but lacked the flavour marinade , that is the epitome of Cantonese Roast Duck! Rate 4/10 The Yum Cha menu, is Very good, basic.(cf HK) no offal or deep fried taro , or savoury dumplings, etc, etc.. but what was available was 7.5/10. The service was a let down.. 3 staff for 5 tables ( 4..5.. and 3x2 diners) They were too occupied doing nothing, and had to virtually shout, to get their attention.. my arm was sore staying up! 3/10..a disgrace !!!

Mongolian food is, shall we say, interesting. It is a little bit Chinese and a little bit Russian and a little bit mutton and potatoes oriented. But here, at Silk Road, we were served a three course lunch (salad, soup, and main) that was a lovely blend of all of the above. It was such a pleasant luncheon and delicious too. The meat wasn't fatty or tough. The soup wasn't too salty. It was quiet inside, and well decorated, and the wait staff was intent on doing their jobs. It was a lovely lunch!
Dimsum was great, around 250.000vnd for a set, they have set A and B, only available for lunch! From 12-2pm everyday

name: Xoài Đu
address: No 1, Alley 5, Tu Hoa Street The Big Alley 5 And Between Intercontinental Hotel & Kim Lien Pagoda., Tay Ho, Hanoi 11207 Vietnam
description: Our service are Vietnamese coffee, cocktail and food. It is a beautiful hideaway and located between Intercontinental Hotel and Kim Lien Pagoda (one of the famous attractions for tourist). Our menu is many creative and delicious drinks. Local beers and ginger beers are must try at our place. Our place is open-air, friendly and great place for you to find a lot activities : Cocktail, Vietnamese Specialty coffee, Chess club, Events, Hand made & High quality products from local...
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Tay Ho
Fast Food Restaurants in Tay Ho
American Restaurants for Lunch in Tay Ho
European Restaurants for Lunch in Tay Ho
example_reviews: My fr led me to this hidden gem! Though small and a tad slow with the batch cooking, the food was out of this world. The beef noodle salad stole the show - simple, flavorful, and made with fresh ingredients. Must-try in Hanoi!

We had the pleasure of dining at Xoai Du Bistro during our recent stay at the InterContinental Hanoi Westlake. Their beef noodle soup was absolutely delightful, packed with fresh vegetables and a delightful nutty crunch from the peanuts. It's the perfect spot to unwind and enjoy a comforting, home-cooked meal. And for those with vegan preferences, they have a variety of plant-based options available. If you're looking for something a bit more interactive, they host chess gatherings every Sunday and even offer wine and coffee appreciation workshops.Xoai Du Bistro is truly a hidden gem worth seeking out.

Everything inside is neat and clean, what makes experience even more enjoyable. Cozy and lovely place to come for a bite to eat (and a drink if you want as well!). Tucked away and quiet spot near the lake. Loads of vegetarian and vegan options of both traditional Vietnamese and other fusion style dishes. Tried my first vegan Bun Bo, huge portion for a good price and really tasty! Staff are so fast with the service, and this place is popular with both locals and tourists.

name: Benaras Terrace Hanoi
address: A 25 Luxury Hotel 684, Minh Khai , Vinh Tuy, Hai Ba Trung, Hanoi Vietnam
description: BENARAS TERRACE: A Taste of Authentic Indian Cuisine in Hanoi BENARAS TERRACE is one of the newest branches in Hanoi of the famous BENARAS Indian restaurant chain in Vietnam. It is the perfect place for food lovers who want to experience the most authentic Indian cuisine. What makes BENARAS TERRACE different? 100% Indian chefs: All dishes are prepared by experienced Indian chefs, ensuring the authenticity of every bite. Natural ingredients: All ingredients are imported directly from India, ensuring freshness and quality. Healthy cooking: BENARAS TERRACE is committed to using no additives, no artificial colors, and healthy cooking methods. The amount of oil is also reduced by 80% to suit the Vietnamese taste. Professional and friendly service: The restaurant is staffed by professional and friendly Indian staff, ensuring a genuine and unique dining experience.
cuisines: American Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
example_reviews: Delicious food served in a calm and relaxing atmosphere… perfect brake! We loved it! Thanks to all the stuff! We will be back.
Wonderful food, wonderful stuff thank you very much food was very tasty. Place was very clean. Great sitting outside watching the world go by.

The food was excellent. Staff of the hotel were cooperative Service was also Excellent. Even the manager was very very good taking care of his staff and customers.in whole we are 100 percent satisfied.

name: Kiez Vegan Cafe & Bistro
address: No. 2A Alley 12 Dang Thai Mai Tay Ho, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Kiez - vegan cafe&bistro is a 100% plant-based, vegan coffee and bistro. We are driven by the motivation of offer a good and diverse alternative of vegan food with a tiny touch of Germany. Our dishes are made fresh, using only high quality ingredients.
cuisines: South American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: The first day we got there we bought something similar to kebab with bread, it was so good. The bread was crispy and tasted homemade. What was supposed to mimic kebab meat was amazing, really soft and flavorful. I, who usually have a hard time with textures, had no problems with this. Then a hamburger was taken which was served with several different toppings, everything was so good there too. Good "meat" and mix of vegetables. Everything felt carefully selected. The bread was soft on the inside and crispy on the outside. Just from this first dining experience, we have ordered from here every day since we arrived in Hanoi. Everything has been 5/5.

I love this place so much! It isn't my first time here😄 Delicious food, yummy beverages- I loved everything I have tried here so far! Also great vegan condiments & vegan products are available. Lovely atmosphere and a warm & welcoming team are always here😻 A heartwarming place with great food ❤️ Thank you so much for being so awesome😍

Ate at Kiez once or twice every week for like two years. Brunch, lunch, dinner, snacks are all fantastic. The staff, owners, and chefs are outstanding. The menu changes every few months so you get great new options constantly. Some of the best vegan flavors you've ever had! The butcher shop variety and chocolate chip cookies are must tries. Thank you Kiez for being consistently the best!

name: Quan Bun Cha Nem
address: 25 Gia Ngu Hang Bac, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description:
We went here in a small group with our tour guide.
It was busy but we got seated and ordered Bun Cha.
It was so tasty, that we will be going back for more! The restaurant is great, the food cooked out front, a great atmosphere, full of life and a fun experience.
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
example_reviews: We went here in a small group with our tour guide. It was busy but we got seated and ordered Bun Cha. It was so tasty, that we will be going back for more! The restaurant is great, the food cooked out front, a great atmosphere, full of life and a fun experience.

Hidden in this humble and small eatery is the best bun cha that I have tried during my stay at Hanoi. Had my first bun cha here as this place was strongly recommended by the hotel staff. I then tried bun cha at other places as well but I had to come back here because they really have the best taste. The pork and bacon were charcoal-grilled to perfection! Will definitely come back again next time!

This small restaurant is all about bun cha and there is a reason it can get crowded, it simply has fantastic bun cha. We were recommended by our hotel and were so glad we went. Delicious yet cheap. We had bun cha and ordered the crispy spring rolls to go with it. All were delicious and fresh. They even have ice cold drinks. While locals are the vast majority that eat here, they love foreigners and recently even added English to the small menu.

name: Tropicana Restaurant
address: 23 Dao Duy Tu Hang Buom, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Hi. Had beef spaghetti in dinner at this place. Its a nice place just next to the street and has a good vibe to it. Food is delicious with reasonable prices. Drinks are good too. Their staff is very courteous especially this lively female Poppy, who is very nice and tries her best to ensure that you enjoy a good meal. Good place to be at for friends, family, business or solo
cuisines: Thai Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
Vietnamese Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
American Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
example_reviews: Hi. Had beef spaghetti in dinner at this place. Its a nice place just next to the street and has a good vibe to it. Food is delicious with reasonable prices. Drinks are good too. Their staff is very courteous especially this lively female Poppy, who is very nice and tries her best to ensure that you enjoy a good meal. Good place to be at for friends, family, business or solo

The pizza here is very good and the Prices are reasonable. Especially considering that there aren't many places for Pasta and Pizza around than you might think. Poppy the friendly waitress was very kind and the service was also good.

We had a very nice dinner here. We had pasta and pizza. Both very well prepared and tasty. We also had the local beer which was very good. The prices are excellent! We where attended by Poppy and she was very nice and friendly. The local also has a very nice terrace to enjoy the view of the area. I would totally recommend this place and surely come back!

name: CCraft Beer Restaurant  -  45A Luong Ngoc Quyen
address: 45A Luong Ngoc Quyen Street, Hang Buom Ward, Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: The Vietnamese authentic taproom More than 50 types of C-Brewmaster craft beer Real Vietnamese foods
example_reviews: Large selection of both on tap and bottled craft beers. Cheap prices. Surprised this isn't more popular

He came here around 6pm and we were the only patrons- which was surprising- all the tourists were at the the bigger joints drinking Hoeegaarden and other bottled beers. We picked this beer garden because it offered Craft beer and boy were we surprised. It was amazing! We told the bar tender what type of beer we liked and she let us taste test a few before picking our beer. It really was the best beer in Vietnam or even Best beer in the world! More people should come and enjoy local beer- not the commercial stuff!!

I have tested 6 kinds of beers with the name of old streets as Hang Bac, Hang Bo, Hang Ngang, Hang Dao, Hang Bong and Nga Tu Quoc Te. Very excited place, a lot of people enjoy together in the crossroads of Ta Hien and Luong Ngoc Quyen Str. That’s real funny, but when you are falling in love of Ha noi, you must to try 🍺😀🥰 Cheers!

name: La Bete
address: Alley 431 Au Co Nhat Tan, Tay Ho, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Specialist in dry aging beef, lamb and pork (Wild Boar) . We are serving full range of dryaged beef from USDA Prime to Premium Hereford and Wagyu. Our pork is sourced from moutains of Northern Vietnam where they raised in a huge farm and running freely.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Good for me and my friends. I love steak here, the dry aged meat is so delicious. I will comeback soon. The space is also beautiful and suitable for dating
I think this is best dryaged steak in hanoi I've tried. It's the first restaurant dryaged about fish

Nice steak restaurant in the alley of Au co. Very nice atmosphere, quiet and friendly staff. Aged-beef was provided and it was nice. Starters and salad was very sophisticated and nice. One negative point was less dessert menu and no espresso to finish the dinner. But this is the steakhouse, enjoy the protein.

name: Hai Cang Noi Bai Restaurant
address: Noi Bai International Airport 4th Floor, Terminal 2, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Serving business lunch and delicious fast food that is inspired Vietnamese – European style and Hai Cang specialties, Hai Cang Noi Bai is suitable and convenient for quick and busy. Hai Cang Restaurant has an area of over 500 m2 and modern decoration with brown – yellow interior that is cosy, luxury and elegant, gives fantastic culinary space at Noi Bai International Airport.
cuisines: Asian Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
BBQ Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Airport restaurants come in all sizes and standards. Hai Cang at Noi Bai airport is definitely not the worst I have been to. My partner chose a Pho bo-beef noodle soup and was happy with that. I had a Ca chien kieu Anh and cannot complain. Ha Noi beer to go with it. .The staff was there but more interested in chatting to each other than caring for their guests. All in all, not the worst airport experience. Next time I will try one of the other restaurants at the airport. There must be something better!
Good Vietnamese food at a reasonable price in an airport. Very clean restaurant. English not so much. No Coke -Pepsi. Would eat hear again.

If you look like a Vietnamese, and started speaking English to the staff, they will start their bullying like assuming that you could not pronounce "hot" when you really meant "pot", and refuse to serve you as fast as those who did not look like Vietnamese. Not all of them were like that, some of them were nice, but those staffs who were not bullies were forced to apologize on behalf of those who were, thus an average 3 rating, otherwise, it would be 1 rating only. But why risk spoiling your mood with bullies working here, especially when you are honestly a different nationality but look like Vietnamese? To the restaurant, you might want to teach these bully staffs how to behave so that it is fair to your other nice staffs and fair to the customers as well.

name: Hummingbird Craft Beer Restaurant & Brunch
address: 56B Tran Quoc Toan, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: A cozy craft beer restaurant & bar serving up BBQ comfort food; BBQ ribs, chicken wings, chargrilled chicken, wraps, rice bowls, burgers, nachos, lamb kebabs & brunch.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Pizza for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
Seafood Restaurants for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: Popped in here with a friend for dinner on a Tues evening after work, it was very quiet. It was my first visit here and I loved the decor, it was just a shame it was lacking atmosphere. It was happy hour so we enjoyed 2for1 draft beers and shared two plates of food. The chicken nachos were fairly average, if it didn't have the tiny cubes of bland chicken meat it would have actually been better! However the lamb and flatbread with dips was simply delicious. The lamb was cooked beautifully and went very well with a skewer of chargrillwd vegetables, and I would happily order that again.

100% worth a visit if you are craving western food or are starting to get a bit bored with Vietnamese food for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The food is truly amazing, as is the service from both the owner and the front of house waiter. We never repeat restaurant on holiday but came back a second time which was just as good.

Great cocktail bar in the heart of Hanoi. Cocktails were stunning, beer was delicious and ice cold. The music and ambiance was perfect. Also the cool smelt and looked incredible (although we had already eaten). Will be back to try. Also we loved Frank!!

name: The Kneipe
address: 52 to Ngoc Van Str. Tay ho Dist, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: A modern German- American pub with authentic German food and some fusion. Atmosphere is nice and cozy with classic Rock and Roll music background which brings you back to the good old day. Live music at weekends and catering in site or outside is available.
cuisines: Late Night Mexican Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: Really nice band, nice German dishes, really good burgers. Good options of Draft beers and very good service from the attendants. Good experience!

Came here for the first time for an early dinner, it was a little odd being the only people in the bar, but like like said we were eating early We both ordered the curry sausages with a side each, mine was mash which was tasty and my husband had the side of potatoes and bacon which he enjoyed too, the other side of purple cabbage that came with the dish was tasty but I think would have been better warm not cold. For me the absolute standout was their pretzels, perfect blend of salty and doughy and I would come back again and again for those! Can't comment on th bar atmosphere on a typical evening but they played skme great chilled out music while we were there
Not a bad option for german food while taste is not super great for their homemade sausage and sauerkraut. Singer on thursday 6-8pm available. Cozy place for a drink too

name: Odeon Brasserie
address: 5 Tran Phu Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Come to ODEON and enjoy typical French Brasserie atmosphere in Hanoi.
cuisines: Asian Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
BBQ Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
example_reviews: We had the warmest of welcomes at this comfortable and friendly bar. The manager is helpful and chatty and her team are kind, caring and attentive. We made friends with Linh who we spent lovely hours talking to over a couple of visits. Linh's English is amazing and puts our non-existent Vietnamese to shame! She is an outstanding member of the team. I can't recommend this place highly enough for a relaxing drink and to watch the world go by.

What a great find. A bar/bistro on the edge of the Old Quarter with chill, unpretentious atmosphere, an amicable staff, and an impressive selection of whiskeys and beers. I happened on this place because it’s close to my hotel and paid a return visit because it’s got such a great vibe. Five stars.

We were in Hanoi for 4 days, staying in a hotel nearby. We came in here on the first night we arrived because it was close and I am so glad we did. They make fantastic cocktails and a good selection of Vietnamese craft beer. We liked it so much we ended up coming every day we were here, later discovering that it is a great place to watch the hustle and bustle of Hanoi and to see the train passing down Train Street. The food here is also of astounding quality, the atmosphere is relaxed and the staff are extremely friendly. If you're looking for somewhere to chill out for a few hours, have a nice bite to eat, a few drinks, and watch the world go by I don't think there's a better place in Hanoi.

name: Bella Vita Italian Restaurant
address: 48 Tô Ngọc Vân, Quảng An, Tây Hồ, Hà Nội, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Brilliant spot serving a great range of real Italian food. We had some drinks and anti-pasti followed by some steak. Honestly the best fillet steak I have eaten in Hanoi. Cooked on a real fire. Normally I much prefer rib eye but this was so tender and full of flavour. He also tried the cocktails which were very good. There is a beautiful dining room but we chose to sit in the cosy outside area.
cuisines: Late Night BBQ Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: Brilliant spot serving a great range of real Italian food. We had some drinks and anti-pasti followed by some steak. Honestly the best fillet steak I have eaten in Hanoi. Cooked on a real fire. Normally I much prefer rib eye but this was so tender and full of flavour. He also tried the cocktails which were very good. There is a beautiful dining room but we chose to sit in the cosy outside area.
My husband and I ate here our last night in Hanoi towards the end of the Lunar New Year and we were thrilled they were open. The food was delicious as was the wine and we loved the atmosphere.
Amazing food. If you want to get in Hanoi original Italian burrata and pasta which is made in from of you by Italian owner with excelent taste this is the best place to go

name: Banh My PaTe
address: 11 Hang Ca Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Traditional Vietnamese sandwich with over 30 years of history. Vietnamese sandwich or another name called “pate bread” have mix dishes like eggs, hotdog, vegetables. The crispy hot crust, delicious fillings. Vietnamese people eat pate bread every day at every meal. Street food is extremely cheap, only about 1 USD for one. Traditional Vietnamese flavors that you can not miss when coming to Hanoi.
cuisines: Late Night Mediterranean Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: Good variety of Banh Mi here at good prices, mostly around VND 25,000. Banh Mi toasted crispy. You can sit on the small stools and watch people go by.

This is the place you want to go to have Banh Mii... At the street, next to the famous "Banh Mii 25"...has no comparison. Delicious local ingredients, and THE BEST PATE EVER!! so cheap as well, you can have 2 , 3, you can't stop eating. I have been here so many times I can't count
Best Bahn mi in Hanoi. I have tried Bahn Mi 25 and this one was my favourite. Authentic local Bahn mi place for the proper Vietnamese street food experience.

name: Quán Abc
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi

name: Huyen Dung Restaurant
address: 4 Ly Thai To Street, Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Located in the center of the Old quarter of Hanoi, right near the Hoan Kiem Lake.The restaurant offers high quality of Vietnamese food, for every pocket's budget. In the restaurant you can enjoy our family and friendly atmosphere: most of our costumers are regular costumers. We invite you to try our traditional food, made to the top quality everyday !
cuisines: French Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: We searching for a local Vietnamese restaurant and we found restaurant by accident. Many choices of food, rice, noodle, hotpot, salad with a reasonable price. English menu is available and staffs can speak english

This place is the one if you want something that is clean and done in a prober kitchen. Nice staff - with a prober menu card - and food is average but better than soooo many other places on the street. Prices are defiantly reasonable - and shopping just outside the door.

This place is small but the customers love it as there are testimonials all over the walls. I watched my pho cooked immediately out front of the restaurant and it was served as I sat down. It was excellent, even on a stiflingly hot day.

name: Bia ZUBR
address: 103 Nguyen Truong To, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Turned into our local bar while in Hanoi for 3 days. Great selection of beers,snacks, never tried the full food menu to be honest. But a great watering hole,owner very helpful and friendly along with a happy and cheerful staff. Recommend highly if your in the area.
cuisines: European Restaurants with Buffet in Hanoi
French Restaurants for Breakfast in Hanoi
German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Turned into our local bar while in Hanoi for 3 days. Great selection of beers,snacks, never tried the full food menu to be honest. But a great watering hole,owner very helpful and friendly along with a happy and cheerful staff. Recommend highly if your in the area.

Taste is almost like in the Czech republic. Dumplings could be thicker. Small portion for the price. Great draft beer 65k for 500 ml. Good wifi and possible to pay by card. On menu I missed svickova. (Vegetable, cream sauce)

The Czech beer is quite good, as you would expect. We tried the salami appetizer, and it was pretty good. Three of us had the chicken schnitzel and I had the pork schnitzel. I would say it was decent food. The chicken was more successful than my pork, which I found too heavily breaded, a little greasy, and the breading didn't stick well to the meat. It was a nice change from all the Asian food.

name: Chef Dzung's BBQ & Hotpot buffet
address: Level 2, No 71 Nguyen Chi Thanh, Lang Ha, Dong Da, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: We went to Chef Dzung with friends on a weekend to eat the dinner buffet on the 3rd floor. There were too many people, narrow and there was too much noise. The price is acceptable for the quality. Food was fresh, service was quite good. If I get a chance to go there again, i'll go.
example_reviews: We went to Chef Dzung with friends on a weekend to eat the dinner buffet on the 3rd floor. There were too many people, narrow and there was too much noise. The price is acceptable for the quality. Food was fresh, service was quite good. If I get a chance to go there again, i'll go.
