Went here on my bday with my boyfriend. The price is same as other buffet grill restaurant in town. The food is ok seafood isn't fresh, nothing special compare to other restaurant (same type). The service is fine; however, some staffs when we called they just ignored us. Should give it a try.
This restaurant serves various foods for buffet (raw and cooked seafood, meat, soups, deserts, salads, Vietnamese traditional food...)

name: Quán Cơm Tay Cầm
address: Số 5 Ngõ Tràng Tiền, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Delicious food gives the warm feeling of a family meal - the restaurant is delicious, reasonably priced, clean. Most impressive, the owner is also a friendly and likable chef, the music is gentle and suitable for the warm space. I will come back and introduce my friends to the restaurant to enjoy other dishes
cuisines: Late Night Thai Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: Delicious food gives the warm feeling of a family meal - the restaurant is delicious, reasonably priced, clean. Most impressive, the owner is also a friendly and likable chef, the music is gentle and suitable for the warm space. I will come back and introduce my friends to the restaurant to enjoy other dishes

Simple but clean place, very central. Attentive service, although not very multilingual. A good start with spring rolls with original filling, then a vegetable soup to introduce the next dish of spaghetti (rice?) with seafood which we were unable to finish due to the quantity. All for less than €8 for two!

This was a tremendous meal - a real find on a back street. Chinese influenced Vietnamese - fried rice with chicken, caramelized fish, steamed water spinach. Small and unassuming. Kudos to the US Embassy advance staff, who presumably found it for a visit by the US Secretary of State. We are only in Vietnam for a short visit but we are definitely going back to this gem of a restaurant before we leave.

name: Restaurant Binh 86
address: Gom Nhat Tan Street Thai Phu, Noi Bai Airport, Soc Son, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Located in a prime location near Noi Bai International Airport, The Restaurant Binh 86 is an ideal destination for diners to rest and relax after tired flights or prepare for business trips away from home Interesting tour. Traditional space, open design with a diverse menu bringing together famous chefs in Vietnam, building a menu of delicious delicacies promising to be a restaurant near noi bai
example_reviews: This restaurant was suggested by our hotel, Airport Classic Hotel, which was nearby. I had the grilled shrimp with salt and chili, which was delicious. My wife had roasted chicken with ginger, which was good but my shrimp was better. I drank draft beer that was tasty and very cold. The staff was very attentive and friendly, and the prices were very reasonable. We ate quite early and by the time we were finished, many locals were there. Give it a try!

We came here as it was close to the airport classic hotel that we stayed in the night before returning to UK. it is a family run restaurant and very popular with the locals. It serves cheap draught beer which was very good. The staff found a couple of westerners in the restaurant quite amusing I think judging by the looks we were getting, but they also were very pleasant and did their best to look after us. The menu is also for locals with dishes that you will not see in the tourist areas of Vietnam, chickens feet, toad and bile secretion to name but a few. There were more usual dishes too, we had a chicken dish and some rice and chips which were good. I should add that the prices were extremely cheap

We were expecting a restaurant with pizza and fruit smoothies per another review, so perhaps that review belongs elsewhere since they serve neither. Extensive menu, almost too many choices. Once we were there we couldn’t leave with so few other choices around the airport. There were lots of locals by the time we left and it seemed like a popular place for draft beer. We enjoyed the grilled shrimp with chili although not much flavor on its own. Nice to have an English menu and Google translate helped. Friendly staff but not one of our better meals in the past three weeks in Vietnam.

name: Nhà Hàng Nhật Toshi Fusion
address: 26 Trần Hưng Đạo, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Skilled and smiling staff who introduced and cooked the menu of fresh ingredients and cow meat at the table for One Pot. A fantastically lovely experience. In addition, appetizers and an aperitif at the house's expense.
cuisines: South American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Skilled and smiling staff who introduced and cooked the menu of fresh ingredients and cow meat at the table for One Pot. A fantastically lovely experience. In addition, appetizers and an aperitif at the house's expense.
The place so Japanese, the food is good, the service also good and enough, all fresh seafood and vegetables. Enjoying Japanese food in vietnam
My family and I had dinner here and the staffs were very supportive. All dishes were nicely decorated! Especially the sashimi, fresh and delicious 👍🏻

name: Delisa - Fresh Salad Bar Hanoi
address: 8A Ly Dao Thanh Street, Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Delisa aims to satisfy the crave of not only salad lovers in Hanoi but also those who want to enjoy healthy and delicious food but lack time to prepare them. We use fresh ingredients, traditional recipe, and homemade sauce to give you an authentic taste. All food is made with love and care of the owner and Chef. We have a wide range variety of salad, wholegrain baguette, and smoothies for you to enjoy.
example_reviews: Delicious, fresh, generous portion of salad and a lovely smoothie. The restaurant is light and clean with mellow gentle music. Service was with a smile and a well set out menu that was easy to understand. Everything about this little restaurant was good. Unfortunately I ate my food before writing this, so no photo
Very good food, fresh and delicious. The only bad thing it’s that smells a little like fish (my mother doesn’t eat seafood) and the entrance is not to clearly pointed.
spectacular! delicious and very fast! would come back everyday. Clean, fast, fresh! Good price quality. We love it!

name: Che Ba Thin
address: 1 Bat Dan Quan Hoan Kiem, Hanoi Vietnam
description: The best sweet soup in Hanoi old quarter! I love "Xoi che" most. Even it's not cheap like other Vietnamese sweet soup, but its taste is very good.  Foreign visitors should try it!
example_reviews: The best sweet soup in Hanoi old quarter! I love "Xoi che" most. Even it's not cheap like other Vietnamese sweet soup, but its taste is very good. Foreign visitors should try it!

Unassuming stall here have been serving Che, a form of Vietnamese dessert since 1930. The menu changes according to seasons. Hot day like this you will want to stop for a bowl of che or if you like, you can mix everything in a cup with ice. The main ingredients are mung beans, grated coconut, and kidney beans. Stop by and sit on the stool like the locals or have it on the go.

Came to know about this dessert shop on TripAdvisor and I tried it when I was in Hanoi. Staff couldn't understand English so I show him a photo of the dessert which I want. I sat on a stool by the roadside to eat the bowl of bean, sticky rice, coconut, ginger with some sweet sauce added to it. It is surprisingly nice! Highly recommended!

name: Minh´s Family Cooking
address: 2D Ta Hien Street, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Great experience, in the middel of beer street. We tryed the meat BBQ and a couple of beer, costed us 280.000. Staff friendly, and gave us a hand, since it was our first time trying it. Great taste.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Great experience, in the middel of beer street. We tryed the meat BBQ and a couple of beer, costed us 280.000. Staff friendly, and gave us a hand, since it was our first time trying it. Great taste.
This place was absolutely delicious.. We ventured back twice (something we don't usually do) as we really enjoyed it, can't rate this place highly enough

A great place to go for authentic food in the heart of the Old Quarter. It specialises in hotpot and barbecue. We had the seafood hotpot - great value at 200,000 for two. Delicious, fresh, quick and cheap. Very good friendly service and lively street atmosphere.

name: Nguyen Sinh
address: 17 Ly Quoc Su, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: This shop seems to be around for a long time. As usual, they don't welcome you in but you just need to step in. They will hand over the menu to you. The beef steak is above average but the price you paid, it is decent. The banh mi and pate was better though slightly pricy.
cuisines: American Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
Asian Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
example_reviews: This shop seems to be around for a long time. As usual, they don't welcome you in but you just need to step in. They will hand over the menu to you. The beef steak is above average but the price you paid, it is decent. The banh mi and pate was better though slightly pricy.

We ordered a simple banh mi and they ended up brining us the most expensive one on the card. Well, we ate it anyways and it was very good but compared to the customer service i would recommend other banh mi places that serve a bigger variety and have friendly staff.

The first banh mi I had here was good. The bread was really great and the pate was really good. I mean really good pate. My first sandwich had a decent amount of meat. I return two other times and got less meat each time. That was a disappointment.

name: Trau Ngon Quan
address: 15 Lê Văn Thiêm, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description:
it seems doing well with water buffalo meat chain Trau Ngon Quan. There are many of them now in Hanoi. We got to this place with a tip that this offers local draft beer (Bia Hơi).

As usual, it's local beer joint type restaurant. Very large open place, very crowded. lots of people, very noisy. zô zô everywhere 🤣🤣🤣.

as usual, all the disks are very dilicious. draft beer was nice.

prices were not so expensive. Staffs were friendly.

will be back.
example_reviews: it seems doing well with water buffalo meat chain Trau Ngon Quan. There are many of them now in Hanoi. We got to this place with a tip that this offers local draft beer (Bia Hơi). As usual, it's local beer joint type restaurant. Very large open place, very crowded. lots of people, very noisy. zô zô everywhere 🤣🤣🤣. as usual, all the disks are very dilicious. draft beer was nice. prices were not so expensive. Staffs were friendly. will be back.

name: Cha Ca Lao Ngu Restaurant
address: 171, Thai Ha Street, Lang Ha Ward, Dong Da District, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Definitely one of the best "Cha ca" restaurant in town with very reasonable price. also with quick service and nice staff.
example_reviews: Definitely one of the best "Cha ca" restaurant in town with very reasonable price. also with quick service and nice staff.

I have visited this place more than 3 times during a week as it offers best Hanoi grilled fish. Unlike other restaurants serving similar dishes, it also serves fish congee and fried fish rolls. These dishes must be tried at all cost. The price is reasonable. Service is fine. However it is often packed with guests at noon time. Make sure you phone to the restaurant to for booking first and try to be on time. The old owner seems to be grumpy to late comers :-)

Hanoi is famous with many special food, one of that is ‘Cha Ca’. In Hanoi, there are several restaurants famous for Cha Ca such as La Vong, Thang Long, Lao Ngu, Gia Ngu. I had tried 3 of 4 restaurants above and Lao Ngu is one of my most fav restaurant. The grilled fish is very fresh, the shrimp paste is delicious & suit your taste 😍 Also after the meal, u will be served tofu & hot green tea to remove the smell of shrimp paste, only at Lao Ngu u’ll experience this :)

name: Bay Buffet Restaurant
address: 167 Hoang Ngan Cau Giay Dist., Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Located in most beautiful location in urban Trung Hoa Nhan Chinh - golden land of Hanoi and Tay Ho, Bay Buffet Restaurant with modern space, impressive design promises to be one of the interesting options for gourmet taste. With more hundreds of dishes tasty, delicate, made from the skillful hands of professional chefs and service quality, Bay buffet is ideal location to organize large and small events, or simply just as the family, friend reunion dinner. Come to the Bay buffet to experience and discover a unique space!
example_reviews: Fresh, taste ok! Friendly staffs always crowded! The car park is a little bit far! Reasonable price!

Stepped in by chance, crowded with families , you find more or less all food you can find in 5 star venues in good quality, mainly seafood and sushi, salads , fruits , price was 380.000 total. Drinks extra. If you are hungry this place is ok, has some food court atmosphere . Prefer for lunch .
We’ve been there for a company function with our Hanoi team. Ideal for functions with many participants and good and large selection of dishes. Reasonable priced for the services received

name: Dim Sum Corner
address: 182 Hang Bong Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Best dim sum in town. Serving noodle in Saigon's style as well.
cuisines: Asian Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
BBQ Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Don't waste your time. Other dimsun restaurant nearby was busy so we tried this place. Nicely decorated with Hong Kong and Bruce Lee memorabilia. Got to table waited about 5 minutes for a menu. Finally ordered dumplings and sweet corn soup. Dumplings were nothing special and soup was too sweet. The bill for 9 Dumplings and soup was over 200 VND. Atmosphere was cold, staff couldn't have cared less if we were there or not. Had to get there attention for the bill. There was only 1 other group. Go elsewhere for a better meal and experience.
The dim sum is really good here. Service was a bit slow but friendly. We loved the spicy wontons and steamed shrimp dumplings.

We had a variety of Steamed Dumplings. So fresh and tasty, we actually watched them making a fresh batch. Not much ambience, very busy however service was quick, food excellent and prices very affordable.

name: Kaiba
address: 16 Phan Chu Trinh Str. Hoan Kiem Dist, Ha Noi Rooftop Corner Stone Building., Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Kaiba sushi is a Japanse restaurant being well-known for: All ingredients and seasonal fishes are flesh and directly imported from Japan. Food are made under skillful hands of chef and cooks with years of experience. Ensuring food safety.
example_reviews: The restaurant is located on the rooftop of the office building. The space is spacious and airy, with a super beautiful garden. The food is authentic Japanese. Diverse menu. There is a delicious puffer fish dish here, but you have to order it in advance. If you come and not order in advance, it won't be enough. I recommend Ozaki beef. The staff introduced it as a premium beef. The meat is tender and juicy and delicious. Attentive service, extremely thoughtful hostess. In general, this is my favorite restaurant and I always recommend it to friends and partners.

The food is delicious. I often eat Japanese food, so the food here is very Japanese, and the fish is also fresh. The garden space is airy, sitting outside is better than sitting in a private room. The staff are also attentive and enthusiastic. In general, I like my stomach

the food overall tasted really good because they use fresh products. this is a high end quality fish with the prices not so high. we went there 2 times. once with a group of friends at night outside. and it was a great vibe with nice breeze. another time was at lunch with their lunch set. this place is for everyone. family and business or even friends.

name: Pizza Lovers Hang Ga
address: 103 P. Hàng Gà, Hàng Bồ, Hoàn Kiếm,, Hanoi 000084 Vietnam
description: 🇵🇸🔻⚖️🕊️🔻 I’ve been here several times and I love both the service and the attentiveness to the taste and value of the 🌿vegan cheese pizza. ⚖️🇿🇦 🕊️🇪🇸🇵🇸 Other items rely on murdering animals or using their secretions. I would recommend the medium-sized version of the vegan cheese pizza 🇵🇸  - particularly if you’re dining alone, are especially hungry and are not having any sides. 🇵🇸🇲🇲🇵🇸🏴󠁧󠁢󠁥󠁮󠁧󠁿🇵🇸❤️ It will be more than enough!  If you order the fries, these are more like wedges and are very pleasant too, but a word of warning - they come with separate servings of بندورة  🍅 tomato ketchup and mayonnaise, the latter of which may not itself be vegan. 🇵🇸🌿🇻🇳🇵🇸 I suggest just asking for ketchup instead. An Apartheid-free Palestine, from the Jordan River to the Mediterranean Sea, this pizzeria is welcoming to everyone 🧕🏽🔻🍉🌿🕊️🧔🏻‍♀️🇻🇳🔻🇵🇸!
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: 🇵🇸🔻⚖️🕊️🔻 I’ve been here several times and I love both the service and the attentiveness to the taste and value of the 🌿vegan cheese pizza. ⚖️🇿🇦 🕊️🇪🇸🇵🇸 Other items rely on murdering animals or using their secretions. GOOD PIZZA, GREAT SERVICE, GUYS WHO DO EVERYTHING TO SATISFY YOU, POSSIBILITY 'TO DRINK BEER, CLEAN RESTAURANT

name: Pho Hanh
address: 65 Lan Ong, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: We loved this restaurant which is tucked away down an alley. They only serve one dish and it is excellent. We will be going back again! It was full of locals 👍🏻
cuisines: Eastern European Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: We loved this restaurant which is tucked away down an alley. They only serve one dish and it is excellent. We will be going back again! It was full of locals 👍🏻

Ended The Night With The Beautiful Street Of The Famous Local Vietnamese Delicacy Of “White Kampung Chicken” With “Keuy Teow” White Chicken On The Street Along Old Quarters ☺️ Thankful to Carter Chadway for bringing us around the street of Hanoi ☺️

If you blink, you will miss the entrance to this excellent pho place. Opens at 6PM....so the small tables and stools are set up on the sidewalk in front the front and across the street. Or you can go down this narrow alleyway/corridor to some interior tables. Their specialty is 'pho ga'.....chicken pho in soup or the dry variety. I was lucky to find this little hidden gem and you should seek it out also if you wish to experience real authentic pho.

name: 1915Y Grille6 Restaurant
address: 54 Trung Hoa Cau Giay, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Lovely staff, really great food. Thanks for making our first meal in Vietnam so amazing! The ambiance was really good as well, sit upstairs!
cuisines: Thai Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
Vietnamese Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
American Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
example_reviews: Lovely staff, really great food. Thanks for making our first meal in Vietnam so amazing! The ambiance was really good as well, sit upstairs!

After the commantaire's so kind people leave the reviews on the 1915y restaurant, I want to eat well so I went to dinner, it was really delicious !!! a green mango salad, cold rolls, a tender green pepper beef on a hot plate and to finish a superb fish dish prepared in 4dischs and green leaves had an amazing taste of oyster flavors. a carrot juice and two beers. all this costs 1155000 dong, = 45 € for 3 people, with friends, we can not take desserts, eat too much. To recommend this restaurant and a young master hotel Mr van is too kind as the other hostesses are so helpful. all give off the charms of Hanoi ...

On my daughter's birthday. My family came this restaurant to have a small party here. The foods were delicious with traditional lavour. The staffs were very polite and religious. I think this place suit for meeting friends, couples and family. The price suit for everyone.

name: My Oshi 03
address: Số 9 Ngõ 25 Triệu Việt Vương, Hanoi Vietnam
description: The food in this place is outstanding. We are expats in Hanoi and we come here once a week and to be honest that's not enough. I can't even recommend something to eat as everything is so tasty (but curry chicken ramen is a personal favourite) excellent service, outstanding value, great portions and all round treat of a place to come. Make sure you're hungry!!! It's worth taking a 10min grab from the old quarter to experience in my opinion Hanoi's best Ramen.
cuisines: Seafood Restaurants for Breakfast in Hanoi
South American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: The food in this place is outstanding. We are expats in Hanoi and we come here once a week and to be honest that's not enough. I can't even recommend something to eat as everything is so tasty (but curry chicken ramen is a personal favourite) excellent service, outstanding value, great portions and all round treat of a place to come. Make sure you're hungry!!! It's worth taking a 10min grab from the old quarter to experience in my opinion Hanoi's best Ramen.

Best place to get ramen and Japanese curry with a very reasonable price as well! I've visited many ramen places across Hanoi and this restaurant cannot be beat.You can tell the head chef/owner is passionate and cares about each dish. My favorite is the miso ramen which had a rich flavor while not being too salty like others I've tried. The noodles are very filling and delicious! I've recommended this to many people I know and taken my friends on multiple occasions. Must try!!
Second time eating here. Service is great and the staff are extremely friendly and the Ramen is even better.

name: Ministry of Men Concept Lounge
address: 44 Ly Thuong Kiet, Tran Hung Dao, Hoan Kiem Melia Hanoi Hotel, Hanoi Vietnam
description:
Ended up coming here twice this week. Had a social group Tues which is the first time I had been here, and all of us ladies were impressed with the bar, decor and friendly staff.
So much so a few of us were persuaded to go back on Friday night for a free flow prosecco evening they were having which was so much fun. Friday evenings are busy though so possibly best to book a table in advance.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Ended up coming here twice this week. Had a social group Tues which is the first time I had been here, and all of us ladies were impressed with the bar, decor and friendly staff. So much so a few of us were persuaded to go back on Friday night for a free flow prosecco evening they were having which was so much fun. Friday evenings are busy though so possibly best to book a table in advance.
The music and light are so awesome, i’m so into the signature cocktails and cigars. Service is the best. I love the atmostphere at here
Good, cool design and friendly staff. Recommend to try new experience. There is a library inside but unfortunately there a event so hopefully we can visit next time

name: BeTo Bistro and Tealounge
address: 1B Hai Ba Trung Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: great service, nice dishes, calm and cozy place. absolutely visit again! 모든 것이 잘 정돈된 레스토랑입니다. 음식이 맛있었고, 응대도 빠르며 훌륭합니다. 인테리어도 깔끔하고 산뜻해서 가족 모두 만족한 브런치타임이었어요!
example_reviews: great service, nice dishes, calm and cozy place. absolutely visit again! 모든 것이 잘 정돈된 레스토랑입니다. 음식이 맛있었고, 응대도 빠르며 훌륭합니다. 인테리어도 깔끔하고 산뜻해서 가족 모두 만족한 브런치타임이었어요!

Stopped here for lunch with family of 5. English menu available we had steak / ribs/ special rice with chicken. Good portions although rather too much sauce on the steak. Delicious cocktails too. Entrance hidden behind a large food stall.

The restaurant ambience is typical local. The food is good ( their speciality as beef are good) The Personal is playing with their phone instead of doing the service witch is pity because can be a very good place. The place is on the first floor

name: King BBQ Hai Ba Trung
address: 20 Hai Ba Trung Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: King BBQ is the brand of a Korean barbecue restaurant chain developed by Redsun-ITI Corporation bringing original Korean cuisine to Vietnamese customers. What makes the difference from these other restaurants is the food, especially Korean popular barbeque beef made by 40-year-experienced Korean Chef Park Sung Min.
cuisines: Late Night Sushi Restaurants in Hanoi
Late Night Vietnamese Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: Meats bbq perfectly by staff who can speak Chinese. Very satisfied with service of a 20years old waitress that recommended us on what to order from our buffet menu. My family enjoyed our dinner.
we had fun, beer and BBQ. staff was friendly. let us stay longer than opening hours. Korean style but finally we can get hot chilli
The men and women here are friendly and also the service is fantastic. One of the better locations for BBQ around Hoan Kiem Lake. Thank you King BBQ for the entire great experience.

name: Green Inn - Plant-based Restaurant
address: 41 Hàng Nón, Hanoi Vietnam
description: A Haven In The Heart Of Hanoi. Located on Hang Non Street, bustling in the heart of Hanoi, Green Inn always strives to create a sense of tranquility and gentleness for diners when they come to enjoy their meal. Like a sanctuary for vegetarian souls seeking tranquility amidst the bustling and crowded Old Quarter, Green Inn serves as a place for those looking for peace in the heart of the lively ancient streets. As you step through that small wooden door, it seems like all the noise has been left behind. Bringing Vietnamese Culinary Culture To Foreigners. Green Inn not only aims to promote the growing popularity of vegetarianism among everyone but also hopes that foreign guests, who follow a vegetarian diet, can still enjoy traditional Vietnamese dishes. That's why Green Inn aims to offer Vietnamese dishes with familiar and refined flavors. All vegetarian dishes at Green Inn are inspired by traditional Vietnamese cuisine, adjusted to suit different palates.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: The outside made us want to dine in this restaurant. We did the right thing. The welcome was very good. Being 8 people, we found a table in a quiet place. The mushrooms in donuts were excellent. For dessert we asked for fresh fruit that was not on the menu. We had 3 different kinds of fruit. Very good experience in a vegetarian restaurant for carnivores.

I found this restaurant by coincidence and it was the last and also by far the best meal during my four weeks in Vietnam. I went to the lunch buffet that takes place 3 times a week and the all vegan food was amazing. The best Pho in my life, phantastic choise of vegetables, mock fish and meat, even desert. 95.000 Duong including green tea! Everything had a different and unique taste. I took another portion away for a friend and they were extremely generous by giving me all kind of food containers. I just wish I had discovered this restaurant on my first day in Hà Noi.

The restaurant creates a peaceful ambiance, even though it is situated in one of the most bustling areas of Hanoi. The cuisine is delightful, healthy, and cooked with minimal oil, making it both satisfying and easy to digest. What's even better is the reasonable price (we have three girls and order 5 dishes and 3 drinks). Strongly recommend !

name: Banh Mi Zoon - Bami Bread
address: 33 Ngo Huyen Str Hang Trong Ward, Hoan Kiem Dist, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: We are one of the best restaurants in Hanoi. Our Banh Mi (Vietnamese Bread) are most special about taste, materials, etc and famoust with foreign travelers who come to Hanoi. We make sure will bring all best quality of Vietnamese breads to our customers. Please come for enjoying our Banh Mi !
example_reviews: It is good to taste the cake here. The menu offers a wide variety of sandwiches that you can order or choose from. The food is reasonably priced.
The sandwiches at this place are hard to beat. The menu offers many custom made sandwiches you won't find elsewhere. Price is equal to other places.
We had the pork/pate banh mi and it was by far the most delicious enjoyed to date. Even better, there were no issues with my hubby's "delicate" tummy.

name: Long Phung Restaurant
address: Rd Hoang Dao Thuy 2nd Floor, 29T2 Tower, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: The Chinese Cuisine has long been famous around the world. With its thousand-year history, the art of Chinese cooking is saturated with cultural impacts and uniqueness. Learning from its neighbours’ cookery, Long Phung Restaurant with its finest Chinese chefs, working with passionate, creative Vietnamese cooks, creates an interesting mix of Chinese dishes that can satisfy the Vietnamese’s palette.
cuisines: French Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: I was recommended this restaurant by a friend but I was totally disappointed. Service is not good, the waitress, at least the one who served us was not happy and conscientious. Most of the dishes are very oily and heavy as Chinese cooking style, but the seasoning is good enough. Space is quite small, and environment is very noisy (due to the guests).
Not very good, bad sausage, rice okay, chicken, beef not good, soup a little better. If I go again, I won't go, not delicious, expensive, few dishes, bad. General opinion.

name: Pho Vui
address: 25 Hang Giay Hang Buom, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description:
The restaurant is located in the busy area of the Old Quarters Hanoi near the busy Beer Street area. Family-run business. This is one of the local foodie blogger's favorites.

The large stock pot simmering in an open kitchen. Plastic tables with low stools spread out on the sidewalk. I ordered the Jumbo Special bowl. It is topped with sliced beef, fatty briskets. The broth is clear but beefy very rich taste, on the sweet side, and must be for simmering the beef bones and bone marrow. Squeeze some lime, add chile and some pickled garlic to take it up another notch. Make sure to order the quay, the fried chinese donut and dip it in. You can order lemon tea and some strong coffee from the lady across and she will bring it to your table.

The lady is happy with a smile and made sure that I enjoyed my bowl. Well-maintained and clean.
example_reviews: The restaurant is located in the busy area of the Old Quarters Hanoi near the busy Beer Street area. Family-run business. This is one of the local foodie blogger's favorites. The large stock pot simmering in an open kitchen. Plastic tables with low stools spread out on the sidewalk. I ordered the Jumbo Special bowl. It is topped with sliced beef, fatty briskets. The broth is clear but beefy very rich taste, on the sweet side, and must be for simmering the beef bones and bone marrow. Squeeze some lime, add chile and some pickled garlic to take it up another notch. Make sure to order the quay, the fried chinese donut and dip it in. You can order lemon tea and some strong coffee from the lady across and she will bring it to your table. The lady is happy with a smile and made sure that I enjoyed my bowl. Well-maintained and clean.

As a westerner with over 75 trips to Hanoi and my favorite cuisine being Pho Bo, I feel somewhat now ready to give this review. I have eaten hundreds of bowls of Pho Bo around Hanoi over the past 15 years and many bowls at Pho Vui, the happy pho place. They have the best. It is without question my favourite. I go back, and back and back again. Consistent every time and beautiful 😍
I order big mix beef pho on 12h pm, the portion is bigger than I thing. Its really delisious flavorful and alot of topping . Highly recommend for all guy visiting Hanoi

name: Buffet Poseidon Times City
address: Hầm B1, Tttm Vincom Mega Mall Times City, 458 Minh Khai, Hai Bà Trưng,, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Buffet Poseidon is the largest chain of hotpot, BBQ, and seafood buffet restaurants in Vietnam. Inspired by Poseidon, the Greek god of the sea, the brand is dedicated to bringing a diverse and exquisite culinary experience to all diners. At Poseidon, guests can enjoy a lavish selection of over 200 meticulously crafted dishes, with premium seafood as the highlight, including crabs, lobsters, mantis shrimp, sea snails, salmon, shrimp, squid, and many more delicacies. Diners are invited to indulge in an unlimited feast, featuring a fusion of Asian and European flavors, expertly prepared by top-tier chefs, ensuring an unforgettable gourmet experience.
cuisines: Mediterranean Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
Mexican Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi

name: Củi Restaurant
address: 31 Hoang Cau street No 3, Alley 31, Hanoi Vietnam
description: A Southern Vietnamese restaurant in the heart of Hanoi which offer an authentic taste in a green and quiet place with a nice touch of Indochina décor. Ideal corner for: - Business dinerA Southern Vietnamese restaurant in the heart of Hanoi which offer an authentic taste in a green and quiet place with a nice touch of Indochina décor. Ideal corner for: - Business dining - Couple - Friends & Family And for expat and international travelers to taste the authentic Northern Vietnamese food in the heart of capital.
example_reviews: Wow that was delicious! The restaurant is beautiful and the service was excellent. We were grateful for the man on the street who had signs in English asking if we were looking for the restaurant. There’s no signage and even though google maps showed us it was very helpful to have his confirmation that we were in the right place.

name: 37 Hùng Vương Restaurant
address: 37A Hung Vuong, Dien Bien, Ba Dinh, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Hệ thống Nhà hàng 37 Hùng Vương gồm nhiều cơ sở với món Phở, và các món ngon Việt Nam được giới thiệu phong phú và đặc sắc.
cuisines: French Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Everything in this restaurant tasted authentically Vietnamese and deliciously good! We ordered a feast and I super enjoyed the oysters! The staff were friendly and helpful. Especially the beautiful young lady at the reception. She took excellent photos of me and my daughter!
Although the stone bowl pho is a bit expensive, it has delicious broth, supple noodles, fresh meat, expensive but suitable quality, you should try it!

Cheap bia hoi, 12.000VND…this is outside the main restaurant and is like a beer drinking hall. If you are Aussies/Euros come here for drinking but I would not recommend ordering food. I ordered spring rolls and instead received these pork things steamed in banana leaf…I ate 2 of them, chewy and not that nice. When I got the bill and asked about the spring rolls after lots of laughing I had eaten 2 steamed pig knobs, wangers doodles, p3n1s. As a tough Aussie bloke not normally a hat I eat but I more feel sorry for the 2 pigs more than myself. if you love a steamed pig knob, check out the photos.

name: TungLok Heen
address: Hoa Lan, Vinhomes Riverside Long Bien, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Head Chinese Chef Adrian Chua is Singaporean and puts on a culinary extravaganza in extravagant surroundings. His presentations are spellbinding and served up by an amazing staff. Vui, Hien, and Nhan made our visit especially memorable.  Kudos for assembling a world-class team.
example_reviews: Head Chinese Chef Adrian Chua is Singaporean and puts on a culinary extravaganza in extravagant surroundings. His presentations are spellbinding and served up by an amazing staff. Vui, Hien, and Nhan made our visit especially memorable. Kudos for assembling a world-class team.

This is one of my favourite restaurants in hanoi. I've been in tunglok Singapore twice so this place is really brought me the "wow" feeling like I was in Singapore The decor concept is remained, the food have the same taste and staffs here are really nice & helpful I just wonder why the restaurants is not so crowded as it should be. I think they should promote it more one social

i was here with my family 2 weeks ago by the recomendation of my friend. i had heard many "wow" before really in here tasting this awesome dimsum and indeed it did not let me down even a bit. The dimsum is served in the traditional way with a a steamer, thin crust, spicy sauce and alot of meet inside. we also order some other dishes but dimsum's still impressed me most the total payment is quite high for the daily meal but worth for an outside family lunch/dinner

name: Cousins Tran Quoc Toan
address: 19 ngõ Doan Nhu Hai, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Western Cantine and Bar
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: If you're looking for western food at big-city western prices, I suppose you'll be happy. The ambiance here is really great. The service is impeccable. And the food was tasty - but the portions were really small for the high prices. The restaurant is located on a small, charming little alley. The bar is extensive but we didn't have alcohol. The pesto was delicious - but again, USD 2 for four tiny slices of ham was ridiculous.
Loved the extensive wine lists and their black squid ink risotto. Had a nice Prosecco to pair with and the bill was less than 60 for three people

My company had year end party in Cousins Tran Quoc Toan last Dec. Didnt know there’s a place like this in such a small valley Doan nhu hai. The resto was very warm and cozy, a fireplace during cold Hanoi weather inside a 100 years-old villa made our diner really impressive, not to mention we had great tarta beef and perfect trout with pasta. Since then, Cousins was one of my favorite place

name: Club Opera
address: 5 Dang Thai Than French Quarter, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Attentive service and tasty food. Had the usual spring rolls, bun cha and a very tasty mango salad. Ambience was lacking as it was dead - surprising for a Friday evening. At 60$ with no alcohol thought it was a bit pricey for Hanoi.
example_reviews: Attentive service and tasty food. Had the usual spring rolls, bun cha and a very tasty mango salad. Ambience was lacking as it was dead - surprising for a Friday evening. At 60$ with no alcohol thought it was a bit pricey for Hanoi.
Nice staff Starters are just alright nothing special Main course chicken was dry and cold very disappointing Not worthy of the price at all

We stumbled upon Club Opera while window shopping in the streets of the French Quarter. For hungry, clueless pedestrians, what a lucky find! Although we'd had several great food and dining experiences during our time in Vietnam, our dinner at this sweet little restaurant in Hanoi turned out to be the very best of all of them. In both flavor and presentation, our seafood dinners were excellent. We also very much enjoyed the ambience of the room which, similar to our hotel at the nearby Sofitel Legend Metropole, offers a historically elegant fusion of French and Vietnamese cultures. Like others, we agree that our meal was expensive by Vietnamese standards. Nevertheless, as New Yorkers enjoying a humongously generous USD-VND exchange rate, we cannot not fairly complain that our tab was inappropriate for such fine dining. We highly recommend Club Opera!

name: Khai's Brothers - The Hanoi Taste
address: 26 Nguyen Thai Hoc St., Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: The charming hundred year old temple at 26 Nguyen Thai Hoc Street. Khai's Brother is a wonderful destination that you really find a subtle service with the cultural treasure of Vietnamese cuisine in different traditional flavors. By the exclusive original tastes and dining experience, your feelings will be stylized as a part of the local followed by a variety of drinking, dishes offering under Lunch and Dinner Buffets
example_reviews: My first meal in Vietnam was lunch and what a treat. You enter the restaurant and out at the back there is a beautiful shaded courtyard with plenty of seating. Around the outside of the area is the food freshly prepared and cooked while you wait. It was very tasty and you could return to the buffet as many times as you wished. A good way to try local food and experience some new tastes. Staff very friendly and helpful.
We really enjoyed our options at this buffet style every style of cooking. Their patio is outstanding and setup is amazing.

Offering a range of traditional Vietnamese dishes, Khai's Brothers has a very pleasant atmosphere with good service and attentive staff. Whilst the prices were not as keen as other establishments in the locality, the setting is very relaxing and service was nicely paced.

name: Dong Phu 1932 Vietnamese Cuisine
address: 12 Hang Dieu Street Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: This restaurant has very nice, upscale decor, so you are dining upstairs in very pleasant surroundings.  The tables are nicely separated and the atmosphere is quiet and subdued.  Fortunately the food is a match for the nice surroundings.  We had fresh spring rolls, grilled catfish Hanoi style and lemongrass chicken, and tasty and very well prepared and presented.  They also have a few good wines, including by the glass.  Service was very efficient and quick.  This was a very nice dinner!
example_reviews: This restaurant has very nice, upscale decor, so you are dining upstairs in very pleasant surroundings. The tables are nicely separated and the atmosphere is quiet and subdued. Fortunately the food is a match for the nice surroundings. We had fresh spring rolls, grilled catfish Hanoi style and lemongrass chicken, and tasty and very well prepared and presented. They also have a few good wines, including by the glass. Service was very efficient and quick. This was a very nice dinner!

We discovered the restaurant simply by walking by and decided to take a look. The interior is really nice and the food even better. We loved absolutely everything we ordered there - Green Mango Salad with Prawns and Bamboo rice with Beef were definitely the highlights. Ended up going there twice simply because the food and service was so good.

We were walking by and saw this wonderful restaurant and decided to stop here for lunch. Food was beautiful, my friends soup came served in a beautiful bowl. We had beef in black bean sauce and beef with seasonal vegetables, all our dishes were lovely. Would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting Hanoi! Service was great too!

name: Phở Còi
address: 19 Mã Mây, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description:
Sometimes you walk into a place and feel at home, where the language differences  mean you cannot understand each other and yet  you do.

We ate a variety of spring rolls, which were delicious 
, however, tte beef and chicken pho was simply one of the best things I have ever eaten .

Go here, relax, have a beer and enjoy simple, beautifully cooked food. 

It doesn’t get much better than this
cuisines: Middle Eastern Restaurants with Buffet in Hanoi
example_reviews: Sometimes you walk into a place and feel at home, where the language differences mean you cannot understand each other and yet you do. We ate a variety of spring rolls, which were delicious , however, tte beef and chicken pho was simply one of the best things I have ever eaten . Go here, relax, have a beer and enjoy simple, beautifully cooked food. It doesn’t get much better than this
Excellent traditional Vietnamese food. The restaurant's space is clean, airy, beautiful, air-conditioned, and has live music, making eating sound like a real restaurant. Reasonable price.

Nice location in the middle of a very lively neighborhood, clean and beautiful sized dining room. very good local menu with fresh ingredients cooked before our eyes. Their specialty is phò, but don’t hesitate to try everything it’s top. The service is impeccable!

name: Indinam Restaurant
address: 33 Hang Bun Street, Ba Dinh, Ha Noi Ba Dinh, Ha Noi , Viet Nam, Nam Từ Liêm, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Indinam proud to bring the Indian Mughlai authentic food to the home town of Hanoi people and to my Indians fellows working in Hanoi & off-course for the foreigners tourist from North to south and east to west part of the globe who love Indian tasty food. We begin with slogan “TASTE IT LIKE IT“. Indinam brings not only Indian food also serves Vietnam authentic food in one umbrella who proudly say that the only One and the first one in the World INDINAM to bringing under one umbrella Indian and Vietnamese cuisine.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Nam Từ Liêm
Street Food Restaurants in Nam Từ Liêm
Korean Restaurants in Nam Từ Liêm
Healthy Restaurants in Nam Từ Liêm
BBQ Restaurants for Lunch in Nam Từ Liêm
Cafes for Lunch in Nam Từ Liêm
example_reviews: Popped in here on our second night in Hanoi,just around the corner from our hotel, very clean and welcoming,had a lovely,hot,spicy curry.service fast,staff pleasant.good price.
Only one Luxury and Tasty Restaurent in Hanoi who can give authentic North Indian food. Highly recommend all visitors to Hanoi should visit Indinam

The food and service in Indinam is incredible! I had punjabi chicken and the daal and it tasted amazing and looked good too! The staff were really friendly and accommodating and nothing seemed a bother with them! they always had a smile on their face and made me and my friend feel very welcome so I would 100% eat here again. :)

name: All Seasons Buffet - Da Nang
address: 193 Nguyễn Văn Thoại, Da Nang 550000 Vietnam
description: Welcome to All Seasons Buffet Da Nang, the pioneer in delivering an unparalleled dining experience with the introduction of Unlimited Lobster service. Our menu boasts an extravagant selection, featuring not only Unlimited Lobster but also an array of delectable seafood and over 50 local dishes. The unique twist lies in our innovative all-you-can-eat concept, where the buffet is served directly to your table, elevating your dining experience. Nestled in the heart of the captivating beach city, Da Nang, All Seasons Buffet offers an ideal haven for enthusiasts of Lobster and Seafood. The restaurant's charm is further enhanced by its industrial, rustic design, creating a gem-like ambiance for a memorable dining rendezvous.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Nang
Street Food Restaurants in Da Nang
Romantic Seafood Restaurants in Da Nang
South American Restaurants for Lunch in Da Nang
example_reviews: My daughter and I chanced upon this restaurant and thought it would be worth trying, given its clean and professional appearance, as well as its reasonable prices and moderate clientele. Upon entering, we were greeted warmly by the staff, who took the time to explain the menu and offer recommendations. We decided on the all-you-can-eat seafood option, which included complimentary water, although we did order additional drinks. We began by ordering a tower, and the waiter kindly offered to peel the prawns and crab for us. As we waited, we ordered another tower for four, and the food continued to arrive as we placed our orders. The cuisine was expertly prepared, aromatic, and flavorful. Dessert was also included in the meal. I would highly recommend this restaurant and was impressed by their desire for feedback on the service and food.

5 star Food fresh and delicious, choose more Top service, specialized people to remove chickpeas for you, very convenient There's half of the shrimp, taste fresh. Pricing economically affordable, will definitely come again to eat, also recommend to relatives

We celebrated my girlfriend's birthday here. It was very tasty. The staff is very fast and attentive. The choice of dishes is large and everything is quite tasty. I really liked that my girlfriend was brought out a separate cake and given a souvenir as a keepsake.

name: Xliii Coffee
address: Lot 422 Ngo Thi Si, My An, Da Nang 550000 Vietnam
description: XLIII Coffee is a coffee brand serving Specialty Coffee to customers who are always concerned about the taste of Origin. With the continuous efforts of excellent farmers worldwide, we will experience the true taste of this fruit. XLIII Coffee has been aiming to become a big, impactful company with social responsibilities, have access to high-quality raw materials and convey the complete original values of coffee to our customers. We follow the Five Strategies: Transparency | Traceability | Ethic | Responsibility | Transitioning Towards Sustainability XLIII Coffee transforms from the original brand - 43 Factory Coffee Roaster. We respect the achievements and values built since the beginning of the journey to discover the world of pure coffee and cherish the starting point of the first shop. On the journey ahead, XLIII Coffee continue to hold philosophy and maintain consistency in our overall activities, core values, and strategic direction.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in My An
BBQ Restaurants for Lunch in My An
example_reviews: We ordered a pour over using Finca Soledad Syndra roast, a single source bean from Peru. The pour over was clean, light, high acidity with floral tones. It paired well with the custard croissant we ordered. The cafe feels clinical, very clean, bright and basically furnished. The barista who made our pour over was knowledgeable about the bean and its origins, and informative about their brand and how they source their beans which are roasted onsite. We would recommend this to anyone who enjoys a good brew and reasonably priced beverages and pastries. We enjoyed ourselves while we were there.

If you are having too much of condense milked- Vietnamese coffee and fancy for more decent experience, it is where you should stop by. Relaxing atmosphere comfortable sitting demonstrated their keen on giving you a solely- coffee experience . They are very experienced and passionate in coffee beans. Staff can tell you all the stories about the beans.

Introduced by my friend as we are heavy coffee drinkers with espresso machine at home. The coffee is special with high score beans sourced directly from farm. The staffs are also very knowledgeable and give us very details about each type of beans, what method to use, which pastry is compatible with the coffee choice. Although the price may not be suitable for normal daily coffee dosage, we think it’s worth it

name: Le Petit Bistro Da Nang
address: 81/09 Phan Tứ, Da Nang 550000 Vietnam
description: Welcome to Le Petit Bistro Da Nang, where exceptional dining meets warm hospitality. Building on the success of our Hội An location, we bring the same cosy charm, exquisite cuisine, and attentive service to Da Nang. Your hosts, Peter and Thuy Lawson, ensure every detail reflects their passion for quality. Guests love our French, Italian, and European dishes, including Duck Confit, Beef Bourguignon, and Mediterranean-style Lamb Shank. Our handmade fresh pasta elevates dishes like Spaghetti Vongole, Napoletana Fusilli, Chicken & Mushroom Mezze Maniche, and Mushroom Pappardelle. With Peter’s family heritage in breeding Aberdeen Angus cattle in Scotland, we serve only the finest Aberdeen Angus beef. A warm, inviting atmosphere, paired with a curated European wine list and the owners' personal touch, makes every visit special. Discover an unforgettable culinary experience at Le Petit Bistro Da Nang.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Nang
Street Food Restaurants in Da Nang
Late Night BBQ Restaurants in Da Nang
Cafes for Breakfast in Da Nang
example_reviews: We decided to have dinner at Le Petit Bistro based on reviews and after looking at the menu. The restaurant and experience were amongst the best we've had in Vietnam. The authentically French food, ambience and staff were outstanding. We enjoyed talking to Peter who co-owns the restaurant with his wife. The chef also came and talked to us after we'd finished our meal. It was nice of them to take time to talk to us and we had nothing but positive feedback from them. As noted in other reviews, there are many high end French restaurants in Danang that charge near US prices. Peter noted that the restaurant is only a little over a month old and they want to build a customer base so are committed to providing the highest quality food, generous portions, at competitive prices. The meal we had last night would have cost three to four times what we would have paid in the US and we had superior service. Try this restaurant before everyone else figures it out!

A welcome contrast to Asian cuisine in a city with such a vast choice of seafood. This was without doubt the most enjoyable dining experience during our month long stay in DaNang. The French onion soup with garlic baguette was a generous bowl, but light and delicately sweet with a sprinkle of cheese. The ribeye was tender and cooked to perfection, medium rare, with beautifully seasoned fries and a creamy dauphinoise side. My partner had the Duck a l’orange which was cooked sous-vide style at low temp and it was tender and succulent. The desserts were also quintessentially French with Crème Brûlée and a Chocolate Soufflé to finish. We enjoyed meeting the English chef who clearly enjoys his profession and sourcing the very best ingredients for their menu. If you are looking for unpretentious sophistication with very reasonably priced menu then Le Petit Bistro is a great choice.

An alley located cozy restaurant with impressive service and crusine. Highly recommend the Duck A L’Orange served with Dauphinoise Potato 😋 Partner loves the Steak Frites Chargrilled House Cut of Steak with Rosemary Salted Fries, Garlic Parsley Butter. Thank you for arranging the window seat, we had a great night and looking for tasting menu next time we visit

name: Thìa Gỗ Restaurant Da Nang
address: 53 Phan Thuc Duyen, My An, Da Nang 50507 Vietnam
description: Located on one of the quietest roads of the city center and within riding distance to the attractions, Thìa Gỗ Restaurant Da Nang has received many praises to the sky about one of the best restaurants in Da Nang. Our menu features famous cuisine from Saigon and Mekong delta such as banh xeo, lau mam hot pot, southern pho, spring rolls, etc. Our restaurant also serves Vietnamese specialties for a variety of diners ranging from meat-free, vegetarian, muslim friendly and low-carb.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in My An
Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in My An
BBQ Restaurants for Lunch in My An
example_reviews: If you're in Da Nang and craving authentic Vietnamese cuisine, this cozy gem is a must-visit! From the moment you step inside, the warm, welcoming atmosphere makes you feel right at home. The menu is a delightful mix of traditional dishes, each bursting with fresh flavors and expertly crafted. Everything we tried was absolutely delicious – from the aromatic pho to the perfectly seasoned banh xeo. The best part? The prices are incredibly affordable, making it easy to indulge without breaking the bank. A special shout-out to Huy, the attentive and friendly staff member, who went above and beyond to ensure our dining experience was top-notch. His hospitality truly made the meal even more enjoyable. Highly recommend this spot to anyone in Da Nang looking for great food, excellent service, and a cozy vibe!

My family and I came here for dinner, and we were lucky to be seated right away because the food was sooo delicious here. Everyone was extremely happy about the price, serving size, and our waiter An was so friendly and helpful, thankfully he helped me eat Bánh xèo correctly bc I did it wrong the first time jahahah, would definitely recommend to anyone who comes here. Completely understandable that this restaurant has a Michellin star! If I come back to Da Nang in the future, I’ll definitely make it a point to return here 🥰

The food is very good. The beef bone broth of the pho is rich in flavor. The pho is soft and glutinous. The stir-fried vegetables are delicious and the price is reasonable. Baozhu can speak Chinese and help us order food. She is smiling and the service is very good. Thank you.

name: Thien Kim Restaurant
address: 166 Bạch Đằng, Da Nang 550000 Vietnam
description: Delicious, reasonably priced Vietnamese food -‘we tried some new dishes and everyone left full and happy! We had Bun Bo (beef noodle soup), Kebab rice noodle and Beef Rib Pho. All deciles (maybe the ribs could be cooked a little longer as it was a bit tricky to get it off the bone but I managed!. Just be aware they only serve beer if you are looking for a wine or spirit, just plan to go to a bar after dinner, but the kids enjoyed a sugar cane juice. But this is a great place for dinner and handy to take in the view of the Dragon Bridge.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Nang
Street Food Restaurants in Da Nang
Late Night Mexican Restaurants in Da Nang
Middle Eastern Restaurants for Lunch in Da Nang
example_reviews: Delicious, reasonably priced Vietnamese food -‘we tried some new dishes and everyone left full and happy! We had Bun Bo (beef noodle soup), Kebab rice noodle and Beef Rib Pho. All deciles (maybe the ribs could be cooked a little longer as it was a bit tricky to get it off the bone but I managed!. Just be aware they only serve beer if you are looking for a wine or spirit, just plan to go to a bar after dinner, but the kids enjoyed a sugar cane juice. But this is a great place for dinner and handy to take in the view of the Dragon Bridge.

Tienkim learned through the blog. I was visiting on a family trip and the store was cool and weaning, but it didn't take long. Bananas and pineapple fries were especially delicious! Now there is a 30% DC event at the receipt after using the nearby Lohaspa, so for those who are traveling, check out!

Close to Danang Airport Good for lunch. The store's cool, the food's cold. Six-year-olds eat well. From 12:00 p.m. to people. You'd better come a little early. Pineapple fries, chicken rice sauce, Fries, orange juice. Family of Three (I1) 52 million Waiting 10 to 15 minutes

name: Bếp Cuốn Đà Nẵng
address: 31-33 Trần Bạch Đằng, Da Nang 550000 Vietnam
description: I don’t normally go to the same restaurant twice when there is so many places to go, but we did here ! You should reserve a table as it gets busy from 6pm so if you don’t book expect to queue! First time we had beef noodles for my 9 year old he ate the lot with steak n chips! We had the beef rolls and they show you how to make it so don’t be afraid to try it, the chicken clay pot is amazing chicken very tender, morning glory with garlic and beef with peppers. The lemon grass juice is delicious, you can’t buy wine by the glass but they have a few cocktails and beers. They only thing is that they don’t do starters and main everything comes at once so the table can get very crowded and dishes can go cold while your trying to finish the wraps etc so I’d order as you go, staff are lovely the place is busy so second time we got there for 5.30 and was ok to sit inside in the aircon area.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Da Nang
Fast Food Restaurants in Da Nang
German Restaurants for Lunch in Da Nang
Greek Restaurants for Lunch in Da Nang
review_summary:
Bếp Cuốn Đà Nẵng has carved out a reputation for its cozy ambiance that masterfully combines modern and traditional Vietnamese design, creating an inviting space for diners. The value is lauded by many patrons, who appreciate the generous portions of authentic and flavorful Vietnamese cuisine at reasonable prices.

While service is generally highlighted as attentive and informative, helping guests navigate the menu, there have been occasional reports of inconsistency. The food consistently earns rave reviews for its freshness and variety, satisfying travelers in search of traditional Vietnamese dishes.

You should reserve a table as it gets busy from 6pm so if you don’t book expect to queue! First time we had beef noodles for my 9 year old he ate the lot with steak n chips! We had the beef rolls and they show you how to make it so don’t be afraid to try it, the chicken clay pot is amazing chicken very tender, morning glory with garlic and beef with peppers. They only thing is that they don’t do starters and main everything comes at once so the table can get very crowded and dishes can go cold while your trying to finish the wraps etc so I’d order as you go, staff are lovely the place is busy so second time we got there for 5.30 and was ok to sit inside in the aircon area.

This is a restaurant that serves delicious banh xeo. I chose the pork version. The staff taught me how to eat it. You put the banh xeo on rice paper, top with lettuce and herbs, and dip it in the sauce. It's said that it's better to blend the two types of sauce available. The portions are large, so if you're alone, this one dish is enough to fill you up. The non-alcoholic mojito was also incredibly delicious. It's clean, reasonably priced, and the food is reasonably high quality, so I think it's a convenient restaurant to visit. You can also take away any leftovers.

It was a great experience. I think I’ve never had such a tasting in vietnamese cuisine like i did in such a place. It’s common sense that when you see a crowd struggling for a seat in a restaurant it means that it’s a great one. Well it was a great one, yea, not because of the crowd, but rather the food was really excellent. It’s a place to go back to, whenever i visit Da Nang! 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

name: La Cabana - House of BBQ
address: 505 Đ. Trần Hưng Đạo An Hải Trung, Sơn Trà, Da Nang 55000 Vietnam
description: La Cabana is a Cozy Argentinian Steakhouse in Da Nang. Located right in front of Dragon Carp, Love Pier, Han River with amazing Dragon Bridge view, La Cabana has spacious space, comfortable seats, excellent air conditioner suitable for couple and group dining. Our sparkling balcony gives you an overall view of the Han river and Dragon bridge. La Cabana's signature includes perfect grilled Argentinian Steaks with a very reasonable price. Have yourself a memorable experience with soft music, excellent food, imported wine at La Cabana restaurant.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Nang
Street Food Restaurants in Da Nang
Sushi Restaurants with Private Dining in Da Nang
Thai Restaurants with Private Dining in Da Nang
Vietnamese Restaurants for Lunch in Da Nang
example_reviews: I found this place while looking for a restaurant that suits the local atmosphere rather than Korean tourists. I was able to eat Tomahawk for half the price in Korea, the owner was friendly, and I was able to get a T membership discount, which was nice. Satisfies.

Was the perfect location to see the dragon bridge light up. The staff were so attentive and the food excellent. The waiter was very friendly and attentive making sure we were completely happy with everything. One of the best meals we have had in na nang

This is a great restaurant for a steak dinner. Lots of family-friendly options too like pasta and hamburgers. We came on a Friday night and booked for 7.30pm. The timing was perfect as we were ready for coffee and desert by the 9pm Dragon Bridge show. Top tip: get your reservation in early and request a table upstairs on the veranda. When we booked the veranda was fully booked, but a group left around 8.30pm and the restaurant staff very kindly let us move tables onto the veranda for our desert. It was a great spot for the kids to see the Dragon Bridge show.

name: Le Comptoir Danang
address: 16 Che Lan Vien, Ngu Hanh Son, Da Nang 550000 Vietnam
description: Indulge in Chef Olivier's culinary delights, paired perfectly with wines by Sommelier Myriam. Savour local ingredients & French finds on our menu, explore unique wineries & grand crus, and feel at home in our warm, elegant bistro. Le Comptoir: where food & wine become an experience.
example_reviews: This is undeniably one of the best French restaurants we have ever been to in the world! We arrived in Da Nang yesterday and the restaurant at our hotel was closed, so we went out to find place to eat. And it was just there on the street in front of us after we walked for only a few minutes. We didn’t have a reservation, and they normally cannot accommodate walk-ins, but it was our lucky day because they found us a table. (Please don’t just show up because you really must make reservation.) Everything was amazing, Including the butter for the bread (they have 4 kinds to choose from!) The sommelier (wine professional) helped us choose the perfect pairing for our meal. They have two set menus, but because I am gluten intolerant, we chose appetizers and entrées from their a-la-carte menu. Not everything I chose was gluten-free, but they were able to make changes so that I could eat everything! Thank you so much to the chef and the sommelier and the wonderful servers who took such good care of us. We love this restaurant, and we will definitely be eating here again.

A friend recommended me to celebrate my birthday in this restaurant. The price is reasonable and the taste is ok, especially the black snowfish, which is very delicious. The staff has good service attitude and the restaurant atmosphere makes you comfortable. They also gave me a free dessert and took a photo for me. I was very happy when the photo was taken. Thank you to the owner for the arrangement💕It is best to make a reservation, otherwise you may have to wait a long time to be seated.

I went to dinner in Da Nang with my wife. It's a bit of a distance from the city, so I took a GrabCar. The shop is in a quiet residential area. The appearance of the shop is also very nice. I was a little nervous because it was a famous restaurant, but they welcomed me with a friendly smile, and I was relieved that the atmosphere inside the restaurant was relaxing. Also, the work of the staff is crisp and comfortable. I asked for a five-course course of Wagyu beef and ordered black tea because I couldn't drink. Cooking has given my brain a very good pleasure in complex flavors that I have never tasted from a single item. All five dishes were wonderfully delicious and I had a satisfying time. The black tea was so good that I ordered the same again and he gave me a little secret recipe. I can't believe it's in there! I was so happy until the last dessert (the smell of bushkan) that I was really glad to include this restaurant on this trip. It was a very good memory. Thank you for the best food and service.

name: Mộc Seafood
address: 26 Tô Hiến Thành, Da Nang 550000 Vietnam
description: Moc Seafood Restaurant space is characterized by ancient Vietnames with deep color and warm. This gives dinners a cozy and comfortable space like being in their own home. In addition,Moc Seafood Restaurant also offers a rich menu and reasonable price,not only suitable for foreign guests but also Vietnamese people.Come to Moc Restaurant and enjoy the ancient atmosphere of Vietnam!
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Nang
Street Food Restaurants in Da Nang
Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Da Nang
example_reviews: I was genuinely surprised by how packed Mộc Seafood Restaurant was! Even at 9pm, there was still a line of people waiting, so I’d definitely recommend making a reservation in advance if you don’t want to wait. The atmosphere has a charming Vietnamese style, warm and welcoming. However, because it was so crowded, it was a bit noisy and made conversations a little difficult. Now, let’s talk about the food — absolutely worth the hype. The seafood is incredibly fresh, and the prices are very reasonable for the quality. The menu offers a wide variety of options, including live seafood. I highly recommend trying the lobster and grouper sashimi — both were sweet, tender, and full of flavor. Every dish we tried was well-seasoned and delicious. Overall, despite the crowd, it’s a fantastic spot for seafood lovers. Just plan ahead and come hungry!

Delicious fresh seafood dinner. We did not have a reservation and waited for about 20 minutes to get a table. We were not seated outside but in the multi-story building ext door. The waitress escorted us to our table. Incredibly fresh. We all had lobster and prawns. They took us out to choose the lobsters and weighed them for us so we knew how much we were paying up front. The tamarind prawns were amazing (minimum order was 300gms). We ordered 500gms between 2 people. We also had a 750gm lobster with garlic butter sauce- very rich. Prices are amazing with it working out around $50Aud / head including drinks and bread for mopping up the sauce. There are also several non-seafood meals for those who do not eat seafood. They also peel your prawns as well!

Exactly what we hoped and wished for. You had seen the reviews, photos and a few YouTubes about the restaurant and made it our first meal when we landed in DaNang. We had some trouble with reservations, but contacted them via FB messenger and it was promptly and efficiently sorted. Arrived to a lovely greeting and given time to look over the menu but it wasn’t really needed as we knew exactly what we wanted and was promptly taken to the tanks to select our dinner. Service was amazing, friendly and it was a real treat to have our freshly cooked seafood peeled and prepared for our very ravenous tummies after a long 24 hour traveling. We thought the garlic butter would be our favorite but to our surprise the salted egg was outstanding. (Garlic butter still very yummy) We over ordered but the price compared to home costs was still totally worth it. We are now totally spoiled as we will always compare this delicious food and brilliant service and we have all agreed, there won’t be anywhere else that can do it better.

name: Xóm Mới Garden Đà Nẵng
address: 222 Trần Phú, Phường Phước Ninh, Quận Hải Châu, Da Nang 552760 Vietnam
description:
I visited for lunch.

The restaurant has a cozy space, suitable for dining on many occasions. The food is seasoned to taste, the portions are large, I ordered a set for 2-3 people and ate as much as 5-6 people, the price is very reasonable. The staff is cute and enthusiastic.

When I stepped into Rang Indian Restaurant in Da Nang, I felt as if I had fallen into a miniature India in the heart of this beautiful city. Every little corner of the space looked like a vibrant painting, promising to create stunning photos that make you want to capture those wonderful moments forever. As I immersed myself in that colorful atmosphere, I could not help but be amazed by the culinary journey that awaited. The menu here is incredibly diverse and rich, with each dish not only delicious but also presented with such finesse, like works of art on a plate. Although I am not a die-hard fan of Indian cuisine, I was enchanted by the essence and allure of the dishes here. The concept is not only colorful but also holds a touch of mystery, which made me love this space even more. The staff at Rang is also very charming and enthusiastic, contributing to making my experience even more complete. If someone asked me about Indian cuisine in Vietnam, I would not hesitate to recommend they visit Rang and try any dish from the menu. I am sure everyone will be drawn to the unique flavors, and what’s more, the prices here are extremely reasonable, making me feel truly fortunate to enjoy high-quality dishes with excellent service without worrying about costs. Rang is not just an ordinary Indian restaurant; it is truly a place that harmonizes the art, culture, and exquisite cuisine of India!

We have visited end of January 2025 and had a fantastic experience. The atmosphere very chill, modern and welcoming. The stuff was extremely friendly and top notch service. I took malai kofta - the best one I’ve ever tried. I highly recommend everyone, though the price may look a bit above the average but the quality of food and service worth it. I’m definitely coming there again.

name: Lang Chai Seafood
