example_reviews: I went to this seafood restaurant with my Vietnamese friend and family. The interior is cozy with a lantern in Hoi An atmosphere. You can see and choose seafood at the entrance, and the staff is quick to respond and cheerful. Crayfish cooked with butter and cheese and king crab are the signatures. The price is reasonable. It was a great experience. It is good for a meal with clean ingredients and a clean atmosphere. I highly recommend this restaurant.

Two of us ate rabbit, doughnabari, caribou, butter-gallic, pineapple fries, morning glory 👍👍 Buttergallic sauce is really delicious. Rabsta 500g was enough. Three types of peanut butter, fried peas, pan. Clearly expensive, but clean and really delicious. Honestly, it's expensive to eat properly. Only food is worth $2.5 million. I think it's worth it. Strong.

It's so delicious! The meeting tastes really good ❤️❤️ The rest of the other foods are also so delicious ☺️☺️And the staff are so kind and understand Korean very well, so there was little inconvenience to order! Eat well and eat well.

name: Citron Restaurant
address: InterContinental Danang Sun Peninsula Resort, Da Nang 550000 Vietnam
description: Savour artisanal cuisine amidst a masterpiece of design and the best views of InterContinental Danang Sun Peninsula Resort's main restaurant, Citron. The most coveted seats in the house - private dining booths - float over the hillside, 100 metres above sea level. Each unique space suspends you mid-air and takes the form of a traditional Vietnamese conical hat. Your chef's artistic palette spans a variety of flavours, with a focus on local regional Vietnamese delicacies and beautifully crafted Mediterranean specialities.
cuisines: Healthy Restaurants in Son Tra Peninsula
Fast Food Restaurants in Son Tra Peninsula
Street Food Restaurants in Son Tra Peninsula
Korean Restaurants in Son Tra Peninsula
Fusion Restaurants for Lunch in Son Tra Peninsula
example_reviews: 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟 A True Taste of Vietnam at Citron! Dining at Citron was an exceptional experience from start to finish. This Vietnamese restaurant offers a perfect blend of authentic flavors, stunning ambiance, and impeccable service. Open for lunch and dinner, it’s the ideal destination for anyone looking to indulge in high-quality Vietnamese cuisine. The menu showcases traditional dishes with a refined touch, using fresh, locally sourced ingredients. From the perfectly crispy crab spring rolls to the rich and aromatic Pho broth, every dish was bursting with authentic flavors. The DaNang blue bone garfish was a standout—expertly cooked and beautifully presented. The restaurant’s design is breathtaking, with elegant Vietnamese-inspired decor and a relaxing atmosphere. Whether dining indoors or on the terrace, the setting enhances the experience, making every meal feel special. Service at Citron is truly five-star. The staff is professional, attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu, always ready to recommend the perfect dish or wine pairing. They ensured we had a seamless and memorable dining experience. If you’re looking for an authentic yet elevated Vietnamese dining experience, Citron is a must-visit. Highly recommended for both locals and travelers!

This restaurant truly lives up to its 5-star rating. The food is delicious, creatively prepared with fresh ingredients, and each dish offers a distinct, rich flavor. The service is exceptional; the staff is professional, attentive, and makes you feel like you're being specially cared for. The ambiance is elegant and spacious, with stunning views that create a relaxed and comfortable atmosphere. It's the perfect place to enjoy a special meal with family and friends, offering both a culinary delight and an unforgettable experience.

We had afternoon tea and breakfast. Afternoon tea time was such a strong wind that napkins flew on the table, and the tea cooled quickly. The sweets were all delicious, especially canelé and scones. Breakfast was not the first thing in the morning, but when I told them what I wanted to eat outside, they took turns to show me around. There was so much alcohol, I was dazzled. In particular, the bread was plentiful and everything looked delicious. Some of them were made on the spot, such as pho and egg dishes. erika, who was in charge of the table at breakfast, was very kind and took nice pictures from various angles. The views are so great that I think it's worth stopping by or just sitting back and getting a taste of the atmosphere. Please note that some photos are quite dark depending on the time and place, so you may not be able to take them beautifully with your phone.

name: Madame Lân
address: 04 Bach Dang Street, Da Nang 550000 Vietnam
description: Founded in 2012, Madame Lân is the ideal destination to fully experience Vietnamese cuisine by the Han riverbank – the heart of Da Nang City. Inspired by the sophistication of Vietnam’s culinary tradition and its emphasis on building connections over shared meals, we created a place where the flavours of Vietnam can be enjoyed in a warm and inviting atmosphere. With a diverse menu that captures the breadth of our country’s regional tastes, we deliver dining experiences that embody both traditional values and modern sensibilities.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Da Nang
Fast Food Restaurants in Da Nang
Eastern European Restaurants for Lunch in Da Nang
Romantic Fusion Restaurants in Da Nang
example_reviews: Nice restaurant atmosphere and service is OK nothing more nothing less. Needs to be taken off the Michelin guide definitely. Food seemed fairly priced until the portion sizes came out then I felt that I was ripped off completely. Beer and coke served in cans and were warm (asked for cold and they didn’t have any) Extremely average you’d be better off just having street food.

We tried out this restaurant followed the review on Tiktok from a food blogger. The food is good, some dishes portion are not worth the price, for example the grilled chicken. We ordered 1/2 grilled chicken but the portion looks like there’s only 1/4 of a chicken. The Madame Lan grilled fish is truly a must try one, plus the stirring squid with pineapple. The Luk Lake beef we requested medium well but it too hard for chewing like well-done instead. The restaurant is an open space, no AC so it will be hot for lunch, but ok for dinner with fresh air. Design with lantern decorations bring Hoi An atmosphere. The location is just right behind the fireworks station. Price is a bit high for a local restaurant, it is more touristic nowadays as many travelers visit, not much local residents. Staff is not attentive at all, especially the girl that serve our table. She delivered the drinks but pour it all over the table and my friend’s clothes, no apology nor clean it after that. Very bad attitude, they are more focus on foreigners than Vietnamese. My tour guide booked the table under my name but the hottest apparently said there’s no table reserved under my name, it took 10mins to find out my reservation but then the table had someone else used it. Overall experience is not really pleasant except some of the food

Nhà hàng Madame Lân: A Feast for the Eyes, But Not the Palate Located beside the charming river in Danang, Nhà hàng Madame Lân welcomes guests with its elegant décor and picturesque setting. While it offers a delightful feast for the eyes, it leaves something to be desired when it comes to the culinary experience. Pros: Beautiful Decor: Nhà hàng Madame Lân is dressed to impress. The décor is beautifully put together and offers endless opportunities for those picture-perfect moments. From the intricate design details to the well-thought-out placement of decorative items, the visual aesthetics are indeed commendable. Great Selection of Food: One of the highlights of Nhà hàng Madame Lân is its extensive food selection. Catering to different tastes and preferences, the menu provides a wide variety of options that promises to tempt every palate. Great Location: Situated next to the river, the restaurant enjoys an enviable location that not only adds to its charm but also makes it easily accessible. The view of the river complements the dining experience, enhancing the restaurant's overall appeal. Cons: Mediocre Food: Despite its great variety and impressive appearance, the food at Nhà hàng Madame Lân falls short in taste. Described as extremely average and lacking any distinct or memorable flavors, the culinary experience does not live up to the expectations set by the venue's lovely ambiance and décor. Pricey by Local Standards: Considering the mediocrity of the food, the price range at Nhà hàng Madame Lân might seem a bit steep, especially when compared to local standards. The disconnect between price and taste quality might leave some patrons feeling underwhelmed. Conclusion: Nhà hàng Madame Lân is a beautiful dining spot in Danang, perfect for those who appreciate visual beauty and a fantastic location. However, if your primary focus is on a satisfying culinary experience, you might find it lacking. The restaurant's broad selection of dishes and wonderful ambiance make it a place worth visiting, but set your expectations appropriately regarding the food's taste and price. Ideal for special occasions or for those looking to enjoy a picturesque dining environment, Nhà hàng Madame Lân serves as a reminder that beauty doesn't always translate to flavor.

name: La Maison 1888
address: InterContinental Danang Sun Peninsula Resort, Da Nang 550000 Vietnam
description: La Maison 1888, the only One Star Michelin restaurant in Central Vietnam, captures the essence of haute French dining, with the distinct gourmet experience of delectable à la carte menu of distinguished classic French cuisine in Danang. This signature restaurant has already becoming the number one gastronomic destination in Vietnam.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Da Nang
Fast Food Restaurants in Da Nang
German Restaurants for Lunch in Da Nang
Greek Restaurants for Lunch in Da Nang
example_reviews: A restaurant well deserving of its Michelin star. Beautiful surroundings, excellent friendly service, fabulous food. After reading a number of reviews on Trip Advisor giving La Maison’s food low ratings, I was anxious to make my own decision. The conclusion is that those reviewers could have been eating in different restaurant or the food has improved exponentially since they were there. The meal that my wife and I enjoyed was as good as any Michelin one star restaurant that we have been to. Some dishes, such as the GRATINÉE D'OIGNONS, were what one might typically enjoy in a 3 star restaurant. I had asked for a pescatarian menu degustation, which resulted in only one change from lamb to spaghetti. I then imagined a bowl of spaghetti bolognaise or similar, but received an imaginative and very tasty creation in which I only found the spaghetti forming a wall of 2 cm pieces when I dug into it. I suspect that the vegetarian menu would be well worth trying. The 8 course menu was expensive but very good value for money. The dishes involving truffle had a very generous quantity of Perigord truffle shaved over them. There were two choices or wine menu paired with dishes. One involved 8 wines, including older vintages, and cost the equivalent of about USD298 per head, while the other, which we had, consisted of 5 generally younger wines costing the equivalent of about USD156 per person. The five wines were well matched and a couple were quite special but, considering they amounted to about 2/3rds of a bottle in total, if I went again I’d probably choose a couple of older wines from the wine list for a similar or larger cost. The beautiful surroundings and the cable car ride to the restaurant add to a memorable evening. I’d recommend La Maison 1888 to any food lover visiting Danang.

We had an enjoyable dinner at this famed French restaurant in Da Nang. The ambience of the restaurant is very homely and feels like you are in a small upscale bistro in Europe. We had the Spring tasting menu designed and curated by Pierre Gagnaire. In keeping with Pierre’s signature style, both the source of ingredients and gestronomic techniques had the nice balance of classic French cooking with a detectable octave of Asian note. The staff was very professional rendering the right level of attentive service respecting the customers’ enjoyment of each course leisurely. The wine pairing selection made by the sommelier was a perfect match to each course and complimented the special flavour meant to be enjoyed. Gastronomy is an artistry. Like any art form, personal preference, taste and experience all play a factor in its appreciation and enjoyment. We were glad that we picked La Maison 1888 during our visit to Da Nang despite some not so positive comments and reviews. We would not be surprised that La Maison will get its own star if Michelin has decided to include Da Nang in its guide in the near future.

Had dinner in this highly acclaimed French restaurant in Danang. The setting was beautiful as the restaurant was housed in a French-styled mansion on the slope of the very exclusive Intercontinental Danang hotel. The restaurant interior deco was nice and the service attentive but not intrusive. The ambiance was excellent and romantic. However, the food served, although nice, fell short of expectations of a restaurant of such reputation and pricing. If you have to pay about VND6 million (USD244) per head in Vietnam for a dinner, you'd better expect something very extraordinary. There wasn't any wow factor. For less than 5% of the pricing, you could actually eat an excellent Vietnamese meal in a local restaurant in Danang city!

name: Pink Salt Restaurant
address: 79 Hà Bổng, Da Nang 50000 Vietnam
description: Pink Salt restaurant is located in a beautiful area in Da Nang city, close to the beach, the Dragon Bridge, and other famous sites. We offer a wide variety of food, with a special focus on fresh and delicious seafood prepared by our talented chef. Pink Salt also features a tempting selection of steaks, perfect for those who love a great meat dish. We invite you to come and enjoy a wonderful dining experience with us!

example_reviews: It's so delicious. Especially the Jjamppong pasta. The price is similar to Korean Jjamppong, but when you look at the ingredients, it makes sense. And the staff is very friendly, the restaurant has a classy atmosphere, and the entrance has a Korean Instagram feel. There is a separate lunch menu, so I recommend trying it.

The modern and stylish restaurant in Vietnam's Danang, the spacious seats and coolness were impressive, the Vietnamese food was similar in every restaurant, and it was too good to taste. Vietnamese meats were very popular, and the pink-solt restaurant is soft, rich in juicy steaks and delicious, so it's easy for the family to eat at a price, and lovers think it's perfect for tasty food and atmosphere. Steak Recommendation, cream paste tomato paste, salad. Especially the Seafood Cream Pasta. I put the steak in the set menu, and the family had enough and good meat, especially the liver, and the ganish was very good! Recommendation for flavoring in Batman!

The quality of the food is really good, and the staff are very friendly. They changed us to a good spot and took care of each and every detail, and their sensible response stood out. You may think the prices are expensive compared to local restaurants, but the individual items were not that expensive and the portions were larger than expected, so the prices felt more reasonable. The pink salt pasta was delicious, and the seasoned octopus was also good, but I think I'll try the puffo next time. The lamb ribs were good because they didn't smell and were just right👍 If you want to have a delicious dinner in Da Nang with a nice atmosphere, I recommend this place~! I think it would be better if you asked for a sofa seat assignment when making a reservation^^ (We didn't use it, but a seat opened up in the middle, so we changed it💝)

name: Missteak
address: 99 Mai Thuc Lan 2nd Floor, Da Nang 550000 Vietnam
description: Missteak presents a minimalist steakhouse experience, where the spotlight shines brightly on the quality of our ingredients. We have a deep respect for natural flavors, which is why you'll find only the olive oil and beef tallow used in our cooking processes. Our commitment to sustainability and ethical sourcing is unwavering; every cut of beef served at Missteak is sourced from free-ranging cattle, grazed on the vast, open pastures of Australia's ranches.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Da Nang

example_reviews: Missteak - Da Nang: A Must-Visit for Steak Lovers Missteak in Da Nang is a must-visit for steak lovers or anyone seeking a refined yet relaxed dining experience. The restaurant offers top-notch food, excellent service, and a welcoming atmosphere that makes it perfect for special occasions or a casual treat-yourself meal. The service is excellent, with attentive staff who speak English, making the dining experience smooth and enjoyable for international visitors. On top of that, Missteak has a delightful surprise for popcorn fans—their spiced popcorn is simply amazing and worth a try. Though on the pricier side, the overall experience at Missteak justifies the cost, delivering one of the finest steakhouse experiences in Da Nang.

The staff are very friendly. In particular, the male manager's smile is very bright and pleasant. It's formal yet casual and friendly, so it feels like you're eating in a nice place. The quality of the meat is good and it's nice that you can order various sauces. The meat is served warm on a stone plate, and the pepper and salt popcorn is addictive.

Wow! We almost didn’t come because of the limited menu but I’m so glad we did! My husband had the ribeye and I had the flat iron steak which was upgraded to a wagyu steak to celebrate the lunar new year. Both steaks were cooked perfectly! I also recommend the corn ribs and penicillin cocktail. We finished off with the carmel cheesecake which was great without being too sweet. We went to a couple other steak places in Da Nang and this was by far the best one. It’s a fairly new restaurant so not a ton of reviews but this was our favorite place in Da Nang!

name: Le Four - European Restaurant

We had Pumpkin soup and fresh seafood pizza for dinner and both were served at the right temperature and we don't have enough words to describe it's taste. Very strongly recommend this place.

This place is honestly the perfect place to go in da neng if you have had enough of Vietnamese food for the night, and want something Italian. I went here with family and the atmosphere when I first came here gave me the feeling that I can hold high expectations for this place and it would somehow meet my expectations. The food that we ordered consisted of pizza and burgers which served a generous amount of toppings in the meat lover pizzas and the pizza being cooked straight out was delicious. I would highly recommend going here again

We had a wonderful late lunch here today. The food was presented beautifully, everything was very well made and flavourful. The mushroom soup, the burrata salad and the chicken were all top notch and the prices are unbelievable. The most luxurious meal for a great price. The staff were really friendly and the service was super quick. We can only recommend!
