description: The best place to drink craft beer in Hue. We got 14 taps of beer brewed on-site in a variety of styles, with Lagers, Pale Ales, and of course IPAs. We also do killer sourdough pizza, beef & chicken burgers on homemade buns and Mexican-style carnitas tacos. Welcome to the brewery!
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: We visited on a very quiet Tuesday afternoon (just us in there!). We are suckers for a craft beer place as generally places with nice beer do great food, and we weren’t wrong here. They had a great barman (as well as the owners) on hand to talk through their beers, and even brought out three for my husband to try before he ordered. I had the freshly squeezed lemon juice which was lovely. The food was excellent. My husband had the chicken burger, the bun he described more like a scone like texture but said it was so tasty. I opted for the fish tacos, again these were full of flavour. I imagine when this place has more people in the atmosphere just improves more. We’re really glad we visited!

Fantastic range of craft beers, friendly atmosphere, great happy hour deals and we were fortunate enough to come for Taco Tuesday - carnitas tacos at about $1.50 Australian dollars each were absolutely delicious. Pizzas looked fantastic too although we did not try them. Not in main tourist area but worth a 15min walk or taxi.

Amazing NE IPA in the heart of Huề! We are from Boston and this is the closest NEIPA we have had to the greats like Trillium and Treehouse outside of New England. The food was awesome (especially the pizza and ice cream) and our server Lý was so kind to us and our kids. We went back daily during our time in Huề.

name: Le Cercle Hue
address: 11 Le Loi Street, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description:
We had an incredible dining experience at this Vietnamese restaurant. The food was authentic, flavorful, and beautifully presented, offering a true taste of Vietnam. The restaurant’s location provides a stunning view, making the atmosphere even more enjoyable.

A special shoutout to Long, our server, who went above and beyond to accommodate our extra requests. His attentiveness, friendly demeanor, and dedication to ensuring we had a perfect meal truly stood out.

If you’re looking for delicious Vietnamese food paired with excellent service and a breathtaking setting, this place is a must-visit. Highly recommended!
cuisines: French Restaurants for Breakfast in Hue
Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: We had an incredible dining experience at this Vietnamese restaurant. The food was authentic, flavorful, and beautifully presented, offering a true taste of Vietnam. The restaurant’s location provides a stunning view, making the atmosphere even more enjoyable. A special shoutout to Long, our server, who went above and beyond to accommodate our extra requests. His attentiveness, friendly demeanor, and dedication to ensuring we had a perfect meal truly stood out. If you’re looking for delicious Vietnamese food paired with excellent service and a breathtaking setting, this place is a must-visit. Highly recommended!

We heard about this historical building in Hue, it used to be a famous sport club (swimming, rowing boat, tennis, etc.) during the French colonial era. Now it’s a high-end restaurant aptly named Le Cercle Hue. We had dinner here on our first night in Hue. Impressive interior with high ceiling, elegant wooden French doors leading to an outdoor terrace overlooking the Perfume River. Relaxing atmosphere, romantic setting with white table cloth, red rose, candle on every table. The napkin on each plate was folded into the shape of a white tuxedo jacket! We enjoyed our fabulous dinner, especially the traditional Cơm Âm Phủ ( Hell’s rice) and Bánh cuốn thịt nướng (rice crepe with grilled pork skewers). Our waiter Lộc suggested an excellent French white wine to pair with the dishes. He also happily showed us how to fold a napkin into a tuxedo when we told him we loved the look of it. Many thanks also to our waitress Ngọc who recommended the fantastic hibiscus lime ice tea (hibiscus infusion with lime juice and ginger-kumquat syrup). Such unusual, complex flavors yet so refreshing! Highly recommend this place.

Excellent location by the Perfume River between two bridges. The local draft beer was very drinkable and the food excellent and reasonably priced given the location. We were served by Long who's English was very good and he was very willing to tell us about the dishes that we had chosen and life in Hue in general. He was very attentive and considerate of our well being given it was a hot day.

name: Nook Eatery
address: Alley 42 Nguyễn Công Trứ street Number 33 Hue, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: A cozy, friendly, funky cafe where you can enjoy a deliciously cooked full English breakfast with the works including baked beans and English muffins - Veggie option available. We also serve a range of vegetarian and vegan breakfasts including home made granola, crepes, smoothie bowls and fresh smoothies & juices. Join us for Lunch and Dinner and enjoy Vietnamese & Asian fusion dishes, home made Vegetarian / Vegan burgers, Australian style beef burgers, Asian style curries and Stir Fry Noodle dishes - Vegan options available, fresh salads, snacks and delicious desserts. We offer a full bar with local beers, mixed drinks, cocktails and our well known coconut coffee which many of our guests keep coming back for. As with all of our dishes we take great care when preparing our Vegan / Vegetarian dishes to ensure our customers satisfaction. The team at Nook looks forward to welcoming you.
cuisines: Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: We chose this restaurant because it was welcoming and original with a very appetizing menu combining Vietnamese tradition and a choice of burgers. The waitresses are adorable and the food is very tasty, made from fresh produce. We had lunch and dinner for three days because this restaurant was close to our hotel but also because we wanted to explore the map. The bill is completely reasonable. A plate of fresh fruit was kindly offered to us during our last meal. The musical atmosphere is also very good, far from the synth covers heard over and over in other places.

This is the 3rd time that I have been to Nook over a number of years and it was great to see that the staff still make you feel very welcome as soon as you walk in the door. It had changed location since I'd last been however it didn't make it any easier to find! They have a wide ranging menu, including both Asian and Western dishes, open from 7am for brekky and close at 10pm. As mentioned, the staff were very frindly and great to have a chat to, and they were also very attentive to your needs, especially Min and Ha. The Nook is set out over 2 levels, with the larger seating area up the top and the kitchen/smaller seating area down the bottom. I had the pork spring rolls and a burger. Both dishes were good, although it would have been great if the bun was a little bigger on the burger from the look of the fries, I would probably say it was time to change the oil in their deep fryer. The only negative really is it would have been nice to have empty plates and bottles etc removed from the table a little quicker. Overall, I recommend that if you are in the area to pop in for a bite to eat or have a drink, you will be treated very well by the staff and also, all the food/drink is reasonably priced.

Very good restaurant. Though a little off the beaten track there are signs directing you to Nooks. The menu is arguably quite limited and a fair amount of it is "Western" but there are enough Vietnamese dishes to keep your taste buds tingling. Nice friendly service.

name: Madam Thu Restaurant
address: 45 Vo Thi Sau Street, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Madam Thu Restaurant is a local restaurant located in Backpacker Area of Hue City. The name of woman who is owner. Madam Thu Restaurant will offer you Lunch and Diner with some famous Hue Food as Stuffed rice pancake (Banh Khoai), Grilled Chopped Pork (Nem Lui), Grilled Pork Vermicelli, Fried Spring Rolls with other delicious Hue Food with Hue Style. Beside, She will show you “How to Cook Hue Food
example_reviews: We ended up here via webs and had meals twice here with abs no complaints!! There are 2 outlets and we came by .45. The place is lovely and inviting. We ordered the 10 pieces taster menu and Bahn bo, both were served quite fast. The dished and dips are so flavorful!! Our host Dihn gave exquisite care, went out of his ways to get us some items which are not on the menu, added so much to our appreciation. We were taught to assemble the rolls, every stuffs. I guess we were quite lucky tasting local foods with such reasonable prices. Give it a go when in Hue and see why this place gets great reviews for its food. Thanks the whole team for warm welcome!! Highly recommended!!

If you’re in Hue and want to sample all the best of the local food, this is the place. For about 190000 VND ( about $13 Aust) you can get a set platter that contains all samples of the local cuisine, everything from the hand rolled rice paper rolls to the fresh fruit for dessert. This place is quick, high quality and great value, but the best bit by far was Oanh our waitress, who took the time to explain the process for constructing every bite and was friendly and delightful throughout to a group of Aussies worn out by a day of high humidity touring. If you want to do yourself a serious favour while you’re on tour, drop in here, order the set menu and an ice cold Huda beer, and ask if Oanh is on duty. Truly worth it.

There are 2 Madame Thu branches 140 metres apart in the same street. Madame Thu number 1 at 4 Vo This Sau street is the more authentic building but both serve the same menu. We ate very well trying the local delicacies which were delicious - only one slight problem was that starters and mains arrived simultaneously. Notwithstanding this the food was excellent and with mineral water and a bottle of French wine we paid about €14 a head which is exceptional value. Credit cards accepted. Staff very helpful in explaining how best to eat some of the esoteric dishes Highly recommended

name: Chan
address: 01 Nguyen Thai Hoc, Hue Vietnam
description: Chan is a Hue traditional restaurant with cozy atmosphere and serve dishes from a typical family meal of Hue people.
example_reviews: This was the best dining experience weve had on our second visit to Hue after 14 years. A beautifully presented restaurant, great atmosphere. The staff are all very professional, friendly and take great care to make you feel welcome. The extensive menu has something for everyone. Vegetable, beef, pork, duck, chicken, seafood and tofu dishes deliver satisfying traditional Vietnamese flavours distinct to Hue. There is also a cafe section at the front for coffees, juices and pastries from 8am in the morning. I recommend trying the caramelised pork belly, the salt roasted chicken dishes and the kumquat and apricot juice but everything on the menu looks and tastes delightful and is very reasonably priced. We have many favourite restaurants in Vietnam and will always return to this one.

This restaurant is a wonderful find We were served by sally (Hien) who spoke brilliant English and was really helpful with our choices and the quantities required which is always difficult as the portions vary so much from one restaurant to another The food was the best we experienced in our three week trip in Vietnam and also one of the most reasonably priced We discovered that we were sitting next to the owners and the fact that they eat there speaks volumes There was a really good mix of tourists and locals eating there We would recommend this restaurant to any wanting to eat Vietnamese and specifically Hue style food

I’m visiting Hue for a couple of days and was curious after reading reviews of Chan. I called to make a reservation (I think we may have been able to just walk in, but it seemed around 80% full when we arrived around 7PM on a Sunday). The ambiance is comfortable, with many intriguing artifacts on the walls ( I asked staff about some of it). All the staff, especially our server Ngoc, were genuinely warm and friendly. I was a little surprised when, stepping out of my Grab, somebody smiling appeared with an opened umbrella (it was raining), holding it above me as I walked to the entrance. The menu seems extensive compared to what I’ve seen in most restaurants on my visits to Vietnam; I recognized some of the items but there were many new ones I haven’t seen elsewhere that I think must be local regional dishes. I like to take my time and look at everything on the menu, and the staff didn’t hurry me a bit to order even though the restaurant is quite busy. The Vietnamese friend I was eating with, from a different province in Vietnam, was more excited at the menu and the food as it arrived than I’ve ever seen him before in a restaurant. He kept expressing his delight at the food, and even said that if he lived near this restaurant he would eat there every day. I enjoyed everything we ordered, though I think my favorite was a fried tofu cooked in a tomato based sauce. I highly recommend trying Cham if you are in Hue, whether you are from Vietnam or are a foreign tourist.

name: Junrei Restaurant
address: 130 Minh Mang Road, Hue Vietnam
description:
Visually very attractive both inside and out, lots of tasteful decorative elements. It is within the Pilgrimage Village Hotel complex and therefore very nicely situated in the green. In the basement there is a nice jazz bar where you can hear perfectly acceptable standards from the Blue Book, often by Cole Porter. Of the long drinks we only tried the mojito and the gin and tonic, only the latter we really recommend. The staff are very friendly, courteous and attentive throughout and know how to make the guest feel like they are the center of attention. Very nice!!!

For the food: The menu is a thick book that is also visually very professionally presented with photos. There is a selection of very nicely presented Vietnamese dishes and some standard international dishes. However, the Vietnamese dishes were quite heterogeneous in terms of quality and we were not always satisfied. However, the international dishes are always well served. We can highly recommend the stylishly decorated and delicious desserts.

The restaurant is relatively expensive, in keeping with the tasteful offering. A pizza, for example, costs around €11, which is good value for money by European standards, but by Vietnamese standards it is of course incredibly expensive. However, you have to take into account that the ingredients for such dishes, such as Camembert or mozzarella, are hard to come by in Vietnam and are therefore expensive.
cuisines: Late Night Italian Restaurants in Hue
example_reviews: Visually very attractive both inside and out, lots of tasteful decorative elements. It is within the Pilgrimage Village Hotel complex and therefore very nicely situated in the green. In the basement there is a nice jazz bar where you can hear perfectly acceptable standards from the Blue Book, often by Cole Porter. Of the long drinks we only tried the mojito and the gin and tonic, only the latter we really recommend. The staff are very friendly, courteous and attentive throughout and know how to make the guest feel like they are the center of attention. Very nice!!! For the food: The menu is a thick book that is also visually very professionally presented with photos. There is a selection of very nicely presented Vietnamese dishes and some standard international dishes. However, the Vietnamese dishes were quite heterogeneous in terms of quality and we were not always satisfied. However, the international dishes are always well served. We can highly recommend the stylishly decorated and delicious desserts. The restaurant is relatively expensive, in keeping with the tasteful offering. A pizza, for example, costs around €11, which is good value for money by European standards, but by Vietnamese standards it is of course incredibly expensive. However, you have to take into account that the ingredients for such dishes, such as Camembert or mozzarella, are hard to come by in Vietnam and are therefore expensive.

Our first night/dinner at The Pilgrimage Village and we’re off to a great start…. the Passionfruit Juice was punchy & the local beer was a winner (& nicely chilled as it should be!). We opted for the A La Carte (there is a half buffet option with an A La Carte for those with huge appetites) and we shared a starter of minced pork skewers which you wrap in rice paper with salad & peanut sauce - delicious if not a bit messy (though a cold towel is on hand). Then for mains we had the deep fried Red Snapper which you similarly prepare and eat in rice paper, though this time with salad & fresh mango slices, then dip in a chilli sauce and also the Beef Curry which was a stand out winner - mild not spicy and the beef was so tender with not an ounce of fat to be seen! All the waiting staff were super friendly, especially Lien who was so polite & sweet. We were going to eat out in town tomorrow evening but I very much suspect we’ll be back in The Junrei to sample more amazing flavours 😋

We had a great time at Junrei restaurant, located in the beautiful Pilgrimage Village. The food was simply delicious, full of local flavors and perfectly prepared. Many thanks to the whole team for their kindness and warm welcome! The waiters have been taking care of us, taking the time to advise us on local specialties, but also on how to taste them to take full advantage of them. A special thank you to Madame Lien, an exceptional waitress whose smile and attentiveness truly brightened our meal. Thanks to her, this culinary experience was even more memorable. Thanks again!

name: Nha Hang Cafe Vy Da Xua
address: 131 Nguyen Sinh Cung Phường Vỹ Dạ, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Very good mode and coffee taste very good . We could spend very good time here . Tea also taste very good and many kinds of tea .
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Very good mode and coffee taste very good . We could spend very good time here . Tea also taste very good and many kinds of tea .

We went here with family, it is a gorgeous cafe shop with lots of places to sit and take photos. It is very calm and beautiful. We had drinks, all of which were amazing. Come here if you’re in the area for sure.

This place was very pretty, the overall ambience and vibe was very calm and serene. The architecture was very pretty as well. I had a matcha, and it was the best matcha I’ve ever had. I recommended coming here for sure!

name: Spice Viet Restaurant
address: 15 Ly Thuong Kiet, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: SPICE VIET is a brand-new chain of farm-to-table restaurants showcasing authentic Vietnamese cuisine by using fresh, seasonal ingredients to create dishes that are healthy, green and delicious. Spice Viet Hue is the first in the Spice Viet chain of restaurants. Other location will open throughout Vietnam (Ho Chi Minh City, Hanoi, Hoi An...) and abroad (Europe, Australia...)
cuisines: Late Night Vietnamese Restaurants in Hue
Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: We forgot making a reservation before coming to the restaurant but didnâ€™t have to wait long, the waiters were very quick to bring out the dishes after only 10-15 minutes ordering. The menu was varied, we ordered a few dishes along with Com Nieu, I have to use the word "excellent" to describe that dinner. The restaurant's space is also charmingly decorated. It's really in the top list of Vietnamese Cuisine Restaurant in Hue.

I highly recommend this restaurant for its exceptionally fresh and quality prepared food. The hotel staff in the restaurant had an excellent service for our breakfast buffet and we enjoyed thoroughly many different varieties of fresh fruit, coffee all kinds of different Vietnamese style food and pancakes. The children really loved it and we would come back again especially the hotel and the swimming pool are excellent When you can enjoy the view from the garden from the HOTEL restaurant.

I've visited multiple Spice Viet restaurants across Viet Nam, and I always find myself returning for their food and interior designs. The restaurant always deliver amazing vietnamese food while also having choices for western cuisine as well; although it's obvious from the name that Viet food is their specialty. Saying specialty is also an understatement as their cooks deeply understand the cuisine, capable of refining it to perfection. I always recommend Spice Viet to all travelers if they're looking for the best that Vietnamese cuisine has to offer, and with a reasonable price as well.

name: Chan - 19 Nguyen Thai Hoc
address: 19 Nguyen Thai Hoc, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Chan is a Hue traditional restaurant with cozy atmosphere and serve dishes of a typical family meal of Hue people.
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: A very patient wait staff who helped our group of 10 take orders then happily spilt bills individually and gave option to pay cash or card +2%. They even reissued a dish after some confusion on orders. Food was lovely and the chan special was real value for money at Vd95k, drinks were also more reasonably priced than other places. Catfish was succulent and little class were very filling.

A real delight 😋 10th day in Vietnam and since 3 or 4 days we can no longer get enough of rice and others, we opt for European cuisine. Today we go to this restaurant, to take over the local cuisine, carefully chosen according to notes and reviews. And now, what a joy to reconcile to Vietnamese cuisine! We ask our waitress Huyen for advice on typical Hue dishes. All happiness and flavors... um... for the proposals made. In addition very beautiful setting and a note more than incredible (25€ to 2 with a bottle of wine included) => No hesitation 👍

We ordered the set meal number 4 and it was great. The braised pork was sweet and tender, the soup was tasty, morning glory, and best of all was the fried fish and rice paper pancakes. This was served with fresh watermelon juice and finished with fresh fruit and the subtly delicious dessert. Our waitress was Huyen and she was friendly, spoke very good English and answered our questions about the dishes with enthusiasm. Highly recommended

name: Ancient Huế Gallery Cuisine
address: 104/47 Kim Long Ancient Hue Garden Houses, Hue 49000 Vietnam
description: Some feasts were said to have included 300 rare dishes served in over a thousand bowls. ‍ Located in the main Garden House, Kim Long Fine Dining Restaurant mixes local specialties with Asian and European flavors to create memorable, modern-day versions of royal feasts. ‍ Discover this unique space and start your culinary journey sitting at a table with lacquered authentic furniture and surrounded by refined ornamental details. ‍ Continue this gourmet escape by enjoying the artistic vision of the mural painting representing the motifs of an Empress robe and take a look at the antique panels with the four seasons flowers carved in by the mother of pearl shells which reflect Ancient Hue. ‍
cuisines: Seafood Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: It's been the best dinner we've ever had in Vietnam. It is more expensive than other places in the city but with a great value for money. The restaurant is located in a hotel with abundant vegetation and an outdoor pool, with a remarkable and elegant wooden building that already provided an unbeatable environment. We took a Shiraz red wine from the house which for the price is totally recommended and the best we have drunk in Vietnam after many disappointments with much more expensive wines. As for the food we share some Vietnamese prawn rolls, highly recommended. Each one also ordered a later dish: my partner ordered a bò Hue bò (traditional meat and noodle soup, flavored with coriander) and it came out delighted; I ordered a grilled chicken with lime leaf that was delicious, with a magnificent sauce and accompanying vegetables that I also can not fail to recommend. For dessert we had a fruit cake of the right passion but not remarkable and a dessert of chocolate type coulant that was totally worth it. The treatment of the staff was always very cheerful and polite and we had the opportunity to see during the end of the dinner a live concert of 5-6 musicians and music who played typical instruments and sang local songs, enlivening and improving the evening. Definitely a dinner to remember in Hue and all over Vietnam. 100% recommended.

I have been to this restaurant during Vietnam trip with my family. We were really satisfied. We were looking for a fairly elegant and well-served restaurant, where we could taste traditional dishes and fortunately we found it! The place remains outside the chaos of the city and presents itself very well. Dispersed in a well-kept "Vietnamese" garden, the restaurant is easily reachable by taxi (cheap). Here you can eat meat, fish, but also children's and vegetarian menus. All served as it should, with tablecloths and cutlery, but without losing the oriental charm. The service is very attentive, the waiters are kind, helpful and attentive. As well as in the kitchen, where they prepare very good and aesthetically fascinating dishes. Price above average here in Vietnam but totally affordable for those coming from the West. Worthy of note if you are looking for a refined restaurant. Great experience!

After so much street food and some "filthy" contexts it is legitimate to indulge in a little luxury. The 32 euros each for the tasting menu are well worth the service offered. The venue, inside the luxury lodge, is truly cared for down to the last detail. Courteous and very attentive service. The phon so praised by books on Vietnam finally takes shape and flavor, it is cooked with great dedication. Everything else is a virtuosity of cooking design and a vague overview of Hué cuisine. The only flaw to point out is the geographical location, not well marked on the maps and difficult to reach even by taxi drivers. If you have difficulty, have the restaurant call. Overall a very nice and refreshing experience.

name: Zucca Restaurant
address: 15 Chu Văn An, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: If you are looking for a restaurant in Hue that offers an intimate and inviting atmosphere, generous portions and reasonable prices, then Zucca Restaurant is the best choice. With rustic decoration and soft lighting, the restaurant offers a unique and memorable gastronomic experience. The service is very friendly and attentive, and the staff always greet you with a smile. Additionally, the restaurant is located close to the Citadel and other tourist attractions, making it a very convenient location.
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: If you are looking for a restaurant in Hue that offers an intimate and inviting atmosphere, generous portions and reasonable prices, then Zucca Restaurant is the best choice. With rustic decoration and soft lighting, the restaurant offers a unique and memorable gastronomic experience. The service is very friendly and attentive, and the staff always greet you with a smile. Additionally, the restaurant is located close to the Citadel and other tourist attractions, making it a very convenient location.

Superb attention from staff, and their lasagna was absolutely mouthwatering. This Italian/Vietnamese fusion establishment truly impresses. They generously provide a complimentary appetizer, beverage, and fresh fruit platter to finish your meal. The pricing is quite fair considering the quality, and the staff's attentiveness is remarkable throughout the dining experience.

The staff creates a warm, inviting atmosphere complemented by delicious, beautifully presented meals. Offering outstanding value, this spot serves fantastic pizza and a great variety of drinks. An absolute must-visit!

name: Pizz.á Restaurant - Italian Cuisine
address: 34 Chu Văn An 2nd Floors, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description:
Spacious, quiet, clean restaurant/pizzeria on the upper floor of a building on a street that's mostly pedestrian in the evening.
The waitresses and waiters are extremely nice, going above and beyond to make sure you have everything you need.
The food itself... *sigh. I ate here twice in three days. Pizza Margherita first, delicious dough, fresh and tasty ingredients. Then pasta the second time, the vegetable lover spaghetti: the mixed vegetable sauce brought me straight to summer back in Italy, all the flavours were there and just right.
Also appreciated the potato wedges or French fries, as the menu says, and the complimentary (thank you!) miso ice-cream was interesting with that spicy mix on top, and itself fresh and good and a nice texture.
Were I staying longer in Hue, I'd likely return a third time!
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Spacious, quiet, clean restaurant/pizzeria on the upper floor of a building on a street that's mostly pedestrian in the evening. The waitresses and waiters are extremely nice, going above and beyond to make sure you have everything you need. The food itself... *sigh. I ate here twice in three days. Pizza Margherita first, delicious dough, fresh and tasty ingredients. Then pasta the second time, the vegetable lover spaghetti: the mixed vegetable sauce brought me straight to summer back in Italy, all the flavours were there and just right. Also appreciated the potato wedges or French fries, as the menu says, and the complimentary (thank you!) miso ice-cream was interesting with that spicy mix on top, and itself fresh and good and a nice texture. Were I staying longer in Hue, I'd likely return a third time!

Great service amazing pizza. Really nice surroundings and atmosphere. Really good value for money. Would definitely come back to this place again. Oh did I forget to mention the nice and friendly waiters. If there was one thing to comment on it would be the IGers. (People who take photos for instagram or any other) but overall amazing. As a family and individual it was brilliant. My 10 year old daughter thought it was the best pizza place she had ever been to.

As tourists in Hue we spent lovely time in this restaurant and we really enjoyed the pizza here! We really appreciate the relaxed atmosphere and the extremely kind and professional waiters. Si Huy followed us in each step of our dinner: he introduced very well the menu, enhancing the originality of the offer and he took care of us in every part of our pizza experience. We really appreciated the pizza, very tasty and rich in terms of ingredients! A really nice pizza experience in Hue, highly recommended!

name: Les Jardins de La Carambole
address: 32, Dang Tran Con, Hue 10000 Vietnam
description: Les Jardins De La Carambole is a new restaurant in Hue serving Vietnamese and French cuisine. It is inside the Citadel, very near the Forbidden City. It's an impressive reconstruction of a French Colonial Villa. Great attention was paid to every detail of the historic reconstruction.
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: A ‘nice’ location with good food. We initially had a nice lunch here, but with a few strange twists and turns. Upon arrival we were asked to place our rental bikes out of sight so that their parking space remained free. That was strange in itself because there was more than enough parking space, but soit; they must have a good reason, we thought. After a delicious starter and main course, the staff started to act a bit weird when we wanted dessert after. This was weird, but we got it. When we had finished dessert and asked again for the menu for a drink when choosing a next activity we were presented with the bill and ordered to leave. When we indicated that we meant the drinks menu, the staff suddenly pretended they could no longer speak English while communication was effortless at first, and they aggressively pushed the bill back in our faces. My tablemate wanted to go to the toilet after checkout but this turned out to be no longer possible. All we can think of is that they wanted our table for the group that just came in, but half the tables were still free. As for hospitality, this restaurant actually deserves a big two, but the food was very tasty and the location looked neat so that's why I'm going for four stars anyway.

Our tour guide dropped us here for a pre paid pre booked lunch along side many others people That said the set menu was very tasty and showed off the cuisine very well . Green mango salad was the winner Staff friendly and showed us how to eat some of the dishes Drinks very well priced

This excellent restaurant built in a colonial style serves top class food for a very moderate local price. The service is top class and the owner showed us around his restaurant telling about the many antiques he has collected over the years. We found this restaurant by accident since it was located in the same street as our hotel and we were immediately attracted by the colonial, beautiful style it was built in. The prices of the food were very affordable and a decision was quickly made to have our breakfast then and there and didn't regret it. we also found out from the owner that he owns a second restaurant in Hue City which we visited at night for dinner and deserves a separate review. E. Rouffa A Day.

name: Eco Restaurant
address: 107 Minh Mang Street, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description:
We ate here two nights in a row as the food and service is amazing. Everything we had was fabulous. They kindly tailored the crispy pancakes so I could try this local favourite (I do not eat pork/beef which is tricky in some places in Vietnam). I was so grateful that they did this. All the staff were friendly and welcomed us back the second day. 

The food is also incredibly cheap, our favourite meal for 2 people including beer was less than £10. Give this place a go if you are in the area, you will love it.
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: We ate here two nights in a row as the food and service is amazing. Everything we had was fabulous. They kindly tailored the crispy pancakes so I could try this local favourite (I do not eat pork/beef which is tricky in some places in Vietnam). I was so grateful that they did this. All the staff were friendly and welcomed us back the second day. The food is also incredibly cheap, our favourite meal for 2 people including beer was less than £10. Give this place a go if you are in the area, you will love it.

We were staying at The Pilgrimage across the road from the Eco Restaurant so decided to go for dinner and support the locals. Ha our host was lovely and we really enjoyed talking with her, her restaurant is beautiful and the food was fresh and very very tasty. Highly recommended. Thank you Ha - Linda & Brett from New Zealand

Family run very friendly owner and staff. All food cooked from freshest ingredients to order - excellent quality at very reasonable prices. Local beer very refreshing. Visited several times as menu varied but very happy to just serve you coffee which was welcome after a walk in the surrounding countryside

name: Đa:mê Café
address: 34 Chu Van An, Hue 49118 Vietnam
description: Đa:mê Coffee Shop is not only about the drinks, but also the atmosphere it brings. The special thing of Đa:mê is the space displays works of art, but can still be used as a place where people can freely meet, chat, work, create and enjoy drinks.
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: I walked into this cafe after lunch at a restaurant close by. The ambience was sleek and minimalist, so different from what I have seen so far in a lot of cafes. It was spacious with tables meters apart for privacy. The music played over the sound system was comforting. There was also ample retail space for its merchandise. From a range of beverages on the menu, I ordered a glass of chilled coffee with coconut cream. The cream was thick without being too rich. A slice of burnt cheesecake completed my tea treat. The service was pleasant and natural. What a lovely place to while away the afternoon.

In Hue in the bar area there is this place that makes excellent fruit smoothies. You can also find croissants, desserts, coffee, tea and more. The place inside has a relaxing atmosphere and is ideal for leaving the chaos of Hue for a moment.

This is a great cafe, coffee is good. Decor nice and has charging points throughout. Great place to sit and charge devices at the same time. No card facilities, cash only. Says it opens at 6.30am, this is when staff arrive, more like open 6.45am-7am for service. Service is friendly and efficient.

name: Cơm Niêu Khải Hoàn
address: 90 - 94 Lê Lợi, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: We loved this restaurant, the delicious food, the simple but very effective decoration and the music creates a very relaxing atmosphere. The Thai maitre Quuang Hunh attended us very well and translated the dishes for us, us. I help choose our menu. A great hit!!!
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: We loved this restaurant, the delicious food, the simple but very effective decoration and the music creates a very relaxing atmosphere. The Thai maitre Quuang Hunh attended us very well and translated the dishes for us, us. I help choose our menu. A great hit!!!

This was by far the best food we had the pleasure of eating in Hue. The goose with passionfruit sauce made our taste buds explode, it was so delicious and something we had never eaten before. The tofu in lemongrass was silky and melt in your mouth. The ambience of the restaurant is fresh and inviting and the staff are highly professional with food and drinks arriving together.

My family was referred to this restaurant by our taxi driver. Khai Hoan is an amazing restaurant with a large menu of many regional Hue foods. Our Mom is from Hue and it’s impressive to have a restaurant in Hue with the quality of restaurants we have in the U.S. and better. We ordered the combo set for 2 and the family set for 4 and it was more than enough food for our family. Each dish, especially the Banh beo, smoked goose breast, thit heo luoc was DELICIOUS. We loved everything and on top of that the decor and the super friendly service was exceptional. You must try this place when you come to HUE!

name: N. Cafe And Restaurant
address: 08 Trần Huy Liệu, Hue 49000 Vietnam
description:
I read so much about this restaurant that I had to dine there. At the end of my meal, I felt the same as all the reviewers. Overall,  it was an excellent dining experience, and the bonus was the view. I had a table that faced the walls of the Citadel. Everything was good, the food, the beverage and the service. 

I was satisfied with my order. The coconut coffee had just the right amount of ice, unlike some places. The diced chicken, vegetable and rice combination for my main dish was cooked well. The service was prompt and fuss-free. 

The little touches made a huge difference. Before the meal; it was a packet of wet tissue, to wipe my hands I was pleasantly informed. At the end, the same wait staff presented me with a fruit, saying it was dessert. How unexpected and a lovely surprise indeed. 

These touches and everything else make me want to recommend this cafe and restaurant to everyone visiting the Imperial City.
cuisines: Late Night Vietnamese Restaurants in Hue
Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: I read so much about this restaurant that I had to dine there. At the end of my meal, I felt the same as all the reviewers. Overall, it was an excellent dining experience, and the bonus was the view. I had a table that faced the walls of the Citadel. Everything was good, the food, the beverage and the service. I was satisfied with my order. The coconut coffee had just the right amount of ice, unlike some places. The diced chicken, vegetable and rice combination for my main dish was cooked well. The service was prompt and fuss-free. The little touches made a huge difference. Before the meal; it was a packet of wet tissue, to wipe my hands I was pleasantly informed. At the end, the same wait staff presented me with a fruit, saying it was dessert. How unexpected and a lovely surprise indeed. These touches and everything else make me want to recommend this cafe and restaurant to everyone visiting the Imperial City.

Nice foods it yummy( delicious ) Friendly great service we went there by accident the restaurant look clean and nice surprise the price is cheap comepare to same level of reataurant We had a few menu Ice coffee nice RECOMMENDED deep fried springrolls The 2 girls very good and attentive you can sit 2nd floor or outside to look at the Hue Palace very top service and ver good prices I will say that High recommend They take credit card.

We were recomened by our hotel near by to viait this place. It was just around the corner. N.cafe &food running by family members. Nice location with look on a citadel. First day we eat schrimps noodle, beef noodle and banana roles. The second spring roles, rice with vegetable and noodle. For desert we order Durian ice cream and almond jelly coffe...everything was so delicious that we can't understand the price at the end. I get also a aloa tea with lichi...Njami if you are in Hue go and visit N.cafe&food !

name: Risotto Restaurant
address: 69 Võ Thị Sáu Phú Hội, Hue 49000 Vietnam
description: Amazing food, beyond tasty. Happy hour is Excellent value, free bruschetta, bottle of local beer and fruit. We ordered a pizza and a risotto, and you get a glass of wine free with the pizza 🍕. The food was gorgeous. The staff were also so lovely. Our waiter Giang was so sweet and friendly. I would definitely recommend coming here!
cuisines: Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Amazing food, beyond tasty. Happy hour is Excellent value, free bruschetta, bottle of local beer and fruit. We ordered a pizza and a risotto, and you get a glass of wine free with the pizza 🍕. The food was gorgeous. The staff were also so lovely. Our waiter Giang was so sweet and friendly. I would definitely recommend coming here!

A real festival for the senses awaits you at Risotto Restaurant! Fresh and local ingredients meet Vietnamese influences creating aromas that dance on the tongue. The presentation is colorful and generous, the service attentive and friendly. Must try: signature seafood risotto with a touch of lemongrass, accompanied by a refreshing Huda beer Cheer !!!🍻🍻🍻 1.2.3 Zo

Absolute gem of a find in Hue. After a little bit of research we opted to have dinner at Al Risotto and what a fantastic choice we made. Waitress was so kind and helpful and helped with the choice for my wife who has an intolerance to garlic. After choosing our mains we were brought complementary bruschetta with tomatoes as well as a free drink each. When our food arrived it was cooked to perfection. Crispy noodles with chicken was the tastiest meal I’ve had since our arrival in Vietnam almost a week ago. My wife had braised vegetables with rice and we shared a lovely freshly prepared Mediterranean salad which were so tasty. To finish off we had more complimentary fruit served. All in all a great food experience in Hue, we have no hesitation in recommending this place to anyone.

name: Quán Hạnh
address: 11-15 Pho Duc Chinh Phu Hoi, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: We ordered the sampler menu for $150,000 Dong each and it was a great way to be introduced to the unique dishes of this region. YUM!! The staff was great about showing how to eat each dish, what sauces to use, etc. We really enjoyed the entire experience.
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: We ordered the sampler menu for $150,000 Dong each and it was a great way to be introduced to the unique dishes of this region. YUM!! The staff was great about showing how to eat each dish, what sauces to use, etc. We really enjoyed the entire experience.

Not sure what to order so we asked the waiter who recommended several dishes, on the first arrival he showed us how to prepare then eat and so on with rest of the dishes on arrival. The food was excellent as was the service. Highly recommended.

Discover this restaurant by reading reviews about our hotel. Crowded restaurant on weekends (when we were there), as many foreigners as Vietnamese. A discovery menu for 6 euros allows you to taste several specialties. The boss speaks a little French and explains how to taste the different dishes. Interessant

name: Madam Thu 2
address: 04 Vo Thi Sau, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Madam Thu 2 - The branch of The Original Madam Thu Madam Thu 2 is a delightful local restaurant nestled in the picturesque city of Hue, Vietnam. This charming eatery is an extension of the original and renowned Madam Thu, building upon its legacy of exceptional Vietnamese cuisine and warm hospitality. Located in the heart of Hue, Madam Thu 2 welcomes guests with a cozy and inviting ambiance. The restaurant's decor is a blend of traditional and contemporary elements, creating a comfortable setting for diners to enjoy their meal. The soothing color palette and tasteful decorations reflect the rich cultural heritage of the region. Madam Thu 2's menu is a culinary journey through the diverse and flavorful landscape of Vietnamese cuisine. Whether you are a local resident or a traveler exploring Hue, this restaurant offers an authentic taste of the region's culinary traditions. From aromatic bowls of Bun Bo Hue to savory spring rolls and crispy banh xeo, every dish is prepared with meticulous attention to detail and the freshest locally-sourced ingredients. One of the highlights of dining at Madam Thu 2 is the warm and friendly service. The staff takes pride in ensuring that every guest feels at home, providing attentive care and helpful recommendations for those looking to explore the menu. The restaurant's commitment to quality extends beyond its food and service. Madam Thu 2 is also dedicated to sustainable and eco-friendly practices, striving to minimize its environmental footprint while offering a memorable dining experience. Whether you're seeking a taste of authentic Vietnamese cuisine, a friendly atmosphere, or a place to unwind after exploring the historic city of Hue, Madam Thu 2 is the perfect choice. With its dedication to preserving tradition and creating memorable culinary experiences, this local gem is a must-visit destination for anyone looking to savor the flavors of Hue, Vietnam.
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Recommended by our guide so took advice and booked . When booking be aware there are two so check what you have booked I’m sure both are good The one we went was big full menu had pictures so clear to understand and order When the starter came the waitress explained what to do The starters were delicious as was the chicken main 2 starters 3 mains 3 beers 1 glass wine large water all for under £24 excellent value Food was delicious staff great Good place to eat in Hue

Excellent restaurant located in the center of Hue in the most famous street for its nightlife and for the presence of many restaurants. The restaurant is mainly frequented by tourists. The appearance is very traditional and the environment overall is very welcoming. From the menu with the presence of traditional Vietnamese dishes I chose the great mix of appetizers, and I really appreciated that the waiter explained to us the order in which the individual rolls had to be eaten and above all which sauce they had to accompany them with. Everything was very good and the evening was pleasant, reservations necessary.

Had a great meal here on the second night of our stay in Hue. We were sat on the terrace area (I think inside has aircon, but temperature was fine where we were). We both had the set platter (VND190k/£5.60) with some very helpful guidance from the staff on the right ingredients for the pancakes and how to construct them and also how to eat the banana leaf items). Local Huda beer was around 70p. Service was good. Would happily come again.

name: COZY Restaurant
address: 6/27 Ha Noi, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: The meaning of the name is Cozy, with a classical frame with country music, soft light when you come to our shop, wish you a cup of coffee with delicious food, guests are number one when entering the shop. . Our prices are very cheap for tourists, Thank you for coming to my restaurant and vegetarian dishes
cuisines: BBQ Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
review_summary:
COZY Restaurant has won the hearts of many diners with its friendly and attentive service, often rewarded with compliments on the complimentary desserts. The food is consistently lauded for being both delicious and authentic, offering great quality and quantity at reasonable prices.

While the global decor gives the restaurant an eclectic vibe, guests are charmed by its warm ambiance, adding to the overall good value, especially for the variety of Vietnamese dishes that are frequently highlighted in reviews for their affordability and taste.
example_reviews: This is a very nice address in Hue. This little restaurant is definitely worth a visit. The welcome is nice, the dishes (at least the ones we tasted) are delicious, and the note is more than sweet (8.50 euros for 2 people with drinks, starter, dishes and dessert is offered). Our best restaurant since we arrived in Vietnam. Do not hesitate, you will not be disappointed, and at worst you will only have lost a little ten euros.....

I came to this place with my family because it was a short walk from the hotel where we stayed during our stay in Hue. The place is minimal but comfortable, the staff super friendly and attentive. We took 5 different dishes to share so we could taste everything and we were impressed by how good they were. Savory and tasty dishes but not heavy and at the end they also offered us dessert (a panna cotta with caramel on top) which was also delicious like everything else. I also highly recommend it because for the 5 dishes we had, plus drinks, the price in the end was very low, so the value for money is also very good.

Tucked down a little alley way in Hue there is a hidden gem of a restaurant. Although quite small, the restaurant was always busy; service was quick and the young staff were very friendly and helpful. The food is quite simply the best that weâ€™ve eaten while in Vietnam; tasty typically Vietnamese dishes-great portion size and so, so cheap! We stayed in Hue for 3 nights and although it may seem boring, we chose to eat there each night trying different things from the extensive menu. We were never disappointed!

name: Bistro La Carambole
address: 18 Vo Thi Sau, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: romantic restaurant with a large room and two terraces, a la carte menu and also menu for groups, wine list. We speak English, French, Vietnamese, menu in Spanish, ipad menu. Air conditioned room, good music. 18 years of experience, we are waiting for you, see you soon
example_reviews: I loved my visit to Bistro La Carambole. It’s located in the heart of the action in Hue City. The restaurant was busy so there was a great atmosphere and buzz, and the decor is lovely. The genial owner Chris, together with the manager and staff ensure that service is attentive and friendly. Prices are very reasonable and there’s a good balance of western and Vietnamese dishes. I had a delicious French onion soup - very moreish on a rainy night in Hue - followed by very tasty grilled chicken with fries. Portions were generous. We also had soft drinks, wine and beers and the total cost for two was very reasonable. We sat at one of the tables outside to soak up the atmosphere on the street and moved indoors when it became a little too humid. I definitely recommend Bistro La Carambole for anyone visiting Hue.

The restaurant was packed when we arrived at 8.45 pm without a booking but we got a table for two. We enjoyed the grilled duck with orange sauce and the chicken in a mushroom cream sauce. The duck was boneless small slices. The chicken was the standout. Two pieces of breast in a rich tasty cream sauce with two types of mushrooms. The mains are served with a choice of rice, mashed potatoes or fries or mixed vegetables. The mixed vegetables were perfectly cooked and seasoned. The fries were hot and crisp, but the mixed vegetables were better. The French Sauvignon Blanc was acceptable for 115K VND per glass. The meals were delivered quickly despite the large number of customers.

We were recommended to this restaurant by our tour guide. And it didn’t disappoint! The service is excellent. Both of our meals were delicious (can’t find anything to fault them) my husband’s steak was cooked to perfection. This restaurant is good value too. At the end of the night the staff called us a taxi, and as it was raining they even walked us out to the car under big umbrellas! Definitely worth a visit if you’re visiting Hue

name: Alma Restaurant
address: 50A Hung Vuong Street, Phu Nhuan Ward Level 33, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Savor Hue's First Steakhouse: Alma at Meliá Vinpearl Hue. Discover our flavourful beefsteaks inspired by local cuisine – from signature Tomahawk steak (1500g), mouthwatering Beef Wellington (1000g) to appetizing salad bowls and desserts. Luxurious atmosphere, modern design and panoramic views, it is perfect for the signature dining and cherished moments with your beloved ones on the floor 33th.
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Alma Restaurant in Hue is a fantastic dining spot that offers a perfect blend of elegance and comfort. The restaurant features a diverse menu with well-crafted dishes full of rich flavors. The ambiance is sophisticated yet warm, making it an ideal place for romantic dinners or business meetings. One of the highlights of the experience is the excellent service—especially from Quynh, who is exceptionally attentive and friendly, ensuring that every guest feels welcomed and well taken care of. If you’re looking for a high-quality dining experience in Hue, Alma is definitely worth a visit.

This dish is absolutely delightful, offering a perfect balance of rich and well-seasoned flavors that truly stand out. The use of fresh, high-quality ingredients enhances its taste, making every bite a pleasure. Moreover, the beautiful presentation showcases great attention to detail, reflecting the artistry and craftsmanship behind its creation. It’s not just a meal; it’s a true culinary masterpiece that excites both the palate and the eyes.

During trip to Vietnam we decided we wanted to have a western meal and decided to give this a try as it was based in a Melia hotel (which we had stayed in whilst in Hanoi with a good experience). Stunning views across the city and excellent menu choice. Food was great! My only one criticism is that they brought our main courses when my husband was still eating the last of his starter! Even the bread roll and butter was of a high standard (not doughy and sweet as is so often the case). Went upstairs to the Skybar for after dinner drink which was equally stunning. Photos don’t do it justice. Definitely worth a visit and worth the extra money.

name: Ben Xuan Garden House Theatre
address: Van Thanh Riverside, between ThienMu Pagoda and VanThanh Temple of Literature, Hue Vietnam
description: VISIT, LUNCH, CONCERT, FINE DINING in the inspiring ambience of BEN XUAN GARDEN HOUSE THEATRE. Ben Xuan is built in royal architectural style, located on the most beautiful site of the Perfume River, and conceptually designed as an East West cultural meeting place. Ben Xuan's owners, Camille Huyền (Artist) and Truong Dinh Ngo (retired Swiss UBS Banker), both of them native of Hue and having lived for more than forty years in Germany, France, and Switzerland, will welcome you personally. The soirée as the highlight of the evening will unfold in the ambience of the Theatre House. The concert program is set up with the repertoire of Camille and accompanied by Ben Xuan's traditional instrument ensemble interpreting Ca Hue Royal Chamber Songs, World lullabies, Vietnamese Art Songs &Folksongs and Western Classical Songs. Enjoy the cultural exchange, chamber music and fine dining at Ben Xuan as the literati, the noble and the royal used to indulge their leisure time. Reservation in advance.
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Food is always the top of our list of priorities when travelling and Vietnam is no different ,though some may think of Pho as the all consuming Vietnamese dish. I was looking for a fine dining restaurant to indulge and narrowed down to 2. Ben Xuan Garden House was my choice after reading some positive reviews. I received an email reply from Ngo who said he would be happy to set a table for us. It was all POSITIVE from the word GO ! Ngo called me and suggested the best approach to Ben Xuan was via a 25min boat ride down the perfume river. On arrival , Ngo warmly welcomed the 4 . We were served refreshments. He even helped snap a few Photos ( which he knew) would become a great conversation piece when friends ask about our visit to Hue. He then introduce his very charming wife Camille to us. We could sense that she was someone very special with multi - talented kills in painting , planning and restoring the Garden House to it's glory. After , a tour of the the compounds , Ngo ushered us into the main recital hall. As we did not see other guests, I thought we would be waiting a while for others to arrive. As it turns out it was going to be just the 4 of us ( overwhelming pleasant surprise ) . The "private" recital was like some surreal VIP entertainment . After 30 odd minutes or so, I was eager to savour the special cuisine prepared for us. Each of the dish served was exquisite and we couldn't help but snap enough fotos to fill a small album. A final comment is that Ben Xuan is not your typical fine dining restaurant but an all encompassing experience . We wish Camille and Ngo all the best of health as most Asians cherish a lot and success in their operation and passion in what they enjoy doing. I strongly recommend anyone who is thinking of visiting and meeting Camille and Ngo not to pass up the opportunity . Best wishes to Camille and Ngo . Lilian & Andy ( Singapore) Liz & Gabby ( Melbourne) .

We took a boat to the front gates of this marvelous and interesting home/studio on the banks of the river and it was truly enchanting. We were met by the proprietors Camille and Truang and started with a tour of the amazing property (designed by Camille). We enjoyed an authentic dinner after a performance by Camille and her fellow artist and performers. The music was an interesting mix of north and south Vietnam pieces, juxtaposed with a piece from the southern US. Traung and Camille were the commensurate hosts and could not have made us feel more welcome. This is a great experience for anyone who appreciates the arts (many of Camilles paintings) and music and is an experience off the beaten path.

We had the pleasure of attending a recital and dinner at the beautiful home of Camille and Truong on this past Saturday evening. It was indeed the highlight of our trip to Vietnam. The music on ancient instruments and Camille’s beautiful voice were magical. Their home is a masterpiece designed by Camille. She is also an artist. Her art is beautifully displayed in their home. They were so welcoming and the food and wine was divine. Reservations are required and I highly recommend it if you are visiting Hue.

name: Nina's Cafe - Eatery
address: 16/34 Nguyen Tri Phuong Laneway 34, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: All our food is made using really fresh ingredients bought daily from the market and supermarket. We make Vietnamese and Western food as well as Huế Specialities. We really recommend trying some of these dishes as they are unique to Huế and very tasty! We also make fruit shakes, hot drinks, cold drinks and numerous alcoholic drinks.As well as food, we can help you to arrange tours whilst you are in Huế. If you have any questions about Hue or Vietnam we will try to help you in any way we can. We want all our visitors to know we are honest and want everyone to have a really happy time while they are at our restaurant.
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: After many days eating local food I wanted to try something closer. I chose the spaghetti with tomato and meat. The spaghetti was very good, different meat than what you usually find in Vietnam, it was minced meat with the same flavor that you can have in Spain. For dessert I chose a pancake and vanilla ice cream that tasted amazing. The portions are not very large, taking into account the price, but the treatment of the waitress (she couldn't have been more pleasant and friendly) and the taste of the food make the experience a 10.

Fantastic food. Y and Hang greeted us and looked after us. We chose Pork skewers on lemongrass & Vegetable spring rolls to start, with 2 Huda beers. For mains we had Pork caramel clay pot and Pork Yellow curry, both with rice. A bottle of Chilean SB - amazing food, so fresh tasting. Service was amazing by Y and Hang who both practised their English with us and taught us some Vietnamese too. We will be coming back as we are here for 4 nights. Highly recommended. They take visa debit cards and charge an extra 3%. Fantastic value as our meal cost £23 for the two of us. Well done to the team!

Absolutely excellent. The food served was all divine- very likely the best Vietnamese food yet! The grilled fish was superb as was the pork and eggplant fried. The pancake for dessert was quite rubbery so wouldn’t particularly recommend that. Will likely revisit.

name: Golden Rice
address: 40 Pham Ngu Lao Street, Hue 47000 Vietnam
description: Golden rice is there to offer our guests Authentic local fresh and Asian fusion food in a cozy atmosphere , well selection of wine and cocktails are also available.
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Great first evening in Hue! The restaurant was quiet but had been recommended by our tour guide. Really good value enjoyed several beers the banana flower salad and complimentary spring rolls both of which were delicious. Then had several curry dishes and other stir fries all were excellent. Great value for money and fabulous service from Chan.

It was the first time we came to Golden Rice for dinner. We ordered three dishes, including stir-fried water spinach, sweet and sour fish, and braised tofu. The sweet and sour fish was especially delicious. The boss also generously gave us a delicious spring roll, here The dining atmosphere is beautiful, with beautiful lanterns and very tasteful decoration. I want to thank you for the service, professional chefs, staff, and the young ladies in the store. The boys greeted me very kindly, leaving behind wonderful times and memories. I would also like to thank the beautiful phuong mai, le dan, who assisted us in renting a motorcycle and providing detailed information about the tour. I recommend friends who travel here to taste the delicious food and enjoy the friendliness of the people.

We initially came here for lunch and enjoyed the food so much that we can back for my sister's birthday dinner. I had pad thai noodles and my sister had a curry dish. An appetizer, two entrees and two smoothies cost us $12. The service was wonderful, the servers were adorable and helped us find new places to go see. The restaurant is centrally located, on a street with many other small, cute, restaurants.

name: Maison Trang Restaurant
address: 24/26 Võ Thị Sáu, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Maison Trang has been gaining a reputation for the high quality of authentic regional dishes that you should not miss such as Beo, Nam, Loc cake, grilled pork wrapped wet rice paper, grilled chopped pork with lemon grass and stuffed rice pancake. Our traditional cuisine is so distinctive from other regions and we serve the dishes which are cooked to past emperors and royal Nguyen Dynasty.
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Many vegan & vegetarian options, the best food I ate since arrival. You enter barefoot, pay cash, English spoken, low prices, everyone smiles and teach you how to eat what they serve. Several vegan and vegetarian options, the best I've eaten so far. Access barefoot, payment in cash, speak English, give directions on how to consume food, all smiling, low prices

We came across this very small family-run restaurant by chance. The road to get there, a side street of the nightlife area, is not particularly lit and initially does not inspire much confidence. We have chosen to order "set menus" in which smaller portions of different dishes are served that you can order individually. All dishes were very good and tasty. Value for money highly recommended. Two menus, two beers and a large bottle of water about 180,000 dong/pers. The service is good, one of the owners explained how to prepare and / or eat the various dishes. Small point about cleanliness, we are in Vietnam so we cannot expect the same standards as other countries. It is normal to find cutlery and more on the table in special containers. The place still looks pretty clean. If you want a typical cuisine, not too touristy and convenient... you are in the right place!

This was our best dinner in Hue! Tucked away in a little alley, if we hadn’t have been told about it we would not have found it. Our family of 5 shared 7 different dishes and they were amazing. You have to try the Bun Bo Hue. Fantastic service and the food came out so quick, our boys were happy to have full bellies. The second best part is that our meal and drinks for 5, cost half that of western venues in local area, and we weren’t haggled off the street to eat there. Just great food!

name: Dmz Bar Restaurant
description: Very good service, nice staff and good food. Love the service from My- she has super energy! Really enjoy the atmosphere in this place!
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Very good service, nice staff and good food. Love the service from My- she has super energy! Really enjoy the atmosphere in this place!

My favourite bar in Hue - I visited 3 times Morning coffee cappuccinos are great. Also some excellent Vietnamese dishes and some western style food too - I enjoyed all The hudda draught comes in a big chilled glass and goes down a treat. The best part about this bar are the staff; they’re courteous, efficient and cheerful offering a top service to their customers The decor is pretty cool too

Efficient prompt service in English with a smile. Tasty snacks & meals & your beer is replenished before you finish your first one! You can even book a superb DMZ tour while you down a cold draught beer at a price that won’t break the bank. I’ll be back again for more!

name: La Paix Bistro
address: 57 Vo Thi Sau Phu Hoi, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: La Paix Bistro is one of the restaurants that bring this bistro breeze into Hue. We are located right on Vo Thi Sau street, a central and busiest street of Hue city. With elegant French style at La Paix, you can experience attractive French-flavored dishes and drinks and enjoy relaxing moments in a typical French romantic space. Forgetting the barriers of formality and style, let's enjoy and experience French cuisine in the style of La Paix Bistro! BRAND PHILOSOPHY At La Paix, we believe that customer satisfaction is the minimum goal a restaurant must achieve. However, La Paix desires more than that. We want to make customers not only stop at enjoying delicious food and attractive drinks but also have an experience imbued with French urbanism - where customers can comfortably enjoy their lifestyle in a romantic space close to nature. DELICIOUS FROM FRANCE CUISINES La Paix Bistro is highly appreciated in the culinary aspect with an attractive menu of dishes that satisfy...
cuisines: French Restaurants for Large Groups in Hue
Italian Restaurants with Buffet in Hue
Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: The friendly and kind staff make you feel more welcome and family when you enter this restaurant while eating delicious food. Excellent customer service and impressive food service will make you feel special. La Paix Bistro is designed to share the love we have for food. The price is reasonable and the portions are even more buffet eating, it seems like you don't need to mention taxes. Properly fuller on a solid entertainment machine. and leaving the restaurant and being a baccarat poker, but also your satisfaction when visiting La Paix Bistro.

From Italian pasta to French and Vietnamese Pho, every dish was a delight to our taste buds. The diverse and well-stocked wine list perfectly complemented our meal. We loved the stylish and creative atmosphere, which added to the overall dining experience. The convenient and easy-to-find location made it a breeze to visit multiple times during our stay in Hue. La Paix Bistro is truly a hidden gem for food lovers!

We took the whole family to La Paix Bistro and were impressed by the professional and experienced chef who created extraordinary dishes. The fusion of Vietnamese and French cuisine is simply delicious! The kids loved the desserts. The only drawback: the service is a bit slow during peak hours. Despite this, we will definitely come back to taste other dishes of their innovative menu.

name: Quan Cat Ba Family
address: 180 Một Tháng Tư, Cat Ba Town, Hai Phong, Cat Ba Vietnam
description:
Good food. It's delicious. The seafood is super. The rice is delicious (garlic rice).
Clam, shrimps and ousters grilled in garlic better is fantastic!
Prices excellent, shrimp 150, shells and oysters 80

Of the disadvantages, it's impossible to order anything, ladies forget everything they asked for. But I also had enough ordered) very delicious) 

Another thing, you have to sit outside, only the locals have inside, and there's no air conditioning inside anyway, just fans. So you can only have dinner there, after sunset)))
cuisines: Healthy Restaurants in Cat Ba Town
Fast Food Restaurants in Cat Ba Town
Asian Restaurants for Large Groups in Cat Ba Town
Vietnamese Restaurants for Lunch in Cat Ba Town
example_reviews: Good food. It's delicious. The seafood is super. The rice is delicious (garlic rice). Clam, shrimps and ousters grilled in garlic better is fantastic! Prices excellent, shrimp 150, shells and oysters 80 Of the disadvantages, it's impossible to order anything, ladies forget everything they asked for. But I also had enough ordered) very delicious) Another thing, you have to sit outside, only the locals have inside, and there's no air conditioning inside anyway, just fans. So you can only have dinner there, after sunset)))

I visited the restaurant with my 2 children (10 & 8). We had seafood (grilled Oysters, squid) + veggies, spring rolls and chicken rice. All food was very good and fresh. The restaurant was quite full and there were many Vietnamese, which of course is a good sign. For fresh seafood and the size of the portions I found the price completely reasonable (we paid 460k VND incl. drinks). We would definitely come back again!

We visited this restaurant four times during our 3-day stay in Cat Ba because it was the best seafood we have ever had, and for a very reasonable price. There is a great range on the menu and definitely something for everyone. The seafood was fresh from the tank. We couldn't recommend this place enough! The family who run it are also very nice and welcoming.

name: The Three M Restaurant
address: 252 đường Một Tháng Tư, Hai Phong, Cat Ba 187310 Vietnam
description:
Exceptional seafood and great beer! Pretty much every variety of seafood I’ve ever heard of - and more! All of it is fresh, kept in tanks and prepared in the restaurant. 

We had Thai steamed clams, beer steam shrimp, salt baked mantis shrimp and fried sea bass which was all delicious!!

Also they serve local Hà Nội beer on tap a variety of craft beers from a brewery in Ho Chi Minh (7 bridges). 

Really inexpensive, really good quality food and great service - especially from our waitresses Hien and Bich! Would highly recommend! 🙂
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Cat Ba
Street Food Restaurants in Cat Ba
example_reviews: Exceptional seafood and great beer! Pretty much every variety of seafood I’ve ever heard of - and more! All of it is fresh, kept in tanks and prepared in the restaurant. We had Thai steamed clams, beer steam shrimp, salt baked mantis shrimp and fried sea bass which was all delicious!! Also they serve local Hà Nội beer on tap a variety of craft beers from a brewery in Ho Chi Minh (7 bridges). Really inexpensive, really good quality food and great service - especially from our waitresses Hien and Bich! Would highly recommend! 🙂

I haven't seen any place as reasonable as my restaurant. My group has 100 guests but the service is still attentive and complete. Fresh seafood tourist area with reasonable prices without being overcharged, the owners and staff are very happy and active. Will come back to this restaurant next time I come to Cat Ba

Great food, cool vibe and excellent service. Hien made some great recommendations and provided excellent service, we enjoyed the pork rib, steamed vegetables and morning glory with garlic. The fish looked fresh as well. We tried the la Palma red wine, it's only 13% and nice and light without being acidic.

name: Secret Garden Cafe And Restaurant
address: 169 Nui Ngoc street, Hai Phong, Cat Ba 180000 Vietnam
description: Secret Garden is a new and unique restaurant located on the tree-lined streets of Cat Ba main town. We focus on fresh, healthy and soul-nourishing food. We strive to ensure quality, great service and great taste. Our menu is full of delicious recipes and flavors not usually found on Cat Ba Island, catering to vegetarians, vegans and non-vegetarians. We offer a range of amazing secret recipes Vegan Burgers, Chicken Burgers, Buddha Bowls, Smoothie Bowls and more. Some of the delicious and unique flavors you can find on our menu are homemade Pesto, Hummus, Guacamole, Peanut Sauce, Vegan..
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Cat Ba
Street Food Restaurants in Cat Ba
Romantic Vietnamese Restaurants in Cat Ba
example_reviews: great food, warm service, and a beautiful atmosphere,..... The staff are exceptionally friendly and welcoming, providing top-notch service that makes you feel right at home. They are attentive to your needs, offering recommendations when asked and ensuring you have a pleasant dining experience

Absolutely loved my visit to this charming little pub in Cat Ba! The atmosphere was warm and welcoming, with friendly staff who made us feel right at home. The selection of local craft beers was impressive, and the food was delicious—try the seafood platter for a real treat! The cozy ambiance and stunning views made it the perfect spot to unwind after a day of exploring. Can't wait to be back here!!!

The moment I stepped into the hostel, I immediately felt the freshness and peace of the atmosphere here. The staff were very friendly, warmly welcomed me and gave me the feeling of being home. The food was very tasty, varied and served all day, I also enjoyed the breakfast at night. The price for drinks, especially beers was really cheap and reasonable. The service was good. I would recommend this place to my friends, and come back one day. Really enjoyed the best time here.

name: The Little Leaf Restaurant
address: 224 Duong Mot Thang Tu, Hai Phong, Cat Ba 187300 Vietnam
description: A cozy and beautiful space. The Little Leaf restaurant with an outstanding menu of coffee, tea and healthy dishes, vegetarian food and Vietnamese dishes. A beautiful space to enjoy a wonderful time when visiting Cat Ba island with friends and family. Enjoy an energizing cup of coffee with nutritious breakfast dishes, enjoy Vietnamese dishes, vegetarian dishes, healthy dishes and some European dishes. Read a book, play games with friends and friendly staff.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Cat Ba
Street Food Restaurants in Cat Ba
Romantic Vietnamese Restaurants in Cat Ba
example_reviews: Very attractive restaurant with nice decoration and seating outside and inside. The menu was very attractive and extensive and the service very friendly and English-speaking (but not always very attentive). We ate there three times because not many restaurants were open during the holidays (Tet). I had a delicious vegetarian teriyaki bowl with cashews, peas, corn, tofu, broccoli, rice, etc. and a ginger tea. My friend had spicy seafood (really spicy) and a coffee. I also tried the vegetarian burger, the tofu with soy sauce and my friend had the vegetarian curry and chicken with fries. We found it very tasty and as a vegetarian I was happy to finally be able to eat something other than spring rolls, fried rice or noodles. I can definitely recommend the vegetarian burger, the bowl and the ginger tea! In addition, the service (a young woman) was able to offer us a bus ride to Ninh Binh directly from the island due to her good English skills. Due to the holidays (Tet), planning the return trip was a bit difficult as many travel agencies were closed.

We selected this restaurant according to the great reviews and were absolutely not disappointed with the food and service. We ordered the burrito and mango sticky rice, both were delicious. The burrito is little spicy. You can est on the terrace. Great value for money.

I had coffee and breakfast here two days in a row, food was lovely, a berry smoothie bowl and avocado and poached eggs on toast were particularly welcome after two weeks of noodles and rice! Espresso was also great. Excellent and friendly service from Huong, who happily accommodated a couple of substitutions/ additions I asked for.

name: Ladybird Cafeteria And Restaurant
description: The menu offers a wide variety of dishes, all made with fresh ingredients that really shine through. The friendly staff made excellent recommendations, and the generous portions meant we got great value for money. The spacious seating arrangement and clean environment made our dining experience super comfortable.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Cat Ba
Fast Food Restaurants in Cat Ba
Romantic Seafood Restaurants in Cat Ba
review_summary:
Nestled in a picturesque spot with stunning views of Cat Ba bay, Ladybird Cafeteria and Restaurant is a haven for those seeking both scenic dining and culinary delight. Guests have called out the exceptional service, highlighting the staff's attentiveness and proficiency in English. It's not just the service that earns rave reviews but also the value, with the restaurant offering a cornucopia of delectable Vietnamese dishes at reasonable prices.

The fusion of local and international flavors, coupled with the fresh ingredients, ensures a memorable gastronomic experience. Moreover, the restaurant's ambiance, with its unique decor and local art, makes for an enchanting atmosphere ideal for a romantic or tranquil meal.
example_reviews: The menu offers a wide variety of dishes, all made with fresh ingredients that really shine through. The friendly staff made excellent recommendations, and the generous portions meant we got great value for money. The spacious seating arrangement and clean environment made our dining experience super comfortable.
