They say they prepare relatively inexpensive lobster, but it must be ordered in advance. I really liked the tuna pieces in sauce, this was the second time I came specifically for it.

An exceptional dining experience awaits at Mui! The pho here is truly outstanding, a delightful blend of flavors that leaves your taste buds dancing. The ambience is refreshingly clean and inviting, setting the perfect stage for an enjoyable meal. Notably, this gem offers incredible value for your money, making it even more appealing. I can't stress enough how highly recommended it is to visit this place in Mui. It's a culinary delight that provides a combination of delicious cuisine, a pleasant atmosphere, and affordability, making it a must-visit for anyone seeking an exceptional dining adventure.

Very often with the children we go to lunch here!All excellent - friendly staff, stylish interior, delicious food, namely pho bo soup, vogue noodles with beef, tuna salad!But the most highlight and find for the children - mush patties like in kindergarten!!!So super cafe, well done!!

name: La Riva Italian Restaurant & Bar
address: 33a Nguyen Dinh Chieu Phường Hàm Tiến, Mui Ne, Phan Thiet Vietnam
description:
We eat Italian! Scents and flavors of Italian food, prepared by Italian chefs. The best Italian restaurant tried here in Vietnam. 
Congratulations to the staff for their empathy, hospitality, ability to convey the Italian atmosphere but, above all, to make this country appreciate the true Italian cuisine
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Mui Ne
French Restaurants for Lunch in Mui Ne
BBQ Restaurants for Large Groups in Mui Ne
Cafes for Breakfast in Mui Ne
example_reviews: We eat Italian! Scents and flavors of Italian food, prepared by Italian chefs. The best Italian restaurant tried here in Vietnam. Congratulations to the staff for their empathy, hospitality, ability to convey the Italian atmosphere but, above all, to make this country appreciate the true Italian cuisine

Excellent delicious Italian food, friendly restaurant staff, met a friendly owner-Italian, told about his establishment)))) Divinely prepared pizza!!! Delicious wine! The whole company was happy! But the prices are higher than other establishments with local cuisine.

We have struggled to find quality dinner places in Mui Ne outside of our hotel (the Anantara), but La Riva was a great choice. I had the parma ham and mozzarella salad to start and the rigatoni puttanesca as my main, and my wife had the beef carpaccio to start and the parma ham and burrata pizza as her main and they were all really tasty. We had a lovely montepulciano d'abruzzo wine; it was a bit pricey for a restaurant in Vietnam outside of the hotels, but nothing outrageous (c.£35). If I were staying in Mui Ne for longer then I would definitely come back here.

name: Chaikhana 312
address: 12 Nguyen Dinh Chieu Sea Lion Resort - Mui Ne, Phan Thiet 800000 Vietnam
description:
This is our second time in Mui Ne and teahouse 312 is the best place to eat, clean, large portions, tasty, huge menu which includes Asian truck cuisine, European and Central Asian cuisine.
I recommend lobsters, you just need to order in advance so that they are delivered fresh.
Awesome beef kebab, I never thought that the best kebab was in Vietnam.
I also recommend trying the local B52, from Yulia and according to her drinking instructions :) I drank 1.8 liters once.
I also highly recommend the fried langman.
And shrimp in sesame seeds.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Phan Thiet
Fast Food Restaurants in Phan Thiet
example_reviews: This is our second time in Mui Ne and teahouse 312 is the best place to eat, clean, large portions, tasty, huge menu which includes Asian truck cuisine, European and Central Asian cuisine. I recommend lobsters, you just need to order in advance so that they are delivered fresh. Awesome beef kebab, I never thought that the best kebab was in Vietnam. I also recommend trying the local B52, from Yulia and according to her drinking instructions :) I drank 1.8 liters once. I also highly recommend the fried langman. And shrimp in sesame seeds.

I’ve been to Vietnam 3 times already! And exactly in Mui Ne! And my boyfriend and I always went there. Always delicious food, variety of dishes. If you are tired of seafood and Vietnamese cuisine, you can always eat something native, especially with a hangover, tom yum helped 😅 The hosts are pleasant, they will always order and offer something interesting. We are lobster and lobster lovers... They prepared them for us with garlic sauce just great! We ate until we unzipped our shorts!!)) We highly recommend this place to tourists! Attached are photos of the goodies!

I want to express my gratitude to the masters of Chaikhana, a worthy place in Muina both just to have lunch and dinner and to celebrate a birthday, boldly recommend to your friends and family. The menus are varied from our patties to the Vietnamese exotic, the prices are more than adequate, the service and energy from Yuli (met locally) is off the scale. Very atmospheric place, clean, neat, delicious. Thank you Yulia and Askhat (I'm not very sure I spelled the name correctly, no offense). When we get back to Muina, I'll be sure to see you first. Prosperity to you, see you again.

name: Thinh's Restaurant & Bar
address: 85 Nguyen Dinh Chieu between Blue Ocean and Saigon Mui Ne Hotel, Mui Ne, Phan Thiet Vietnam
description: We offer to all our guests authentic vietnamese food in a relaxing atmosphere. Our menu is available in English, German, Russian and Chinese. The taste of our dishes is equal with the food of the local people, while we prepare it more or less spicy by request. The Restaurant has 60 seats in total, 28 in the front part along the main road and 32 seats in the backyard which is more quiet. The toilets are probably some of the cleanest in Mui Ne. Our wifi is free of charge for all our guests. Our staff speaks English and German. Please note that we don't have Russian speaking staff in our restaurant. We are looking forward to welcoming you soon.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Mui Ne
French Restaurants for Lunch in Mui Ne
BBQ Restaurants for Large Groups in Mui Ne
Cafes for Breakfast in Mui Ne
example_reviews: This is the second time we have been here because of the exceptional cuisine. The first time we had a Vietnamese platter with four different dishes. The food is very well seasoned, not too spicy and simply delicious. The chef also speaks German and gives good advice. The staff is very friendly. We will be back.

First time in Vietnam and immediately found a restaurant where German is really spoken. All food is well explained by thin and if you want cooked in different spiciness levels. Always super delicious, no matter what we ordered. And inexpensive. Time had flown too fast, unfortunately. PS: If you feel like it, you can also have new glasses made at more than fair prices. Thin is also an optician with training in Germany.

After a few days we finally found Thinh's restaurant where you could pay with Visa card. We were warmly welcomed and tried the very delicious menu on several days. It was all very good and of course cheap. Thinh tries very hard and we felt very comfortable among exclusively German guests. Menu in German and Thinh speaks German, of course. So he could also answer our other questions about country and people chatting ;) His herbal schnapps are also great. Definitely recommended.

name: Quan Bo Ke Tuan Thao 180
address: 120 Nguyen Dinh Chieu, Mui Ne, Phan Thiet Vietnam
description: The seafood is very fresh, good cooking. The price is more expensive than Nha Trang but I think it is worthy
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Mui Ne
Cafes for Lunch in Mui Ne
Italian Restaurants for Lunch in Mui Ne
example_reviews: The seafood is very fresh, good cooking. The price is more expensive than Nha Trang but I think it is worthy

Whole stretch of mui ne is filled with seafood and i was afraid to get the bad ones so i did alot of googling and thankfully i picked out the right one! The snapper was fresh and crispy, the lobsters were big, and the bamboo shoots were so meaty! Scallops on the smaller side but all good! Total meal set us back to $45 SGD which is so reasonable! Staff were very friendly too. Will love to go back again. Freshest seafood i ever had!

I m coming from egzotic place where is good prepared sea food normal to me. I tried so bad food during my traveling that I really didn't excpect nothing special in Vietnam. But, when food arrived and when we started to eat I was positive suprised! Food is amazing. We had shrimps, tuna, squid and few more things. They had butter and garlic on the top, so juicy, tasty, soft, even tuna wasn' t dry. We payed good price for all of that, you can ask for Discount. I was like at home! I ll come back again, next Year.

name: Backstage Bar & Grill
address: 139D Nguyen Dinh Chieu, Mui Ne, Phan Thiet Vietnam
description: Welcome to the Backstage Bar & Grill, the most friendly place in Mui Ne! We welcome you from 8AM to midnight to serve you our French, Vietnamese and International cuisine. Come try our continental or american breakfast, soups, salads, pasta, steak, BBQ table combos, noodles, seafood, desserts and sweet crepes, as well as a wide choice of drinks: all kinds of alcohol, wine, cocktails, coffee and fresh fruit juice. You are here at home and hope you'll have a great time with us at Backstage Bar & Grill!
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Mui Ne
Italian Restaurants for Lunch in Mui Ne
Late Night Pizza in Mui Ne
example_reviews: For a start, the food was great - a,largely french menu and well cooked and presented. The ambience was also great. However - the gold star goes to the waiting staff, who run their little socks off in a helpful, friendly and unobtrusive way. They're all good - but Vee is absolutely outstanding ( with great English, by the way). A message to the owners - whatever you're paying these guys, you should double it. I've returned 5 times for dinner purely on the strength of the service. Definitely a 5 star (if quite expensive) option.

Honestly stunning meal! Highly recommend! Food excellent, cocktails delicious and service attentive. For starters we can the beef carpaccio and cheese board, and for mains I had duck breast and hubby had steak. Can highly recommend those dishes. Not the cheapest in the area but you get what you pay for and in my mind it is excellent value. Many delicious cocktails too. If you are close by a must to stop in at, it was about 3km from our hotel so we used the taxi app grab and got here for 34k about £1.30

If you go here you need to try the arrabbiata pasta, it’s one of our favourite dishes at home, and this one became one of our top ones we’d ever had. So much flavour and a good portion size for the good price too! The staff were lovely and welcoming. If I could go back again and again, I would!

name: Steak Ngon
address: 61 Mai Hắc Đế, Phường 6, Da Lat 670000 Vietnam
description: Great restaurant. We were 2 couples and had pumpkin soup, camembert, caesar salad, rib eyes (all medium rare and perfectly cooked) and salmon. Sides were roast potatoes, truffle fries, broccoli and asparagus. All was wonderful, no complaints. Beer was chilled, no need for ice as in most places, and glass of French wine tasty. Service was good, though Im not keen on the clearing of plates whilst someone on the table is still eating. 10 out of 10 otherwise!
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
example_reviews: Great restaurant. We were 2 couples and had pumpkin soup, camembert, caesar salad, rib eyes (all medium rare and perfectly cooked) and salmon. Sides were roast potatoes, truffle fries, broccoli and asparagus. All was wonderful, no complaints. Beer was chilled, no need for ice as in most places, and glass of French wine tasty. Service was good, though Im not keen on the clearing of plates whilst someone on the table is still eating. 10 out of 10 otherwise!

Very nice steakhouse. If you are looking for western-style service and food this is the place. Very attentive staff - Andy the Maitre’d and the rest of the staff are awesome. Steak was cooked as ordered and very tender. Wine by the glass is from Chile (white) or France (red) and is very affordable. If I’m in Dalat again I will definitely return.

After a long days travel through the rainy mountainous area of Đá Lạt, we stopped by for dinner after a quick google search. When arriving, we were quickly greeted by a gracious host who guided us through the ground floor which seemed to be a cafe? The space is a cozy intimate dining area. The menu is in both English and Vietnamese with highlighted recommended dishes. Our choices for the evening were the Dá Lạt salad, crab bisque pasta, steak and mashed potatoes. The da Lạt salad surprised us both. It’s quite plentiful and the vegetables/fruit were fresh. The crab pasta was crabby in flavor, but in a good way. It even came with the shell stuffed with crab meat and cheese baked on top. The steak was seasoned nicely and the pepper sauce paired well. The steak was cooked a tad bit rare for my partner, but she still enjoyed it. We enjoyed the pepper sauce, but it was fantastic with the mashed potatoes. The carrots were cooked very well. Overall, we enjoyed our experience. It’s a good value, it’s good for sharing (you may need 3-4 plates for two depending on how big of appetites you have), and the service is fantasticz

name: Trang's Cookery Restaurant
address: 211 Phan Dinh Phung, Da Lat 670000 Vietnam
description: A warming, cozy little restaurant for Vietnamese culinary experience in Dalat. If you want for a little escape from local food, Trang's Cookery Restaurant always welcome.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Thai Restaurants for Lunch in Da Lat
example_reviews: I came here because this restaurant showed up on my gluten free search of Dalat and it was near our hotel. What a really nice atmosphere over several busy floors of happy customers. I explained my gluten free needs to the waiter and he took a photo of my translation card and then came back after talking with the kitchen staff, and he recommended the beef and veggie stir fry set, that comes with soup (yummy broth), salad with vinegrette and rice. I was really pleased at the size, presentation, and most of all the taste was really nice! I was full but not stuffed and everything felt light and fresh. It was also pretty cheap, so on a travel budget, it was great! I have to give a shoutout to the amazing wait staff who ran those stairs like athletes, making sure everyone was happy and getting their food quickly! We will be back! {Also I did not react to my meal at all! :) }

I had breakfast at Trang's Cookery today, and it was delightful. I enjoyed their avocado-packed eggs with the freshest 'muffin' bread that wasn't overly sweet. The coffee was top-notch. What stood out the most was the excellent service from the hardworking and incredibly polite server. The only thing I might not order again is the pumpkin soup, as it was a bit too sweet for my taste.

Wonderful friendly service as soon as you walk through door. Free hot tea whilst you browse the menu. My husband and I opted for the hot beef Philly baguette. It arrived beautifully presented with fries and side salad and a very large (cut in two) baguette filled to the brim. Highly recommend this lovely, clean and friendly little restaurant. PS they have delicious looking cakes but was too full to try them! It rained whilst we were in there and a family leaving were given free rain ponchos. It’s the little things 🥰

name: Moto Laurie Cafe
address: No. 8 Ngo Thi Sy, Ward 4, Da Lat 670000 Vietnam
description: We are a Restaurant/Cafe serving western-style food, Cakes. We have Locally roasted coffee and a range of Vietnamese Craft Beers. All our meals are cooked to order. Our concept is fresh and delicious food in a relaxed vibe open outdoor area with a balcony and indoor seating I'm sure you will find a seat you will enjoy. From breakfast, lunch and dinner we have you covered. Please check out the menu link and hope to see you soon. Thanks
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Da Lat
Late Night Pizza in Da Lat
Seafood Restaurants for Lunch in Da Lat
example_reviews: I went with my family and experienced the delicious food here. I ordered pancakes, lasana, cheesecake. Because my family ate it all, I didn't take pictures of the dishes, only pictures of the desserts...sr the whole family To be honest, this is the first time I've eaten European food in Vietnam with the right flavor, full of Western standards, and the pancake portion is quite large, 3 thick pieces. My baby couldn't eat it all, so his parents had to eat for him to finish the plate I give Cheesecake a score of 10, it's rich in flavor and you can taste the light fatty flavor after eating Lasana is extremely fragrant and rich in flavor. My baby doesn't like to eat tomatoes and this dish has tomato flavor but he can still eat it and he compliments all 3 dishes as delicious. Service is friendly and attentive, but food takes a while to prepare. If improved, it would be an ideal place for tourists to enjoy more. The atmosphere is sunny in the morning but the wind is cool, so I really enjoy sitting and eating while admiring the peaceful view of the hills and small houses In short, my house is quite picky about style, but my husband, me and my baby all like it. It's simple and the food is perfect... I will come back many times when I visit Da Lat again. Thank you shop😄

It’s just amazing, there’s not a negative. Absolutely everything we took was amazing. Burgers, pasta, pizzas everything is homemade, desserts are divine, I recommend 100% and frankly for the price we are students, it is really cheap. There is not a flop, it is a 20/20. It’s the first time I’ve been to a restaurant and everything is good, honestly! It’s definitely the first time I’ve posted an opinion on the Internet so much it’s amazing! Go ahead, eyes closed!!

This is not my first time at Moto Laurie. They were at a different location, movinh maybe a year ago, to a larger and more attractive location. The owners are wonderful people and very dedicated. Since moving, the menu has been widely extended, and they have numerous, exquisite vegan dishes, which I have sampled. They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner. They have many bakery items from bread to cakes. (Some of them only to order) I believe it is the only place in DaLat that has home made bagels. Yes, they do have bagels with lox and cream cheese . (Lox=smoked salmon.) I have to say that I have never had a menu item that I disliked. The soups are amazing. Pizza delicious. I have one objection: Nobody comes back to the table after serving to ask if one would care for something else. Maybe that is only expected by westerners only, but I feel it could add to the quality of service. It is not uncommon in Vietnam and a small price to pay for a delicious meal at a reasonable price. Highly recommended. I will be back.

name: Nhà hàng Túi Mơ To Garden Restaurant
address: Hem 31 Sao Nam, Phuong 11, Da Lat Vietnam
description:
Such a peaceful restaurant tucked away from the crowded main road. 
They serve a variety of grilled meats, seafood, and vegetables with different sauces and side dishes. 
The restaurant has a cozy atmosphere and reasonable prices. And the beautiful view was to d*e for.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Late Night Vietnamese Restaurants in Da Lat
Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Da Lat
example_reviews: Such a peaceful restaurant tucked away from the crowded main road. They serve a variety of grilled meats, seafood, and vegetables with different sauces and side dishes. The restaurant has a cozy atmosphere and reasonable prices. And the beautiful view was to d*e for.

Such a fun place with immaculate vibes - the view, lights and music made for a lovely evening in a very Instagrammable location. The food was delicious, however I would recommend asking for a second bbq grill if in a larger group as our fire died down quite fast. The pork belly and vegetables were stand out and the drinks were impressive too. Definitely head here if visiting Da Lat, it's an amazing quiet spot set outside of the hustle and bustle of town.

We arrived at the restaurant fairly early at 4pm and sat upstairs, but the downstairs doesn't open until 5pm. When you hear Da Lat, everyone mentions Bag Mo To, so you should be able to enjoy the grilled dishes there. The seasoned meat is delicious. The green salt and orange here are delicious when dipped in vegetables. That day, I ordered cheese-wrapped beef, kimchi-wrapped pork, and grilled pork ribs. It's been a long time since I've had such delicious baked food. The food here is a bit expensive.

name: Goc Ha Thanh Restaurant
address: 51 Truong Cong Dinh, Da Lat Vietnam
description:
On the recommendation of a local.here go eat. Looked fine, so on the terrace. Too bad we were served everything at once, quite large portions, so not being able to eat everything. Toilet downstairs you walk, really characteristic of some restaurants here, through less beautiful febued / living area, where laundry hangs, tap is loose at toilet and darker, dirtier part.
But the food tasted delicious!
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Seafood Restaurants for Breakfast in Da Lat
example_reviews: On the recommendation of a local.here go eat. Looked fine, so on the terrace. Too bad we were served everything at once, quite large portions, so not being able to eat everything. Toilet downstairs you walk, really characteristic of some restaurants here, through less beautiful febued / living area, where laundry hangs, tap is loose at toilet and darker, dirtier part. But the food tasted delicious!

Excellent local dishes. The fried spring rolls in rice paper with fresh herbs was truly amazing. I suspect they were freshly made while we waited because they did taste refried. Lemongrass chicken and morning glory were perfect! Unlike other restaurants that beg you for a review or give you a free gift in exchange for a review, this place lets the food speak for itself!

We stayed in Dalat for 4 days and were lucky enough to have this restaurant within a short walk from our hotel. We visited on the first night, as we thought we need to find our bearings, arriving in a new city, and of course with the thousands, literally, of restaurants to choose from this was on our doorstep. The food was delicious, served promptly, piping hot - incidentally not always the case in Vietnam and served with a smile, despite the restaurant being full to capacity. We enjoyed the food so much we didn't try anywhere else in the evenings, so ate there for 3 consecutive nights. The taste of the coconut curry sauce on the steamed rice is to die for and the chicken with ginger so moreish. Couldn't fault any of the food we had. Delicious!!!

name: Sagar Indian Cuisine Đà Lạt
address: 46 Đường Tăng Bạt Hổ Phường 1, Da Lat Vietnam
description: We all have only one life so must eat good food and be healthy and strong for good food Sagar Indian Cuisine is the best
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
example_reviews: Amazing food and service. Portion sizes are well worth the money, ordered a paneer dish and was not the usual rare piece of paneer floating in sauce lol. Would highly recommend

Dropped in here for our last meal in Dalat, and wished we had come in earlier. From the friendly welcome we got, to the amazing tasty dishes we ate, I couldn't fault it and would recommend this restaurant to anyone who is visiting Dalat. We would honestly say this is the best Indian/Nepalese that we have had (home or abroad). One warning, the portions are generous, and the naans are bloody huge.

Visited on a Saturday night - restaurant was fairly quiet at 8pm so no problems getting a table. Service was really good - attentive and friendly. Food was great - the lamb tikka and chicken tandoori were perfectly cooked and with just the right level of spice for us (we requested mild). Butter naan was fluffy and delicious and finished off with a pot of excellent masala chai. Definitely worth a visit!

name: Chefs Dalat
address: 156 Đường Phạm Ngọc Thạch Phường 6, Da Lat 670000 Vietnam
description: At Chefs Dalat, we combine the finest of Dalat ingredients with our utmost passion for European cuisine. Each of our dishes is meticulously crafted to bring you an unforgettable dining experience in this beautiful city
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Late Night Asian Restaurants in Da Lat
Steakhouses for Lunch in Da Lat
example_reviews: I dined at 'Chefs Dalat,' last night and it was a fantastic experience. The price-to-quality ratio was excellent, making it a great choice for a delicious meal without breaking the bank. The standout was the top-notch service. The staff was not only incredibly friendly but also attentive and accommodating. They made us feel welcome from the moment we walked in. The ambiance with music added to the cozy and enjoyable atmosphere. It felt like the perfect place to relax and savor a great meal. In summary, 'Chefs Dalat' comes highly recommended for excellent food, outstanding service, and a pleasant ambiance. I’ll have breakfast there tomorrow!

My family had an incredible Christmas dinner at Chefs Dalat! The set menu was absolutely delicious, with so many standout dishes. The tortellini soup in the pho-style broth was such a fun twist, and the A5 Wagyu beef was melt-in-your-mouth amazing. We absolutely devoured the Christmas pudding and loved the homemade mulled wine. The atmosphere was super cozy and festive, with beautiful Christmas decorations. Service was outstanding – Ms. Linh was attentive and friendly, making sure we had everything we needed. Overall, this was such a great experience, and we left feeling so happy and full. Highly recommend for a special night out!

My family, including 2 kids, visited the restaurant in January 2024 and it was a lovely experience. Their seasonal salad was so fresh and crunchy! We sat right next to the pizza oven and got to see our pizza order slowly baking. The head chef came out to check on us and asked for feedback towards the end, which was so kind and courteous of her. Overall, an amazing visit with satisfied tastebuds and top-notch service!

name: Anna's Coffee House
address: 9B Dong Da, Ward 3 At Robin hill, near the cable car, opposite the motorbike parking, Da Lat Vietnam
description: Lovely cafe selling espresso, cappuccino, and Vietnamese style coffees made from locally sourced and freshly roasted heirloom varieties of Arabica. Serving waffles, smoothies, and brunch, burgers and burritos are regular items, is open from 7:30AM to 5PM (to 9PM by reservation), Anna's Coffee House, is perched near the summit of Robin Hill, Dalat, right next to the Cable Car, and enjoys views of the distant mountains, with ready access on foot to the forest, and a couple of great guest houses in the neighborhood.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Steakhouses for Lunch in Da Lat
Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Da Lat
example_reviews: I was drawn to this cafe after reading all the positive reviews left by other travelers, and it did not disappoint. Despite only being a 10-minute car ride from Da Lat's busy center, it feels like a distant overlook amongst the mountains, with a view of the city. Peaceful, serene, and every corner of this place felt well-cared for and thought out. And for far-flung travelers missing a taste of home, the Western food served here tastes authentic and fulfilling. In Da Lat's wide ocean of cafes and coffee shops, this place truly stands out.

Beautiful scenic environment. Right next to the cable cars. Outdoor/indoor cafe, adorned with flowers and plants, a photographers delight. I've had many meals here, though mostly breakfast. Everything I've eaten has been very good. My favorite breakfast meal, is the Rancheros Huevos, though their waffles, eggs, omelettes, are excellent as well. One of the attractions besides the tasty culinary delights, is the location, as the outdoor part of the cafe sits on the edge of a beautiful green lush valley, where photographers just love. The staff are very friendly and conscientious. This is a cafe that I will continue to visit. Coming there, is the highlight of my day. Thank you to both Anna and her husband, Bartlett, for setting up the guests for a beautiful experience.

What a beauty of a hidden gem! The decor, the view, the beautiful smiles from the staff ... We are so glad we found Annas and made a visit Directly opposite the cable car ramp, it doesn't look like much outside but the wonder starts when you walk through the doors We had an English breakfast with an omelette & for drinks we had 2 coffees (he did), and I had an English tea ... Fairly priced we were not disappointed! I can honestly say that this meal, was the 1st time I have ever eaten out at a cafe and had the plate heated to keep my meal warm ... 10/10! We were so impressed we went back for brunch! This time I had an apple pie and he had a blueberry pie with icecream ... So yum!! With a carrot and orange juice ... We'll be back before we leave Da Lat! Well done to the staff at Anna's ... You are as beautiful as your venue 🙏🏽

name: Gemination Eatery & Bar Da Lat
address: 24 Trương Công Định, Phường 1, Thành Phố Đà Lạt, Tỉnh Lâm Đồng, Da Lat 66110 Vietnam
description: There is no 10 VND drink, but the staff is enthusiastic and attentive, taking care of guests enthusiastically, especially Toan, who talked and shared a lot with us. The food is also diverse and quite delicious. Diverse wine menu, many delicious and unique signature dishes. A must try destination for those who want to experience a gentle, chill, private dining space
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Romantic European Restaurants in Da Lat
review_summary:
Gemination - Eatery And Bar is acclaimed for its cozy and inviting environment, making it a versatile choice for anything from romantic dinners to laid-back socials. The staff's friendliness and expertise have been highlighted, although the service timing received mixed reviews.

Patrons have lauded the unique and flavorful cocktails, yet opinions diverge regarding the food, with some guests criticizing the portion sizes and cost. Despite these concerns, the overall experience continues to charm many who visit.
example_reviews: There is no 10 VND drink, but the staff is enthusiastic and attentive, taking care of guests enthusiastically, especially Toan, who talked and shared a lot with us. The food is also diverse and quite delicious. Diverse wine menu, many delicious and unique signature dishes. A must try destination for those who want to experience a gentle, chill, private dining space

Gemination Bar has quickly become one of my favorite spots in Da Lat. The cozy atmosphere is enhanced by soft lighting and tasteful decor, making it an ideal place to unwind. The bartenders here are true masters, crafting cocktails that not only taste amazing but also look spectacular. I was particularly impressed with their use of fresh, local ingredients in each drink. My favorite was a unique blend that included guava and mint, which was refreshing and packed with flavor. The staff were attentive and friendly, providing top-notch service that made the experience even better. This bar is perfect for any occasion—whether you re celebrating with friends or enjoying a quiet evening. I highly recommend Gemination for anyone looking to indulge in delicious cocktails while soaking in the charm of Da Lat.

At Gemination Lounge Bar, crafted beverages are truly an art form. Each drink is carefully crafted with attention to detail, creating not just a drink, but an experience. I sampled the Hibiscus Cooler, which was beautifully presented and bursting with flavor. The mixologists here are passionate about their craft and eager to share their knowledge, making the experience even more enriching. The warm setting, combined with creative crafted beverages, makes it a perfect spot for an evening out. If you appreciate artistic mixology, Gemination Lounge Bar will not disappoint!

name: Rung Thong Mo Farm & Bistro
address: Đường Hoa Hồng Phường 4, Da Lat 670000 Vietnam
description: Rừng Thông Mơ Farm & Bistro is undeniably the ultimate destination for fusion cuisine in Dalat. Our restaurant is designed to cater to families and children, providing an array of captivating activities that guarantee an unforgettable experience. These include the remarkable Mơ Park, an expansive outdoor playground boasting a sandpit and a long slide. Moreover, families can explore the Mơ Farm, our organic farm that allows children to explore and acquire valuable knowledge. To further enhance the experience, we proudly present Mơ Academy, where kids can participate in fun cooking, arts, and crafts classes.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
European Restaurants for Lunch in Da Lat
example_reviews: Rừng Thông Mơ (a.k.a. Mơ Restautant) is the most phenomenal atmosphere. Situated on the side of a hill in the forest, it is just so relaxing. Its probably the nicest resort restaurant I’ve been to in Vietnam in terms of the atmosphere, and the service matches what you would expect at Four Seasons Nam Hai, Amanoi and similar places. We were staying at the Mơ Stay Forest resort and dined at this restaurant 2 of our 3 evenings in Dalat. A series of small pavilions in the forest, each pavilion has just 1-2 tables and its own fireplace. So the dining experience is private and quiet. With a cool breeze in the air, very quiet music, and surrounded by magnificent trees, it’s an unbelievably pleasant dining experience. The service is attentive and outstanding. They were patient and friendly. There seems to be 1 server per 2 tables and the server is always standing at a nearby station and paying attention. We had several special requests which were well handled – including ordering Canh Ga Chien Nuoc Mam, which is not on the menu, but was excellently prepared. In terms of good quality, they provide great attention to detail for both food and drinks. The Soda Chanh (lemon soda) was much more of a crafted drink than the typical Soda Chanh - it included a lot of crushed lime, aloe vera chunks, a delicious Vietnamese mint leaf called Chocolate Mint and was just delicious so we had to keep reordering it. The food is high-quality and we especially enjoyed the salads. My only request would be to add more Vietnamese food and more vegetable dishes given they grow the vegetables right there at their organic farm, which we had visited earlier in the day. There is also a large playground for children. This is good both for families and romantic dinners. The total bills were around VND1.5 million, which is great value for money considering this is the same ort better standard as the best restaurants at 5 star resorts in Vietnam.

Quick response on Instagram when I made a reservation. Love food and the atmosphere here. Staffs are friendly, they are always available near our table to assist us but not too close to disturb while we are enjoying dinner. We also love food, they are beautiful. Taste good & nice decoration. Thank you so much for such a wonderful birthday dinner.

The most beautiful and tasty place for more than one month travelling through Vietnam . The perfect atmosphere where the best service, concept, well prepared and presented dishes meet the stunning design of nature , forest and pines air. We had a dinner and enjoyed the life music here. We sincerely thanks to everyone who involved to this process- from the host, who met us at the entrance till the every person in kitchen. Thanks to one who created this place. I believe this is made with love.

name: Blue Parrot Mexican Grill
address: 102 Ba Tháng Hai Phuong 1, Da Lat 670000 Vietnam
description: Welcome to Blue Parrot Mexican Grill, where we bring the vibrant flavors of Mexico to Da Lat! As the only Mexican restaurant in town, we pride ourselves on offering an authentic dining experience. From 10:00 a.m. onward, join us for lunch or dinner and indulge in our delicious selection of burritos, tacos, beef and chicken enchiladas, and fajita plates. Our menu boasts a variety of mouthwatering options to suit all tastes. And of course, no visit to Blue Parrot is complete without trying our renowned margaritas. Served in generous portions, they're the talk of the town. Don't miss our must-try Chile/lime Mango Frozen margarita for a unique twist. While you're here, make sure to meet "Big Bit," our friendly Blue and Gold Macaw. He loves posing for photos, especially when adorned with a traditional Mariachi sombrero and Mexican serape. Immerse yourself in the lively atmosphere, filled with great Mexican music.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
European Restaurants for Large Groups in Da Lat
Romantic French Restaurants in Da Lat
example_reviews: Very nice Mexican restaurant! The cheese a bean burrito was very good and so filling! We also had salsa a guacamole with chips, the guacamole was so fresh a full of flavour, the chips were super crunchy but not salty but still moreish. Would definitely recommend to eat her for tea with friends or family & yes they have a real blue parrot which is very vocal 😆 the staff were really nice too!

This was such a good find! I am vegetarian and they have a separate menu for us! Mushroom burrito was so good. I also ordered way too much because I was excited (refried beans, queso dip, fries) and ate most of it! Yummy. The service is also really good. I can't fault this place at all, the staff were really friendly and made conversation with all customers. Definitely go here, it's clean and colourful inside too.

This restaurant has a very nice atmosphere, beautifully decorated in theme. The staff was also very nice and friendly, and the food was served quickly. The portion sizes were decent, but they did stand out in flavour. Would have not expected to get close to authentic mexican food here in Vietnam, but it was really good! The waitress also shared some tips for trying other food here in Da Lat, and elsewhere in Vietnam. Would definitely recommend if you are looking for a change from only Vietnamese cuisine!

name: Artist Alley Restaurant
address: 124/1 Phan Dinh Phung, Da Lat 670000 Vietnam
description: Artist Alley restaurant is established in the year of 2002 by Vo Trinh Bien , a famous artist in Vietnam.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Da Lat
example_reviews: Artist Alley was very near the hotel we were staying at in Dalat. It is set back from the road, and although it has a neon sign on the street entrance, it is quite easy to miss. Being set back from the road, it is quiet. We were greeted and directed upstairs. It is decorated with paintings on the walls. We had both lunch and dinner there (3 visits, that is how much we liked it). The host understands and speaks English well, and they were able to cope perfectly with vegetarian and gluten free dietary requirements. There is a good selection of both Western and Vietnamese food. I particularly liked the spaghetti bolognaise (vegetarian), and their special smoothy is also worth checking out. We didn't get a chance to try any of the deserts. Top notch, highly recommended.

Lovely restaurant, not difficult to find using Google Maps, even though it is up an alley – as the name suggests. Walls covered with paintings and other artwork, and the space itself has been designed and created by Bien, who waited our table and whose family prepare the meals. Unfortunately, drinks list did not include local beer, but did include a small range of Da Lat and foreign red wines. Bien, is friendly and his English is very good - he had visited London. The restaurant is very clean, and tables, coverings and napkins upmarket (proper table linen!). Interestingly, many tables were set with knife, fork and spoon place settings - we weren’t offered chopsticks nor a rice bowl: the hemisphere of steamed rice plus accompanying vegetables was brought to us on a dining plate. Food was pretty good though not outstanding – that’s the only reason I haven’t given a 5 rating.

Artist Alley Resturant is a great choice for diners looking for a unique meal at very competitive prices . The hardest decision for me is choosing between their Grilled Trout or their ostrich steak and vegetables. Both are great and I can’t say enough about the pricing and their multiple offerings on the menu . Their onion soup is also a spectacular offering and is delicious. Grilled Trout with mixed vegetables and a bottle of water tonight was 125,000 vnd or $5.00 usd and I have to say it’s the best $5.00 meal I believe I have ever had. You cannot go wrong here and I always come back as their quality and prices are excellent. The restaurant is very quaint and seating upstairs is plentiful . Multiple wine offerings and mixed drinks. A great asset for Da Lat restaurants and you can’t go wrong with the quality and prices that they offer . 👍👍

name: La Viet Coffee
address: 200 Nguyen Cong Tru, Da Lat Vietnam
description:
A warehouse-style roastery cafe where you can drink inexpensive but professional coffee.
The smell of roasting coffee that wafts from the moment you enter makes the heart of coffee enthusiasts pound.
It's a spacious store, so you can come in and out comfortably, and there's no pressure on price.
However, I think my coffee skills are good, but is it a problem with the Vietnamese coffee beans?
Café latte, cappuccina, or coffee are bland and have a bitter finish.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Late Night Pizza in Da Lat
Seafood Restaurants for Lunch in Da Lat
example_reviews: A warehouse-style roastery cafe where you can drink inexpensive but professional coffee. The smell of roasting coffee that wafts from the moment you enter makes the heart of coffee enthusiasts pound. It's a spacious store, so you can come in and out comfortably, and there's no pressure on price. However, I think my coffee skills are good, but is it a problem with the Vietnamese coffee beans? Café latte, cappuccina, or coffee are bland and have a bitter finish.

Very nice and fresh food. The coffee is a must try. Only thing: we ordered a chicken sandwich and a burger and the fries were completely cold! They called them “shoestrings” fries but they don’t mention on the menu that they are cold.. maybe was the end of the shift?

This is a very nice place. I love the decoration inspired by the farm universe. I drank a Lavender milk coffee. It was very good, the Lavender flavour was subtile. The croissant was delicious and remind me the real french croissant. The nutty banana cake was delicious too. I really love the atmosphere of this place.

name: An Cafe
address: 63 Bis, Ba Thang Hai Street, Da Lat 670000 Vietnam
description: An Cafe is designed to bring peace to everybody. Here we focus on surrounding our guests with green plants and let them enjoy calm music. We are proud to be the first cafe in Dalat with healthy drinks and tasty food. We hope that everybody, who come to An Cafe, will keep in his heart, soul and mind only positive vibes.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Romantic Italian Restaurants in Da Lat
example_reviews: We ate here a couple of times, for both breakfast and lunch. The quality and freshness of the food was excellent, and the coffee and cold drinks we had were some of the best we have experienced. The Cafe has a beautiful setting on multiple levels surrounded by plants. A peaceful oasis in the middle of town.

After feeling a bit under the weather and homesick, all I fancied was egg and avo on toast like I would have at home. We came to An cafe and I was instantly calmed by the leafy settings, lots of space to sit. We sat in a little open booth at the top with swing seats which I loved. Variety on the menu. The inside was cute too. Staff were lovely and food was relatively speedy given how busy they were. I would recommend this cafe!

Excellent restaurant in a very busy city, the food is great catering for vegetarian and local dishes. Breakfast was terrific western style eggs on avocado toast. The setting is great wit swing style seats among plants and nature with fresh fantastic food. Highly recommend

name: Đà Lạt Phố - Street food in Vietnam
address: Tang Bat Hổ 38, Da Lat 66117 Vietnam
description: We are a little, pretty restaurant located at Western Square- Centre and 200m far from Dalat night market. We serve traditional Vietnamese dishes such as "Bún Chả ", Banh Xeo (crispy Vietnamese pancake), Banh mi ... at suitable prices for locals. Come to us "Dalat Pho" if you like to explore Dalat - Vietnam's cuisine.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Da Lat
example_reviews: Dalat Pho is an excellent destination to enjoy traditional Vietnamese street food. With its cozy and vintage ambiance, the place offers a delightful and memorable culinary experience. The menu features a wide range of authentic dishes such as pork rolled with rice paper, Hue-style beef noodles, pho, and broken rice that are all expertly prepared and hygienically safe. Prices are reasonable, and the service is friendly and prompt. I was thoroughly impressed with this eatery and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking to sample delicious Vietnamese street food in Dalat.

A place to visit when coming to Da Lat. The owner is friendly. The staff is enthusiastic. The food is very delicious and cheap because it is located in Da Lat. The prices listed on the menu do not worry about being ripped off.
Clean and fresh. Bun cha Ha Noi was so good! Traditional Viet Nam foods are so good especially banh mi and bun cha. Ofc i'll come back

name: Émai Dalat
address: 88 Hoàng Hoa Thám, Da Lat 670000 Vietnam
description: Nestled into a pine valley hillside, the Émai Italian restaurant serves refined European cuisine, blending traditional and contemporary flavours to deliver an experience like no other. From Camembert Mushroom Pizza to Slow-Cooked Beef in Southern Italian Red Wine, Duck Confit Ravioli to Charcuterie - each of our dishes are a blend of centuries of European tradition and our unique innovations that exalt each dish with exquisite taste.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Steakhouses for Lunch in Da Lat
example_reviews: Upon entering the dining room you’re immersed in the Quality, subtle creativity and comfort of the space. You set yourself up for an amazing dinner. Wine list is simple, yet covers all the bases profoundly. The menu is set up in Italian courses that you can choose from. The service on the floor guided me in not over ordering and with their attention to detail I had a fantastic meal.

The surroundings are intimate and beautiful. Pleasant music and the beautiful rooms. We ordered four pizzas and they tasted really good. The kids (ages 8 and 11) said they were the best pizzas ever. We also tasted some of their desserts. The chocolate mousse was really good. Unfortunately, their tiramisu was far too sour for my taste. It tasted of yogurt and blackcurrants. However, they were kind enough to offer me another dessert, an affogato, and it tasted great. This was without charge. Sweet waiters and good atmosphere. Top marks from here.

Went there in the cold winter night craving for hot tomato soup (after a recommendation from friend) and the restaurant took me by surprise. By the time I reached, had to wait for few minutes for a table and staff was so nice that they immediately offered hot water to warm up while I was waiting for my table. The soup was delicious and served with the most beautiful atmosphere around. It made me look for a main course and generally I like pasta with red sauce. Being vegetarian it wasn’t on their menu but chef customized it for me and it was absolutely delicious. It was light on stomach and the taste of sauce was tantalizing which made me finish the last drop of the sauce in the pasta. Was also served freshly baked sour dough bread on the side that are also very comforting and tasty. Staff was very attentive, friendly, accommodating. The table setting and overall decor was customised for holiday season and was festive but yet peaceful. Overall a must go place for a dinner when you are in Dalat!

name: MiMi Sushi & Pizza
address: 103 Bui Thi Xuan Ward 2, Da Lat 670000 Vietnam
description: Welcome to MiMi Sushi & Pizza in DaLat. Located right at the center of Dalat city, this restaurant is a recommended place for you to experience Italian and Japanese dishes. So delicious, fresh sashimi, best pizza and pasta. Regards.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
French Restaurants for Breakfast in Da Lat
example_reviews: This spot was an absolutely unexpected highlight of my time in Da Lat. Despite my love for Vietnamese food, after a few weeks in the country, I was ready for something a bit different. I didn't assume much at all when I searched for sushi, but Mimi offered quite the pleasant surprise. Their fish was extremely fresh, beautifully plated, and very affordable for the quality. And admittedly, though I doubted that a place that offered sushi could deliver on their italian food, I was very wrong. The pizza and pasta are delicious, I particularly loved the Pizza Messicana. Da Lat is a small city, so almost everything is a short car ride away. Definitely give this place a visit if you're in the area, you won't regret it!
We eated there sushi,pasta,” etc everything was so good and tasty. Table service is polite and fast and food price is 👌 Definetly reccomend Mimi Sushi 😊

We went for lunch as a family group. The welcome and seating was prompt and very friendly. Drinks orders were executed promptly and served ice cold. We ordered Salmon Sashimi, Crispy salmon skin salad, sea grape salad, beef udon noodles, fuji beef and some pasta. All the food was served quickly and was fresh, well prepared and tasty. Certainly on our list for a return visit during our next stay in Dalat!

name: Primavera Italian Restaurant
address: 54/7 Phan Dinh Phung Ward 1, Da Lat 670000 Vietnam
description: Italian cuisine homemade restaurants - food store from Italy Have vegan/vegetarian / gluten fee/ whole wheat option
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Italian Restaurants for Lunch in Da Lat
example_reviews: I was looking for a burger for lunch, and walked by this place. It seemed promising, so I noted its location and returned gor a late dinner. Being from the outskirts of New York City, my standards for pizza are high, bordering on snobbish. I had the pizza with spicy salami. The waitress explained that the salami was not spicy, but that they added crushed red pepper as a finishing touch. The pizza was delicious, on a light crust and baked in a stone oven. If you get tired of noodles and oddly seasoned street food, this place is a fantastic alternative.

This is our first time to the restaurant, we do not understand the food on the menu so we asked the waitress for advice, she is very enthusiastic and cute. We tried the Luganega pizza as suggested by her, with italian sausages and crispy mushrooms, Pastas varied and delicious, I don't remember all of them. See you next time

I had an experiential evening with my family, everything surprised me by the food cooked with fresh ingredients, the wine that warmed me up with the chilly weather in Da Lat. Staff was very kind and she was very serious in asking if I had any ingredient allergies. I will be back again, must try!

name: Phở Ân Đà Lạt
address: 23/5 Đường Trần Phú, Da Lat 670000 Vietnam
description: Pho An Da Lat offers a rich traditional pho flavor, blending clear broth, soft and fragrant beef and fresh, chewy pho noodles. The restaurant not only serves delicious food but also offers a cozy space, ideal for enjoying in the chilly weather of Da Lat. The special feature of Pho An is the sincerity in each bowl of pho, encapsulating the essence of Vietnamese cuisine. This is a place where visitors not only enjoy delicious food but also feel the kindness in every moment.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Da Lat
example_reviews: The rice noodles are soft, the beef fresh and tender, cooked to perfection. Combined with crisp bean sprouts and scallions, every bite feels like harmony in a bowl. The highlight? Their sweet-and-sour dipping sauce that elevates the flavors of the beef to a whole new level. The cozy atmosphere, paired with the friendly smile of the owner, makes you feel right at home. This is more than just a meal—it’s a taste of Da Lat’s heartfelt hospitality. Phở Ân offers not only a delicious bowl of pho but also a sense of peace and warmth unique to this mountain town. If you visit Da Lat, don’t miss it!

"It's been a long time since I came back to Pho An. The seasoning is still the same, still rich and flavorful, with the fragrant scent of green onions, the sweet taste of long-simmered bones, plenty of meat, and delicious beef meatballs. The beef here is very good and fresh because the owners go to the market very early, selecting the freshest and most delicious cuts of meat. 40,000 dong for an adult-sized breakfast bowl is very cheap. Good value for money. The service is very good, and the owners are very friendly.

This is one of the best Pho I ever had in Dalat so far. I like to broth taste very much here, the seasoning is light, delicacy. Besides, the cleanliness and well-preparation of ingredients from Beef, fresh herbs, to some garlic pickles is incredible. The decoration is eye-catching, tables and chairs are comfortable too. One small detail which also makes me like about this place is its floor kept clean without many trash on it after a bunch of customers. Highly recommend for your breakfast in Dalat, warm up your body in the cold weather!

name: One More Cafe
address: 77 Hai Ba Trung Street, Da Lat 670000 Vietnam
description: One More Cafe is an Australian style cafe serving great coffee, breakfast, brunch and lunch dishes, as well as amazing cakes and desserts - all the food you miss from home. The service is friendly and fast, the wifi is free and fast and that's about all that's fast here, the rest is just relaxed. Come sink into a comfy chair, listen to some great music and recharge.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Romantic Italian Restaurants in Da Lat
example_reviews: Gorgeous food, great service & a beautiful doggo named Pooki who was very sociable and loving. All staff greeted us with smiles & were attentive. So good we returned for lunch the next day. Granola fruit & yoghurt was delicious & a great portion. My friend had the egg/avo special & said it was absolutely amazing (I had food envy, I must admit) Cinnamon swirls are an absolute must try! Fresh out the oven. Second visit was for lunch, soup & sandwich was nice. Carrot cake was sublime, moist & perfect ratio of cake to frosting. Whilst we were there on our second visit, a disgruntled man entered the cafe & was rude to the manager about a previous incident where he had been asked to leave. The manager was extremely professional & calm despite the man getting progressively more aggressive. He handled the situation extremely well with minimal disruption to customers. The place is a credit to him.

Absolutely perfect breakfast here at One More Cafe. went with 4 friends and everyone had a very delicious breakfast. The Eggs Benedict was the best I have ever had. On a nice thick toast with a real and thick slice of ham... not the processed kind. delicious hollandaise, cherry tomatoes and some green leaf herb that was uncommon but very tasty 120k and 10k for some crispy bacon on the side. 2 friends had the big breakfast at 125k but they also have a smaller serve at 70k. they have healthy options. Buddha Bowl, and salads and soups... nice decor and background music. lovely staff. will go back again tomorrow opens 8am

Going to One More Cafe was recommended to us by a nearby hotel which didn’t offer breakfast…… we were pleasantly surprised how good our breakfast was….. staff just lovely, cafe was spotless & comfortable. Omelette was delicious & they have mastered the art of a great cappuccino. We went there for breakfast each day…. Highly recommend

name: Fujiya Sushi Dalat
address: Lô 34 khu qui hoạch Nguyễn Công Trứ, Phường 2 Ward 2, Da Lat 63000 Vietnam
description: Fujiya Sushi Dalat offers authentic Japanese food that ensures your satisfaction. We serve sushi, sashimi, tempura, ramen, udon, and teriyaki. It is located in the beautiful city of Dalat, Vietnam where there is eternal spring, has so many kinds of flowers and the climate is cool all year round. Come and enjoy this Japanese authentic food and we guarantee your satisfaction.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Steakhouses for Lunch in Da Lat
Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Da Lat
example_reviews: Our maki, sashimi, and tempura exceeded all expectations! The products are extremely fresh and seem to be cooked so right! It’s all very japanese, from the way you order meals to the attitude of waiters. We expected to have a nice dinner, but what we’ve got was an absolutely wonderful one! We paid about $25 for our substantial meals and it seemed a great value for money.

Sushi bars always lure me in, even if I'm in Vietnam and absolutely loving the phenomenal local cuisine. Today I wanted sushi and decided to give Fujiya a chance. I have to say I was entirely blown away by how authentic this meal turned out to be. In fact, several of the dishes were prepared better than those I've sampled in Japan. We started with chawanmushi and it was divine; slivers of enoki mushrooms nestled over the delicate egg custard, which was cooked to a perfect texture. I opted for a bento box to get some variety and what followed was shockingly delicious. A sampling of sushi and sashimi came first; generous slabs of fresh fish including salmon, tuna, mackerel and octopus. Then came chicken teriyaki, which was tender and juicy, and without the sticky, overly sweet sauce that usually is served. The meat had clearly been marinated and was rich with flavor, so no need for sugary sauce. Then came a filet of seasoned mackerel, grilled by a chef who has some real skills. The meal also included some sides that I'm especially picky about; miso soup and kimchi. The soup was among the best I've ever had, served hot in a covered bowl, with some enoki, seaweed and soft tofu. The kimchi was crunchy and bright, with just the right level of heat. Truly a perfect lunch, and priced at 250K. Wow. But the most impressive dishes were actually served to my partner and deserve special mention. We love oysters, and decided to try what Fujiya had on the menu. The platter that arrived was probably the most beautiful dish I've ever seen. Two giant oysters sat snugly on crushed ice, topped with a raw quail egg yolk, various caviar and a sprig of sea grapes. Colorful flowers and garnishes were artistically placed, and we both grabbed our phones to take pictures. The oysters turned out to be directly imported from Hiroshima, a city known to have some of the best oysters in Japan, and these were a revelation of texture and flavor and we immediately ordered two more. Honestly I can't think of an oyster I loved more than this one. She also ordered a salmon gunkan trio and again, the presentation left me in awe. A beautiful piece of salmon was wrapped around the rice instead of seaweed, and ikura plus other caviar were featured in the center. Amazingly creative. Service was friendly and well-paced, and we were hardly rushed. The seating was in a private wooden enclosure like you would find in Japan and was quite comfortable, the perfect spot to celebrate our last day in Vietnam. The whole three-story restaurant is quite beautiful, well-designed and exceptionally clean. Kane, a manager, politely helped serve our dishes and added a personal touch to what was really one of the more elegant meals we've had anywhere. I remain grateful to everyone at Fujiya for their dedication to the craft.

My husband and I had such a great experience eating here, we ordered one sake ikura roll (there was a lot of salmon in it), ramen with pork and kimchi udon soup. Waiter gave us potato salad as a compliment and it was very tasty. Everything was great, very delicious and portions are really big. And there were Japanese people eating next to us, it says a lot about the quality of food here.

name: Da Quy Restaurant
address: 119 Phan Dinh Phung, Da Lat 61000 Vietnam
description: Had a great meal at this restaurant. We had crispy noodles with shrimp, pork and veg. Beef with chilli and lemongrass. Morning glory with garlic and fried rice with seafood. All dishes were excellent and at very low prices for the quality of food. The owner also brought us a complimentary home made yoghurt dessert that was very nice too. One of the best meals we’ve had in our six weeks holiday.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Steakhouses for Lunch in Da Lat
Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Da Lat
example_reviews: Had a great meal at this restaurant. We had crispy noodles with shrimp, pork and veg. Beef with chilli and lemongrass. Morning glory with garlic and fried rice with seafood. All dishes were excellent and at very low prices for the quality of food. The owner also brought us a complimentary home made yoghurt dessert that was very nice too. One of the best meals we’ve had in our six weeks holiday.

Fantastic service from a very friendly family-run restaurant. The food was authentic Vietnamese. The Bò ðăc biêt full topping was phenomenal - well worth a visit for travellers who want to try authentic Vietnamese foods for such a reasonable price!

If I could give this place more stars I would! Very friendly staff and the best food I’ve had so far in my 3 weeks in Vietnam! Everything tasted very fresh, the restaurant was flexible with dietary requirements as we are travelling with a vegetarian. We had a few tastes of different dishes and got to try the artichoke tea (definitely give it a go it’s delicious). It’s recommended by lonely planet and by us :) will be back if we’re ever in Da Lat again!

name: Tiem Ca Phe Tui Mo To
address: Hem 31 Sao Nam, Phuong 11, Da Lat 67000 Vietnam
description: Our first member of Reply 1994 - Tui mo to - is a coffee shop for those who love Da Lat - a place to relax and heal your souls - a vintage coffee shop that takes you back in time with our charming decor and aroma. The cozy seating arrangement is perfect for an afternoon catch-up or a quiet reading time with the gentle sunset view of the romantic shimmering greenhouse valley.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Steakhouses for Lunch in Da Lat
Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Da Lat
example_reviews: Would totally recommend this place for an evening couple date! The shop had a very romantic and cozy ambiance. Me and my gf were having a great hanging out seating outside, looking out to some glowing lights of the (kind of) greenhouse valley, with some tasty hot teas and cakes. Prices are very fair too (~40k - 65k).

I recently visited Túi Mơ To Café, and it was a delightful experience! The café has a unique, cozy ambiance with lots of natural light and a peaceful atmosphere, perfect for unwinding. I had their signature coffee, which was smooth and well-balanced, paired with a delicious homemade pastry. The staff were friendly and attentive, making me feel right at home. It’s a great spot to relax, enjoy great coffee, and take in the charming surroundings. Highly recommend it if you're in the area!

The staff welcomed me and enthusiastically guided me from the moment I entered the gate. The order and service staff were extremely enthusiastic and guided me down to where to take photos with nice deco and which tables had nice views. Because the first time I came, I was a bit confused because the restaurant was large and had many views. I think they're just dedicated but still very fun and not awkward like other shops I've been to. I go to Da Lat 4-5 times a year, but this is the first time I'm writing a review because the staff is so enthusiastic ❤️ Seeing the package of medicine my lover brought, my friends told each other to bring an ashtray, that's sophistication.

name: The Peace Cafe
address: 42 Lý Thường Kiệt St, Da Lat 670000 Vietnam
description: The Peace Cafe is open from 10:45am to 4:45pm, and is available for private parties, corporate functions, weddings, birthdays, outdoor barbeque dinners, etc.The menu includes a good selection of international dishes, Vietnamese dishes, coffees, teas, cocktails, and a wine list featuring Vegetarian, good cold beers, Chilean and Vietnamese wines. A few dishes are made especially for the Vegetarian cafe, including the Pizza, and Burger. Live Music during the weekends. Friendly dogs
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Seafood Restaurants for Breakfast in Da Lat
example_reviews: I was escaping Hanoi's suffocating heat and chose Dalát since I had already visited Sapa. Both at 1500m above sea level, offer a nice respite from the sweltering valley temperatures. I was looking for an apartment and saw Dalát Train Villa and Cafe on a Dalát Expat FB page. I took a Grab motorcycle taxi and went to check it out. The Administrator, a lovely woman Nguyen Thuy, showed me the premises. The first studio apartment was a bit small, but the second was perfect The property is a very large, elaborate garden, with 8 villas built in French Colonial style, circa 1935. They vary in size and apartments, from rooms, to small studios and family cottages that can accommodate a whole family, with small to full kitchen facilities. There is a community laundry room and the family apartments have their own washing machine. There is an old refurbished train car converted into a Cafe, with additional outdoors seating. They are open from 8:00am to 9:30 pm, serving breakfast, lunch and dinner, beverages, cocktails and snacks. The food is fresh made, eclectic and wonderful.The staff is friendly and eager to help. They will bring food to your room on rquest. The apartments are serviced once a week. Prices are competitive, with discounts on long- term stays and 15% off Cafe consumption for lodgers.Thuy and her husband Curtis are great regarding suggestions, recommendations and overall assistance. Their two children are delightful and puppies Mimi and Brownie are friendly and playful. I have been here two weeks and not going anywhere for a while. Lots to see in the area and excellent location, very walkable. I do not hesitate to recommend.

I came on a quiet Sunday morning and soaked up the nice atmosphere and train theme over a wonderful healthy breakfast of fresh fruit and yogurt. Tasty cup of strong coffee to accompany and provide the instant wake-up needed for a lazy Sunday. Curious to try a lunch or dinner-I"ll be back. Met and had a nice exchange with the proprietor who treated me to a second cup. No siesta today!

We visited the cafe after looking around the Dalat train station. The cafe was roughly a 10 minute walk away. The location was fab. There is an open garden area with a number of tables and chairs and some seating within an old carriage. Our children loved the freedom of the gardens to run around. The menu was ample and food ordered was delicious- especially the Vegetable lasagne. Would highly recommend to anyone wanting some delicious food in a quaint spot.

name: Me Linh Coffee Garden Dalat
address: Ta Nung Commune, Lam Ha District, Da Lat Vietnam
description:
Didn't plan on going so it was a nice detour. 
There are some sculptures to take pictures with but you have to purchase something from the cafe to gain entry to that section. Not too bad if you were wanting to try the fresh coffee anyway. 
You can walk along the bridge & look at the coffee plantation for free if you aren't bothered by the other bits.

example_reviews: Didn't plan on going so it was a nice detour. There are some sculptures to take pictures with but you have to purchase something from the cafe to gain entry to that section. Not too bad if you were wanting to try the fresh coffee anyway. You can walk along the bridge & look at the coffee plantation for free if you aren't bothered by the other bits.
Lovely spot. Got to learn about the coffee process and try some. Saw weasel enclosure - a first for me. If you are an Insta poster, this is also the spot for you! Wow!!

The view of the coffee plantation is very nice. However, there is wooden trail into the coffee plantation that was close, the explanation on coffee production process was very poor (couldn't see anything on coffee roasting and grinding) and the prices for a cup of coffee were very high

name: Quán Cơm Linh Đà Lạt
address: 11 Lê Văn Tám Phường 10, Da Lat 66100 Vietnam
description:
We had a quick meal on a rainy afternoon in August. We were all in a hurry, the rain came and we didn't have time to manage it, but fortunately a quick but correct decision helped us enjoy the meal. Dinner with a taste of home. Here, with a level 4 house, decorated in a rustic style, hot rice and soup are brought out just in time, everything seems to be gathered together to make the meal more delicious.
 If you have a chance, please try to visit.
(near the center - about 5 minutes by car and has car parking)
