We were all in a hurry, the rain came and we didn't have time to manage it, but fortunately a quick but correct decision helped us enjoy the meal. Dinner with a taste of home. Here, with a level 4 house, decorated in a rustic style, hot rice and soup are brought out just in time, everything seems to be gathered together to make the meal more delicious. If you have a chance, please try to visit. (near the center - about 5 minutes by car and has car parking)

I happened to visit the restaurant during a quick trip to Da Lat. What impressed me was that the restaurant's space was quite warm, the food was simple but familiar like home-cooked meals, and the staff were super cute. If I have a chance, I will stop by the restaurant :)

I stopped by Quan Linh with my friends and we ordered lunch including shrimp soup, stir-fried water spinach with garlic, and braised pork. All 3 dishes are delicious and hot. The prices here are reasonable compared to the general level. If I have a chance, I will stop by the restaurant again.

name: Gourmet Burger
address: 54/4 Phan Đình Phùng Phường 1, Da Lat 650000 Vietnam
description: Alain The Best Gourmet Burger in Dalat. Australian import meat, only fresh ingredients : bread, bacon, vegetables, mushrooms etc, French chef and owner (Alain) ! Our menu have Burgers, Fish an Chips, Rib Eyes australian steack, French fries, Italian sausage. Beers, soda, water... We can speak English, French and Vietnamese Opening time : 7/7 from 12 to 9pm (from noon to 9 p.m.) We have re-opened to welcome you even better than usual with a new address 54/4 Phang Dinh Phung, a few meters from the old one! See you soon. Alan
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Seafood Restaurants for Breakfast in Da Lat
example_reviews: Amazing cozy place to have good burgers with good quality meat! Prices are beyond reasonable, not only because of the delicious food, but because the owner is a really nice person to spend some time chatting with. He will tell you lots of interesting things about life in Da Lat, and about his life journey. DEFINITELY A MANDATORY STOP IN DA LAT.
Great selection of burgers on the menu in this bright little cafe style eatery. Friendly family run with delicious food. Clean plates all round. Set within a beautiful picturesque street. ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

a truly excellent example of a traditional Australian-style hamburger! (the beef and bacon variety). the all-Australian beef patty was tasty and perfectly cooked, and the bun and other ingredients were just perfect. not too big, but easily enough for a great feed, and really perfectly balanced and tasty. will be back!

name: Down Under
address: 55 Ba Thang Hai Hana Dalat Hotel, Ward 1, Da Lat 670000 Vietnam
description: THE BEST IN TOWN!! The first venue in Dalat dedicated to your sporting passions, BIG Screens, Great Food & Good Company. We are true blue committed to exceeding your expectations! !!Fair Dinkum!!
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Late Night European Restaurants in Da Lat
French Restaurants for Lunch in Da Lat
example_reviews: Food was great (we had loaded fries, burrito with garlic chips and bangers and mash which were Cumberland so I was over the mood) and staff were very attentive. Owner was a lovely guy too but didn’t catch his name. The bar sports a large screen playing ESPN and also sells Saigon cider which was a treat. Well worth the trip if you’re in De Lat!

This isn't just the best sports bar in da lat .. the food is 10/10 .. the waggu burger is delightful and would recommend to anyone .. they also have a wide selection of food and beers .. the owner is very welcoming and makes you feel right at home even though you could be miles from it !! Thanks and keep up the good work !!

I visited a small burger shop then wandered a couple of doors up the street and spotted the Down Under Bar Sports Bar. It turns out that the owner, Peter, was the former proprietor of the burger place! He was there during my visit and we chatted away for a couple of hours as he told me how it all came to be. He is a good man with doing something a little different to the norm. TV screens adorn the walls playing various sporting events from surfing, to football, golf, cricket, both rugby codes and even AFL. To name but several. It opens early enough (and stays open late enough) for you to be able to catch your sport of choice from anywhere in the world. As a smoker, I didn't find the non-smoking policy to be a hinderance, as it is easy enough to step outside to partake if you so choose. The drinks menu was extensive, from local and imported craft beers (and all your favourites), to mixed drinks and cocktails. The "grub" (food) menu was exceptional with some hilariously named dishes (Peter has quite the sense of humour), from simple snacks up to fine quality steaks. All of which - like the drinks - are within the budget of even the most budget conscious visitor. Particularly at Happy Hour, where drinks were 50% off! The decor is clean and fresh and the staff most friendly. All bearing testament to the vision Peter and his wife have for the place. It had only been open a couple of months prior to my visit and I encourage you to stop in and say g'day to Peter and enjoy the ambience. In my conservative estimation, I rate it a solid 11/10. Do not visit Da Lat without dropping in. Stu.

name: Le Retour
address: 38 Phan Boi Chau, Da Lat 670000 Vietnam
description: The place for you to rejoice life because “years, lovers, and glasses of wine are things that should never be counted”
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Seafood Restaurants for Breakfast in Da Lat
example_reviews: What a pleasant surprise to find this lovely cheese and wine bar in it would be a delight anywhere let alone in Da Lat. we could only stay for a short time and enjoyed goats cheese with apple, honey comb and bread. Service was amazing. The young man extremely polite and helpful. Even took some pictures and air dropped them for us. Overall wonderful end to our last night in Da Lat.

What a gorgeous find! After reading reviews, I was delighted to stumble upon this bar. Beautifully decorated for Christmas, it offered a warm welcome. Once inside, I was surprised by the small size, but the design was such that you didn't feel crowded. Welcomed by the charming and personable Nguyen, I chose a glass of the Viognier and generous plate of prosciutto. The experience was delightful. I will be back to try the Italian white. Highly recommended.

We popped in to have a quick drink with our three boys and ended up coming back every night we were in Da Lat. The children loved the space, the lovely lady Tran was excellent with the three boys helping them make wax seals and chatting with them. The wine was delicious as well! A real gem.

name: Biang Dalat Garden Restaurant
address: No. 94 Ly Tu Trong Street Inside Banyan House Eco Hotel, Da Lat 670000 Vietnam
description: Biang Dalat is an eco friendly farm to table restaurant using all fresh ingredients from the farmers of Dalat city cooked by professional chef in a modern way
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Street Food Restaurants in Da Lat
Romantic Italian Restaurants in Da Lat
example_reviews: Table not to be missed. Fusion cuisine, Italian inspired. The sauces each have their own particularity, but always a flavor in harmony with the meat; chosen. I recommend the smoked basa fish and the porcheta. A variety of wines, white and red, are offered and sound advice is provided. The dishes are plentiful, and the service very attentive. The restaurant offers space and conviviality; the decoration is elegant. The staff is particularly welcoming and available. We celebrated New Year's Eve there, with family, with great pleasure.

This restaurant is a kind of hidden and chill, the decor is just my style. With only 2 people going, I couldn't order many dishes, because each portion was quite large. I ordered salad and steak, Salad is a no-brainer because Da Lat vegetables are always fresh and delicious, the steak is also very delicious. Highly recommend this restaurant to everyone.

We weren't sure how the food would turn out after reading some reviews, but we were pleasantly surprised with everything we ordered. The steak was cooked to our requests and was absolutely delicious. Will definitely be back for that. The octopus was also was good. At first i thought the portion might not be enough but it was, in fact, very filling, but also left us with a bit of room for dessert. They only have 1 option right now,a pumpkin budin which was nice. I'd also like to note that the staff was very attentive. They wrote down our order and confirmed it, which i appreciated, and they also answered any of our questions regarding ingredients and allergies/sensitivities. You could tell that they were really making an effort to serve with care. Clean well stocked bathrooms as well were a big plus. Definitely recommend coming here for a treat dinner, as it is pricer than other traditional options, however it was totally worth it!

name: Comet Restaurant
address: 61 Hang Be Level 11, Aurora Premium, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Perched on the 11th floor of Aurora Premium Hotel & Spa, Comet Restaurant offers breathtaking views of the heart of Hanoi - Hoan Kiem lake. With its contemporary western design, delicious fusion cuisine, and excellent customer service, Comet Restaurant is the perfect place to experience the best of Vietnamese and international flavors. Featuring a menu of delectable dishes and a selection of fine wines and drinks to match, Comet Restaurant is an unforgettable dining destination. Whether you're looking for a sumptuous international standard breakfast buffet, a professional a la carte lunch, or a sophisticated dinner, Comet Restaurant has something for everyone. With a capacity of 52 seats, it's the perfect place to enjoy a memorable meal and savor the authentic taste of Vietnam.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Pizza for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: The restaurant is luxurious, the view overlooking Sword Lake is very chill, the feeling is very healing, the food is good, and the service quality is very good, coming here automatically takes beautiful photos because the staff here serve very enthusiastically. I am very impressed with the service of Huong (Dora) and Huyen. Will definitely come back for the second time.
The location of this place is really great.Every place is nearby The overall service was really great Maria was really helpful and was there at every point of time

My dinner at Comet restaurant was nothing short of spectacular. The ambiance was warm and inviting, with elegant decor that set the tone for an unforgettable evening. The menu offered a wide variety of dishes, each crafted with precision and creativity. I opted for the fuji steak, which was cooked to perfection and bursting with flavor. The staff were attentive and knowledgeable, ensuring every detail was taken care of. From the impeccable service to the exquisite presentation of each course, every moment was a treat. To top it off, the dessert was the perfect ending. Comet restaurant truly delivered an exceptional dining experience. Highly recommended!

name: Batavia Restaurant & Cafe
address: 116 Ngoc Ha Street Ngoc Ha Ward, Ba Dinh District, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Batavia Hanoi, brings authenticity of Indonesian Culinary with Traditional recipe, modern ambience & sincere hospitality. Certified as Halal Restaurant, we guarantee all the goods and food handling according to the Muslim law.
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
Thai Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
example_reviews: Food in Indonesia. When having trouble choosing a menu in Hanoi, for a few days in the city, always eat western fast food. Iseng Iseng googling Halal Food in Indonesian version, it turns out there is Resto and Cafe Batavia - Taste of Indonesia Hanoi. Finally can Eat Enak, Goat Tongseng, Chicken Preset, Dendeng Balado and Grain Asem, not forgetting Mendoan tempe and corn bakwan. The story of revenge along with other Indonesian comrades. Good Job Batavia, Great Food

The food here is incredible, authentic Indonesian food. I've both eaten here and also ordered home. Its a hidden gem. The prices are very reasonable and the staff are very friendly. Will definitely be going back. Definitely check out this spot because its very different when compared to the other available cuisines in Hanoi.

We tried the Ayam Penyet. Of course not as spicy as back in Malaysia or Indonesia but decent enough to allay my craving. The interior is cozy and spacious. We liked the place. Price range from 300-400k dong for 2 people.

name: Chapter Dining And Grill
address: 12C P. Chan Cam Hang Trong, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Vietnamese Contemporary Dining with focus in Charcoal Grill technique by Chef Quang Dung - Tasting Menu only
cuisines: South American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Exceptional food in an stylish setting. The restaurant is just off a busy street and is set among some local eateries but don't let the location fool you, this is an establishment of the highest quality. You go into the waiting area which is overlooks the open kitchen, you immediately see the care and passion of the chef's. The attention to detail I have only seen in some of the best restaurants. This was a tasting menu paired with no alcoholic or alcoholic (+ cost), we tried both. This was the only minor gripe that some of the pairings did not go so well, weren't bad but this could have been due to availability in the local market. The food was exceptional, the items I was unsure of were outstanding, highlights, the cone!!!, fois gras and buffalo and the kumquat (what a dish). Everything flowed possibly a little quick could of had a couple more minutes between dishes to read the postcards about the next course but nothing off putting and the staff were outstanding and had great understanding of the food. Highly recommend as a treat

Chapter was truly one of our most memorable dining experiences to date. We had the 10 course tasting menu which was delicious, creative, and made from locally sourced ingredients. The chef’s passion for Vietnamese history, food and culture is reflected in each dish. We also had the pleasure of speaking to the chef about his inspiration for the various dishes, which was an informative and insightful experience in itself. The restaurant made last minute accommodations for our special dietary requirements and the service was truly exceptional. The wine pairings with the tasting menu were sublime! We would highly recommend this gem in Hanoi for a truly unique Vietnamese fine dining experience.

I have been to many fine dining restaurants in vietnam and all were amazing but at the end of the day it's just a dinner, at chapter it felt like more then a dinner the chef brought us on a journey of local produce and fantastic taste. With the new campfire menu we tried, it really felt like eating at a fine dining camp site. The non-alchaholic pairing was a pleasant surprise that I honestly didn't expect. It was vietnamese tastes and ideas at its core but presented in a fashion that turns every dish into a painting. The staff were incredible and extremely attentive and never missed anything, described each dish to its core, and were fun and bubbly to talk to. Would recommend and will be going back when the menu changes.

name: Yalla Kebab&grill
address: 41 Dao Duy Tu, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Yalla Kebab&Grill is a middle eastern HALAL restaurant located in the heart of Hanoi (the old quarter).
cuisines: Thai Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
example_reviews: Friend and I came by this little gem in Hanoi for dinner last night. We both had the chicken Fattah and fresh lemon juice. Everything was delicious! Portion sizes were very generous and we also had a sweet treat of traditional Arabic rice pudding. The host was very bubbly and service was 10/10 -was also nice to be seated in a comfortable booth for a change!

Great experience at Yalla Kebab & Grill! ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ Dinner at Yalla Kebab & Grill was amazing in every way! The restaurant serves authentic Halal and Arabic food and everything was delicious. The flavors are rich and authentic, making you feel like a traditional homemade meal. I tried Chicken and Meat, Humming, Grilled Chicken, Rice, and each dish was prepared and full of great flavors. The meat was perfectly grilled, the hummus was creamy and delicious, and the grilled chicken was perfectly grilled with delicious rice to complement. The service was excellent, and the atmosphere was warm and friendly. I would highly recommend this place to anyone seeking an authentic Arabic and delicious Hanoi experience . Will be back soon! #Eat_Arabic #Restaurant_Hall #Shorma #Barbecue #Delicious #Vietnam

Enjoy egyptian menu in the heart of Vietnam. Hanoi. The resto served mediteranean cuisisine like shawarma and kebab. The taste is delicious and they served happily. The price is reasonable and not to expensive. Good job btw

name: Rice Bistro
address: 32 Hang Manh Street, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: The original Rice Bistro started in 1994 in Old Quarter, Hanoi. Our restaurant is where you can enjoy an exclusive experience of the Vietnamese culinary tradition redefined with Western flair. Inspired by age-old native flavours and western food style, our Chef has created a variety of delicious dishes.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Pizza for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
Seafood Restaurants for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
review_summary:
Rice Bistro has garnered high praise for its combination of value and authenticity, offering a menu of high-quality Vietnamese dishes that are both varied and reasonably priced. Guests frequently commend the tranquil and elegantly adorned environment, which enhances the dining experience.

The cuisine, bursting with traditional Vietnamese flavors, from bun cha to sea bass, consistently earns rave reviews. Additionally, the service at Rice Bistro is often highlighted for its attentiveness and friendliness, contributing to the overall exceptional experience many travelers enjoy.
example_reviews: Vietnamese restaurant. But the price is not very expensive, of course compared to the local water prices, the rice is expensive, but it is very valuable for clean food, one by one fresh ingredients. Everyone was friendly with the air-conditioned clean bathroom and had mango and shrimp in the afternoon. I think a little like this is too good! More than anything really delicious!!! Especially salad and mango salad should be roasted.

Exquisite Vietnamese experience ... close to our hotel...fab food served by Linda. We had grilled seafood, morning glory, rice and cocktails for under 1 million dong. Great value for money in a peaceful, elegant setting. We're coming back tomorrow as more wed like to try on the menu

A gem of a restaurant! Lovely decor, relaxing ambience , well staffed and excellent food. A large menu to choose from at very reasonable prices for the quality . Our waitress, Amber, was very polite and well spoken. She was very attentive to our needs without being overly intrusive while we enjoyed our meal. Highly recommend this restaurant.

name: Summit Lounge
address: 20th floor - Sofitel Plaza Hanoi 1 Thanh Nien, Ba Dinh District, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Renowned for having the "best view in Hanoi" with spectacular panoramic views of the city skyline, this rooftop bar is ideal for evening cocktails or get-together while watching the sunset on West Lake. Indoor and outdoor seating are available.Open daily:4:00 pm - midnight.
example_reviews: The Bar is now called THE SUMMIT and is located on the 20th floor of the Pan Pacific hotel. To get the only 2 elevators go to that floor so check the elevators before you get in. Once there the view of the city is amazing, and if it gets a bit cool sitting outside you can either ask for a blanket from the staff or move to the comfortable tables and chairs inside.

For a romantic date , a Friday drink with co-workers or just to watch the sunset, it is an awesome place to chill out and enjoy the rivers and lakes that Hanoi skyline offers the visitors. Interesting cocktails and drinks. There is food options as well.
Sit there to embrace the sunset and enjoy the night scene with a glass of wine. Lovely place to chill out

name: Red Bean Ma May
address: No.94 Ma May St, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Red Bean Ma May is an oasis of cozy calm, with an atmosphere made even more soothing by a color scheme of creams and browns bathed in warm lighting. The space is designed with both classical and traditional Southeast Asian features. This restaurant specializes in serving authentic Vietnamese cuisine, offering a culinary journey through Vietnam's rich and diverse flavors.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Italian Restaurants for Large Groups in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: During our 2017 visit to Hanoi, my partner and I lucked into finding the Red Bean. We loved it and i wrote a Trip Advisor review at the time. Fast forward to 2025 ... back in Hanoi and wanted to again try the Red Bean. We needed a bit of refined dining after the chaos and noise of the city. There were 7 of us and the restaurant was about a 1/2 walk from our hotel. We passed a number of restaurants along the way and some members of the group suggested just stopping at one of them instead of trekking so far. My partner and I were pretty set on the Red Bean though and our friends stuck with us. We we just hoping we hadn't oversold it. And we hadn't! It was every bit as wonderful as the first time. It is elegant - white table clothes, lovely serving dishes, etc. but no need to dress fancy. We were all in pretty casual clothes. Food was AMAZING (upscale Vietnamese) service IMPECCABLE, and SO REASONBLE. To give you an idea of the price, we shared the tasting menu (many dishes and all delicious) and shared a few bottles of wine and the bill for each of us was around $55 Canadian. Everyone agreed that the trek was well worth it. Highly recommend!

We had a delicious meal here. Lots of choice, Vietnamese food but also European food. It is more expensive compared to other restaurants here, but you get what you pay for. The food tasted delicious and the service is very nice and really ready to help you. Definitely recommended if you are in Hanoi and want to eat delicious food

Ly Nguyen was our server and she was fantastic! Food was amazing and presentation was beautiful. We got a 5 course meal of authentic Vietnamese food for the equivalent of 25 USD. Ly was VERY helpful in answering questions, educating us on the food and providing other recommendations for Hanoi. She went above and beyond. Service in general from all staff was excellent. Would DEFINITELY come back here.

name: Ivegan Supershop Old Quater Hanoi
address: 56 Hàng Điếu, Cửa Đông Hoàn Kiếm, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: We have eaten at iVegan several times in Hanoi and we love it. We appreciate that we can be certain the food here is completely vegan as many other places who claim to be vegan also serve egg or milk products and you need to ask to make sure. We had the Saigon bowl and the vegan chickpea tuna sandwich, which we really enjoyed. The blueberry muffin smoothie is my favourite drink and I’ve ordered it just about every time. Pricing is a little higher than other vegan places, but the quality of food (as well as the aesthetics), the service, and the atmosphere are fantastic. A few steps up, there is a completely air conditioned floor, which we always choose as a break from the Hanoi summer heat while we eat. Today, when we came up, a gentleman working here turned on additional fans and checked on us to make sure we were comfortable. We thought that was so kind. We absolutely recommend iVegan if you’re looking for a plant-based place to eat!
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Romantic Vietnamese Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Italian Restaurants for Lunch in Hoan Kiem

We appreciate that we can be certain the food here is completely vegan as many other places who claim to be vegan also serve egg or milk products and you need to ask to make sure. We had the Saigon bowl and the vegan chickpea tuna sandwich, which we really enjoyed. The blueberry muffin smoothie is my favourite drink and I’ve ordered it just about every time. Pricing is a little higher than other vegan places, but the quality of food (as well as the aesthetics), the service, and the atmosphere are fantastic. A few steps up, there is a completely air conditioned floor, which we always choose as a break from the Hanoi summer heat while we eat. Today, when we came up, a gentleman working here turned on additional fans and checked on us to make sure we were comfortable. We thought that was so kind. We absolutely recommend iVegan if you’re looking for a plant-based place to eat!

I stumbled upon this lovely vegan food spot in Hanoi. Despite being in a central area, it’s so quiet and peaceful inside. The menu is extensive with lots of choice. There’s so much fresh food to try from and lots of different protein options. I enjoyed my Tempeh Bagel so much that I came back the next day for another one and also had a fresh orange juice and blueberry smoothie. I’d definitely recommend and come back again. The food and drinks are inexpensive considering the quality. Nice option if you’re looking to get away from the street food within the old quarter.

I was there for breakfast and was very happy about the vegan cafe in Hanoi! A very delicious bagel, totally delicious juice and good coffee, as well as free, treated water - a great breakfast! A must for all blant-based fans:)

name: Victor Rooftop Bar & Restaurant
address: 10th Floors, 58 Hang Gai Streets, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Welcome to Victor Rooftop bar & restaurant is one of beautiful rooftop bar & restaurant in Hanoi city. We're opening our French style - Vietnamese Restaurant with delicious decor foods and Our rooftop bar have many signature Cocktail, Mocktail, Beer, Teas, coffee, cake ... with many choice. We're hope to serve all of you soon !!
example_reviews: I can’t recommend victor hotel enough, we were looked after from the minute that we arrived. Breakfast was served in the rooftop bar, a nice selection of hot and cold with freshly prepared eggs and omelettes. The room (Premium) was very comfortable and a good size. The food is very nice and kim chi 😍 is good We weren’t disturbed by any of the road noise.

Captain Skybar & Restaurant in Hanoi is a vibrant dining destination with Japanese, European, and Vietnamese cuisines. The rooftop Skybar offers stunning city views, making it an excellent spot for a memorable meal or a night out with friends. A must-visit for diverse and delightful dining experiences in Hanoi.

Had some funs while visiting this place in Hanoi. Centrally located in Hanoi, from the rooftop you can see the lake and everything else in Hanoi. The bartender was very decent, he gave some of his signatures which were fabulous and worthy. Definitely will come back to this bar when i'm back in Hanoi in near future.

name: Cinnamon Restaurant
address: 08 Hang Buom Phường Hàng Buồm, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Vietnamese Traditional & Vegetarian Food
example_reviews: Great place, clean and with very helpful staff. We tasted duck and highly recommended the traditional catfish dish served on a stove. Tiger beer and saigon in the bottle. Prices in line with the market of ha noi, 5 people the expense is about 14 euros each, with 2 beers and appetizer and a plate served
Super friendly staff and great customer service. The food is excellent, cooked using very fresh herbs and vegetables. The portion size of each dish is also very generous, excellent value for money!

We asked our hotel To make a reservation here for us because our tour guide had recommended. We were not disappointed, we didn’t opt for the set menu as there seemed a lot of food and we had to order 1 set menu per person . We shared a Papaya beef salad to share between us then I had chicken fried rice and my husband had stir fried beef in peanut sauce served with rice . We then shared flambé banana and ice cream ( a dessert a rare treat in Vietnam ) The service was excellent- very friendly owners , who mentioned post Covid that they had had to relocate from a good position by the lake to a few streets back and they were nit as busy because if the location until People find them again . They have I my been reopened a few months . Highly recommend as an alternative to all the street food surrounding

name: Uu Dam Chay, Hanoi
address: 55 Pho Nguyen Du, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: A phenomenal experience! We saw the reviews and thought that they might oversell the location and the food. But this is really an exceptional restaurant that creates a unique ambiance with high quality foods - many of them we never tried before. The menu is highly creative and the service is incredibly attentive. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone that wants to try out something unique and wonderful in Hanoi.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: A phenomenal experience! We saw the reviews and thought that they might oversell the location and the food. But this is really an exceptional restaurant that creates a unique ambiance with high quality foods - many of them we never tried before. The menu is highly creative and the service is incredibly attentive. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone that wants to try out something unique and wonderful in Hanoi.

The place and atmosphere is very quiet and all the details from the menu itself to the plating are super nice and very careful. We ordered avocado and mango rolls, pad thai, tofu with tomato and some crispy tofu balls with a very rich cream cheese. The food in general is fine, but for that price we have eaten more delicious on our trip to Vietnam. The drinks themselves have seemed especially expensive (e.g. small water 85,000 dongs...).

We dined at this restaurant after seeing the water puppet theatre (recommended). It is vegetarian; I am not a vegetarian but I was able to find some tasty dishes to try and found them very good, beautifully presented and good value. Service was attentive and there was a good level of choices on the menu. Well worth seeking out this restaurant - it is fairly central, about 10 minutes walk from the Lake.

name: Downtown Restaurant & Lounge
address: 09 Ô Quan Chưởng Str, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Well-located in the vibrant Old Quarter of Hanoi, near O Quan Chuong Gate - one of historical site of Hanoi, Downtown Restaurant & Lounge is one of the best choices for both locals and international travelers. Downtown Café & Restaurant is founded in 2017 by a group of well-experienced trip leaders who have been working in the travel and hospitality industry for many years. We find ourselves so fortunate to have traveled to many parts of the country and tasted a variety of food throughout different regions of Vietnam. We fall in love with our country’s food. Therefore, the team nourishes an aspiration to expose gourmets to a wide range of the authentic Vietnamese cuisines as seeing that Vietnamese food has become more popular in over the World.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Indian Restaurants for Large Groups in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: The food was so good. I am allergic to shrimps they made us a tasting menu without shrimp!!! We loved the hanoi spring rolls, sautéed eggplants, and grilled chicken with honey the most!!! When you visit hanoi vietnam you should come and try their delicious food 🫶🏻

We came back here for Traditional Hanoi Grilled Fish and Fried Vegetarian Spring Rolls. They are very nice and tasty as we tried before in Jan 2024. Plus the waiter Quyet is very charming and helpful. This Downtown Cafe & Restaurant is really recommended.

The guide took us while visiting the city and I was a little suspicious. The experience was excellent. The waiter welcomed us with excellent English, first illustrating the menu and then patiently explaining to us how to consume the various dishes, all excellent, always being available but without ever being intrusive. Highly recommended

name: Chill Club 2 Seafood Restaurant
address: 49A Hàng bè, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description:
Hello everyone! I really suggestion to come here and have a dinner or lunch in this cosy nice place. The will take are about you bringing amazing tasty food. All the staff is so kind and ready to help you. We tried some vegan dishes and everything was awesome. William is owner and his amazing person, I recommend you to read his story after eat.
Best vegan place!
Elena

All the staff is so kind and ready to help you. We tried some vegan dishes and everything was awesome. William is owner and his amazing person, I recommend you to read his story after eat. Best vegan place! Elena
The best! Great dinner! Best duck in Vietnam. Very hospitality and worm and friendly staffs, I agree to recommend this place for everyone
Excellent food and hospitality. Very attentive waiters at the hotel and good quality food. The rice with the tofu was excellent

name: Mau Restaurant - Vietnamese & Vegetarian Food
address: Số 88, Hàng Bạc, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: "Welcome to Mau restaurant ( Authentic Vietnamese Cuisine) Mau Vietnamese restaurant is Located in the heart of Hanoi Old Quarter , just a couple of steps away from Hoan Kiem Lake . Small and cozy Vietnamese restaurant & Vegetarian options in Hanoi. We serve Vietnamese traditional dishes from three parts in Vietnam including the north , the central and the south.""
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Indian Restaurants for Large Groups in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: This restaurant was perfect, the interior was beautiful but the food was incredible. I had the Vietnamese pancake and the lovely staff showed me how to put it together and eat it and it was genuinely the best food I’ve had in Vietnam. My friend also had the pork bun cha and she similarly loved it. The prices were good for the amount and quality of the food you get (90,000 dong for mine) however they do add 10% tax but she was nice enough to take this off as we prearranged prior to choosing the place.

We have been on holiday in Vietnam now for 2 weeks and we have finally found our absolute favorite Vietnamese restaurant!! All our dishes were amazing but in particular we really enjoyed the skewers. The waitress showed us how to assemble the options arranged on the plate into a rice paper wrapper and then roll up and dip into the dipping sauces (which I also have to specially mention were soooooo good!). There were lemon grass chicken skewers, rice noodles, pineapple, cucumber, carrot, mint and lettuce to roll up inside. I will remember it forever!

We visited this restaurant on no less than three occasions during our stay in Hanoi . The food was excellent and the atmosphere, warm and friendly . The Bun Cha was totally delicious. The staff team members under the guidance of Tuyet were keen to speak English and make the eating experience fun . Thank you

name: Alsultan Hanoi Restaurant
address: 178B Xuân Diệu, Tay Ho, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Alsultan restaurant Hanoi is an Egyptian halal restaurant in the heart of Hanoi, Vietnam, serving an authentic menu that lets you savor the flavors of Egypt.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Tay Ho
Fast Food Restaurants in Tay Ho
American Restaurants for Lunch in Tay Ho
European Restaurants for Lunch in Tay Ho
example_reviews: Popped in here during Tet as it was open and we had been meaning to go for a while. The inside is very well decorated and has a cool vibe to it. Not sure if it was due to Tet that they seemed light on staff, when we went in we didn't see a member of staff for the first 10mins, but we were happy enough to find a table and grab a menu to browse through. We both really enjoyed the chicken shawarma wraps, the had great flavour and were well filled. The side pitta bread and hummus was tasty, we were not too keen on the falafels though, they were a little on the dry side. They were out of vine leaves, so we will just have to go back and try them another time The member of staff we had was a little cold and didn't make much effort to interact, but otherwise the food was tasty and good value so we enjoyed that

This spot offers one of the most delicious meals in Hanoi. I ordered Beef Shawarma Fattah, Fries and Yoghurt Cucumber Salad that goes great with rice that is in Fattah. The price of what i ordered 8.5$.

Al Sultan serves some of the best Egyptian food we've ever had, and we lived in the Middle East and visited Egypt. We're willing to bet this is the best Egyptian food in Vietnam. If you know Egyptian and Middle Eastern food, just choose your favorites and enjoy. We like the koshari, falafel, and shawarma. What's even more fun about Al Sultan is all the football, Mo Salah, and ancient Egypt swag. Good times!

name: Masala Art Indian Restaurant & Bar
address: No. 9 P. Nha Tho Street Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: A chic Indian restaurant located in the heart of Old Quarter serving delectable vegetarian & non-vegetarian halal Tandoori Kebabs, Kathi Rolls, Biryani, Curries & more!
example_reviews: If you are looking for true authentic Indian food in Vietnam, a country where getting good Indian food is a challenge, then Masala Art, Hanoi is the answer. We were a group of 6 friends from New Delhi, India, came to Vietnam for holidays for 10 days with Hanoi as our last destination. After having Vietnamese food for 8 days, decided to try Indian food at Masala Art. Thoroughly enjoyed the food. Our experience was so good that we repeated our visit for Dinner next day too. Each dish was excellently well prepared, delicious and flavourful. We had mix of Vegetarian and Non Veg dishes. Each was truly delicious. In sweets, we tried Gajar Ka Halwa; OMG, really mouth watering and authentic Red Carrot Halwa. Service and hospitality was superb; very attentive, highly personalized; always smiling. Please reserve a table when you plan to visit and enjoy the lunch / dinner at Masala Art. This place is fairly occupied and busy.

Ok, I was a little nervous based on the reviews which seemed overly positive but I am very pleasantly surprised. I decided to give this place a try since my previous preferred Indian restaurant has recently changed ownership after 15 years. This was a 3 person business dinner. We spend roughly a but under $100 for a table packed full of food. A few apps, the meat kebab platter, several mains, a biryani, and two types of naan. I would say all the dishes except for one were good to excellent. The one dish that was disappointing was the palak paneer which was still ok but it was incredibly bland. I like palak paneer so I was not expecting it to be some huge flavor explosion because it's a simple white cheese with creamed spinach but I expect it to have some flavor and good palak paneer usually has a creamy but subtle richness to it. This palak paneer was flavorless. The manchurian cauliflower app was not what I would consider an Indian dish but it was really good. The rest of the dishes were yummy and more traditional (not that I would know) compared to what I have had at other Indian places. I will happily return there in the future. Service was fast and attentive.

Masala Art in Hanoi offers a delightful dining experience with its elegant and ambient atmosphere, featuring a regal Rajasthan-style interior that exudes luxury. The food is delicious, and the staff is friendly and attentive, making you feel right at home. Located in a convenient spot, it's the perfect place to relax and enjoy authentic flavors while on holiday. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a blend of comfort and sophistication.

name: 3 Spoons
address: Plot E6, Pham Hung Road 62nd Floor, Landmark 72 Building, Nam Từ Liêm, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: A lively restaurant with amazing skyline views over Hanoi, 3 Spoons not only offers the best, most extensive and energetic breakfast buffet, but also a choice of three wonderful cuisines in the world. Sample the most authentic dishes from the Vietnamese and Chinese cuisines, savour the freshest seafood from the Japanese kitchen, or enjoy fragrant Italian breads, pasta and stone-oven pizzas. 3 Spoons Restaurant is also the main setting of InterContinental Hanoi Landmark's monthly Edition Brunch – the most exclusive Sunday Brunch experience in Hanoi, organized with a different monthly theme on the first Sunday of every month. The brunch features the best in culinary from world-famous brands and all 4 of the hotel’s restaurants and bars. Live music and captivating entertainment, from fashion show to art gallery, are also offered every month, for the ultimate Sunday indulgence for all guests.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Nam Từ Liêm
Korean Restaurants in Nam Từ Liêm
Healthy Restaurants in Nam Từ Liêm
Fast Food Restaurants in Nam Từ Liêm
BBQ Restaurants for Lunch in Nam Từ Liêm
Cafes for Lunch in Nam Từ Liêm
example_reviews: I had a very fun and happy experience at the restaurant while on vacation with my family. The waiters and uncles were very enthusiastic and polite. Ms. Huong and the other aunts and uncles are very dedicated to the children and grandparents. The food is not much but delicate and delicious, the place to get buffet food is also very convenient. Thank you and I will definitely come back. I had a very fun and happy experience at the restaurant while on vacation with my family. The waiters and uncles were very enthusiastic and polite. Ms. Huong and the other aunts and uncles are very dedicated to the children and grandparents. The food is not much but delicate and delicious, the place to get buffet food is also very convenient. Thank you and I will definitely come back.

Visited 3Spoons for a weekday family lunch. Beautiful Restaurant with a spectacular panoramic views of Hanoi. The restaurant offers both an a la carte menu, as well as a buffet for lunch. We opted for the buffet as there is such a substantial offering, ranging from Italian dishes, local Vietnamese and an amazing array of sushi, and not to forget the delectable dessert room!!! Needless to say we all thoroughly enjoyed our meal, and finished off with some of the best coffee we've experienced in Vietnam. A very special mention to the wonderful service from all the staff, especially the professional Ms. Huong who took our reservation and explained the menu to us, and our waitress Ms. Thuy Duong who made sure we never had an empty glass, and provided friendly and efficient service to us. 5 star food, 5 star service, 5 star location!

My wife and I very much enjoyed our meal. The restaurant manager could not have been more polite. The customer service was outstanding from start to finish. Most importantly, the food was delicious as always.. 😋 The Intercontinental brand never fails to impress me... We have eaten in Intercontinental hotels in Ho Chi Minh City and Da Nang as well... Wow! Three Spoons is very highly recommended, along with all of the other Intercontinental hotel restaurants!!

name: Pho Thin 1955
address: 61 Dinh Tien Hoang Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Pho Thin Bo Ho is the Phở restaurant established since 1955 by Mr Thin. From now, Pho Thin Bo Ho has 3 shops in Hanoi and 1 shop in HCM city, that has operated by Mr Thin' sons and daughters. The 1st one is located at 61 Dinh Tien Hoang street, Ha Noi, which has run by my father- mr Thin's 1st son. Pho Thin Bo Ho gets a good standing in Hanoian's heart and also visitors around the world.
cuisines: BBQ Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
example_reviews: After receiving a recommendation from a local tour guide, I visited on the evening of the last day of the trip. I actually liked the unique atmosphere of a local restaurant where English was not widely spoken. Even though I only said a simple greeting, I felt like everyone was looking at me favorably, so I felt relieved. The rice noodles came out just a minute after ordering, and the soup was thick. The fried food that my grandfather sold separately only cost 10,000 dong, and it was eaten dipped in soup. I think it is a restaurant with the right level of difficulty that allows you to feel the atmosphere and taste of a local restaurant, but is not too hard.

The restaurant serves only one type of pho, beef pho, which features a thick broth and plenty of green onions. It is made by slowly simmering beef bones and is characterized by its deep richness and flavor. The noodles are soft and topped with plenty of green onions and herbs, which blend perfectly with the broth. On the table are condiments such as lime, garlic vinegar, and homemade chili sauce, allowing customers to change the flavor to their liking. The prices are quite reasonable, and those who want to enjoy the Vietnamese specialty pho in Hanoi should try it at this restaurant!

If you are a Pho lover, then you absolutely must check out this Pho restaurant. This is highly recommended by my Airbnb host, as well as other local foodie experts. It's a good sign when you see locals only. The place, a hole in the wall or actually in an alley with two long tables, shared table. This place only offers Beef Pho and does it very well! This is the original Pho Thin, the first location. A hole is the wall, situated on an alley. From the moment you walk in, you can smell the aroma of the rich broth and beef permeating the air. The clear broth looks simple however it packs a beefy and flavorful with a perfect balance of spices and seasoning that creates an authentic, one-of-a-kind taste. The beef is tender and generous portion. The noodles are perfectly cooked. Topped with a generous amount of green onions. Make sure to pair it with the Fried donuts and tea from the older man next door and must be paid separately. They have condiments available at the table to customize your taste. The garlic vinegar is great, chili oil paste, sliced chili, and lime. The service is fast, despite the language barrier. Just point out what you want. It's an outdoor dining, on an alley. No AC, just fans. Overall, this Pho restaurant is a must-visit for any food lover.

name: Hanoi Oriana Restaurant
address: 38 Lo Su Street Eliana Signature Building - 8th Floor, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Oriana Restaurant located on 8th floor where you could get the great view of Old quarter We serve Vietnamese traditional food with Vegetarian and Vegan option we ensure that we will bring the fresh, tasty of authentic cuisine beside the friendly and informative staff team Welcome to Oriana Restaurant!
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Late Night Asian Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Cafes for Breakfast in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: We enjoyed our meal on the 8th floor very much! The traditional Hanoi grilled pork was delicious, and the service was great. Everyone was very kind and welcoming. Ly, our waitress, was kind enough to show us how to eat the traditional dish. We would recommend this to anyone.

Thanks for all the good food and comfortable ambience to do work Special gratitude to Ms. Ly who have been very kind in providing the guidance on the possible cuisine that i should have, to experience Vietnamese food & explaining very well in English Appreciate your overall team's kindness & hospitality.

Oh my god! The food and service was out of this world! Alex was the star of the show and made the experience more than 5 stars.. he showed us how to eat the food to ensure we had the best experience, and it wouldn’t of been the same without his guidance and presence. This man (Alex) really is a testament to the place!

name: 5 Spice Restaurant
address: 27 Hong Phuc Nguyen Trung Truc Ward, Ba Dinh District, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Located in the old quarter of Hanoi, 5 Spice is easily accessed from diffirent direction. It is surrounded by virant streets but also easy to stroll around, 5 Spice is ideal place to dine. Built in 1923, 5 Spice building is an old French house which belong to Frech family then Vietnamese deputy minister of finance. After many rich families lived here,since 2012, 5 Spice Restaurant was moved in running upto now. Is has 3 storeys with 4 dining room and 1 open terrace dining area. The restaurant capacity is 120 – 140 seats. Each room has diffirent style is design and decoration, also a private cosy atmosphere with diffirent size of dining rooms. It can accommodate varied sizes of groups. With our experiences, 5 Spice is always confident and ready in service of your valued passengers. Come to us and enjoy your meals!!!
example_reviews: This is a great place for dinner, service was outstanding the beer was superbly cold with a great variety of local beers. The food was delicious and our waiter Harry along with his colleague walked us back to our accommodation with umbrellas as it was raining heavily. Admittedly it was only a short distance but that is what i call fantastic service. We will be back for another meal tonight

We went to the restaurant as it was recommended by our tour guide. We went here early evening without booking and we were lucky to get a table as many tour guides use this as a restaurant serving a set menu for their tour groups. The restaurant is situated near the Old Quarter and serves traditional Vietnamese dishes. We found the food was excellent and service very good. I strongly recommend this restaurant but advise booking as it is used by tour groups.

You can get a good meal here. The dessert (flambe banana crepe with slivered coconut, vanilla ice cream and chocolate syrup) was delicious. The birthday cake they served was good. There are framed traditional musical instruments mounted on the wall as decoration.

name: An Bread
address: 04 Đình Ngang, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Excellent food, service and location. Beautifully presented food and drink. So tasty! Best Pho! Lovely people serving us. Can watch the train from train street pass by as you are eating and if you sit by entrance the people/moped watching is fabulous! Great value food! 👏
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Italian Restaurants for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
Pizza for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: Excellent food, service and location. Beautifully presented food and drink. So tasty! Best Pho! Lovely people serving us. Can watch the train from train street pass by as you are eating and if you sit by entrance the people/moped watching is fabulous! Great value food! 👏

What a great little find, we sat on the footpath and enjoyed wonderful egg coffees, wine coffee, salted coffee we also ordered food spring rolls. Staff were nice my favorite thing was their art coffees. Definitely worth a visit.

We ended up here by chance this evening and were absolutely delighted: for the usual small sum for Vietnamese cuisine, we had the best meal of our trip so far. And the exceptionally friendly service here is also worth mentioning. Absolutely recommended!

name: Nabemono Wagyu Hotpot Buffet
address: 8th Floor, 12-14 Nguyen Quang Bich, Cua Dong, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: All you can eat buffet served with 100% authentic wagyu beef
example_reviews: Wow! What a fabulous meal. Huyen Yu, was our server and brought her beautiful smile to serve us along with the tastiest of food. The 2 of us ordered the medium priced wagyu hot pot along with a side mango salad and summer rolls. Everything was so fresh and tasty. Highly recommended! If I wasn’t leaving the city, I’d most definitely be back. 😋

The restaurant is located inside the hotel, and provides 10% off for guests staying at the hotel. It serves Japanese style hot pot with Wagyu beef. The quality of the beef tasted like Angus but I guess any beef that comes from Japan could be called Wagyu? No idea. It just tasted very rough and not like a regular Wagyu eaten in Japan. It was a slow night at the restaurant and there were only 4 tables including us. The environment was nice, veggies were all-you-can-eat free refill, and we generally had a nice time. The service was pretty great, and our server, Huyen, has been helpful and nice!

Really sweet. If you're missing a meal (but lunch) Come on. Well, I've been here for four hours for dessert meals and fruit. If you ask for Kim Chi, you'll have Kim Chi at breakfast. Beef and Vegetables 3 mins per person!!! The servers were very friendly and we were the only ones in the hall who asked us what we needed.

name: Spice Viet
address: 46 Nguyen Truong To Ba Dinh Dist., Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Just a 10-minute walk north of Hanoi’s Old Quarter, Spice Viet Hanoi Restaurant specialises in farm-to-table Vietnamese cuisine in a cosy, contemporary setting. Our extensive menu features both Hanoi specialties like West Lake-style shrimp fritters and pan-fried fish flavoured with turmeric and galangal as well as favourites from the length of Vietnam.
example_reviews: We were so pleased to have found Spice Viet Hanoi after a full day of sightseeing. The food here is beautifully presented and the flavours are incredible. We enjoyed mixed and vegetable spring rolls followed by chicken pho and pork belly with noodles. The service was second to none, both our servers were very attentive. All in all a great place to enjoy some great food!

We went with a group of 10 . A beautiful night had by all - the food was delicious, well presented and thoroughly enjoyable - we all enjoyed all that was served. Congratulations to the staff for their professionalism, eagerness to please - all with a pleasant disposition. Thank you for a wonderful dining experience.

Verrrrry kind staffs so glad to your great service! All servers care for us any time we want. It was very happy dinner at this restaurant. Foods taste delicious (especially duck spring roll she-maybe kind manager recommended us). Have to visit once again another time. Today meal was the best thing I've experienced in Hanoi. Thank you for your service again!

name: Timeline Coffee & Restaurant
address: 7 P. Đinh Liệt Hàng Bạc, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: we are know as local restaurant in Hanoi old quarter, with special vietnamese foods...
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
American Restaurants for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: Great spot to sit - eat, drink and watch people pass below. Annie was a pleasure to be served by - she was lovely, very polite and happy to help with directions and generally with our food, I hope to see Annie in Australia one day! We also had the pleasure of being joined by two kids; who were very well behaved and always left when you said ‘okay time for me to eat!’ Food was priced higher than most places, but worth it for the view and the experience from the staff. Thank you again Annie!

The spot is nice for dinner. Unfortunately it rained, but the waiters quickly rearranged the parasols so we didn't get wet outside. You can order a variety of local vietnamese food that tastes good. We recommend the vegetarian spring rolls.

I Would highly recommend this place for food and drinks, very chilled vibes and great staff, catered to all my needs and I was well looked after. The pho was top notch and great draft beer, perfect for solo travelers and couples, anyone who wants some great food and drinks with a nice view of the street below from the balcony. Please visit you will not be disappointed.

name: May De Cuisine - Vietnamese Restaurant
address: 107 Ma May Ward Hang Buom, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: May De Cuisine – The perfect destination for ALL who love Vietnamese culture expressed in food!! In the middle of the bustling Old Quarter of ancient Hanoi, May De Cuisine's Oriental cuisine is like a romantic stopover for tourists from all over Vietnam. Come to May De Cuisine, and you, too, will have a unique Vietnamese culinary experience, where delicate and beautiful dishes are created from the heart of our artisan chefs. Not only delicious, Vietnamese dishes with rich menus and seasonal updates, are created through the rich and the loving care of our incredible chef. In a rustic and intimate historic space, the symphony between the emotions of taste, smell, sight and touch will be our great gift to you on your journey as you explore our beautiful capital, Hanoi. May De Cuisine – The perfect destination for ALL who love Vietnamese culture expressed in food!!
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Pizza for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: From the warm greeting at the door, to the polished but friendly service, May De Cuisine excels in all areas. The menu is a broad representation of northern Vietnamese cooking, with extensive a la carte and set menu meals, including vegetarian choices. Set on three or four floors of a quaint restored old building in the bustling Old Quarter, May De Cuisine is a quiet oasis of comfortable seating and large portions. The set menu of four courses ordered was almost too much for one meal, but we tried our best, as the food was prepared and presented with such care. In particular, the young server named Timber was charming and attentive without fail, with excellent English skills.

Recently visited a restaurant and the experience was extremely positive. From the very first minutes, attention to detail was noticeable – the interior is cozy, with pleasant lighting and comfortable atmosphere. The staff is polite and friendly, the waiters (Timber) are excellent at navigating the menu and are always available to help with the selection.

We were taken to this fine restaurant by or guide Sammy N. She ordered a variety of dishes to try and I wish I could tel you what they were in Vietnamese. We had a delicious smoked duck salad, fried crispy white fish, chicken and cashew stirfry, steamed vegetables, soup and a chocolate dessert. Great service and nice location.

name: Xoi Yen
address: 35b Nguyen Huu Huan Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description:
I visited at dinner time, so the big three-story store was crowded with what looked like tourists and locals. There are also English words on the menu table, so first, I choose from three types of base okowa: turmeric, corn, and white rice. Next, you choose toppings, which can be chicken, grilled pork, boiled egg, or deep-fried fish, but there is also a mix if you don’t have to choose. It was quite voluminous so I was full.
The bill is a postpaid payment at the cash register, but the price is written on the slip, so even if you don’t understand the language, you can still do something about it.
example_reviews: I visited at dinner time, so the big three-story store was crowded with what looked like tourists and locals. There are also English words on the menu table, so first, I choose from three types of base okowa: turmeric, corn, and white rice. Next, you choose toppings, which can be chicken, grilled pork, boiled egg, or deep-fried fish, but there is also a mix if you don’t have to choose. It was quite voluminous so I was full. The bill is a postpaid payment at the cash register, but the price is written on the slip, so even if you don’t understand the language, you can still do something about it.

At the end of the Ninh Ben tour, we were taken to a Bun Cha restaurant for free, but I had eaten there the day before and didn't really like it. When I told the guide, he took me to this restaurant because it is famous for its okowa. I arrived around 7pm, but it was very crowded and I finally managed to get a seat. To order, first you ask if you want your okowa plain or with corn, and if you want chicken, pork or beef as toppings. The local guide helped me with the order, such as whether I wanted it steamed or fried, which was helpful. I ordered a simple okowa with steamed chicken. It was refreshing and easy to eat even in the heat, and it was delicious. I added soy sauce halfway through and it changed the flavor and was delicious.

Excellent!!! The place was crowded with Vietnamist people. They have rice with different toppings you can choose. Rice could be traditional sticky rice, turmeric sticky rice etc and toppings like chicken, beef, mushrooms etc The price was really cheap, we paid around 4-5€ for everything.

name: Som Tam Thai
address: 11B Hai Bà Trưng Phường Tràng Tiền, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Great spot. Just me being pedantic and rarely giving out 5’s. Would recommend to anyone looking for Nice clean and tasty dinner.
example_reviews: Great spot. Just me being pedantic and rarely giving out 5’s. Would recommend to anyone looking for Nice clean and tasty dinner.
This restaurant has excellent location. Not too crowded in the evening but busy during lunchtime due to all the office buildings around. Better go in the evening for leisurely atmosphere
Good food. Good location. Portion sizes were a bit hard to guess. Portion of some dishes are so small and some unexpectedly huge. Overall good taste.

name: SportivO Bar
address: 39 Hang Buom Street, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 11010 Vietnam
description: The best sport bar in the heart of Old quarter where you can find Premium draft beers, classic/signature cocktails, sports events broadcasting with 4k tv screen. In addition we offer a variety of selections for exquisite food with both western and local fusion. With outstanding location, open environment for family gatherings or intimacy dates , great options for team-building events, information exchange spot for tourists. A place that will be the highlight of your staying in Hanoi.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Italian Restaurants for Large Groups in Hoan Kiem
Pizza for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: Great sports bar with multiple screens. Ice cold beer and bar food available; can highly recommend the spring rolls. Professional and friendly bar staff make for a wonderful experience!

A great sports bar in Hanoi with a number of large screens in order to watch sports late at night or during the day. The beer on offer covers the north and south of Vietnam and there are a selection of craft beers available. The food was good and I would recommend it to any sports fan in the area. We also liked the football team pillows.

This great sports bar went out of their way to make sure that I could watch a UK rugby match late in the Ha Noi night - despite my being the only person there who was interested in te game. I dropped in earlier in the day and made an enquiry. Half an hour later Ha Anh, the brilliant manager, dropped me a note to confirm that all systems were go (despite all sorts of technical difficulties). Sure enough, when I turned up all was ready: I saw the game (don't ask!) and enjoyed several pints of excellent witbier to accompany the action. Many, many thanks. This is a place worthy of recommendation.

name: Pizza 4P's Phan Ke Binh
address: 05 Phan Ke Binh Ba Dinh, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: An Earth to People restaurant on a mission to make the world smile for peace, one pizza at a time. Earth to People is our commitment to serve safe and fresh foods directly from Mother Earth to you. Located in Ho Chi Minh City, Hanoi, Danang and Nha Trang.
cuisines: Late Night Mediterranean Restaurants in Hanoi
Middle Eastern Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: We walked to this branch from our Airbnb soon as we dropped our bags. We went to the Hoan Kiem branch 3 years ago. Service crew are amazing as expected. Not all speaks good English but they all do speak a lot of English. The cheese are all home made and the dishes are very reasonably priced.

We have an amazing dinner with Pizza 4Ps. Never ever disapointed me. I love all kind of cheese in here. And burrata salad also. The staff is friendly and attentive, always making sure to provide excellent service. Overall, Pizza 4P's is a top-quality pizza joint that offers unique and delicious pies that will leave you wanting more. The fantastic ambiance and friendly service make for a truly enjoyable dining experience.

Overall, this place was very good. The staff was very accommodating even though our wait time for our pizza and seats was well over an hour each. They offered good service and provided our table with complementary dessert due to the issues that we unfortunately experienced; which is why I gave them 4stars. This type of customer service was excellent and is not very common. The pizza itself was good, I donâ€™t think itâ€™s the very best in Hanoi, but it was good. Very crowded and busy, with a nice atmosphere, the prices are decent and you do get a good portion size. Follow @travelingypsey on Instagram & GoogleMaps!!! Pictured is the Mushroom Pizza!

name: La Table Hanoia
address: 12 Lý Đạo Thành Tràng Tiền, Hoàn Kiếm, Tầng 3 tòa nhà Press Club, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: La Table Hanoia aspires to be more than a fine dining establishment or a modern cocktail bar. Our foundations are inspired by inspiration itself. That drive to find beauty wherever it may hide. But the pursuit of beauty is understanding the process behind it. The journey it takes from nothing to perfection. And that is what we attempt to achieve here. Set above the famous Journalist Association, home to writers and journalists since the war, we are intended as a tribute to the finest creations by the gesture of the hand. Here at La Table Hanoia we strive to offer creations of beauty. From our fine gourmet selection of foods to the location’s elegant design. The seamless service to the atmosphere of casual grace, not to mention our unique and award-winning cocktails. La Table Hanoia welcomes you.
cuisines: Eastern European Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Small five stars. My boyfriend and I had three courses for lunch and drinks. Close to four stars, which is because the elements on the plate were anonymous, and without particularly interesting taste or texture. The rest was excellent though. The waiter recommended the Pho cocktail to me, which was the most interesting feature of the lunch, both in the way it was made and the way the drink tasted. Great decor and wonderful staff.

Came here with my mom for a fine lunch. 1. Location: in the middle of Hanoi, luxury area but not too vibrant. Should come here on a sunny day to take marvellous photos on the street 2. Space: The restaurant has different areas to choose based on your interest, I chose a perfect table next to the window with an outstanding view to Sofitel Metropole Hotel across the road. Design is high-end but not overwhelmed, not too crowded. Such a perfect place for lowkey people like me. 3. Food: We got Temptation Set Menu with 3 courses, freshly start with smoked salmon salad & creamy cauliflower soup. Beef filet with red wine sauce was too good to be true. The most impressive thing was strawberry sorbet, fantastic ending. It’s was a pity that seafood quenelle failed though…the French oyster’s smell wasn’t processed well. 4. Suitable for: family, couples 5. Price: 690,000++vnd/ 3 courses (drinks excluded) Overall: definitely gonna come back to discover more

The food was excellent and the service was very efficient and friendly. The whole evening was made perfect with a live piano performance during the evening. We ate 2 of the beef dishes and both were lovely and share a prawn dish to start which really was delightful

name: Pho Ly Quoc Su
address: 18 Le Truc, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description:
A Michelin starred restaurant (previously) so we definitely have to try, right? Came here for dinner and it had a snaking queue when we arrived. I think we queued for 30mins+ before finally having a table to sit. And even then, they put us beside another family haha. Prepare to sit with anyone as long as there are available seats!

Dinner was great and I spent about 90K VND-  $5 sgd for a steaming bowl of delicious soup. Beef was half done as I requested and the broth was really good as well. Would come back here again for sure. The time taken to queue though leaves the experience a bit unsatisfactory.
cuisines: South American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: A Michelin starred restaurant (previously) so we definitely have to try, right? Came here for dinner and it had a snaking queue when we arrived. I think we queued for 30mins+ before finally having a table to sit. And even then, they put us beside another family haha. Prepare to sit with anyone as long as there are available seats! Dinner was great and I spent about 90K VND- $5 sgd for a steaming bowl of delicious soup. Beef was half done as I requested and the broth was really good as well. Would come back here again for sure. The time taken to queue though leaves the experience a bit unsatisfactory.

We visited this restaurant because they sell mainly vermicelli noodles. The dish is called pho it was mentioned quite a lot before we came to Vietnam. Most people complimented this as a delicious dish that definitely we must try when we come here we ordered two bowls of beef pho, it was really good. But what I don't like is that the beef noodle soup has too many onions and the wait staff is also quite long so I don't like it very much.

I quite like the food here, I find the broth of the dish very delicious and rich, the noodles are soft and the beef that is cooked with is also seasoned very well. You can also order more cakes to eat with vermicelli noodles, I see they also give me an extra portion of raw vegetables. The restaurant staff said that the Vietnamese way of eating is to mix raw vegetables and eat with vermicelli noodles. It really tastes so much better

name: Kỳ Bistro
address: 51 Xuân Diệu, Hanoi 124403 Vietnam
description: Came here for dinner and drinks with friends and we all ate well. Plenty of Asian options and the pork ribs and beef bulgogi were tasty. A range of drinks at reasonable prices, clean restaurant and excellent attentive service from Mai. No complaints.
cuisines: South American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Came here for dinner and drinks with friends and we all ate well. Plenty of Asian options and the pork ribs and beef bulgogi were tasty. A range of drinks at reasonable prices, clean restaurant and excellent attentive service from Mai. No complaints.

1. Staff: warm, pleasant, hospitable 2. Food quality: great portions, unique spices & sauces, tasty 3. Ambience: clean, airy, nicely decorated * the Special Vietnamese Coffee with Herbs" is highly recommended !!! Excellent customer experience

This spot is great , me and my girlfriend visited it last night for dinner and it was a great experience. I have been meaning to visit it for a while, as it's near my house. I always thought it didn't look busy from the outside but I realized yesterday it has a lovely downstairs part with outside seating area with a good vibe that you can't see when looking at the restaurant from street-level. It had a great little bar with a lot of variety which was nice and the food was delicious too. My favorite was the summer rolls with crab, I also loved the desserts too. We tried the pickleballs with ice cream and also the passion fruit créme brulée. Hope this place will get more business, it seems to have a lot of interesting items on the menu and the staff are so nice !

name: Net Hue restaurant
address: 198 Hang Bong, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: This is listed on the 2009 Lonely Planet Guide--page 69. It is a Hue cuisine restaurant. It was simply delicious and full of locals. Great price
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: The food is Pretty good, but the service not so much. We came around peak lunch rush but once we were seated we were mostly ignored. We got 2 lemonades which were very warm. We also ordered a raspberry tea but they conveniently forgot until we reminded them 15 minutes later. When we finally got our drink, it was the wrong one! Probably won’t come again

On recommendation we order a must, the fish claypot. Good taste, hearty because accompanied by rice, vegetables, broth and seasoning. We found it too fatty; as it cooled, the white fat gelled. We will come back to it because the menu offers a plethora of dishes.

There are a number of Net Hue restaurants in Hanoi but this one, for some reason, feels the nicest. The menus are all the same but there's something about this location that I really like. Another thing that I like about Net Hue is that it's such a great value and offers such a wide variety of food. It's a great place to go with friends and not have to worry that the meal will be too expensive. I will certainly go back!

name: Highway4 Kim Mã
address: 575 Kim Ma Ba Dinh District, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Highway4 offers the ultimate Vietnamese dining experience. The food menu has been specially crafted over the past 15 years, serving traditional Vietnamese flavours as well as the opportunity to explore another side of Vietnamese culinary culture. At Highway4 you can try the wide range of fruit, herbal and plain liquors under the brand "Son Tinh" - Vietnam's first and ONLY internationally-awarded liquor. Highway4 is perfect for discovering and exploring Vietnam's culture of food and drink or getting together with a group of friends or colleagues for an evening of fun and feasting. Highway4 Kim Ma is located in the south-west corner of Hanoi, opposite Thu Le Lake and Park (zoo), and close to the landmark 65-floor Lotte Building which occupies a prominent position on the junction of Kim Ma and Nguyen Chi Thanh Streets.
example_reviews: Last weekend, I had the chance to experience Highway4 Kim Ma for the first time. As I stepped into the restaurant, my first impression was that the décor was beautiful, exuding a strong Northwest Vietnam vibe. The space was airy and spacious, creating a comfortable dining atmosphere. The menu was diverse, offering a wide range of choices at reasonable prices—perfect for those who want to explore the traditional flavors of the Northwest region. The staff were friendly and enthusiastic in helping with menu recommendations. If I get the chance, I will definitely come back and introduce more people to this amazing restaurant.

Last week, my friends and I were looking for a restaurant to gather and chat and have fun together, so I went online and found Highway 4 Kim Ma restaurant. In my personal opinion, I find the food here very delicious and suitable for my taste, the staff is also enthusiastic and attentive. This restaurant has a very cool and quiet space, suitable for gathering with friends and family.

I had a very deep impression when visiting the Tay Bac restaurant at Highway 4 Kim Ma. Grasping the geographical location in the heart of Hanoi attracts many customers. The restaurant space is clean, airy, classic style suitable for today. The staff is enthusiastic and dedicated. The menu is indispensable, with many delicious dishes in the traditional style of the Northwest. This is my feeling, if I have the opportunity to visit, I will definitely visit the restaurant to enjoy this specialty

name: Joseph Restaurant - Anatole Hotel Hanoi
address: 30 Nhà Chung, Hanoi Vietnam
description: We went to this restaurant for lunch. We were alone in the room but the service was there. The only problem is that English is not yet well assimilated and instead of a lemon juice we had an apple juice. The rest of the meal was excellent. As a gastronomy not large quantities but quality ingredients. We were delighted by this meal
cuisines: Mexican Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
example_reviews: We went to this restaurant for lunch. We were alone in the room but the service was there. The only problem is that English is not yet well assimilated and instead of a lemon juice we had an apple juice. The rest of the meal was excellent. As a gastronomy not large quantities but quality ingredients. We were delighted by this meal

I visited Hanoi for five days while on a trip with companions in Vietnam. In the Hanoi Old Quarter, we dined on Hanoi food, tried some regional specialties, and visited a few eateries. Joseph Restaurant was the thing that most impressed me. What a beautiful thing! It is very good, the steak! We love it with wine, such an awesome location that is worthwhile for travellers to visit.

The reviews that patrons have provided on this website helped us choose this restaurant. You're all correct, and I appreciate it. Excellent cuisine, stunning and eye-catching décor. Actually, we felt like VIPs. Will return.

name: Dizenki - Trạm Sạc Bình An
address: BT12, Ngõ 75 Phố Trần Thái Tông, Dịch Vọng, Cau Giay, Hanoi 122000 Vietnam
description: I like spa here because the technical are friendly and good at skill, and the foods are very delicious , local are so beautiful and peace
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Cau Giay
Fusion Restaurants for Lunch in Cau Giay
Asian Restaurants for Lunch in Cau Giay
Vietnamese Restaurants for Lunch in Cau Giay
example_reviews: I like spa here because the technical are friendly and good at skill, and the foods are very delicious , local are so beautiful and peace

The vegetarian restaurant is decorated in a very artistic style. The food is delicious and very delicate. The staff here is very friendly, enthusiastic and lovely. The dishes are not only delicious but also like works of art.

name: Chicken Society
address: 51 Xuan Dieu, Tay Ho Fraser Suites Hanoi, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description:
The restaurant is located deep in the lobby of Fraser suites Hanoi, so when you intend to dine here. You should contact in advance so the staff can guide you through the entrance.
The plus point of the restaurant is its cleanliness and spaciousness.
In the past, when I came here, I often ordered chicken dishes/portions for each person. Now there is Chicken Rice (699,000/1 dish) enough for 4-6 adults to choose from a full menu of chicken rice: Honey grilled chicken, crispy fried chicken, Hainanese steamed chicken, Crispy fried chicken cakes cheese, Fried chicken and mushroom spring rolls, Chicken salad, Salt roasted chicken wings / Fried fish sauce.
Thank you, Quan, for your advice on how to cook chicken and take care of your family throughout the meal, even the smallest thing. Will recommend everyone to come here.
example_reviews: The restaurant is located deep in the lobby of Fraser suites Hanoi, so when you intend to dine here. You should contact in advance so the staff can guide you through the entrance. The plus point of the restaurant is its cleanliness and spaciousness. In the past, when I came here, I often ordered chicken dishes/portions for each person. Now there is Chicken Rice (699,000/1 dish) enough for 4-6 adults to choose from a full menu of chicken rice: Honey grilled chicken, crispy fried chicken, Hainanese steamed chicken, Crispy fried chicken cakes cheese, Fried chicken and mushroom spring rolls, Chicken salad, Salt roasted chicken wings / Fried fish sauce. Thank you, Quan, for your advice on how to cook chicken and take care of your family throughout the meal, even the smallest thing. Will recommend everyone to come here.
