Whenever I crave chicken rice, I have to drag my husband and children to Chicken Society. The restaurant is located on the premises of the Fraser suites hotel, so it's super nice. Sitting and eating overlooking the hotel's swimming pool is very chill. At noon, the green trees are cool to the eye, and in the evening, the lights turn on sparklingly. The restaurant has a separate play area for children, so the couple eats without having to look after their children, which my children really like. The chicken rice here is super delicious, the rice is soft, tender, and flavorful, and the chicken is soft and sweet. Sometimes ordering a few more dishes from the menu is also delicious. Enthusiastic and friendly staff, especially a friend named Ngan. In general, this is my favorite restaurant, I highly recommend everyone to come!!

Food is reasonably priced, super cheap especially on holidays, the restaurant does not charge any extra fees. You can buy a swimming ticket, take a shower and then eat at the restaurant. Restaurant staff Friendly and enthusiastic. Thank you for your professionalism. Quan took care of my family for a thoughtful dinner. We will definitely come back

name: Blue Eyes Sky Bar
address: 20 Lo Su Street 11 th Floor, Shining Central, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 0084 Vietnam
description:
During my trip to Hanoi with my family, I used the Sky Bar inside the really nice Shining Central Hotel.
My wife and I ordered cocktails, and the kids enjoyed being able to watch the night view of Hanoi while drinking juice.
Hotel guests were able to use the hotel at a lower price because they were able to receive a discount. Thank you, Manager Suzy!
I will visit again next time I come to Hanoi!
If you're going to Hanoi, give it a try.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
American Restaurants for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: During my trip to Hanoi with my family, I used the Sky Bar inside the really nice Shining Central Hotel. My wife and I ordered cocktails, and the kids enjoyed being able to watch the night view of Hanoi while drinking juice. Hotel guests were able to use the hotel at a lower price because they were able to receive a discount. Thank you, Manager Suzy! I will visit again next time I come to Hanoi! If you're going to Hanoi, give it a try.

It is a nice spot to wind down and have a nice drink! It is on the rooftop which has a very nice view of the city! My only critique is that they stop a little bit early in serving food. The sky bar does not close until midnight but the food service stops like 5-6pm. It would be so nice if they serve some type of finger food or something. Other than that it is very nice!!

Great drinks, cool music and amazing staff. Cocktails were really nice, the music was fun and the staff even came over with a blanket as it got cold. It is expensive but the service and the view are worth it!

name: Duong Dining
address: 101 Ma May Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Duong Dining is located 101 Ma May street in the center of Hanoi Old Quarter. Duong Dining is a restaurant in Hanoi with elegance of unique contemporary architecture that harmonizes with the sophistication and nostalgia of the old quarter atmosphere. During 3 years of operation, Duong Dining provided customers with a wonderful culinary space, becoming a familiar destination for many foreign tourists in Vietnam. Duong Dining was opened in June 2017 is an upgraded product based on the experience and value of 2 Duong’s Restaurants from Hanoi to Saigon after 3 years of operation and development. Coming to Duong Dining, diners will enjoy an elegant and charming menu designed by a talented and experienced chef. Chef Duong, the founder of Duong’s Restaurant, is in the top 4 of Top Chef Vietnam program. Chef Duong and his team built the menu by focusing on traditional Vietnamese dishes with Western influences. There are not too many dishes on our menu because we aim to create perfect dish
cuisines: South American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Visiting Hanoi the first time The restaurant was highly recommended by friends and family We had our Christmas dinner here with 25 people and they were able to prepare for the big party without problems. Menu choice was either traditional Vietnamese or western. The fried spring rolls was one of the best I’ve ever had. The broth for the beef pho took over seven hours to prepared, and yes it is so tasty Price is very inexpensive Highly recommend this restaurant

The moment I stepped in, I was so excited to see many bottles of wine but they serve only non-Vietnamese wine by​ glass​. I wanted to sip Vietnamese wine, it was a let down​ but they serve Not-typical-Vietnamese dishes. I like the way they serve dishes as it is more westernized. I found it sophisticated. ​It is Michelin Bib Gourmand. If you want to try Vietnamese cuisine with a unique taste, you can try Duong's. We had a set menu (8 dishes) Probably exclusive to group tourists ? It was fine but 2 ​of prawn​/shrimp dishes ​were included, which I found strange​. ​ ​Their service could be improved

Upon our arrival in Hanoi, we were eagerly recommended this restaurant by both friends and family. The menu offered a delightful selection of both traditional Vietnamese dishes and Western options. Amongst our choices, the fried spring rolls stood out as one of the best we have ever tasted. The beef pho broth, meticulously prepared for over seven hours, was a testament to the restaurant's dedication to flavor and quality. To our surprise, the prices were incredibly affordable, making our dining experience even more enjoyable. Without hesitation, we wholeheartedly recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking an exceptional culinary adventure in Hanoi.

name: Xupito Bar
address: 37 Luong Ngoc Quyen Street, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: We found the Xupito Bar just off the intersection with Beer Street in Hanoi . A great little Bar , serving cheap cold Beers , great food , excellent Host , great friendly staff . We made a point of having a Drink & a snack here every day of our 4 night stay in Hanoi . Not as hectic as most of the Bars around this area . Highly recommended .
example_reviews: We found the Xupito Bar just off the intersection with Beer Street in Hanoi . A great little Bar , serving cheap cold Beers , great food , excellent Host , great friendly staff . We made a point of having a Drink & a snack here every day of our 4 night stay in Hanoi . Not as hectic as most of the Bars around this area . Highly recommended .

We ordered the beer nachos and the beef tacos. Both were good for 1 person each, it was awesome. The lady working turned the AC on for our table and it was a nice little spot to people watch at “beer corner”. We went during the day so it wasn’t madness. Good pricing and good Mexican food and flavors. Would recommend a lot! A cute little place to enjoy Mexican food.

Great little cafe for lunch. Inexpensive and has a fewmexucan options alongside Vietnamese dishes. Fun little place, in the heart of the old quarter. Good place to view the hustle and bustle of the street outside

name: Pizza Pomodoro 7 Hàng Buồm
address: 7 Hàng Buồm Hoàn Kiếm Hà Nôi, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi Vietnam
description: I visited this restaurant based on a friend’s recommendation, and I’m so glad I did! The staff was incredibly friendly, explaining the menu and helping me choose the best pizza. I had the Tropicale pizza with ham and pineapple – the flavors were well-balanced, and the crust was just the right amount of crispy. Perfect for a casual meal in Hanoi.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
American Restaurants for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: I visited this restaurant based on a friend’s recommendation, and I’m so glad I did! The staff was incredibly friendly, explaining the menu and helping me choose the best pizza. I had the Tropicale pizza with ham and pineapple – the flavors were well-balanced, and the crust was just the right amount of crispy. Perfect for a casual meal in Hanoi.

If you love pizza, this place should be on your list when visiting Hanoi! The wood-fired pizzas have the perfect balance of crunch and chewiness. I had the Brie Cheese Pizza, and it was rich and delicious. The restaurant is easy to find in the Old Quarter, and the staff makes you feel at home. Definitely a must-try

I was craving pasta and decided to try the Lasagna Bolognese here. It was baked to perfection with layers of rich beef sauce, melted cheese, and fresh pasta. The portion was just right, and the service was excellent. The restaurant is small but has a warm and inviting atmosphere.

name: Barbak
address: 22 Quảng An, Tây Hồ Hà Nội, Hanoi 11200 Vietnam
description: Barbak is a vibrant and inviting casual restaurant, where guests can indulge in a unique dining experience highlighted by open-fire grill skewers and artisanal sundaes ice creams. Our menu is a fusion of Mediterranean inspirations and beloved Asian flavors, expertly crafted to tantalize your taste buds. At Barbak, we prioritize authenticity, creativity, and popularity, ensuring that every dish reflects our commitment to culinary excellence. Whether you're craving traditional Mediterranean fare or adventurous Asian-inspired dishes, Barbak promises a dining experience like no other. So, our only house rule is simple: Come hungry, relax, and savor every moment of your meal with us.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: This place has just opened up in Tay Ho. We walked past it a few times and having viewed the menu we decided to give it a go. I'm glad we did. While there are main courses, the specialty seems to be various types of meat on skewers. Between us we had lamb, beef, pork and veggies. The lamb was a little firm, but the beef was melt in your mouth tender. My wife loved the pork. Veggies were very nice as well. It really is a taste sensation. There are heaps of staff and they are super attentive without being annoying. Prices are a little on the higher side but it's definitely worth it. We will be back.

This was my second visit to Barbak and the beautiful, impressive atmosphere makes it perfect for gatherings with friends. The space is calm and quiet, with sophisticated, stylish decor. Most importantly, the food is delicious. Both times, I was impressed by the beef tartare and various skewers, especially the wagyu tongue. I would recommend it to everyone.

Stumbled across this walking down Hang Bo street. Incredible Mediterranean food - particularly the focaccia and dips. Apparently this restaurant only opened recently, but I suspect it will soon become a favourite for foodies visiting Hanoi. Great meat and vegetarian options, and a warm beautiful atmosphere.

name: Shimla Westlake
address: Số 7A Ngõ 40, Đường Xuân Diệu Phường Tứ Liên, Quận Tây Hồ, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Shimla is an Indian style cafe/ Bistro, where you can find from speciality coffee to speciality Masala tea, traditional punjabi breakfast to Modern Indian breakfasts, street food to indo-fusion foods, small bite size canapés to full meals. Shimla is ready to serve everything from morning coffee to late nightcap for every mood of the day. We have tasted and selected dishes from all around India to bring it to your table directly, and to accompany it we have selection of liquor and wines specially selected to compliment the food prepared by our chefs.
cuisines: South American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Me and my friend visited here as one of the other 3 branches of this restaurant is in the village where she lives in England so we emailed to say we were coming and we were met with such warm welcome and service, Sachin was brilliant at helping with our order and the food came very quickly. The food itself was delicious and we didn’t have one bad mouthful. I couldn’t recommend this place more as even the price was good for the quality and quantity of food you get

My wife an I often visited when it was Maazi; we live in Vinh Phuc Province and were unaware of the change until we got there. Not intending to discredit Maazi in any way, we were each happy with the subtle changes: The menu seems to offer more and the service was faster, so the food we ordered was still hot when it reached our table. I was looking for something different than my usual, so I asked Farhan for a suggestion; upon trying it, I was glad I sought his recommendation. Their black chai tea completed an awesome visit.

After 6 weeks tasting all the delicious specialties of Vietnam, once we arrived in Hanoi, we wanted something else. What a nice surprise! The dishes were a real delight, we didn't leave a single crumb. Just a small downside about the slowness of the service to get our aperitif cocktails... which ultimately arrived at the same time as our dishes even though we had ordered them 15 minutes before. But the quality of the food made up for it.

name: The Cobra Snake Ba Mao
address: 40 Le Mat, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Enjoy Snake Traditional Food from Local Take photos with many kinds of snake Drink Snake Wine
cuisines: BBQ Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
example_reviews: Once in a lifetime opportunity to ever try snake cobra wine and meat! greeted by many friendly faces that welcomes you to his store. You will never find such a generous and kind owner like Mao even though there was a language barrier, he use translator to explain every dish to you to ensure you know what you are eating. Accompanied by his beautiful wife that cooks the dishes with so much passion that u can taste it in every bite of your dish. Truly a once in a lifetime unique experience

Due to the time of day, I was the only customer. Made to feel extremely welcome. Dishes were explained, plentiful and tasty, cooked by the owner’s lovely wife. Tried the snake heart and blood, though was a bit over powered by the homemade wine. Also got to learn about the owner, Mao, and his family/restaurant history.

Warm welcome, the owners are really very friendly and are very attentive. Snakes are presented to you alive, quickly killed, skinned in front of you and very quickly cooked. We were treated to 2 dishes (snake meat sautéed with garlic and spring rolls fried with snake meat). It's very good. The gentleman made us taste his snake wine (specialty of their home) a snake alcohol, lotus tea, dishes all unknown to us. In addition, we were treated to the Cobra qui dance demonstration! Really an address worth a visit! Thank you to them for this beautiful and rich experience!

name: Annam Indian Restaurant - Hanoi
address: 17 Hang Muoi St, Ly Thai To Ward, Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Step into the heart of Hanoi's Old Quarter and embark on a mesmerizing culinary journey at Annam Indian Restaurant. Established in 2018, this delightful establishment offers an exquisite combination of unfamiliar South Indian & tongue tingling flavours of North Indian cuisine, encompassing a symphony of exotic ingredients and heady spices. Indian cuisine has the whole palette of flavours in Tamil we call “அறுசுவை” “Arusuvai” இனிப்பு – Sweet, புளிப்பு – Sour , உவர்ப்பு – Salt, கசப்பு – Bitter, கார்ப்பு – Pungent & துவர்ப்பு – Astringent. At Annam Annam Signature Dishes: Fluffy Kerala Parotta; Crispy Masala Dosai; Tangy Fish Curry; Spicy Chicken Curry; Creamy Paneer Butter Masala; Healthy Dal Tadka & many more… Weekend Specials : Madras Mutton Dum Biriyani, Naatu Kozhi Sukka Varuval, Mutton Pepper Roast, We continuously strive to exceed the expectations of our guests with high quality healthy food and services. We Remain Team Annam .
example_reviews: Authentic Indian HINDU Restaurant offering both South and North Indian Cuisine at an affordable price. Located at the heart of the old quarter, is a must go place if you are craving for the home food. The agarbathi/ sambrani fragrance gives you a warm welcome feels u are back home. South Indian Thali, Chicken 65 and their Biriyani the best in Vietnam .. We had almost all the meals here during our entire stay in Vietnam. Higly recommended.. Don't Miss it

Annam Restaurant in Hanoi offers a delightful South Indian dining experience right in the heart of the city, close to the Old Quarter. Situated on the 4th floor, accessible by lift, this cozy spot serves up a hearty, authentic South Indian meal. We had a full spread, including crispy idlis, dosa, and a rich ghee roast that truly hit the spot. The food is flavorful, well-prepared, and a welcome change for anyone craving Indian cuisine in Hanoi. The owner, who speaks Hindi, adds a personal touch to the experience, making it feel even more homely. The ambiance is simple yet comfortable, perfect for a casual meal. If you're in the area and looking for a taste of South India, Annam is definitely worth a visit!

If you're craving for a South Indian vegetarian respite after touring Vietnam this place is it. The dosas and paneer kottu rotti are out of this world - highly recommend the Mysore Masala Dosa if you like a bit of spice. Staff seem to prioritise regulars over visitors, should improve with the right direction at the start of service.

name: Spices
address: 17T5 Hoang Dao Thuy Street, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Very good ambience as well as great quality and quantity of food has been served. I tried Mutton biryani, dosa and chicken 65 which seems for to be very delicious and thoughtful staff who always monitor and table and serve the food one after the other which we had order. Staff is friendly and Manager Zihen was very approachable. Last but not the least I felt that food was served with worth of my money. I would recommend people to try. Thank you! All the best for spices taste Hanoi Team
example_reviews: Very good ambience as well as great quality and quantity of food has been served. I tried Mutton biryani, dosa and chicken 65 which seems for to be very delicious and thoughtful staff who always monitor and table and serve the food one after the other which we had order. Staff is friendly and Manager Zihen was very approachable. Last but not the least I felt that food was served with worth of my money. I would recommend people to try. Thank you! All the best for spices taste Hanoi Team

This restaurant is off the usual path compared to the usual areas where restaurants are located (Hoan Kiem, West Lake). I've been here 9 times in recent months. The first review I made for them was when I ordered home over a year ago (August 7, 2022). The food is great and the staff are simply awesome. Definitely check out this restaurant, their food is good and the best part is that they have a huge South Indian menu too. Must try their Rava Dosa, simply delicious.

Best Indian food in Vietnam! Tried both north Indian as well as South Indian food, top notch! Got packed a little for dinner as well as we didn’t want to take a chance considering limited vegetarian food option problem here. Totally recommend it !

name: Chốt 8 Mã Mây
address: Mã Mây Số 8, Hanoi 11000 Vietnam
description: The shop has very delicious apricot wine, the seafood is also very fresh, the enthusiastic staff is ready if you feel bored drinking or you will get drunk. My favorite is crab and goby hotpot, grilled chicken feet with salt and chili. , extremely delicious
example_reviews: The shop has very delicious apricot wine, the seafood is also very fresh, the enthusiastic staff is ready if you feel bored drinking or you will get drunk. My favorite is crab and goby hotpot, grilled chicken feet with salt and chili. , extremely delicious

We ordered fried corns and tofu as appetizers which were really good. Then my partner ordered grilled prawns as his main and I ordered fried rice with salted fish and shredded chicken. The grilled prawns with the Wasabi dip were fantastic but the fried rice was ok. I ordered the guava fruit juice which was refreshing and a great thirst quencher. I had to wait a long time for the juice so something to keep in mind if if you're really thirsty and can't wait. They have a big array of options so is a great choice for groups and couples.

We came for the lunch. There is many choice on the menu , the women can explain you witch kind of food is it , easy to make your choice . The taste are really good, the fish , the chilli sauce , the fried Rice, everything was perfect. We was talking with the women, she is so nice and smilling, I will recommend this restaurant to eat.

name: 1968 Restaurant
address: 33 Duong Thanh Street, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Located underground, the 1968 Restaurant is an all-day dining restaurant serving famous Asian signature dishes. The restaurant maintains an elegant atmosphere using waterfall decorations, lush, natural plants, and gentle lighting. 1968 Restaurant offers two private dining rooms for corporate meetings, personal celebrations and holiday parties. The smaller room can seat up to twenty people and the larger Grand Room can seat up to sixty people. In addition to the private rooms, there is an open dining area that serves buffets and fine-dining options.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Italian Restaurants for Large Groups in Hoan Kiem
Pizza for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: As guests of the Peridot hotel we also wanted to test this restaurant with an Asian vocation. We already knew the environment as breakfast is served in these spaces to hotel guests. The gastronomic proposal is original and the service is very attentive and friendly, which in our case was followed by Son who was very attentive to us during dinner, thus contributing to making our dinner very pleasant. We also greatly appreciated the excellent cocktail he prepared for us and served us with extreme professionalism.

This restaurant offers an exceptional dining experience. The food is absolutely amazing, and every dish is presented beautifully, looking as good as it tastes. The quality of the ingredients really stands out, with everything tasting so fresh. The ambiance here is lovely, making it a perfect spot for a relaxing evening. On top of that, the staff are incredibly friendly and attentive. Our server Gia Linh was knowledgeable about the menu and gave excellent recommendations, responding to our requests promptly. The service was professional yet warm, making us feel truly welcome. Thank you for such a memorable experience!

The food quality is exceptional, with dishes that are beautifully presented and made from fresh, high-quality ingredients. Service is attentive yet unobtrusive, with staff knowledgeable about the menu and ready to offer recommendations. Their enthusiasm for the food enhances the dining experience. I was pleased to be served by Phong, a waiter who impressed me a lot by how he take care me and others costumers. He was very gentle and soft when we asked for everything. He made my dinner night way more delightful. For those interested in pairing meals with beverages, the drink menu is well-rounded, offering both innovative cocktails and a solid selection of wine1968 Restaurant is a great choice for both food enthusiasts and those looking for a unique dining experience. I will absolutely come back again.

name: Casa Italia
address: 18 Le Phung Hieu Street, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description:
Casa Italia Hanoi, nestled within the Italian Cultural Centre, offers an inviting and authentic Italian dining experience. The ambiance is charming, especially the outdoor seating area, which is perfect for enjoying Hanoi's pleasant weather. Whether you're savoring a leisurely meal or simply sipping coffee, the al fresco space provides a relaxing atmosphere.

The staff at Casa Italia are professional, attentive, and eager to ensure that guests have a pleasant dining experience. Their service is efficient, adding a welcoming touch to the overall environment.

When it comes to food, Casa Italia does not disappoint. The dishes are of excellent quality, featuring fresh ingredients and traditional Italian flavors. From their pasta to the pizzas, each plate is thoughtfully crafted, bringing a taste of Italy to Hanoi.

One downside, however, is the practice of charging for hot water. While this may seem like a small detail, it’s worth noting for guests who might expect complimentary water as part of their dining experience.

Overall, Casa Italia offers a solid dining experience with a few minor quirks. It’s a great spot for those looking to enjoy authentic Italian cuisine in a pleasant and professional setting.
cuisines: Mexican Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
example_reviews: Casa Italia Hanoi, nestled within the Italian Cultural Centre, offers an inviting and authentic Italian dining experience. The ambiance is charming, especially the outdoor seating area, which is perfect for enjoying Hanoi's pleasant weather. Whether you're savoring a leisurely meal or simply sipping coffee, the al fresco space provides a relaxing atmosphere. The staff at Casa Italia are professional, attentive, and eager to ensure that guests have a pleasant dining experience. Their service is efficient, adding a welcoming touch to the overall environment. When it comes to food, Casa Italia does not disappoint. The dishes are of excellent quality, featuring fresh ingredients and traditional Italian flavors. From their pasta to the pizzas, each plate is thoughtfully crafted, bringing a taste of Italy to Hanoi. One downside, however, is the practice of charging for hot water. While this may seem like a small detail, it’s worth noting for guests who might expect complimentary water as part of their dining experience. Overall, Casa Italia offers a solid dining experience with a few minor quirks. It’s a great spot for those looking to enjoy authentic Italian cuisine in a pleasant and professional setting.

This place is SO good that we came back twice in a weekend! The food is just fantastic! Completely authentic italian - I wish we lived here! It's a funny venue - set in a gorgeous old house but feels a bit odd as it's an italian trade place - showcasing Vespas (and a divine Motoguzzi!). Very popular with ex pat families at the weekend, it's just incredible value and the best pizzas we have had outside Italy. And the gelato.......

Restaurant across from our hotel. We kept being drawn back to their food and gelato. We ate here at least 3x because of their perfect style Napoli pizza and daily made gelato. The salads are big so plan on splitting, the wine is good and reasonable so multiple glasses will happen. Their pastas are also very good and prices are mind blowing reasonable. It's casual outdoor, friendly service and laid back atmosphere will make you linger. It's a place that locals meet and catch up in the afternoons, but it was never overly busy when we went.

name: Bia Hơi Cổ Tân
address: 23a Tông Đản, Hoàn Kiếm, Hanoi Vietnam
description:
Bia Hơi Cổ Tân is a traditional Vietnamese draft beer brewed and served fresh daily. It has a light, refreshing taste and is very affordable, making it a favorite among locals. It's often enjoyed with street snacks in a laid-back, communal atmosphere.
The mậu dịch-style beer at Cổ Tân is reminiscent of Vietnam's subsidized economy era, where beer was a symbol of simplicity and social connection. The establishment exudes a nostalgic vibe, with basic wooden tables and chairs, an airy open space, and a friendly, no-frills service style. Here, beer is not just a drink but a cultural experience, bringing people together to chat and enjoy the vintage ambiance.
cuisines: French Restaurants for Breakfast in Hanoi
German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: The first time I came to this restaurant, the restaurant has a very diverse menu, more than 20 pages. The prices are good, the staff are enthusiastic, although there are some dishes that take a long time to prepare, there are also dishes that are quick to make like the sauteed pork rind with pickles below.. And every week there is a promotion program to give away beer on arrival. Book a crowded table, I really like the style of this restaurant in terms of preferential policies for customers..!

The local nightclub restaurant, known as the Hanoi fast food store, is good for food, people are warm, and the atmosphere is relaxed. We ticked a silk chicken pot (half a chicken), will attach a plate of silk and butter, the taste is simple, but I believe the Taiwanese eat well. With a glass of ice tea, relax.

The staff are very cute, bringing the food quickly.. I ordered a plate of stir-fried water spinach 5 minutes ago and saw it all on the table, a plus point for this speed... Wish Co Tan had more customers. .Love you guys

name: Hanoi Taco Bar
address: 13 Dao Duy Tu Street, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Located in Hanoi's bustling Old Quarter, just a stone's throw from the ancient East Gate, Hanoi Taco Bar offers delicious Mexican dishes, truly memorable cocktails, and a break from the chaos of the busy streets. Relax in our bright air-conditioned interior, and watch the street life go by outside. We offer a comfortable and versatile space for dining and drinking, with live music and film projections on selected nights. Hanoi Taco Bar is proud to offer the biggest selection of high-quality 100% agave tequila in Vietnam. Come and try our exciting range of unique handcrafted cocktails and imported Western beers. We offer a wide selection of vegetarian food and alcohol-free cocktails throughout the day.
cuisines: Vietnamese Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
Asian Restaurants with Buffet in Hanoi
example_reviews: The restaurant serves authentic and delicious Mexican food with a variety of flavorful dishes. The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring a pleasant dining experience. The vibrant atmosphere enhances the enjoyment, making it a must-visit for Mexican cuisine lovers. Thank you 🙏🏼

This was sooo good! We booked a table for 4 on a Sunday evening and enjoyed a great view of the lake lit up at night. The pork nachos were delicious and rather a huge portion which me and my husband shared and we loved constructing a burrito from all the flavours on the menu. Friendly staff with good English speaking and a nice clean restaurant with very good food

This is a really good restaurant with tasty food. We weren't too hungry so ordered 3 tacos and a quesadilla to share. The food was of excellent quality and the flavours were extremely tasty. The Taco's are of a medium to smallish size so if you're particularly hungry I would advise to order more. I'd recommend you to sit on the outside balcony as you can really soak up the Hanoi atmosphere whilst enjoying your meal.

name: Viet Kitchen Restaurant & Rooftop Bar
address: 11 Floor 27 Hàng Hành, Hoàn Kiếm, Hanoi, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Viet Kitchen Restaurant & Rooftop Bar – The Heart of Vietnamese Gastronomy Immerse yourself in the vibrant flavors of Vietnam at Viet Kitchen Restaurant & Rooftop Bar, located at Le Premier Hotel, just steps away from Hanoi’s iconic Hoan Kiem Lake. Combining modern elegance with authentic cuisine, the restaurant invites diners on a journey through Vietnam’s rich culinary heritage. Enjoy specialties like Hanoi Grilled Pork Noodles, Chả Cá Hoàng Thành, and Banana Blossom Salad, each crafted with the finest local ingredients. Pair your meal with our signature cocktails or curated wine selection at the rooftop bar, offering panoramic views of the city and its enchanting skyline. Whether you're a traveler exploring Hanoi or a local seeking a refined dining experience, Viet Kitchen Restaurant & Rooftop Bar is your destination for unforgettable moments. MENU VIET KITCHEN: https://lepremierhotel.com/UploadFile/Service/Vietkitchen-Menu.pdf
example_reviews: During my visit to Hanoi, I had the pleasure of dining at Viet Kitchen, and it was an unforgettable experience. The restaurant perfectly showcases the rich and vibrant flavors of Vietnamese cuisine in a modern yet cozy setting. The menu offers a diverse selection of traditional dishes, each prepared with fresh, high-quality ingredients. I tried the [specific dish you enjoyed, e.g., "pho," "spring rolls," or "bun cha"], and it was exceptional. The balance of flavors was spot-on, and the presentation reflected great attention to detail. The staff at Viet Kitchen were friendly and attentive, always ready to recommend dishes and ensure that everything was just right. The ambiance added to the overall experience – a wonderful mix of contemporary design and traditional Vietnamese charm. If you're looking for authentic Vietnamese food in Hanoi, Viet Kitchen is a must-visit. Whether you're a local or a traveler, this restaurant offers a true taste of Vietnam with exceptional service. I’ll definitely be returning on my next trip to the city!

Authentic Vietnamese restaurant with romantic atmosphere and gorgeous views of Hanoi city and Hoan Kiem Lake. The food was very upscale in presentation without losing its authentic taste, and carefully prepared with high-quality ingredients, fresh herbs and spices -- We highly recommend Hanoi Grilled Fish (Cha Ca La Vong) dish! Service was excellent and unpretentious -- Our host for the evening, Mr. Hao, was very charming and professional. He made sure the customers could experience the best Vietnamese hospitality and will always remember Viet Kitchen as one of the reasons to return to Hanoi.

This restaurant is exceptional. All levels. Perfect location in the "Old Center", on the 8th floor of the Premier Hotel & Rooftop. A 2-minute walk from the busiest square of the city (and the lake). Restaurant recently opened. Very chic and intimate with lake view. Delicious food. I tried nems, “pho ga” (chicken pho) and “mango sticky rice”. I went to this restaurant two nights in a row (and I did the same thing again because it was so good). Big bravo to the chef. The service is excellent. Thank you to Howard who welcomed me in the best way and advised me on dishes, things to see and activities in Hanoi! In perfect English and with a smile! The restaurant is not reserved for hotel guests. It's open to everyone. And until late at night. I will return during my next stay in Hanoi. I highly recommend! The service is

name: Angelina
address: 56 Ly Thai To Sofitel Metropole Hanoi, Trang Tien Ward, Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Angelina - Hanoi's bespoke cocktail bar, whisky lounge and restaurant, offers hand-crafted cocktails, an expertly curated wine list, and a world-class whisky selection. The kitchen uses the finest ingredients to serve innovative comfort food, inspired by European and New World recipes. Elements of tartan, oak, copper, green and blue burlap as well as plush furnishings create an elegant, yet warm atmosphere with a touch of the Scottish highlands. Angelina - the place to be for those who know - where the food and drinks are as polished as the staffs, and where you make evening soirées unforgettable. Open until late with house music most evenings from 9pm.
cuisines: Thai Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
Vietnamese Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
American Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
example_reviews: This remains a firm favourite for a relaxed cocktail in the evening. We love the cocktails, which are not the usual classics, so it's nice to try new ones, I enjoyed the cherry sour and jungle bird this time. There are snacks provided to graze on, and they are always tasty.

5 star Roasted Chicken All i wanted was a good old hearty chicken and i got the juicest whole chicken for the year. Other food were tastefully presented and delicious, the clam chowder perhaps a touch too salty. Loved the ambience and the surroundings. If you will go hysteria from smoke, this place is unsuitable. It is a cigar bar and smoking is okay in parts of the interior. RT 13/1/23

Popped in here for the first-time as a treat prior to going to opera house for a show. The bar is simply stunning and has a really cool vibe, hard to imagine that you are in the middle of the old quarter when in here. We had 2 cocktails each which were delicious, my only slight critism would be that the waitress said we could order any of the drinks on the front page and get another free as it was happy hour but dis not make it clear that these had to be the same drink, hence why we ended up with four drinks which was rather pricey!

name: Bản Quán
address: Số 2 Đường Thành, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Ban Quan offers regional food in a lovely setting. If you would like to try delicious fresh Vietnamese flavours this restaurant is special. We ate a delicious green mango and smoked buffalo salad, lovely sautéed vegetable and catfish with bamboo pickle, with a lovely fresh fruit and black jelly on ice dessert.  Wonderful.
cuisines: South American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Ban Quan offers regional food in a lovely setting. If you would like to try delicious fresh Vietnamese flavours this restaurant is special. We ate a delicious green mango and smoked buffalo salad, lovely sautéed vegetable and catfish with bamboo pickle, with a lovely fresh fruit and black jelly on ice dessert. Wonderful.

Great taste! We ordered the green mango salad which was really light, fresh and really hit the spot. The orange juice and pineapple juice were also really fresh. We’d recommend visitors to come by to this restaurant when visiting Hanoi.

It's a lovely place. It is food of Vietnamese ethnic groups in the north of the country. Local crowd. Different food. From insects to elaborate dishes of traditional cuisine. All exquisite. At an average of 10 euros a plate.

name: Take Taco
address: 65 P. Cầu Gỗ, Hàng Bạc, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Hanoi Vietnam
description:
Take Taco is a fantastic spot in Hanoi for anyone craving delicious, fresh, and flavorful tacos. The restaurant has a cool, laid-back atmosphere with friendly staff who make you feel welcome from the moment you walk in.

The menu offers a great selection of tacos with both classic and creative fillings. The ingredients are fresh, and the flavors are well-balanced. The tortillas are soft and warm, and the toppings complement the fillings perfectly. Whether you’re into beef, chicken, pork, or vegetarian options, there’s something for everyone. The portions are generous, and everything is well-prepared.

In addition to tacos, they also have great sides and drinks. Their nachos are crispy and well-seasoned, and the guacamole is creamy and fresh. The cocktails and margaritas are refreshing, making it a great place to relax with friends.

Prices are reasonable for the quality, and the service is quick and efficient. If you’re in Hanoi and looking for a break from Vietnamese food or just love tacos, Take Taco is definitely worth a visit!

If you're after a change from rice and noodles try this place! We did and went back and back. On our first visit we tried the chicken wrap and the quesedilla. The wrap was the hands down winner. It comes with very thin french fries which were served hot. The only disappointments were that the drink prices were considerably higher than other dining places nearby and the menu prices having a 10% tax added at bill paying time. It would be much clearer if the menu had the actual price to be paid so there is no bad taste at the end of the visit. The staff were friendly and helpful. The dining area and toilet are clean. When we were flying home the staff were happy to put our meals in take away boxes and still tasted great at the airport.

We came here after reading the trip advisor reviews and were not disappointed. We both had Mexican food as we fancied something different from Vietnamese food. It made a pleasant change. It’s a very basic fast food restaurant but the food was freshly made to order at a good price. They also sell a good selection of soft and alcoholic drinks like beers and wines. They also serve a selection of Vietnamese food should you want that. We are planning to go again before we leave Hanoi.

name: Viet Spring Rolls
address: 21 P. Nguyen Huu Huan Second Floor, Inside Bun Cha Ta's House, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Viet Spring Rolls has acquired ample culinary skills to serve you with homemade mouth-watering Vietnamese Street food; the best Hanoi has to offer. This meal is served in a cosy restaurant located at 65A Bát Ðàn Street, Old Quarter of Hanoi, Vietnam, and at a reasonable price. The chefs at Viet Spring Rolls have put together recipes that are modern, seasonal, healthy, and pleasurable to the buds. Our restaurant has a style of cooking which is boundless, as their wide range of meals cut across Hanoi local foods. Every day is a new day with their daily specials. We get creative in the preparation of their house specials like: Crab Fried Rolls,Traditional Fried Rolls,Vegetarian Rolls,Seafood Fried Spring Rolls,Fried Chicken Spring Rolls ,FRESH SPRING ROLLS,Viet Special fried rice mixed with vegetable , etc; and even appetizers specials like: Papaya Salad, Banh Xeo,,, and lots more. This iconic spot shifts its menu daily to incorporate fresh, seasonal ingredients like; shrimp, pork,
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
American Restaurants for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: It’s rare to find eateries with great food in high volume areas that still value meeting customers and going above and beyond with service. Viet Spring Rolls definitely went above and beyond. The spring rolls were super fresh and flavorful but the main takeaway was how nice Pumpkin (I butchered the pronunciation of her real name so she opted for a nickname) and Thuỷ were. They taught us how to say ‘cheers’ in Vietnamese, corrected our pronunciation of some key words, wrote down suggestions for exploring Hanoi and overall were super cool. Thank you for a great experience!

We have tried many different restaurants for spring rolls but so far we enjoy the ones from here the most. Tender and juicy meat wrapped inside the crunchy skin accompanied with great dipping sauce. They have fast and friendly service. Will definitely come back!

For sure we won't forget about Viet Rolls, and specially Daisy, so gentle and nice and all the staff. The food was delicious, definitely one of the best spring rolls we had in Vietnam, and we were even offered happy water (meaning rice wine) and taught how to make a toast in vietnamise. Daisy was very talkative and made our dinner so much special. Definitely a place to go, if you are in Hanoi.

name: The Veg - Organic Vego & Tea
address: 1 Tống Duy Tân Street Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: The Veg’s mission is to show the community of Hanoi, that a plant-based diet can be delicious, simple, and can have tremendous positive effects on one’s physical, and spiritual well-being. The Veg delivers selected organic plant-based nutritious whole food, vegetarian and vegan meals with fresh ingredients directly supplied by organic farms and Viet traditional, herbal tea.
example_reviews: I love The Veg. Not only did I frequent this restaurant EVERY SINGLE DAY I was in Hanoi, but it essentially prevented my starvation too. After all, veganism is not an easy feat in this city. It is so cost-effective, the staff are absolutely lovely, and the food is extremely filling. Please get the vegan meatballs with black rice (you won't regret it). I will probably never go back to Hanoi, but if you do you best believe I'll be going back to The Veg for every meal if I do.

Visited the cafe for brunch/lunch with my friend on our trip to Hanoi. Food was delicious - we tried the banana pancakes, vegan oatmeal, Hanoi rolls and stuffed tofu. Portions were extremely generous and we struggled to finish (but did so because it was so yummy!) Couldn’t fault the service, speed, menu or anything else. Love that they had clearly marked out “not spicy” on some options too! Juices were delicious also.

😊 I was surprised when I was back this time. The restaurant has a new menu with more food options- adding more Western vegan food. 😗 If you eat there at night on weekends, you'll have free live music from other pubs nearby. On weekdays, it's quite peaceful. The price now is up though the food portion is still same. Like last time the Vietnamese noodles would be 50 or 55k, but now it's 65k. 🙂 The drink menu seems better and very friendly healthy drinks. 🤦‍♀️ It's still an inconvenience when the staff is only on 1st and 3rd floor whereas the customers on the 2nd floor want to ask for something like sauce, new order. They should have a bell or something which can help customers communicate with the staff without leaving the table. Yeah, I'm in the middle of my meal,I don't wanna leave my table just to call you, I pay for the service so you should present when we need. .. In sum, I dont think I will come back for a fourth visit or introduce this restaurant to my friends when I have no choice.

name: Sky On 9 Rooftop Bar
address: 134 Tu Hoa, Tay Ho, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Sky On 9 is located on the 9th floor of 134 Tu Hoa building, you will be greeted with a stunning panoramic view of the sparkling West Lake and the surrounding Ha Noi cityscape. The bar is situated in a chic and modern setting, with stylish furnishings and ambient lighting that creates a sophisticated atmosphere. Whether you want a classic cocktail for a serenity night or some wine for a romantic date, Sky On 9 is always pleased to serve you the best.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Tay Ho
Street Food Restaurants in Tay Ho
European Restaurants for Lunch in Tay Ho
Cafes for Lunch in Tay Ho
example_reviews: Naomi noodles are very delicious and fragrant, it feels like being on a small island and enjoying seafood Whiskey sour - classic cocktail but with eggs, super delicious and creamy!!! Must try

The shop is perfect for a private, romantic date. I organized a birthday party here and the staff took care of it very thoughtfully and meticulously. From enthusiastically assisting with setup, receiving items to help me decorate, then bringing the cake, turning on the music and everything was great Thank you so cute shop

The restaurant has a beautiful view, the space is very quiet, I really like it. In particular, the staff are extremely cute and serve extremely enthusiastically. The food is also good, I find the prices more reasonable than many other restaurants I have experienced. Overall, 10 points, everyone. ♥️

name: San Fu Lou Cantonese Kitchen - Vincom Metropolis
address: Tầng 2, 29 Liễu Giai, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: San Fu Lou_ The house of three blessings. At our restaurant, we provide great tasty food, healthy cooking techniques and hygiene. At SFL, we take the traditional concept of a Chinese kitchen and bring it to a new level of sophistication with a contemporary Oriental ambience replete with the colours and material of a traditional Chinese "house". Our show kitchen, which is a first in Vietnam for a Chinese restaurant, allows diners to take in a visual feast before the food is served. This kitchen shows the guests the extensive Chinese influences which can be found in the Vietnamese culinary heritage today.These include the use of bean curd, stir-frying food, the use of chop-stick and wok, and so much more. SFL is a place to enjoy Chinese classics with handpicked teas and allows all guests to appreciate nostalgic tastes in these modern times.
cuisines: Late Night American Restaurants in Hanoi
Asian Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
BBQ Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: We saw this place and decided to dine here, the other restaurants were rather full and we hadn’t booked. Right, this restaurant is over 3 floors and the staff are really nice. We as always ordered too much or it could be that the Vietnamese restaurant are very generous. The food was ok, we had the bill and left the money, there was about an extra $3 or so, so we didn’t wait for the change. We left and the waitress ran after us with the change, she was surprised that we had left a tip.. Loved the hot and sour soup

The restaurant is nicely located across from the park near the opera house. Theme street view and air- conditioning were wonderful. But we came for the food and it was tasty. The service met our every need.
Friendly staff, Chinese space in Hanoi. If you want to enjoy Chinese cusine in Hanoi, let’s try San Fu lou. Highly recommend for you.
